Title: Software Engineer
Description:
Position Overview:
Are you passionate about software development and cybersecurity? Do you want to be part of a strategic initiative to shape the future of data protection? We are assembling a new team dedicated to the evolution of our data protection product suite, and we are seeking four highly skilled Software Developers to join us on this journey.As a Software Developer on our team, you will play a critical role in developing, maintaining, and enhancing our data protection solutions. This is an exciting opportunity to join a newly integrated team where your contributions will directly impact the security of highly sensitive organizations.
Key Responsibilities:
Software Development:Design, develop, and maintain high-quality software solutions with a primary focus on Windows environments.Engage in feature development, architecture design, and refactor existing codebases to reduce technical debt.Collaboration and Team Engagement:Participate actively in team meetings and code reviews, ensuring adherence to security and architectural standards.Manage development environments and continuously improve your skills through ongoing learning.
Technical Leadership:Contribute to the evolution and improvement of existing systems.Maintain high standards in software architecture and security practices.
Technical and Skill Requirements:
For All Developer Roles:Windows Development: Proven experience in programming under and for Windows environments.Full-Stack Development: Strong proficiency in C/C++ and other relevant programming languages.Software Architecture & Design: Extensive experience with software architecture, design patterns, and best practices.Problem-Solving: Ability to analyze complex problems and propose innovative solutions.Collaboration & Communication: Strong communication skills and a collaborative mindset.Adaptability: Ability to adapt to evolving technologies and maintain a continuous learning mindset.
Nice-to-Have Skills:Project Management: Familiarity with project management methodologies and tools.System Design for Security: Experience in developing and refining system architectures with a focus on encryption.Version Control: Proficiency in Git for collaborative development.Continuous Improvement: A commitment to staying updated on security standards, emerging technologies, and best practices.
Personal Qualities:Team Spirit: A strong team player who contributes positively to team dynamics.Effective Communication: Ability to clearly articulate ideas and collaborate with cross-functional teams.Continuous Learning: A proactive learner who stays updated with the latest trends and technologies.
Team Environment:You will be part of a dynamic and newly formed team dedicated to advancing our data protection solutions, comprising one Lead Developer, four Developers, one QA Specialist, and one Project Manager. We operate in a hybrid work environment, with an office based in Neu-Isenburg and the flexibility for remote work. This role offers significant opportunities for skill development and career growth within the field of data protection technology.
Workplace Details:Location: Neu-Isenberg office (Hybrid).Working Hours: Flexible, with remote work options depending on geographic location and time zone compatibility.Travel: Generally not required, but occasional travel for on-site presence or team meetings may be necessary.
Application Process:We are looking for candidates with experience in industries such as endpoint protection, peripherals manufacturing, automotive, or enterprise software. The application process includes two interviews, with no additional tests or assessments.If you are passionate about software development and security, and eager to contribute to the protection of sensitive data, we encourage you to apply and join our team!
How to Apply: Please submit your CV to Sailajan@optimussearch Join us in our mission to secure the future. We look forward to hearing from you!

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Magyarország egyik legnagyobb rendszerintegrátor cégéhez keresünk Data Scientist pozícióba, bővülés miatt, új kollégát.
Feladatok:Adatgyűjtés és adatfeldolgozás különböző forrásokból, biztosítva az adatok minőségét és integritását.Adatelemzési modellek és algoritmusok fejlesztése, tesztelése és implementálása a hatékony döntéshozatal érdekében.Generikus adatelemzési pipeline folyamatok létrehozása, riportok készítése.Prediktív elemzési modellek és gépi tanulási algoritmusok létrehozása és alkalmazása az üzleti problémák megoldására.Az eredmények vizualizálása és jelentések készítése a vezetőség és más érintettek számára.Szorosan együttműködés az üzleti elemzőkkel, AI engineerekkel és más érintettekkel a követelmények és célok megértése érdekében.Folyamatos tudás naprakész tartás az adatkutatás és a gépi tanulás legújabb trendjeivel és technológiáival.
Elvárások:BSc/MSc diploma (matematikus, data scientist, villamosmérnök, mérnökinformatikus), minimum 3 év szakmai tapasztalatErős analitikai képességek és problémamegoldó készség.Kiváló ismeretek a statisztikai elemzési módszerekről és technikákról, korreláció elemzésben tapasztalat.Erős ismeretek Python programozási nyelv használatában.Jó ismeretek a gépi tanulásról és az adatbányászati technikákról.Képesség nagy mennyiségű adat kezelésére és adatokból történő következtetések levonására.Erős kommunikációs készség, különösen az eredmények világos és érthető bemutatásában.Adatbázis-kezelési kompetenciák, mint például SQL.Angol nyelv középszintű ismerete, német nyelv nem kötelező, de örömmel vesszük a középszintű ismeretét.
Amit ajánlunk:Befogadó, támogató és lendületes csapat vagyunk, emberközpontú vállalati kultúra jellemzi cégünketOnboarding programmal támogatjuk minél gyorsabb beilleszkedésedet (mentorálás, új belépőknek szervezett programok)Folyamatos fejlődési lehetőséget biztosítunk, képzésekkel járulunk hozzá szakmai és személyes fejlődésedhezSzéleskörű juttatási csomagot kapsz (prémium lehetőség, rugalmas béren kívüli juttatások, lojalitás elismerése, születésnapi extra szabadnap)Munkába járásodat támogatjuk, ingyenes parkolási lehetőség áll rendelkezésedreModern munkakörnyezetet biztosítunk (igényes irodakörnyezet, korszerű munkaeszközök)Rugalmas munkavégzésedet (home office lehetőség) támogatjukFizikai és mentális egészség megőrző programunkhoz csatlakozhatsz (céges sportolási lehetőség, sport kihívásokon és külső rendezvényeken való részvétel, pszichológus és coach támogatás, előadások különböző témákban)Rendszeres közösségépítő programokon vehetsz részt (Reggeli Ébresztő, nyári Food truck, céges rendezvények, csapatépítő programok)Különböző Társadalmi felelősségvállalás (CSR) aktivitás részese lehetszCsaládbarát cég vagyunk (nyári tábor támogatás gyermekeknek, baba üdvözlő csomag, különböző gyermekeknek szóló programok és aktivitások, apaszabadság támogatás, irodai gyermek játszó sarok)Állatbarát irodaként működünk, bátran magaddal hozhatod kedvenc háziállatodat

Title: IT-Consultant
Description:
Deine ArbeitsumgebungDer Kunde bietet eine einzigartige Arbeitsumgebung, die das Beste aus beiden Welten vereint: ein familiäres, kollegiales Umfeld kombiniert mit der Möglichkeit, für einen internationalen Marktführer zu arbeiten. Die Unternehmenskultur ist geprägt von flachen Hierarchien, persönlicher Nähe und der Zusammenarbeit über Ländergrenzen hinweg. Mitarbeiter:innen werden ermutigt, ihre Ideen und Erfahrungen einzubringen, um das Unternehmen aktiv mitzugestalten und die Arbeitsbedingungen kontinuierlich zu verbessern. Spannende und herausfordernde Projekte im Bereich der Softwareentwicklung für den internationalen Versicherungsmarkt bieten täglich neue, abwechslungsreiche Aufgaben und fördern die persönliche Weiterentwicklung.Sie bieten für die Standorte Nürnberg und Köln eine Stelle als IT-Consultant (w/m/d) an.

Dein ArbeitsalltagIn der Position als IT-Consultant bist Du verantwortlich für die Entwicklung und Implementierung von geschäftskritischer Individual- und Standardsoftware für Versicherer.Dein Hauptaufgabengebiet umfasst sowohl die Anpassung und Individualisierung der Softwarelösungen in verschiedenen Kundenprojekten als auch die Arbeit an internen Projekten.Dabei berätst Du Kunden, unterstützt sie bei der Anwendung der Software und sorgst für eine reibungslose Integration der Lösungen in ihre bestehenden Systeme.

Was Du mitbringstEin erfolgreich abgeschlossenes Studium im Bereich Informatik oder Wirtschaftsinformatik, oder eine vergleichbare Berufsausbildung, bildet die Grundlage für deine Tätigkeit. Berufserfahrung in der Entwicklung von Java EE-Anwendungen und fundierte Kenntnisse in Java-Entwicklung, relationalen Datenbanken (SQL) sowie Modellierung und Design sind entscheidend für den Erfolg in dieser Rolle. Idealerweise bringst du auch Erfahrung in IT-Projekten im Versicherungsumfeld mit.

Die BenefitsDer Kunde bietet Dir eine Vielzahl an Benefits, die Dir nicht nur berufliche Weiterentwicklung ermöglichen, sondern auch eine ausgewogene Work-Life-Balance unterstützen – all das in einem sehr persönlichen und freundlichen Arbeitsumfeld, das von einer internationalen Unternehmensgruppe getragen wird. Zudem kannst Du abteilungsübergreifende Erfahrungen sammeln und so Dein Wissen und deine Fähigkeiten kontinuierlich erweitern.Homeoffice & flexible ArbeitszeitenÜbernahme der Kinderbetreuungskostenbetriebliche AltersvorsorgeSportangebote und Duschen vor Orteine Lounge mit Spielekonsolen & regelmäßige Firmen-Events

Title: IT Support Engineer
Description:
Draag jij graag verantwoordelijkheid voor de technische ondersteuning van verschillende klanten? Ben je op zoek naar een omgeving waar je kan groeien in jouw job? Dan ben je hier absoluut aan het juiste adres.
Voor de versterking van het interne IT team zijn we op zoek naar een gemotiveerde en enthousiaste IT Support Engineer. Als Support Engineer ben je een belangrijke schakel in de ondersteuning van de IT infrastructuur en zorg je voor het oplossen van allerlei gebruikersproblemen (gaande van een applicatie die niet opstart tot complexere problemen). Daarnaast identificeer & analyseer je problemen, lost ze op en zorgt voor heldere documentatie. Een duidelijke communicatie, zowel naar de eindgebruiker als naar je collega’s toe, beschouw je als een belangrijk deel van jouw job.
Wie ben jij?Je hebt kennis van o.a. W10/11, (Azure) Active Directory, Office 365, Hyper-V, Intune,....Certificaten zoals Microsoft Modern Desktop Administrator, Microsoft Office 365 Fundamentals of Microsoft 365 Certified Security Administrator Associate zijn zeker een troefJe bent hulpvaardig, klantgericht/klantvriendelijk en sterk in jouw communicatie
Wat is het aanbod?Een omgeving waar je kan steunen op een team vol ervaren collega-experts binnen hun vakgebied. Zo kan jij ook op eigen tempo groeien in de richting die jij wenst!Een loon gebaseerd op jouw kennis & kundeDe ruimte om je werk flexibel in te delen en veel vrijheid in je eigen rolEen efficiënte onboarding zodat je je snel thuis voelt en helemaal jouw ding kan doen!Een zeer ruim budget om te spenderen aan trainingen, cursussen, opleidingen,...Dag- en internetvergoedingGSM budget, laptop,...Een organisatie die jou stimuleert om te groeienGeen detachering, jouw collega's zijn écht jouw collega's!Een goede werk-privé door glijdende uren en mooi aantal vakantiedagen (20 + 12 ADV)....

Title: Python Software Engineer
Description:
Company Description:Severin Simko IT Services, established in 2018, is a dynamic IT company operating in Slovakia and the Czech Republic. We specialize in providing a range of IT services encompassing cybersecurity, automation, and software development.
Organizational Structure and Operations:Our project teams consist of 5-7 members, each with distinct responsibilities. Junior team members receive mentorship and guidance from senior technicians to facilitate professional development and problem-solving. While we maintain offices in Košice, Slovakia, and Brno, Czech Republic, current operations are remote. Our workforce is presently distributed across both countries.
Current Hiring Need:We are currently seeking a Python Developer for a Software Engineer position to contribute to our ongoing project, slinkydata.com, and support our continued growth.Full remote, but must be from Slovakia/Czech Republic
Project Overview:Slinky (slinkydata.com) is a lead and data management platform, designed and developed by Severin Simko IT Services since 2020. The platform is engineered to handle high-volume data processing, encompassing ingestion, parsing, and normalization. Slinky incorporates internal and external validation tools, empowering users to manage data utilization effectively. API integrations with various systems and solutions optimize data utilization and provide tracking and monitoring functionalities.
Role Responsibilities:Develop Python-based applications for the Slinky data management platform (slinkydata.com).Conduct testing of features developed by other team members.Ensure high performance and scalability by contributing to MySQL database management, including query optimization and scripting.Utilize and work with open-source technologies regularly.Write clean, maintainable code and follow best practices in software development.Maintain clear documentation of technical processes and application functionalities.Communicate directly with clients.
Required Qualifications:Proficiency in Python development (minimum 2+ years in production), with hands-on experience in relevant frameworks like Flask, Django, and FastAPI.Experience with Git for version control and collaborative development.Solid knowledge of databases, including MySQL or similar SQL, with experience in query optimization.AWS experience, including working with pipelines, batch jobs, and cloud-based deployment.Understanding of RESTful API development and microservices architecture.Problem-solving mindset with the ability to work independently and troubleshoot effectively.CI/CD pipeline experienceEffective time management, interpersonal, and communication skills.A willingness to learn new skills and technologies.English language proficiency at the Upper-Intermediate (B2) level.
Primary Description: Severin Simko IT Services · Košice, Kosice, Slovakia (On-site)
Company Description:
Severin Simko IT Services is a young and dynamic IT company based in Slovakia and the Czech Republic which was established in 2018 to provide cybersecurity solutions for log management, infrastructure monitoring, intrusion detection and prevention and general IT Infrastructure security hardening and automation.  

At Severin Simko IT Services, we are focused on helping small and medium sized businesses and individuals who want to improve their cybersecurity in order to protect their own business, customers, and data from cybersecurity threats or automate the repetitive technical tasks.
 
We design, implement and maintain cybersecurity solutions using open-source technologies to reduce downtime and business losses and provide protection of business-critical data according to the industry standards. 

Our area of expertise also includes automation of a broad range of IT functions including application deployment, configuration management and continuous delivery using Ansible and services related to a long-term Linux support and IT outsourcing and consulting.
Specialties: Cyber security,Log management,Infrastructure Monitoring,Intrusion detection,Automation,Linux

Title: Information Security Analyst
Description: Job RequirementsYour profile:You have at least 2 to 3 years of professional experience in the IT field.You are fluent in both English and French, with Dutch being a plus.You possess strong skills in MS Office.You have a basic understanding of the cybersecurity landscape. In-depth technical knowledge is not required initially, but a willingness to learn and apply new knowledge in a complex business environment is essential.You are familiar with privacy principles and regulations (such as GDPR), and have an understanding of risk management, with the ability to identify, assess, and mitigate digital risks.You can work effectively with various stakeholders and help foster a collaborative environment where cybersecurity is integrated across operations.You are open to pursuing recognized security certifications (e.g., CISSP, CISM, CISA, CGEIT, CRISC, ISO 27001/5).You have a keen eye for detail and can work independently with minimal supervision.You are skilled at presenting information in a clear and understandable way.You are knowledgeable in basic project management concepts, tools, and the phases of the project lifecycle.You are capable and eager to work in an international and multicultural environment with a strong focus on service orientation.You are willing to travel within Benelux and France (approximately 10%).

Title: Information Technology Auditor
Description:
Cégünkről: A BTA Group a hazai IT piac innovatív képviselője. Átfogó szolgáltatásokat nyújtunk szoftvertesztelés, fejlesztés, projektmenedzsment területen. Most új IT Auditor pozícióba keresünk tapasztalt kollégát, aki hozzájárul cégünk sikeréhez.
Feladatok:Részvétel IT rendszerek, folyamatok és infrastruktúrák átfogó auditálásában.A szervezet IT ellenőrzési és biztonsági politikájának értékelése és ajánlások megfogalmazása.Kockázatelemzések és kontrollpontok kialakítása.Az auditfolyamatok és eszközök folyamatos fejlesztése.Szoros együttműködés az informatikai csapattal a javaslatok végrehajtásában.Számviteli és jogszabályi előírások figyelemmel kísérése az IT rendszerek auditálása során.Jelentések készítése és az audit eredmények prezentálása.
Elvárások:Legalább 3 éves banki környezetben szerzett tapasztalat IT audit vagy IT kockázatelemzés területén.DORA (Digital Operational Resilience Act) ismerete.Mély technikai tudás az IT rendszerek működéséről, infrastruktúrákról.Tárgyalóképes angol nyelvismeretErős analitikai képességek és problémamegoldó készség.Jó kommunikációs készség.IT audit tanúsítvány (pl. Title: IT Security Specialist
Description:
We are looking for a talented Cybersecurity Engineer to join our team of IT professionals on behalf of a government sector client based in Nicosia, Cyprus.
Job Description:We are looking for an experienced IT Security Specialist  to join our team and contribute to high-impact cybersecurity projects. The ideal candidate will have a solid background in IT and hands-on experience in at least one of the following areas:
🔹 IT Asset Management – Overseeing and managing IT resources efficiently.🔹 Firewall Management – Configuring, maintaining, and monitoring security perimeters.🔹 Network Management – Ensuring network security, stability, and optimization.🔹 Patch Management – Implementing updates and security patches.🔹 Asset Hardening – Enhancing system security configurations.🔹 Antivirus Management – Deploying and managing endpoint protection solutions.🔹 Application Security – Securing software and mitigating vulnerabilities.🔹 Supplier Risk Management – Assessing and mitigating third-party risks.🔹 Identity & Access Management (IAM) – Controlling and managing user access.🔹 Privilege Access Management (PAM) – Securing and monitoring privileged accounts.🔹 Business Continuity & Disaster Recovery (BC/DR) – Developing resilience strategies.
Requirements:✔️ Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, IT, or related field.✔️ 6+ years of IT experience, with at least 2 years in a specialized cybersecurity role.✔️ Proven track record of participating in cybersecurity projects or operations.✔️ Hands-on expertise in at least one of the above-mentioned areas.

Title: Junior Cyber Security Analyst (all genders)
Description:
Orange Cyberdefense ist der führende Anbieter für professionelle Cyber Security Services und Lösungen im Businessbereich. Durch maßgeschneiderte, effiziente und standardisierte Lösungen im Bereich „Managed Threat Detection and Response“ sind wir in der Lage, mit Angreifern auf Augenhöhe zu agieren.
Zur Verstärkung unseres Cyber Security Operations Centers (CyberSOC) in Augsburg suchen wir junge Talente, die uns als Junior Cyber Security Analysten (all genders) in unserem CyberSOC 24x7 Team unterstützen und sich langfristig in unserem Unternehmen weiterentwickeln möchten.Die Aufgabe des Junior Cyber Security Analyst (all genders) besteht darin, Kompromittierungen und Angriffe bei unseren Kunden zu identifizieren, analysieren und einzudämmen. Als Basis dienen hierzu SIEM-Plattformen, Network- sowie Endpoint-Detection-and-Response-Lösungen führender Hersteller am Markt, gepaart mit der Kompetenz und Erfahrung unserer Mitarbeitenden.
Die Herausforderung für unsere AnalystInnen besteht darin, im täglichen Daten-Dschungel nach der berühmten Nadel im Heuhaufen zu suchen, die es uns ermöglicht, unsere Kunden bereits in frühen Phasen eines Angriffs zu informieren, sowie bei der Lösungssuche zu unterstützen. In enger Zusammenarbeit mit globalen Niederlassungen des CyberSOC und dem globalen CSIRT-Team unterstützen wir unsere Kunden im Incident-Response-Prozess.
Deine Aufgaben als Junior Cyber Security Analyst umfassen:Klassifizierung und Untersuchung von Alarmen aus unterschiedlichen Threat-Detection-Plattformen und Bereitstellung der aufbereiteten Ergebnisse an unsere KundenEinschätzung der Auswirkungen eines Angriffs, Durchführung von Erstmaßnahmen und Erstellung von konkreten HandlungsempfehlungenAnomalie- und Angriffsmustererkennung in allen Stufen der Cyber-KillchainToolgestütztes und manuelles Threat Hunting zur Erkennung von Angriffen, u.a. nach Bekanntwerden von Zero-Day-Exploits oder Schwachstellen mit potenziell schweren Auswirkungen auf KundenumgebungenZusammenarbeit mit SIEM-Spezialisten und weiteren technischen Experten, um Services und Tools zielgerichtet weiterzuentwickeln und möglichst viele wiederkehrende Aufgaben zu automatisieren
Was du mitbringen solltest:Du hast eine erfolgreich abgeschlossene Ausbildung als Fachinformatiker (verschiedene Schwerpunkte), eine vergleichbare Ausbildung oder ein Studium im MINT-BereichWeiterführende Berufserfahrung ist ein Plus aber kein MussDu beschäftigst dich in deiner Freizeit gerne mit Cyber Security (z.B. Try Hack Me, Hack The Box, Podcasts, etc.)Deine Persönlichkeit ist geprägt von einer schnellen Auffassungsgabe und der Bereitschaft, sich in neue Themen einzuarbeitenDu hast eine lösungs- und zielorientierte Arbeitsweise und die Fähigkeit, im Team zu arbeitenWir freuen uns, wenn du bereits Basiskenntnisse in den Bereichen Netzwerk (TCP/IP, Application Layer) und Betriebssysteme (Windows/Unix) hastBonuspunkte gibt es, wenn du dich mit einem oder mehrerer dieser Themen bereits auskennst: Microsoft Security, Firewalls, EDR, SIEM, IDS/IPS, Pentesting, Red und Blue TeamingBereitschaft zu Nacht-/ Feiertags-/ WochenendschichtenFür diese Stelle solltest du außerdem sehr gute Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse (Sprachniveau B2 und aufwärts) mitbringen
Das erwartet dich bei uns:🤝 Verantwortungsvolle Aufgaben in einem internationalen Umfeld👩‍💻 Mobile Office Option📚 Stukturierte Einarbeitungsphase mit Paten🎓 Unterstützung bei deiner individuellen Weiterentwicklung🌴 30 Urlaubstage + Möglichkeit zu 2 Wochen unbezahltem Urlaub, Sabbatical & Workation🕙 Flexible Arbeitszeiten und Arbeitszeitmodelle🛍️ Corporate Benefits🥗 Pizza- und Bowl-Tage an unseren Standorten München und Augsburg🩺 EGym Wellpass🚲 Job Rad🥳 Diverse Teamevents (Wiesn, Weihnachtsfeier, Feierabendrunde, Grillevents auf unseren Dachterrassen)🎁 Kleine Aufmerksamkeiten zum Geburtstag, zu Jubiläen und besonderen Ereignissen

How does working in a Scrum team helps you to align technology and business aspects?

Company Description:
Loxon is a trusted business solutions provider with more than 20 years of experience in the field of end-to-end credit management. Since 2000, we’ve offered comprehensive, integrated lending, collection and risk management solutions for the financial services industry. 
 
The company was started by young banking experts with a desire to find a customer-centric way to help banks and financial institutions improve their lending and collection activities and risk assessment procedures, build efficient, risk-aware processes, and reduce credit losses.  

Loxon’s vision from the start is to make managing finances seamless for everyone. And as a trusted market expert, our extensive, in-depth knowledge of different business scenarios, coupled with our expert teams and a large partner network, empower us to solve a range of credit management issues. 

Loxon’s core value is its ability to unite its extensive business knowledge with the latest technology, creating best-in-class business solutions. Since our inception, we’ve become one of the market leaders in end-to-end credit management business solutions, employing more than 200 people and successfully cooperating with 80+ financial brands and banking groups globally. This enables us to continuously gain more understanding of the global market’s changing needs. 

Loxon, with its customer-centric mindset and client-centred support, is dedicated to being a marketplace leader by providing its customers with a reliable, competitive advantage, while maximising their business potential.

Title: Junior Consultant - Cybersecurity
Description:
Chi siamoSiamo un gruppo multinazionale di consulenza direzionale, leader nell'analisi e nella progettazione di modelli di Governance, Organizzazione e Controllo. Aiutiamo i nostri clienti ad esplorare nuove opportunità di sviluppo e crescita del valore, identificando rischi e definendo le migliori strategie di gestione e controllo.Abbiamo una significativa presenza internazionale, con 85 uffici e oltre 7000 dipendenti in tutto il mondo. Operiamo in Italia dal 2004 con oltre 500 professionisti.Protiviti è un Worldwide partner di soluzioni cloud di Microsoft con diversi Microsoft MVP e Microsoft MCT nei nostri team.
Chi cerchiamoA fronte di un consolidato trend di crescita dei servizi di Cybersecurity, per la nostra sede di Roma, siamo alla ricerca di risorse junior da inserire nell'area della Technology Consulting.Il team di Cybersecurity e Data Protection di Protiviti trasforma il rischio potenziale in un vantaggio competitivo, proteggendo ogni livello dell’organizzazione per concedere nuove opportunità di business, in modo sicuro.Entrare a far parte del team di Cybersecurity di Protiviti consente di lavorare su progetti di:Security Program & Strategy: supporto alla definizione e al mantenimento di strategie e modelli di Information Security;Incident Response & Recovery: definizione dei processi di security incident management e analisi e supporto operativo nella gestione degli stessi;Data Security & Privacy: definizione di progetti di data security sia a livello di governance (data classification, definizione policy procedure e processi) che di implementazione di soluzioni tecniche a supporto (es. DLP, Encryption, ecc.);Digital Identity: supporto complessivo nella definizione di programmi di Digital Identity sia a livello di governance che di implementazione delle relative soluzioni tecniche a supporto;Microsoft Security: implementazione di soluzioni di sicurezza Microsoft.

Requisiti:Laurea STEM o laurea in Economia a indirizzo informatico;Curiosità nell’approfondimento tematico e applicativo della Sicurezza informatica;Conoscenza fluente dell'inglese;Buone capacità relazionali e comunicative, predisposizione al lavoro di gruppo, intraprendenza e flessibilità.

Protiviti è una società che offre pari opportunità e valorizza la diversità e l'inclusione. Il nostro processo di selezione è meritocratico e lontano da qualsivoglia forma di discriminazione diretta o indiretta, nel rispetto dei migliori standard internazionali e delle leggi applicabili (inclusi ma non limitati alla L. 903/77).
Company Description:
Protiviti è un Gruppo multinazionale di consulenza direzionale, leader nell’analisi e progettazione di modelli di Risk Management, Organizzazione, Compliance e Controllo; supporta le aziende nell’identificazione dei rischi e nella definizione delle migliori strategie di gestione, governo e controllo. 

In Italia, Protiviti opera nelle sedi di Milano, Torino e Roma e conta oltre 250 professionisti.

Protiviti è un network caratterizzato da una presenza internazionale di rilievo con oltre 70 uffici nel mondo e oltre 4.600 persone. La base Clienti include oltre il 60% delle imprese del Fortune 1000 e il 35% delle Global 500. Obiettivo di Protiviti è la diffusione di una cultura aziendale finalizzata ad allineare i processi, i sistemi informativi e l’organizzazione alle migliori prassi internazionali. 

Protiviti fa parte del Gruppo Robert Half (RHI), quotato al NYSE e appartenente all’indice S&P 500.

© 2018 Protiviti Srl.

Title: SOC Analyst I
Description:
About eSentireeSentire is on a mission to hunt, investigate and stop cyber threats before they become business disrupting events. We were founded on the premise that if you can’t find a solution, you build it. Entrepreneurship and innovation are in our DNA. Our culture is based on transparency, teamwork, and continuous innovation.
As the authority in Managed Detection and Response, we protect the critical data and applications of 2000+ organizations in 80+ countries, across 35 industries from known and unknown cyber threats.
 The Opportunity The Global Security Operations Centre (GSOC) is central to eSentire’s Service Delivery Organization (SDO) with a growing team of over 100 passionate members across two SOC locations in Canada and Ireland. The GSOC delivers comprehensive security services to customers worldwide on a 24x7 basis, utilizing best-in-class tooling from both external vendors and internally developed technologies. We are trusted by over 1500 organizations globally to detect and respond to cyber threats and to protect them from business disruption.
eSentire considers employee development, wellbeing, and mental health as top priorities. GSOC Analysts operate on static and predictable 8-hour shifts which offer a healthy work-life balance and are provided with resources to develop and grow their careers.
The successful candidate will perform Tier I security analysis tasks across network and endpoint security in a fast-paced and dynamic environment.
 Tier I Responsibilities Analyze incoming security signals in real time with a balance of accuracy and speed using a variety of forensic toolsApply investigative tools, techniques and procedures (TTPs), use your understanding of the security threats associated with the incoming signals and follow defined runbooks to determine and execute the relevant actionsPerform allowlisting/filtering of false positive signalsFor confirmed true positive signals, you will alert clients using defined templates and escalate high priority alerts to clients by phoneBlock malicious network traffic and isolate infected hosts on customers networksAdd malicious IOC’s to eSentire’s Global Denylist for all customers where appropriate.Complete basic-intermediate client support requests/queries assigned by the operations lead. Work directly with clients via email/phone as needed to complete these tasksHandle some service administration and troubleshooting tasks 
 Requirements  Relevant degree in Computer Science, IT Security, IT Management, IT Support or related discipline or up to 3+ years equivalent experience. Degree course or industry experience must include a strong focus on networking and security.Keen interest in Cyber Security with foundational knowledge of network and endpoint security technologies including:Intrusion Detection Systems (IDS), Snort/SuricataPacket Capture (PCAP) Analysis using WiresharkWindows system internals, basic knowledge of PowerShellLinux Kernel and basic scripting (Bash/Python) knowledgeAnalytical mind with strong attention to detail and a commitment to quality of serviceStrong customer facing written and verbal communication skills with the ability to effectively communicate complex security concepts with end customers.Natural ability to thrive in a fast-paced and time sensitive environmentAbility to work in an operational/shift-based environment with flexible working hours to include evenings and weekends 
Our Culture and ValuesAt eSentire we work in a collaborative and innovative work environment. We work with brilliant and passionate people who strive and encourage others to do their best. eSentire’s idea-rich environment welcomes creative and sometimes unconventional perspectives!We celebrate diversity, operating with mutual respect and consideration, in an environment that fosters inclusivity for all. We believe that a variety of perspectives, backgrounds, and experiences make us stronger – if you’re enthusiastic about this opportunity but don’t meet every qualification, we encourage you to apply anyway. It takes a diverse set of thoughts, cultures, backgrounds, and perspectives to be a true market leader.
Total RewardsWe believe in rewarding performance and providing comprehensive benefits tailored to support your well-being. Our package includes comprehensive health benefits, a flexible vacation plan, and participation in our company-wide equity program, allowing you to share in the success and growth of our organization.
AccommodationIf you have any accessibility requirements during the recruitment process, please reach out to our HR team at aoda@esentire.com and any accommodation needs will be addressed upon request. Your talents and unique perspectives are valued, and we look forward to the opportunity to work together to build a more inclusive future.
It's our mission at eSentire to protect our customers 24/7/365 and we extend this conviction to job seekers. Title: Junior Software Security Engineer
Description:
Stelfox is partnering with a SaaS Product provider who deploy their B2B solutions across an international portfolio of financial services & Insurance organisation.
We are looking to add a Junior Application / Software Security Engineer to the team, in order to help safeguard applications and protect data from cyber threats. Ideally you will have a background in software development and security tooling.
Some of the tasks include:Work closely with software development teams to integrate security into the SDLC,Conduct security assessments and provide guidance on secure coding practices.Develop & implement security policies and proceduresPerform penetration testing & vulnerability scanning.Stay up to date with the latest trends and threats.Work with third-party vendors to ensure security compliance.Conduct threat modelling and risk analysis.

Title: Technical Consultant
Description:
Technical Consultant - IAM Software Platform
Identity & Access Management Software Company
Linux, Windows, Powershell, Bash, REST API's, SQL, PostgreSQL...
Fluent Dutch is essential
Salary: Upto ~5000 per month depending on experienceBenefits: 27.5 holidays, pension, 8% holiday, learning budget, quarterly trips...Level: Mid or Senior (~3+ years experience)Location: Commutable to Houten, Netherlands 2/3 days a week (flexibility when you need around your personal situation)
Here's what they're looking for:
You have a technical skillset - API's, Databases & Scripting won't be alien to you: Linux, Windows, Powershell, Bash, REST API's, SQL, PostgreSQL...You're someone who's naturally curious, enjoys finding solutions & solving problems, you're interested in learning new things, and enjoys variety in your workYou're happy being client facing & comfortable being independent with flexibility to manage your workYou don't need IAM experience, but experience or an interest would be helpful
Does this sound like you? Great! here's some more info...
Your Role
As a technical consultant, you'll be designing, implementing, and optimizing their IAM solution depending on the needs of their clients.
You'll likely be implementing solutions in new environments, working on new feature requests, handling client questions, sharing knowledge, dealing with challenges etc. You'll be in a client facing role, so you'll be a strong communicator and someone who can apply yourself to different scenarios and a varied role.
There's 3 key areas in the business: compliance, access & identity; you'll join team access focussed on their access management solution alongside ~5 others in your immediate team. Your department is led by an experienced manager who's far from a micromanager... he gives you the trust and freedom to manage your own workload, supports you however you need, and is there to help and share his knowledge.
Your colleagues are developers, support, sales people.... parents, bakers, travel lovers and more. There's a wide range of people from all walks of life who care about work-life balance and enjoy a relaxed, fun, supportive, humorous and sociable environment. Office Fussball, drinks, fun events and more if that's something you want to be involved in.
Company
With cyber-criminals now 'logging in', you'll be joining an Identity & Access Management company on a mission with their software and services to ensure the right people have access to the right data, at the right time, for the right reasons.
20 years and counting along with multiple acquisitions, they continue to thrive with their unified central platform and services offering compliance, access and identity solutions making adifference across sectors that society relies on most like healthcare, Banking, Government and more.
They're financially backed and supported by one of the largest software investors in Europe, and with 70+ people in 3 locations, you'll be joining their access division as part of their IAM solution team based in Houten.

Title: Threat Intelligence Analyst
Description:
QIBIT, divisione ICT di Gi Group S.p.A., prima Multinazionale Italiana del Lavoro, è specializzata nella selezione, formazione, inserimento e sviluppo professionale dei profili IT per il mercato italiano. Il nostro obiettivo è generare valore e crescita professionale per le proprie Persone e garantire la sostenibilità nei progetti IT dei Clienti e Partner tecnologici, presenti e attivi principalmente nei settori bancario, assicurativo, telecomunicazioni, utilities, e-commerce.
Il nostro Cliente è una fra le più importanti società di consulenza strategica a livello internazionale. Per inserimento diretto nel nuovo Hub Tecnologico basato su Napoli ricerchiamo una figura di Threat Intelligence Analyst.
Responsabilità principali:Raccogliere e analizzare dati di threat intelligence provenienti da fonti OSINT, CLOSINT, etc.Identificare e profilare threat actors e mappandoli sul MITRE ATT&CK framework.Monitorare e prevedere trend emergenti nel panorama delle minacce informatiche, fornendo insight strategiciSupportare attività di threat hunting e collaborare con Red Team e Blue TeamSupportare il team nella gestione delle minacce, fornendo raccomandazioni basate su analisi approfondite.Contribuire alla redazione di report di intelligence e analisi del rischio, fornendo informazioni chiare e fruibili per stakeholder tecnici e non tecnici.Collaborare con i team di sicurezza, risk management e compliance per garantire l’allineamento delle strategie difensive alle normative e best practice di settore.
Requisiti:Esperienza nelle attività sopracitate;Familiarità con MITRE ATT&CK framework;Conoscenza delle tattiche e tecniche di attacco utilizzate da threat actors e gruppi APT.Esperienza nell’uso di strumenti di threat intelligence e threat hunting.Capacità di analizzare grandi quantità di dati e identificare schemi e tendenze significative.Eccellenti capacità di comunicazione e redazione di report, con attitudine al problem-solving.
Contratto: tempo indeterminato direttoSede: Napoli – possibilità di lavoro da remoto al 50% Gi Group S.p.A. è autorizzata ad operare dal Ministero del Lavoro e delle Politiche Sociali (Aut. Min. 26/11/2004 PROT. 1101- SG). L’offerta si intende rivolta ai candidati nel rispetto del D.lgs. n. 198/2006 e ss.mm.ii. e dei Decreti Legislativi n. 215 en. 216 del 2003 sulle parità di trattamento. I candidati sono invitati a leggere l’informativaprivacy ai sensi degli artt. 13 e 14 del Reg. EU 679/2016 al seguente indirizzo www.gigroup.it/privacy-candidati

Title: Working Student – IT, Information Security & AI
Description:
About Us

Munich-based Workpath was founded with the mission to enable organizations to define and achieve their most important goals and support a holistic, integrated, and outcome-oriented strategy execution for large organizations. Workpath makes strategy work simple and accessible from top-level management to team members, integrates seamlessly with corporate processes and tools, leverages Artificial Intelligence and offers strategy execution enablement and training services. Leading Fortune 500 companies worldwide trust Workpath. For more information, please visit: https://workpath.com/en/home

Role Overview

We are looking for a motivated Working Student (IT, Information Security & AI) (m/w/d) to support our Engineering team at Workpath. In this role, you will assist with and take ownership of processes related to Information Security, prepare for regular ISO 27001 security audits, figure out how to leverage AI in order to make work on our ISMS (Information Security Management System) more efficient and take over general IT tasks.

You will work closely with our CTPO (Chief Technology and Product Officer).

If you have a keen interest in cybersecurity, IT governance, and AI-driven automation, this role will give you valuable hands-on experience in a dynamic SaaS company.

Key Responsibilities

Information Security

Assist with and take ownership of processes which are part of our ISMS: Information security training, risk management, management review, pen tests etc.Support in InfoSec audits (ISO27001, TISAX, customer audits) and auditor relations.

AI Use Cases

Explore the use of AI-driven tools for a variety of use cases (e.g. for the ISMS) across the company in order to make Workpath more effective and efficient.

IT & Operations

Assist with managing company laptops and phones, and general IT requests.Review new tools and processes to assess risks and InfoSec compliance.Collaborate with internal teams to ensure secure and compliant IT operations.

Requirements

We don’t expect you to be an expert—what matters most is your curiosity, motivation, and willingness to learn. However, you’re a great fit if you have:

Currently enrolled in a Bachelor’s or Master’s program in IT, Computer Science, Cybersecurity, or a related field.Basic knowledge of information security principles, and interest to learn more.Interest in AI and automation.Strong analytical skills and a structured way of working.Proficiency in German and English (spoken and written).

What We Offer

Hands-on experience in Information Security & AI at a fast-growing SaaS company.Flexible working hours to fit your study schedule.Mentorship & learning opportunities from experienced professionals.A hybrid work environment with remote work options.Mental health days and support through OpenUp.Attractive salary package, Hrmony allowance, and other benefits.

Join Us

If you are passionate about creating impactful content and driving Marketing success in a dynamic startup environment, we would love to hear from you. Apply now to be a part of our journey in shaping the future of work.

Apply Here

For more information about Workpath, visit our website.

This is achieved through Workpath‘s strategic operating software consisting of workflow and analytics tools as well as an all-in-one enablement solution. 
Workpath is headquartered in Munich, Germany. The company is backed by industry experts with many years of experience in leadership and technology.

Title: Python developer

Jeho hlavnou úlohou bude všetko spojené s vývojom a udržiavaním data science aplikácií a služieb.
Hlavné zodpovednosti a úlohy na tejto pozícii budú: 
• vyvíjať efektívny, čistý a opakovateľne použiteľný kód, ktorý možno ľahko udržiavať a škálovať• analyzovať požiadavky pre dodávanie kvalitných riešení• vyvíjať BE časti produkčných aplikácií• koordinovať sa s internými tímami na pochopenie požiadaviek užívateľov a poskytnutie technických riešení• zlepšovať funkčnosti existujúcich systémov• participovať na code review• pomáhať s prípravou pre nasadenie aplikácií a poskytovať podporu po nasadení podľa potreby• pomáhať nastavovať štandardy a pravidlá pre vývoj data science aplikácií• hodnotiť a prioritizovať požiadavky na zmeny a nové funkcionality
Radi sa s Tebou stretneme ak máš:
• skúsenosti s vývojom BE častí aplikácie v Python-e, najmä vývoj API• veľmi dobré porozumenie princípov vývoja aplikácií a práce s Python frameworkami (FastApi, Django...) a vieš pracovať s kontajnerovými platformami (Docker)• dobré schopnosti pri navrhovaní unit testov, debugovania• dobrú znalosť nástrojov na verzovanie kódu (Git)• dobré komunikačné zručnosti pre vyjasnenie úloh a vysvetlenie navrhovaných riešení• schopnosť pracovať pod tlakom, navrhovať a nachádzať efektívne riešenia problémov• samostatnosť ako aj efektívnu kooperáciu v tíme• schopnosť prioritizácie
Ďalšie benefity:
• Príležitosť byť súčasťou silnej a úspešnej banky• Možnosť stáť pri zrode bankových inovácií• Atraktívne kariérne príležitosti• Kvalitný odborný a osobnostný rozvoj• Práca so skúsenými lídrami• Zvýhodnenia na produktoch Tatra banky balík služieb Tatra personal, úvery, zmenárenské služby• Motivačné ohodnotenie• Dni Zdravia• Bezplatná psychologická podpora 24/7• Príspevok na DDS

Title: Software Engineer
Description:
Sisu Group is a fast growing iGaming startup with offices in Tallinn and Malaga, and over 140 team members. We are on a mission to revolutionise iGaming and sports betting by creating the next-generation platform and products. Our offerings are 100% cloud-based, capable of seamless scaling across different regions and brands. So far in 2024, we have successfully launched two brands, ReSpin and Epicbet, on our proprietary platform. Sisu Group is founded by iGaming veteran Jan Svendsen, who previously founded Coolbet, NordicBet and Triobet. The majority of the company is owned by staff, with secured funding totalling €21M.
We are seeking a Software Engineer to help us build the next generation iGaming platform. If you're looking to build something from the ground up, free from any technical debt, look no further than Sisu Group.
You’ll have the exciting opportunity to:Design and develop software solutions to meet business needsWrite clean, efficient, and maintainable codeCollaborate with cross-functional teams to gather and analyze requirementsImprove the performance, scalability, and reliability of the softwareBuild and deploy automated, cutting-edge software that is cloud-native.
What we expect:Willingness to create new services from scratchInterest to automate where possibleUnderstanding of application lifecycle and agile workflowsStrong communication and teamwork skillsGenuine interest and enthusiasm for the technologies and tools we use
What we use:Typescript & Node.jsReact / PreactTerraform (CDK)Google CloudGithubMonorepoArgoCDPostgreSQL
Location: Tallinn, working hybrid - 4 in the office and a day remote.
Company culture and benefits:At Sisu Group we believe in creating a positive and inclusive workplace culture where teamwork is the key. We value collaboration, open communication, and treat all team members as equals. We encourage each other to be proactive and take ownership, while also providing the support and resources needed to help them grow and develop even further.
We understand that our employees are our biggest asset, which is why we offer a competitive compensation package that includes stock options, and generous paid time off. We believe that building a great company is about more than just creating a successful product, it's about building a community of passionate and driven individuals who share a common goal.
If you're looking for a company where you can grow professionally, work with talented and dedicated colleagues, and make a real impact, while sharing our key values of caring, thinking outside the box, taking charge and having a positive mindset, then Sisu Group is the place for you.
By submitting this application, the candidate agrees that Sisu Group stores personal details to be able to process the job application. Sisu Group follows and is compliant with the General Data Protection Regulation. Clear police record required, ensuring a commitment to integrity and a safe workplace.

Company Description:
Sisu Group is a fast growing iGaming startup with offices in Tallinn and Malaga, and over 130 team members. We are on a mission to revolutionize iGaming and sports betting by creating the next-generation platform and products. Our offerings are 100% cloud-based, capable of seamless scaling across different regions and brands. 

Sisu Group is founded by iGaming veteran and hall-of-famer Jan Svendsen, who previously founded Coolbet, NordicBet and Triobet. Co-founders are CEO Anders Karlsen and CFO Yannick A. Svendsen. The majority of the company is owned by staff, with secured funding totaling €21M.

We are passionate about what we do, we are product driven and always moving forward. We are dedicated to creating a workplace that is truly enjoyable and motivating, where everyone is aligned and enthusiastic about their work. Sisu is a Finnish word with a meaning of extraordinary courage, determination and perseverance. It embodies the core meaning of our company in our journey to creating the best iGaming products and platform in the world.

Our team is highly experienced with over 800 years of industry experience. We know what it takes to build a successful company and top-notch software from scratch.

In January 2024 we launched our first brand built on our proprietary platform, ReSpin.com, which is a lightning fast online casino that focuses on personalized rewards and user experience. In June 2024 we launched our second brand, Epicbet.com, a sports-driven brand powered by our proprietary sportsbook, with user experience and product in focus.

We are scaling up the organization rapidly and are always in the lookout for talented team players. We offer competitive salaries combined with stock options, because here in Sisu we are all owners! Reach out to info@sisugroup.com if you want to know more and join our fun journey.

Title: Data Analyst Trainee
Description:
Join our Team

About this opportunity:

Launch your career at Ericsson, a leading Information and Communication Technology (ICT) company! Here in Tallinn, we have an innovation center with cutting-edge technology and world-class experts developing new Industry 4.0 solutions for the manufacturing of Ericsson mobile network radio products.

We offer real challenges and hands-on experience in our Smart Manufacturing unit, supported by a personal advisor, a motivational team, and competitive compensation. We foster a culture of innovation, lifelong learning, and continuous development, where we experiment, learn, and push boundaries together.

We expect you to be studying at vocational, bachelor or master level. Be the one who makes things happen – join us

Gain insights into the data flows and processes involved in electronics manufacturing operations.Contribute to the resolution of production challenges through data analysis and problem-solving techniques.Assist in the design, development, and implementation of data visualizations and analytics solutions to support business decision-making.Collaborate with the analytics team to provide technical support and troubleshooting assistance to analytics users.

The skills you bring:

Foundational knowledge of data analytics concepts and usage of BI tools (Power BI).Basic understanding of data engineering principles, data modelling and ETL processes.Anatural curiosity and analytical mindset, coupled with a proactive approach to applying these skills to real-world business problem-solving. 

 Why join Ericsson?

At Ericsson, you´ll have an outstanding opportunity. The chance to use your skills and imagination to push the boundaries of what´s possible. To build solutions never seen before to some of the world’s toughest problems. You´ll be challenged, but you won’t be alone. You´ll be joining a team of diverse innovators, all driven to go beyond the status quo to craft what comes next.

We encourage people from all backgrounds to apply and realize their full potential as part of our Ericsson team. Title: Junior Database Administrator
Description:
Getronics is a global ICT integrator with a long history that extends over 135 years, across various locations in the UK, Europe, Asia Pacific and Latin America. Getronics are the founders and leading member of the Global Workspace Alliance with a unique model provides customer with consistent IT services. Our vision is to reimagine the digital future one customer as a time.
We have an exciting opportunity for an Junior Database Administrator to join our team!
Team Purpose:
Working within Managed Services, the DBA Team currently comprises of 7 DBA’s, 4 of whom specialize in SQL Server. The DBA team provide remote database administration services for nearly 400+ SQL Servers across multiple different customers. Our primary support platforms are SQL Server 2008 - 2019 running under Windows 2012 - 2019, and include some high availability solutions, with a limited number of legacy Windows 2003/ 2008 and some SQL Server 2000/2005 installations.
Role Purpose:
As part of the global operations team, the role will be reporting into the DBA team leader. It will require interaction with various teams within Managed Services such as Windows, Storage and Virtualization team as well as non-technical teams such as Service Desk, Change Management and the Project Management Office. The role has no direct reports.
Responsibilities/Accountability:
To install, support and maintain MS SQL Server instances and databases under the guidance of a Senior DBA. To work as part of the team DBA to ensure that all SLA’s are maintained. Respond to all SQL Server related incidents.Assist the team with proactive improvements to internal processes.To participate in the change control process.
Skills/Experience:
Ideally the applicant will have some understanding of databases, preferably with some experience using SQL Server.Experience with Windows 2012 through to Windows 2019 Operating Systems.Experience working with High Availability solutions such as Windows Clustering.Experience with Disaster Recovery solutions.An understanding of virtualization technologies.An understanding of storage technologies.An aptitude for problem-solving in a multi-disciplinary environment.Understanding of ITIL processes.Knowledge of TSQL, VB/ ASP, PowerShell would be an advantageExcellent written and oral communication skills
If you think you have 75% or even 90% of what we are looking for and know you are capable of the responsibilities and duties at hand, we encourage you to apply! Not all applicants require 100% of what we expect. This will prove you are willing to develop, curious to learn and grow professionally and personally.
What to do next:
If this ticks your boxes, and you are looking for a new and exciting opportunity, then please apply below with a copy of your CV and your contact details. We would appreciate a short message as to why you are interested in the position and Getronics!
As a business, we offer an Employee Referral Programme, if you have someone in your life you think would be a perfect fit then send them a link to the career’s webpage.
If you would like to ask any questions regarding our vacancies, Getronics as a business, or anything else, please don’t hesitate to get in touch. The Talent Acquisition team will be available on 0141 814 1055 or alternatively, email into weallmakeuk@getronics.com
We are committed to equal opportunities for all staff and applications from individuals are encouraged, regardless of age, disability, gender, sexual orientation, race, religion, or belief, relationship status, and families.
Company Description:
We empower your business to stay competitive by offering flexible, secure and reliable technology services, tailored to your unique needs, helping to drive growth, increase efficiency, reduce cost, and delivers measurable success.

We are committed to low-carbon and sustainable development through our IT solutions to help companies like yours reduce your environmental impact.

Getronics is a global leader in technology solutions with a team of over 4,000 colleagues in 22 centres, providing comprehensive end-to-end services across the globe. 

We are one of only 18 companies from around the world positioned within the Gartner’s 2024 Magic Quadrant for Outsourced Digital Workplace services, and we are the leading and founding member of the Global Workspace Alliance (GWA).

We are committed to delivering exceptional customer service, to enable your business to focus on your core strengths while entrusting your IT needs to Getronics.

Title: Data Engineer in Finance Tribe
Description:
Job Description

Join us in our quest to provide fast & accurate financial information to investors, regulators, and internal decision-makers, as well as optimizing the management of financial resources. Your expertise in Python programming and data engineering will be instrumental in building a scheduling platform on AWS, creating data transformations, data monitoring and reconciliation jobs in Python.

As a Data Engineer, you will be a part of our innovative team working on the Daily Profit&Loss application. You will be helping the team to build a new AWS-based platform. You will ensure a smooth migration of ELT, data monitoring and reporting scripts from SAS to Python language. You will collaborate with a self-driven cross-functional agile squad including Analysts, Engineers, DevOps. We assure you plenty of room to grow using a modern technology stack and AWS Cloud services.

Finance Tribe ensures Danske Bank delivers on its financial potential, benefiting customers, colleagues, society, and investors by building a solid bank financially. We make sure this is done by efficiently steering Danske Bank’s finances.

We have a variety of initiatives, delivering on our goals to provide fast & accurate financial information to investors, regulators, and internal decision-makers, as well as optimizing the management of financial resources.

Depending on your experience and knowledge, we may offer you a different seniority for the role.

You will:

Collaborate closely with the team to build the target architecture on AWSEnsure smooth migration of SAS based data monitoring and reconciliation solution to Python basedEnsure all code deployment is done via pipelines and all application code is stored in version controlWork in an agile & collaborative manner within internationally (Denmark and Lithuania) distributed squadWorking closely with other developers to ensure development is in par with development guidelines and best practices

About you:

You are skilled in SQL databases and programming with Python(Optionally) you have experience with SAS programming languageYou are adept at creating, modifying, and maintaining ETL (Extract, Transform, Load) or ELT (Extract, Load, Transform) workflowsYou have experience with Amazon Web Services (AWS), including managing cloud infrastructure with TerraformGood understanding of development lifecycle process, willingness to learn new programming languages, tools, and processesHave a high level of personal responsibility and commitment to the team goalsAnalytical mindset to understand the problem and turn it into solution using code as a toolAdvanced English skills

We offer:

Monthly salary range from 3480 EUR to 5220 EUR gross (based on your competencies relevant for the job).

Additionally, each Danske Bank employee receives employee benefits package which includes:

Growth opportunities: professional & supportive team, e-learnings, numerous development programs; (incl. professional certificates); 100+ professions for internal mobility opportunities.Health & Well-being: a diverse, inclusive, work & life balance work environment; additional health insurance; mental well-being practices; partial psychologist counselling compensation; silence and sleep zones at the office; game rooms.Hybrid working conditions: Work from home up to two days a week; home office budget (after the probation period); modern Danske Campus workplace developed with anthropologist for the best employee experience.Additional days of leave: for rest, health, volunteering, exams in higher education institutions, and other important activities. Moreover, for seniority with Danske Bank.Monetary compensation package: accidents & critical diseases insurance; financial support in case of unfortunate events, travel insurance; IIIrd Pillar Pension Fund contribution.

See all the benefits HERE.

Your title in job contract will be IT Software Engineer (Cloud Specialist).

“We celebrate multiple approaches and points of view. We believe diversity drives innovation.”

If you have any questions, please contact Dalia Kaulakienė.

Danske Bank is a Nordic bank with bridges to the world around us. For 150 years, we have supported people and businesses in releasing their potential. A career with us is an opportunity to join a community of 22,000 colleagues in a culture where we are committed to Teaming Up, Owning It and Being Open. Together, we are on a journey to transform Danske Bank into a better bank. For our customers, our employees and the societies around us.

Company Description:
Affinity is a consulting company specialized in information technologies, focused on people and with the assumed proposition of offering valuable business and career experiences for its extraordinary and extensive community of global talent and partners.

Recognized by Deloitte Technology Fast 500 for two consecutive years and distinguished by Financial Times 1000 and INC Europe 5000, Affinity offers outsourcing and nearshoring services, today with +10 years of activity, +400 employees, and projects in more than 20 countries. Affinity is headquartered in Lisbon, Portugal, it has offices in Oporto and Obidos and representations in Sao Paulo, Brazil and Tunis, Tunisia.

Affinity also has a product development area, especially dedicated to Keywork, is a brand dedicated to developing human resource oriented products for greater agility and process efficiency. Defending the values of Affinity, Ambition, Action and Apprenticeship (Learning) in everything it proposes, Affinity is driven by the mission of offering IT consulting services and quality cloud products, nationally and internationally, promoting and developing unique experiences and translating a real commitment to creating mutually prosperous relationships with people, the market, society, and nature.

Je wordt onderdeel van een gezellig en professioneel team, met de focus op de nieuwste technologieën en een goede werk-privébalans.

Over de rol - Eerstelijns en tweedelijns support bieden aan eindgebruikers. Incidenten registreren, analyseren en oplossen met behulp van registratietools zoals TOPdesk. Installeren en configureren van hardware en software. Zorgen voor de optimale werking van systemen en netwerkomgevingen. Eerstelijns en tweedelijns support bieden aan eindgebruikersIncidenten registreren, analyseren en oplossen met behulp van registratietools zoals TOPdeskInstalleren en configureren van hardware en softwareZorgen voor de optimale werking van systemen en netwerkomgevingenContact onderhouden met verschillende afdelingen en als tussenpersoon fungeren tussen de gebruiker en technische teams

Kwalificaties - Een MBO ICT diploma of HBO werk- en denkniveau.

Vereiste vaardigheden
1-2 jaar aantoonbare werkervaring in IT supportErvaring met tools zoals TOPdesk (of vergelijkbare tools)Certificering op het gebied van Microsoft en/of ITIL is een préGoede beheersing van de Nederlandse taal, zowel schriftelijk als mondelingMinimaal 32 uur per week beschikbaarIn bezit van rijbewijs B

Loonbereik en compensatiepakket - Een salaris tot €3500 bij 40 uur (afhankelijk van opleiding, ervaring en certificering). Bonusregeling per behaald certificaat (€100 - €250). Een leaseauto of fiets, reiskostenvergoeding of NS Businesscard. 37 verlofdagen, waarvan 12 voor studie. Mogelijkheid om thuis te werken en flexibele werktijden. Doorgroeimogelijkheden naar functies als systeembeheerder of consultant. Een prettige werksfeer en de kans om te werken bij topbedrijven.

Gelijke kansen verklaring - Inclusief een verklaring over toewijding aan diversiteit en inclusiviteit.

Company Description:
Het succes van organisaties hangt steeds meer af van de prestaties van de IT-afdeling. IT is de motor achter slimme oplossingen die aansluiten bij de wensen van uw medewerkers én klanten. Het is daarom zaak om een IT-afdeling te vormen die de werkzaamheden binnen de organisatie ondersteunt én de weg naar nieuwe zakelijke kansen opent. Met slim gebruik van de cloud én de juiste aandacht voor security. Daarom BlueDutch.

Wij zijn uw IT-partner voor analyse van de huidige situatie, advies over alle aspecten van IT en het plaatsen van IT-specialisten die haarfijn aansluiten bij uw behoefte en bedrijfscultuur. Zodat u de uitdagingen van vandaag en morgen het hoofd kunt bieden. Wat maakt ons daarin anders? Wij leveren PIT (Personal IT)!

Dit betekent dat we uitblinken in betrokkenheid. Wij zijn altijd bereikbaar, denken proactief mee en houden een vinger aan de pols bij onze klanten en IT-professionals. Bij BlueDutch zijn we pas tevreden als de klant een IT-professional tot beschikking heeft die bij het bedrijf past en de IT-professional een uitdaging heeft gevonden waarin hij of zij kan excelleren.

Title: Analyst
Description:
Funkční Analytik – Backend systémy 
🚀 Staňte se součástí prestižního projektu zaměřeného na digitalizaci a optimalizaci klíčových bankovních služeb pro firemní klienty.
Hledáme analytiky, kteří se zaměří na návrh procesních toků a business logiky backendových aplikací – žádné technologické detaily, jen čistě konceptuální návrh a provázání procesů v rámci robustních systémů.

Co od Vás očekáváme?Zkušenost s návrhem procesů robustních backendových systémů.Praxi v bankovním prostředí, ideálně v oblasti firemních klientů.Znalost sekvenčních diagramů a datových modelů.Analytické myšlení a schopnost porozumět složitým procesům.
Co nabízíme?Práci na významném projektu.Dlouhodobou spolupráci na IČO.Hybridní režim – remote i onsite dle potřeby.

Title: Data Protection Consultant
Description:
Inleiding
Bij het agentschap Digitaal Vlaanderen zijn we op zoek naar een Consultant Gegevensbescherming ter versterking van de Partnerdienst Gegevensbescherming.
Ben jij op zoek naar een nieuwe uitdaging waarbij je deel uitmaakt van een echte gemeenschap van vakspecialisten en waarbij je bij verschillende organisaties tewerk kan worden gesteld?Heb jij reeds ervaring als specialist gegevensbescherming of Data Protection Officer en ben je op zoek naar een uitdaging waar je kan meewerken aan een ruim gamma van projecten in jouw vakgebied? Dan ben jij misschien onze ideale kandidaat!!
Waar kom je terecht? 
Als Consultant Gegevensbescherming kom je terecht bij de Partnerdienst Gegevensbescherming die vanuit Digitaal Vlaanderen de Vlaamse Overheid een centraal expertisecentrum aanbiedt m.b.t. gegevensbescherming.In deze gemeenschap van experten staan klankbordsessies, opleidingen en kennisdeling centraal en kan je ook de expertise vinden die eigen is aan de Vlaamse Overheid.
Jouw werkplek hangt af van je activiteit en van de afspraken met de organisatie waar je werkzaam bent. Soms spreek je af met andere collega’s binnen het bureau in Gent of Brussel voor kennisdeling. Andere dagen ga je naar het kantoor van de klant waarvoor je werkt. Uiteraard is het ook mogelijk om sommige dagen vanuit thuis te werken.
Wat is jouw opdracht?
Als Consultant Gegevensbescherming begeleid je de organisatie op vlak van de toepassing en de naleving van de wet- en regelgeving in verband met de verwerking van persoonsgegevens, in het bijzonder de Algemene Verordening Gegevensbescherming (AVG). Het is mogelijk dat je hierbij de rol van Data Protection Officer (DPO) opneemt.
Daarnaast kan je ook gevraagd worden concrete begeleiding in verband met gegevensbescherming bij projecten te geven (zoals de opmaak van een gegevensbeschermingseffectbeoordeling), ofwel maak je deel uit van een groter gegevensbeschermingsteam.
Je ziet onder andere toe op de naleving van de AVG, je adviseert en informeert de organisatie over gegevensbescherming, je ziet toe op de aanmaak van de nodige documentatie. Je maakt overeenkomsten op (verwerkersovereenkomst, protocol, …) en onderhandelt hierover met de wederpartij.Als je als DPO bent aangesteld, adviseer en rapporteer je rechtstreeks aan de leidend ambtenaar.Dan voer je bovendien de taken uit zoals bedoeld in artikel 39 van de AVG vanuit een onafhankelijke en onpartijdige positie.
Je behandelt vragen van betrokkenen en je staat in voor eventuele contacten met de bevoegde toezichthoudende autoriteit.
Naar wie zijn wij op zoek?
Als Consultant Gegevensbescherming heb je bij aantoonbare ervaring en een gedegen kennis m.b.t. gegevensbescherming en privacy. Je hebt ook affiniteit met, en bij voorkeur basiskennis van, topics die nauw met gegevensbescherming samenhangen zoals (publiek)recht, IT, risicomanagement en informatieveiligheid.Je hebt aantoonbare ervaring van minimum 3 jaar in de gevraagde (medewerker gegevensbescherming, DPO, privacy officer, …) of een vergelijkbare functie (bv. advocaat, jurist) waar gegevensbescherming een belangrijk luik van je takenpakket was. Ervaring in overheidscontext en in organisaties met een complex stakeholderlandschap zijn pluspunten.
Je bent communicatief en luistervaardig. Deze eigenschappen stellen je in staat om de essentie van een boodschap te analyseren en om overtuigend je eigen standpunt te vertolken. Daarnaast kan je jouw communicatie aanpassen aan je doelpubliek voor sensibiliseringsacties en om opleidingen te geven aan je collega’s die minder kennis over gegevensbescherming hebben. Tevens kan je hen proactief informeren en adviseren.
Een Consultant Gegevensbescherming bij Digitaal Vlaanderen is iemand met een hands on mentaliteit die vlot kan samenwerken met diverse stakeholders, onder druk kan presteren en daarbij zorgvuldig blijft en iemand die open staat op het vlak van kennisdeling en informatie vergaren. Je volgt zelf proactief relevante ontwikkelingen op vlak van gegevensbescherming (nieuwe wet- en regelgeving, richtlijnen, adviezen van toezichthouders, rechtspraak en best practices) op.Je motiveert en beargumenteert de standpunten die je inneemt grondig op basis van een brede en afgewogen analyse. Je houdt daarbij rekening met de consequenties van jouw oordeel, ook op andere domeinen. Je hebt een sterke ruggengraat en laat je niet van de wijs brengen bij wat tegenkanting.
In onze sterk gedigitaliseerde omgeving is het een meerwaarde indien je een grote interesse hebt in digitalisering en informatisering.Behaalde certificaten m.bt. gegevensbeschermings zijn uiteraard een troef evenals goede IT-skills.
Werken via Vlaanderen connect.
Je wordt tewerkgesteld via Vlaanderen connect., de ICT-strategische dienstverlener van de Vlaamse overheid. Bij Vlaanderen connect. word je voor onbepaalde duur ter beschikking gesteld aan Digitaal Vlaanderen. Je krijgt hierbij een contract van onbepaalde duur.
Werken voor Vlaanderen connect. betekent werken in een organisatie met boeiende en uitdagende IT-functies én de mogelijkheid om mee je schouders te zetten in het uitbouwen van een digitaal en slagkrachtig Vlaanderen.Verder biedt werken voor Vlaanderen connect. tal van voordelen. Je werkt bij entiteiten van de Vlaamse overheid of bij lokale besturen voor lange termijn. Zo kan je meewerken aan een digitale en slagkrachtige overheid, voor burgers en ondernemers.Daarnaast kan je doorgroeien en jezelf ontwikkelen door het enorme potentieel aan uitdagende functies via Vlaanderen connect. bij de Vlaamse overheid en de lokale besturen.
Wat kunnen wij jou bieden?
Vlaanderen connect. biedt een contract van onbepaalde duur en een competitief salarispakket met:Een aantrekkelijke brutoverloningEen bonussysteem op basis van vast te leggen doelstellingenEen mobiliteitsbudgetMaaltijdcheques van 8 euro/dag (eigen bijdrage 1,09 euro/dag)Een forfaitaire onkostenvergoedingEen hospitalisatieverzekering (je kan gezinsleden aansluiten)Een groepsverzekeringEen opleidingsbudgetEen laptopEen smartphone met abonnementsformuleThuiswerkmiddelen en mogelijkheden tot thuiswerkMogelijkheid tot kinderopvang tijdens alle schoolvakanties aan een voordelig tarief.
Bij Vlaanderen connect. is een gezonde balans tussen werk en privé belangrijk: een werkweek van38 uur, 28 dagen verlof en extra wettelijke feestdagen (11/07, 02/11, 15/11 en 26/12).Verder werken wij met flexibele werkuren en bieden wij ook de mogelijkheid tot thuiswerken.

Title: Student Assistant IT
Description:
Join Global Wind Organisation as an IT Student Assistant and make a difference with your tech skills! Help us build a safer, greener world – one innovation at a time.
Global Wind Organisation (GWO) is a non-profit organization dedicated to creating safer work environments within the wind energy sector. As the global standard-setting body for safety training and workforce development, GWO unites leading wind turbine manufacturers and operators to ensure a consistent, injury-free work environment. 
At the heart of our operations is WINDA, GWO's core product and global database. WINDA connects and tracks safety training and certifications, serving as a critical platform for both training providers and the technicians who rely on these qualifications. It ensures transparency and accountability in safety training, helping to build trust across the wind industry.
As an IT Student Assistant, you’ll play a vital role in supporting our IT team. Working closely with the IT Administrator and WINDA Product Owner, your contributions will help maintain and improve GWO’s IT landscape, ensuring seamless operations and user support.
Key tasks include
The primary responsibilities of the assistant are to support with:IT Support: Install, configure, and maintain hardware, software, and networks; manage user access, licenses, and IT inventory; troubleshoot and resolve technical issues.IT Security: Support the implementation and monitoring of security controls and raise security awareness.WINDA Support: Test and troubleshoot WINDA, assist in specifying new functionality, and maintain system documentation.API Management: Support API integration, troubleshoot issues, and assist stakeholders in accessing and utilizing API functionalities effectively.Governance: Assist with IT governance, service management, and process documentation.
As our new colleague you are
We are looking for a motivated and communicative individual with a proactive mindset. You are someone who values teamwork, takes initiative, and helps others find solutions even when the answer is not immediately clear.
Qualifications:Technologically savvy with knowledge in IT architecture, cybersecurity, system landscapes, or coding.Proficient in Microsoft Office and fluent in English.Currently pursuing a Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in a relevant field (e.g., IT or Business).Committed to staying with GWO for at least 12 months.Ambitious, eager to learn, and ready to grow with us.
If the above sounds interesting, you should join us!
Seize the exciting opportunity to be part of an expanding industry where one can grow, enjoy and contribute.
GWO offers:Purposeful work for a non-profit organisationFlat organisational structureEmphasis on a balanced work lifeContinuous personal developmentStrong foundation for professional networking and sparring
As we process applications as they reach us, we encourage you to apply today rather than tomorrow. Please send your application and CV using the “apply” button. In case you have questions regarding the position, please reach out to Nanna Falker Becker at nfb@globalwindsafety.org.
GWO encourages applicants of all genders and backgrounds. Applicants must possess the legal right to work in Denmark while studying at the time of application and be available to work in Copenhagen.
GWO main office is in Copenhagen.
We look forward to receiving your application.
Primary Description: Global Wind Organisation · Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark (Hybrid)
Location: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
We encourage EU citizens who are ready to relocate to Hungary to apply.
About Acasus:“Impact for citizens.”
Acasus helps governments help people.
We are a consultancy delivering transformational reforms in health and education. We have built a reputation in dynamic, and often challenging, countries and contexts.
Acasus undertakes high-profile projects in an expanding group of countries, including: Pakistan, Chad, the DRC, Mozambique, Somalia, Afghanistan, Ethiopia and Nigeria. From increasing vaccine delivery, to providing greater education access for children, our consultants are helping millions of people access better services.
Apply to join us if you want the opportunity to do the same.
How will you make an impact?You will use the latest data management technologies to improve health and education services for citizens in a number of low- and middle-income countries, including the DRC, Ethiopia, Afghanistan, Pakistan, Mozambique, Somalia, Chad, and others.
Tasks and responsibilities:Work closely with local Associates to create regular analysis and data visualisations for all project stakeholders, including government officialsUnderstand general and country-specific project requirementsDeliver dashboards and data processing flowsDevelop data processing flows that can be used as standards for multiple projectsWork on multiple projects simultaneouslyEducate and support other associates and Data AnalystsCollaborate with other functional areas, such as Operations and Engineering
We are looking for:3+ years of experience in data analysisAdvanced Tableau data visualisation skills, including dashboard design practicesAdvanced analytical skillsAbility to present insights to senior stakeholders and decision makersAdvanced SQL skillsExperience with building and maintaining ETL flows is a plusExperience with unstructured data (e.g. JSON files) is beneficialExperience with geographic information system (GIS) analysisExperience with Python or other programming languages is advantageousAble to work individually and as part of a teamExcellent communication skillsProficiency in written and spoken English
What's in it for you?A competitive compensation packagePrivate Health InsuranceCafeteriaYear-end bonus based on company and individual performanceHigh degrees of responsibility and autonomyOpportunity to learn and grow in an enthusiastic and supportive environmentSee your work have a tangible impact on health and education services every day
Our team is diverse in nationality, gender, race, religion, ethnicity, class, age, education and sexuality. Consequently, we encourage people from all backgrounds to apply.
Tune into the Acasus Podcast to explore our vital work in Africa and Asia. Here you can learn about the work of our team and listen to stories about the challenges that matter most.
