Title: JUNIOR DATA SCIENTIST INTERN OPPORTUNITY – CAT DIGITAL SLOVAKIA
Description:
Career Area:

Enterprise Cross Functional

Job Description:

Your Work Shapes the World at Caterpillar Inc. 

When you join Caterpillar, you're joining a global team who cares not just about the work we do – but also about each other. We are the makers, problem solvers, and future world builders who are creating stronger, more sustainable communities. We don't just talk about progress and innovation here – we make it happen, with our customers, where we work and live. Together, we are building a better world, so we can all enjoy living in it.

Big machines mean big technology. Are you looking for your next big challenge? 

When you join Caterpillar, you're joining a global team who cares not just about the work we do – but also about each other. We are the makers, problem solvers, and future world builders who are creating stronger, more sustainable communities. We don't just talk about progress and innovation here – we make it happen, with our customers, where we work and live. Together, we are building a better world, so we can all enjoy living in it.

Cat® Digital is the digital and technology arm of Caterpillar Inc., leveraging the latest technologies to build industry leading digital solutions for our customers and dealers. With over one million connected assets worldwide, our teams use data, technology, advanced analytics, telematics, and AI capabilities to help our customers build a better world.

Job Opportunity:

Cat Digital is expanding its intern program into Slovakia. We are seeking students with an interest in technology to join our team to help us establish and grow our presence, organization and culture. As an intern, you will be exposed to cutting-edge technologies and have the opportunity to collaborate with top professionals working on very high impact and visibility products. Don't miss this chance to join a newly formed presence and support digital innovation for a global leader in heavy machinery!

Internship Dates:

Monday June 16th until Friday September 5th, 2025 (student part time contract).

After successful completion of the initial 12-week program, the best interns will have the opportunity to join our part time intern job and continue their career at Caterpillar.

Compensation:

8 euros gross / per hour (up to 640 euro gross per month)

Benefits:

Hands on experience.Workshops and trainings.Agile.

The scope of the intern program will be focused on:

Data Science

Data Science interns will join the Predictive Maintenance Team within Cat Digital and will have the opportunity to learn about development of condition monitoring models to power asset management solutions for customers and dealers. Interns will be exposed to machine learning and statistics-based/physics-based analytics techniques on time-series sensor data, machine fault codes, inspections and analysis records, and other datasets to identify health anomalies, predict equipment failure modes, estimate remaining useful life, and build equipment risk models.

Basic qualifications:

Students of 2nd class of bachelor’s study in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Data Science/Analytics, Data Visualization, Software Engineering, or related area English written and spoken (at least B1 level)Analytical thinking, willing to learn and develop, intellectual curiosity.

Nice to have:

Interest in technologies like Python, SQL, Machine Learning, Pandas, Matplotlib, AWS.Experience and/or interest in Data Science work using Pandas and visualizing the results.Participation in school clubs or student organizations.

Additional Information:

If you are interested in applying for this position, please attach a copy of your resume in English.

Please frequently check the email associated with your application, including the junk/spam folder, as this is the primary correspondence method. If you wish to know the status of your application – please use the candidate log-in on our career website as it will reflect any updates to your status.

Caterpillar is committed to creating a dynamic work environment that values diversity and inclusion, respect and integrity, customer focus, and innovation. For more information, visit https://www.caterpillar.com/en/careers/why-caterpillar.html

Posting Dates:

March 3, 2025 - March 28, 2025

Caterpillar is an Equal Opportunity Employer (EEO).

Company Description:
Headquartered in San Diego, California, USA, Solar Turbines Incorporated, a subsidiary of Caterpillar Inc., is one of the world’s leading manufacturers of industrial gas turbines, with more than 16,000 units and over 3 billion operating hours in over 100 countries. Products from Solar Turbines play an important role in the development of oil, natural gas and power generation projects around the world. Solar Turbines’ products include gas turbine engines (rated from 1,590 to 52,500 horsepower), gas compressors, and gas turbine-powered compressor sets, mechanical-drive packages and generator sets (ranging from 1 to 39 megawatts). Solar’s customers put the company’s products to work in many areas including production, processing and pipeline transmission of natural gas and crude oil and generation of electricity and thermal energy for processing applications, such as manufacturing chemicals, pharmaceuticals, and food products.
 
Solar’s foundation is people and Solar’s culture is one where individual contributions are valued, diversity in the workplace is encouraged, and safety is emphasized in all aspects of the business. Solar Turbines, founded in 1927, is comprised of a dedicated and multi-talented workforce of more than 8,000 employees with decades of experience working as a global team.

Title: IT Traineeship Rotterdam
Description:
Start met kennis opbouwen, niet per se met kennis. Wait, what? Starten met je IT-baan, zónder IT-diploma? Precies, wij geloven al in jou als jij de juiste skills en motivatie hebt. En die staat nou eenmaal niet altijd op papier. Kom een betaald IT-traineeship volgen in Rotterdam, waar jij binnen no-time wordt klaargestoomd voor een communicatieve rol in de IT. Begint het al te kriebelen? Lees snel verder.
DIT GA JE DOENEen goed begin is het halve werk. Je gaat namelijk van start met het opdoen van de eerste IT-kennis en relevante communicatietrainingen tijdens onze bootcamp en wij doen ons uiterste best dat zo uitdagend en divers mogelijk te houden. De bootcamp duurt 3 weken en biedt jou een gevarieerd programma op een externe locatie in Weesp en bij ons op kantoor in Den Haag. Hier leer jij ook jouw mede-QISS'ers kennen en behaal jij direct jouw eerste twee IT-certificaten. Bootcamp afgerond? Tijd om jouw IT-carrière een vliegende start te geven! Doe eerst praktijkervaring op bij een opdrachtgever in jouw regio en ontdek vervolgens welke IT Track het beste bij jou past. Na een paar maanden kun je je specialiseren in een specifieke richting met onze IT Tracks en zo verder groeien in de IT. 
Wel zo gezellig, je hoeft het allemaal niet alleen te doen. Er staat namelijk niet alleen een Talentmanager achter je, we hebben ook IT-coaches die jou begeleiden in het teken van jouw ontwikkeling. Zowel professioneel als op persoonlijk vlak. Win-win!
DIT BIEDEN WIJWhat’s in IT for you? Die vraag begrijpen wij maar al te goed, dus laten we maar niet om het antwoord heen draaien.Een contract met baangarantie, waarbij je vanaf de bootcamp al wordt betaald;Een startsalaris vanaf € 2600,- op basis van 40 uur. Ook zonder IT ervaring;Het salaris groeit mee met de stappen die gelden bij onze opdrachtgevers;Werken bij de beste IT-detacheerder van Nederland, uitgeroepen door MT/Sprout;Reiskostenvergoeding van 23 cent per kilometer óf een OV businesscard;De mogelijkheid tot een leaseauto na afronding van het eerste jaar;Maar liefst 25 vakantiedagen, een bonus- en pensioenregeling (waarvan het eerste jaar premievrij is!) en 8,33 procent vakantiegeld;Toegang tot de QISS Academy, ons eigen opleidingsprogramma waar je jezelf kunt ontwikkelen en doorgroeien;De mogelijkheid erkende IT-certificaten te behalen;Een ingang bij de Top 500 werkgevers in de Randstad;Een persoonlijk leerplan en begeleiding door je eigen Talentmanager en IT-coach;De leukste borrels en kennisavonden, de gezelligste collega’s en een open bedrijfscultuur.

DIT NEEM JE MEEIT-diploma op zak? Mooi meegenomen, maar wij willen veel liever weten met wíe we te maken hebben en waarom. Ben jij enthousiast, communicatief sterk en barst je van de motivatie? Dan is de kans groot dat wij een match zijn!Even wat praktische must haves:Heb jij minimaal een afgeronde HBO-opleiding (of een propedeuse) in de pocket?Ben je beschikbaar voor 36 tot 40 uur per week?Beheers je zowel de Nederlandse als de Engelse taal vloeiend?Beschik je over een rijbewijs en heb je recente rijervaring?
Heb je na de bovenstaande informatie nog vragen? Neem dan contact op met onze Recruiter Sophie (+31 6 39541557 of sophievanruijven@qiss-it.nl)!
Primary Description: QISS IT · Rotterdam, South Holland, Netherlands (Hybrid)
Skill: Skills: Communication, IT Consulting, +2 more
Company Description:
Wat ons onderscheidt van alle andere IT-bureaus? Diversiteit. Meer dan 10 jaar geleden gingen wij als enige in de markt voor ‘Meer vrouwen in de IT’ en dat doen we nog steeds vol overtuiging. Maar om het verschil te blijven maken voor onze talenten én opdrachtgevers, gaan we nu verder dan dat. We zetten een stap vooruit en verbreden onze blik op diversiteit. We gaan voor wie jij bent en wat jou uniek maakt. 

Onze talenten verschillen in opleiding, werkervaring en culturele achtergrond. Overeenkomsten vinden we in persoonlijkheid. Zo zijn al onze trainees op hun eigen manier sterk in communicatie, klantgerichtheid en verbinden. Dat is waarmee zij zich onderscheiden in de wereld van IT.
 
𝗜𝗧 𝗦𝗧𝗔𝗥𝗧𝗦 𝗪𝗜𝗧𝗛 𝗔 𝗤𝗜𝗦𝗦
Wij helpen jonge talenten aan een vliegende start in de IT. Met doorgroeikansen die passen bij hun persoonlijke ambities en de ontwikkelingen in de markt. Zo kunnen onze talenten zich breed ontwikkelen en bieden we onze opdrachtgevers dat wat zij zoeken. 

Onze trainees vervullen functies die de brug slaan tussen IT-afdelingen en eindgebruikers. Functies zoals functioneel beheerder, support- en servicedeskmedewerker, projectmanager of IT coördinator.

Nieuwsgierig geworden om bij QISS IT te werken, of om met ons samen te werken? Check onze website qiss-it.nl voor meer informatie en de mogelijkheden.

Title: Business Analyst
Description:
Immáron 8 éve IT megoldásokat szállító magyar cég vagyunk, amit azzal a céllal alapítottunk, hogy a piacon szerzett eddigi tapasztalatainkat felhasználva építhessünk valami újat, de egy olyan családias szervezetben ahol jól érezhetjük magunkat és a munka-magánélet egyensúlyát is fenntartsuk. Szeretünk folyamatosan tanulni és fejlődni, kedvencünk a közlekedésinformatika ugyanakkor nem vetjük meg a muffinos délutánokat sem.
Térképészeti nyilvántartó rendszer zöld mezős fejlesztésére keresünk üzleti elemzőt, aki egy nagy volumenű projekt keretében az elejétől fogva részt vesz az üzleti igények folyamatos feltárásában és a tervezésben.
Feladatok:Üzleti folyamatok megértése, modellezése, tervdokumentációkban elkészítésében való részvételFejlesztés támogatása a fejlesztői csapattal való együttműködés közbenÜzleti követelményeknek és tervdokumentációknak való megfelelés biztosítása a fejlesztés soránRészvétel az elkészült rendszer átadási folyamataiban
Elvárások:Üzleti elemzői/rendszerszervezői területen szerzett legalább 4+ éves tapasztalatFejlesztéshez kapcsolódó dokumentációk készítésében való tapasztalatÜgyfélképes kommunikációKépesség a fejlesztői csapat támogatásábanMagasszintű képesség dokumentációs és fejlesztéstámogató eszközök használatában

Company Description:
Our team has both tech-savvy generation Y titans as well as professionals with many years of IT background. Our mission is to deliver business solutions to our domestic and international partners in areas like application development, data warehouse, business intelligence, and reporting. 
We deliver solutions with our team on a project basis, or T&M, onsite or remotely. We work with .Net, Java, C++, MS SQL, Oracle DB, MS Power BI in Agile, Scrum and Waterfall.
Apart from our business solutions, we are capable of supporting our Partners with IT resources like software developers, PMs, scrum masters, testers (manual / automated), solution architects or business analysts.

Title: AI Data Engineer
Description:
Dołącz do naszego zespołu AI & Data i odegraj kluczową rolę w tworzeniu innowacyjnych rozwiązań z zakresu sztucznej inteligencji. Szukamy pasjonatów nowych technologii, którzy chcą mieć realny wpływ na rozwój produktów i pracować w dynamicznym, inspirującym środowisku. Jeśli chcesz realizować wdrożenia AI, transformujące sposób pracy naszych klientów, to stanowisko jest dla Ciebie!

Twój zakres obowiązków:

Holistyczne podejście do zarządzania pipelinami danych.Projetkowanie i implementacja procesów ETL.Tworzenie projektów relacyjnych baz danych.

Nasze wymagania:

Ukończone studia wyższe (preferowane kierunki to informatyka, matematyka, statystyka lub pokrewne).Bardzo dobra znajomość języka Python oraz relacyjnych baz danych.Doświadczenie w realizacji przepływów ETL’owych.Co najmniej 5 lat doświadczenia na stanowisku Data Engineer.Doświadczenie w metodykach zwinnych oraz w pracy z narzędziami wspierającymi współpracę zespołu w zakresie priorytetyzacji zadań (ADO), tworzenia kodu, kontroli wersji (GIT), dokumentacji.Pasja do tworzenia kompletnych rozwiązań/produktów Data Science.Umiejętność przystępnej komunikacji treści technicznych.Dobra znajomość języka angielskiego i polskiego w mowie i piśmie.Unix/Linux.

Dodatkowym atutem będzie znajomość z zakresu:

Doświadczenie w realizacji przepływów ETL’owych w systemach rozproszonych.Docker, Kubernetes.MS Azure, GCP.Frameworków do batchowego przetwarzania danych (Apache Airflow, Apache Spark).Silnika bazodanowego PostgreSQL, MS SQL.Znajomość koncepcji związanych z uczeniem maszynowym i sztuczną inteligencją.

To oferujemy:

Wsparcie merytoryczne i finansowe w zdobyciu uznanych kwalifikacji i certyfikatów;EY Badges – globalna certyfikacja Twoich kompetencji i możliwość zdobycia tytułu MBA renomowanej uczelni Hult University;Career Counselor - profesjonalny, indywidualny doradca w zakresie budowania i rozwoju kariery;Innovate EY – unikalne programy, w ramach których możesz stworzyć własny start-up, korzystając z naszego know-how i finansowania;Platforma psychoedukacyjna – pakiet bezpłatnych konsultacji ze specjalistami z szerokiego zakresu zdrowia psychicznego i rozwoju osobistego oraz dostęp do aktywności edukacyjnych;Wygodny, hybrydowy model pracy uwzględniający Twoje potrzeby w zakresie czasu i miejsca jej wykonywania;Program benefitów oferujący m.in. prywatną opiekę zdrowotną z dodatkowymi badaniami profilaktycznymi, ubezpieczenie na życie, bilety, sporty zespołowe, platformę do nauki języków obcych, karty sportowe i wiele innych (dostępnych online i offline).

Etapy rekrutacji:

Aplikuj. Jeśli robisz to po raz pierwszy, załóż profil i dodaj CV. Porozmawiajmy. Czekają rekruterzy i rekruterki oraz osoby z Twojego przyszłego zespołu. 

O EY Polska 

Jesteśmy globalną firmą doradczą - pomagamy przedsiębiorcom, organizacjom i społecznościom najlepiej wykorzystać swój potencjał. Zespoły audytorskie, consultingowe, prawne, strategiczne, podatkowe i transakcyjne zadają nieoczywiste pytania, by móc znaleźć nowe odpowiedzi na złożone wyzwania, przed którymi stoi dziś świat.

Zatrudniamy ponad 390 000 wyjątkowych ludzi w ponad 150 krajach na świecie. W Polsce jest nas ponad 7000, pracujemy w: Warszawie, Gdańsku, Katowicach, Krakowie, Łodzi, Poznaniu, Rzeszowie i Wrocławiu.

Codziennie tworzymy razem niesamowite rzeczy. Mamy ludzi, ścieżkę rozwoju i szkolenia, dzięki którym będziesz się szybko rozwijać, zdobywając doświadczenie na kolejnych projektach.

Dbamy o środowisko – nie tylko biznesowe. W ramach realizacji założonego planu, zmniejszyliśmy swoją globalną emisję gazów cieplarnianych w roku fiskalnym 2023 o 43% w stosunku do roku bazowego 2019.

EY jest pracodawcą równych szans, doceniamy oraz promujemy różnorodność w zakresie wiedzy i doświadczenia naszej społeczności. Prowadzimy program "Poziom Wyżej bez Barier", który wspiera pracowników z niepełnosprawnościami w realizacji ich ambicji i marzeń związanych z rozwojem zawodowym. 

EY zapewnia wszystkim kandydatom jednakowe szanse w procesie rekrutacji, niezależnie od płci, wieku, rasy, wyznania, orientacji seksualnej, pochodzenia, niepełnosprawności lub jakiejkolwiek innej prawnie chronionej podstawy, zgodnie z obowiązującym prawem.

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
Job Description: Data Engineer at HCLTech, Sweden
Location: Gothenburg, Sweden
Company: HCLTech
Position: Data Engineer
About Us: At HCLTech, we are committed to driving innovation and excellence in the technology sector. Our team leverages cutting-edge technologies to deliver robust and scalable solutions. We are looking for a passionate and experienced Data Engineer to join our dynamic team in Sweden.
Technologies We Use Daily:PythonApache SparkBashTable formats (Delta)Cloud platform technology (Azure)DockerData platforms (Databricks/Snowflake)GitHub
Who Are You? You are a seasoned professional with a minimum of 5 years of experience in related fields. You are familiar with agile methodologies and fluent in English, both verbal and written.
Key Responsibilities:Design, develop, and operate data pipelines.Implement ETL processes, Streaming Data Integration, and Change Data Capture (CDC).Collaborate with cross-functional teams to deliver high-quality data solutions.Ensure data quality and improve code quality.Apply data privacy and protection methods/tools.
Ideal Candidate:Deep knowledge and passion for modern data architecture principles.Extensive hands-on experience as a Data Engineer in an agile environment.Comfortable working independently and collaboratively.Pragmatic approach, understanding the trade-offs between the perfect solution and a working solution.Knowledgeable about data modeling, data access, and data storage techniques.Experience with cloud technologies (Azure and AWS).Knowledge in Software Engineering, SQL, Data Streaming (Apache Kafka), and CI/CD toolchain.
Why Join Us?Be part of a forward-thinking company that values innovation and excellence.Work with a team of talented professionals in a collaborative environment.Opportunity to work with cutting-edge technologies and make a significant impact.
How to Apply: If you are passionate about data engineering and meet the above qualifications, we would love to hear from you. Please submit your resume and a cover letter detailing your experience and why you are the perfect fit for this role. Share your CV at vikas.koul@hcltech.com.

Title: Python Engineer
Description:
We are looking for a senior Python Developer who is keenly interested in Python-based processing of LIDAR data, object detection, validation and transformation. This role will directly contribute to the creation and maintenance of greener, safer and more resilient urban spaces.
Who we areAs the global pioneer for digital twins of urban forests, we provide very detailed digital copies of each individual tree in a city. This insight will provide cities with the information they need to ensure the maintenance and development of their green spaces. With our solution we support the digital transformation of smart cities world-wide. Combining the latest laser scanning technology with the most advanced AI & machine learning methods, greehill enables cities to be radically more productive in their daily operations and to improve the well-being of citizens through a greener, healthier, and more resilient urban environment. We currently operate offices in Budapest (HQ, R&D), Berlin, Singapore, San Francisco and Paris.
Your task will beWriting effective and scalable Python codes for solving various challenges.Use Python libraries such as FastAPI, SQLAlchemy and Pandas.Support ML processing using Python tools.Store and process 2D, 3D, GIS data.
We need you to haveHigh level knowledge of Python, strong algorithmic thinking.Team-player attitude.
We value if you haveKnowledge in data processing of urban objects.Experience with docker/kubernetes and cloud technologies.Experience in a startup working environment.
We offerOpportunity to have high impact on the digitisation and management of urban forests and on climate change adaptation in cities.Opportunity to join a dynamically growing team with a lot of freedom to develop together with us.Possibility to work and learn in an international, open-minded team of passionate (green-) tech experts.
Please note, our office attendance is high, with employees working on-site four days a week.
We appreciate the interest of all job seekers in our organization. However, please note that at this time, we are unable to consider applications from outside of Hungary, who require a work permit for this position. We thank you for your understanding and encourage you to explore other opportunities with greehill in the future.

Company Description:
Helping cities world-wide grow greener and healthier through Smart Tree Inventories. 

 

We are bringing the right data to the people who need it. ​At greehill, we digitize entire urban forests and provide a platform that empowers cities to map, monitor and analyze the current status of their urban forest and optimize the impact of urban trees on urban life. We enable data-driven decision-making to improve ecosystem services, thermal comfort, and operational efficiency.

Title: Neolaureati Ingegneria Informatica
Description:
Il Gruppo BV TECH è un gruppo innovativo, fondato nel 2005, interamente italiano ed uno dei principali attori del mercato italiano dell’Information & Communication Technology e della Sicurezza delle Informazioni.Il Gruppo comprende società di ingegneria, servizi informatici e sicurezza con più di 1000 dipendenti e ha sedi su tutto il territorio italiano (le principali a Milano, Roma, Genova e Grottaglie) e internazionale (Londra e Boston).Particolarmente focalizzato sui temi della Cybersecurity, il gruppo è partner fondatore di (IC)3, il consorzio creato dal Massachusetts Institute of Technology (ora Cybersecurity At MIT Sloan - CAMS) per diffondere e sviluppare la cultura della sicurezza informatica nel settore della protezione delle infrastrutture critiche.Il Gruppo BV TECH sviluppa tecnologie «nazionali» nel settore ICT in ambito sia civile sia militare (C4ISTAR), con l’ambizione di contribuire significativamente all’innovazione e alla crescita del Paese.Le principali aree di expertize del Gruppo BV TECH sono:Sviluppo soluzioniIngegneriaGestione ServiziProdotti e Tecnologie
PosizioneBV Tech S.p.A, Società di ingegneria e servizi ICT, ricerca per ampliamento del proprio organico e da inserire su un progetto di ricerca in ambito Cyber Security un/a:
NEOLAUREAT* (triennale e/o magistrale) IN INGEGNERIA INFORMATICA o AFFINI
AttivitàLa risorsa sarà coinvolta su progetti di sviluppo e gestione di apparati applicazioni nazionali per la gestione dei rischi cyber, tramite procedure e strumenti per la prevenzione, rimedio e governo della sicurezza dei dati e delle informazioni nazionali.
RequisitiConoscenze tecniche richieste:Laurea triennale e/o magistrale in Ingegneria Informatica, Ingegneria Elettronica, Informatica, Matematica e Fisica.Buona conoscenza lingua inglese (B1)
Rappresenterà un plus l'esperienza maturata
Completano il profilo Una preparazione più specifica e orientata alla sicurezza informatica, oppure su tecnologie innovative (Big data, AI, Machine Learning…) o su elementi di programmazione avanzata (microservizi Java, sviluppo app…).

Inserimento in progetto immediatoSede di Lavoro: Grottaglie/ RutiglianoModalità di lavoro: IbridoSi offre: Inquadramento e RAL saranno commisurate in base all'esperienza maturata.Ai sensi della vigente normativa l'offerta di lavoro s’intende estesa a entrambi i sessi. (L 903/77).

Title: Intern
Description:
PCN Recruitment Agency (Intern Recruitment Consultant) 
About Us:PCN is a boutique recruitment agency based in Amsterdam, dedicated to connecting top talent with industry leaders. We specialise in five core areas: Fintech, Cybersecurity, SaaS, E-Commerce, and Salesforce, supported by a global network that spans across borders. Our office is located along the picturesque Singel canal in Amsterdam.
The Role:We are seeking an Intern to work closely with our Freelance Director, Calum Peacock, who brings over 10 years of recruitment experience. You will be part of an exciting journey to grow our Freelance division within Fintech, specifically within the Tech and Product vertices. .Start Date: January/February 2025Contract: 6 months, with the potential for a permanent role.
Day-to-Day Responsibilities:Spend the initial months focused on the candidate side, learning from Calum and our friendly team of consultants.Gain a comprehensive understanding of the full 360 recruitment process.Engage with inspiring individuals and businesses regularly.Conduct cold calling and participate in networking events.Receive extensive training and day-to-day desk coaching.Contribute to closing both small and large deals.
What We Are Looking For:A positive and hardworking attitude.Close to AmsterdamA people-first mentality balanced with a motivation for financial success.An open mindset towards continuous learning.Currently studying / eligible for a Dutch Internship Resilience in dealing with rejection and resistance.
What We Offer:Continuous professional development.On the desk training / Weekly training sessionsA 4-day working week!!Discounted lunchesParticipation in our monthly borrel and weekly team outings.Working within a fun team of 10Singel office located with rooftop!A very competitive commission structure.
How to Apply:If you're interested in this opportunity, please apply to this job or reach out directly to Calum at +447771887806 or calum@teampcn.com.
Skill: Skills: Training, Coaching, +1 more
Company Description:
PCN was founded in 2008 as a boutique recruitment agency with the vision to be a gateway to Fintech for job seekers and leaders within the industry. Since then, we have been connecting unique talent in Fintech, SaaS, Cybersecurity, Salesforce and E-commerce with top-tier companies within their industries. We build long-lasting relationships with leading partners within the industry, like Klarna, Uber, Zalando, Mollie, Worldline, Delivery Hero and many more. 

With an Amsterdam-based headquarters and offices in Berlin and Atlanta, we're committed to providing the best services to our clients, streamlining the recruitment process and making it as easy as possible for both sides. We help our clients to have smooth, fast, successful and sustainable hiring processes while filling both permanent and temporary positions with our niche expertise and extensive resources. 

In addition to our hiring services, we work as a media/advertising agency under the name PCN Media. We provide employer branding and professional media services to our partners like In Check with Fintech podcast, video content, e-blast services and event organization. So far, we have helped the biggest organizations and partners like Money2020, Netcetera and Reuters boost their online visibility along with promoting and organising large-scale events. 

The building block of our work and company culture is based on the three values of our company: Knowledge, Empathy and People. Contact us to find out how we can help.

Title: Launch your career as an Entry-Level Tech Consultant at Deloitte
Description:
Job Description
Are you a tech-minded graduate ready to make waves in the world of technology and transformation? Can you see yourself working directly with clients to deliver innovative solutions and help them navigate the complexities of today’s digital landscape? Perhaps you see yourself as a upcoming Infrastructure architect, Solution architect, tester, information security consultant, red teamers or AI Developer?
Technology and Transformation  
In Deloitte Denmark, our teams within Technology & Transformation are at the heart of delivering cutting-edge solutions and transformative projects for our clients. Here, we offer more than just a job: we provide a supportive environment where your ideas can flourish and your skills can shine, and where we can make a real impact - together. 
Being a tech consultant at Deloitte 
Two days are never the same working as a consultant in one of our tech teams in Technology and Transformation. Some things, however, will define your everyday: 
Analysis and innovation: Identify technological challenges, conduct analyses, and develop advanced solutions to tackle complex business challenges and energize operations.Advisory: Build strong stakeholder relationships by working directly with clients to understand their needs, give technological advice and deliver tailored solutions.Collaboration: Explore fresh perspectives together with diverse teams and contribute to our collective success.Learning: Engage in continuous learning across multiple disciplines and get hands-on with the latest technologies and methodologies to stay ahead of the curve.
Who we’re looking for 
We are looking for individuals that can recognize themselves in the following descriptions: 
Graduates or young professionals: Master's students graduating this summer (or alumni with up to 3 years of experience) within Computer Science, Information Technology, Engineering, or related fields. Team players: Colleagues and strong communicators with capital C’s who are eager to contribute in supportive, collaborative, and helpful environments. Problem solvers: Analytical thinkers with a knack for tackling challenges head-on and asking critical questions, who can navigate ambiguity to produce insights, and who’ll thrive in transformative projects at client site. Passionate learners: Curious minds with a genuine passion for technology and eagerness to grow and develop, for example within specific fields like Cloud, Sales Force, AI development, SAP 4/HANA, system resilience enhancement, solution development or IT security.
Let’s find the perfect match for you 
As we are a large organization with a complex structure that is difficult to understand from the outside, we would like to invite you to our Talent Discovery Day the 9th of April to give you a comprehensive insight into Deloitte and our technology teams: Cyber, Cloud & Engineering, AI & Data, Digital Customer, ServiceNow and Technology, Strategy & Transformation.
During the first part of the day, you will have the opportunity to learn about our various projects and consultants and engage in casework and collaboration tasks with peers. During the second part of the day, some of you will be invited to participate in individual dialogues to explore the potential match and right place for you in Deloitte. Based on this, we hope to present some of you with a job offer in one of our tech teams the following day. 
What’s next? 
We hope we caught your attention, and that you would like to join us on the 9th of April at our office at Weidekampsgade 6, 2300 København. 
Although we would like to meet all of you, we only have a limited number of spots available. Therefore, we kindly ask you to apply with your resumé (CV) and grades, and, instead of an application letter, we would like you to answer the questions you will be presented with on the next pages (please only consider the required (*) fields).
The application deadline is Monday the 31st of March, and we will get back to you at the latest within Friday the 4th of April with more information. 
Please do not hesitate to contact Sarah Manniche at smanniche@deloitte.dk if you have any questions.
We encourage all candidates to apply for the position regardless of, e.g., age, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, religion, ethnicity, nationality, or disability. 
Additional Information
In Deloitte, you will find passionate, caring people who are curious by nature and striving to evolve. We value our different skills, perspectives and experiences and foster an environment where innovative powers thrive. To us, success is the feeling that the work we are doing will outlast us. The impact we make is not about what we achieve as individuals, but how we enable those around us to be their very best. From professional development to leadership opportunities, we empower our people to be extraordinary by playing to their strengths – because that is how we can make a difference.

Title: Python Software Engineer
Description:
Summary

ESET, a world-renowned pioneer in cybersecurity, invites you to join our quest to safeguard the digital landscape. We are seeking an experienced Python Software Engineer to help develop ESET AI Advisor—our AI assistant that empowers customers to navigate a rapidly evolving cybersecurity environment

Job Description

As an experienced Python Software Engineer, you will be at the forefront of enhancing our next-generation AI assistant, which leverages large language models (LLMs). Your primary responsibilities will include back-end development and integration with our diverse product line, optimizing our DevOps pipelines, monitoring cloud performance in Microsoft Azure, and contributing to data collection and analysis.

You will join our Automated Systems and Solutions Department, located in Bratislava, where you will transform our project vision into reality. Your focus on maintaining the highest standards of code integrity, security, and quality will be pivotal to the project’s success.

Our tech stack includes Python, FastAPI, SQL, S3, Jenkins, Docker, Kubernetes, Kafka, JIRA, Confluence, and Git.

Why ESET?

You'll be at the heart of creating solutions that protect millions of users worldwide, from major corporations to individual consumers. This role offers the opportunity to continuously learn, experiment with the latest technologies, and make a significant impact in the cybersecurity landscape.

Candidate Profile

We seek a driven professional with a Master’s degree or equivalent in Computer Science or Cybersecurity. Your background should highlight strong Python programming experience and a commitment to producing clear, maintainable code. Proficiency in Linux, CI/CD (Jenkins), and container technologies (Docker, Kubernetes) is essential. Hands-on understanding of AI/ML, computer security, network security, or reverse engineering will set you apart.

At ESET, we believe in work-life balance and fun. You'll enjoy several on- and off-site team building activities, an annual Christmas party, and our legendary company party known as 'Zranica'.

Take the Leap

Join us at ESET, where your expertise not only contributes to technological advancement but also embodies our ethos: ensuring progress is always protected. If you're ready to make a significant impact in a role that champions innovation and security, we invite you to apply and join our mission.

Employee Perks, Benefits

 please visit our website: https://www.eset.com/sk/o-nas/kariera/benefity/

Basic wage component (brutto): from 2700 EUR

* The final basic wage component can be increased accordingly to individual skills and experience of the selected candidate.

* Performance bonus 2 times per year up to 10% of the basic salary paid for the evaluation period(usually 6 months).

Benefits

Health & well-being

BenefitPlusHealthcare (check-ups/annual programs)Multisport cardTravel card "električenka"Supplementary pension savingSick days

Family

Marriage allowanceChildbirth allowanceParental contributionESET family events (Family day, St.Nicholas)

Office

Refreshments in the office (fruits, coffee, soft drinks)Let´s get together breakfastActivity room, quiet roomESET events (Žranica, Christmas party..), teambuildings

Other

Loyalty allowanceLoyalty extra days offLoyalty cakeLoyalty glass awardRefer a friendChristmas presentsDiscounts from external providers

Primary location

Bratislava

Additional locations

Time type

Full time

Get to know us:

Bratislava is the true home of ESET, housing the world headquarters of the company.

The majority of ESET software is developed in the heart of Technology Division based in Bratislava.

It is as well the center of ESET research and other HQ divisions – like finance, operations, sales and business, communication and marketing.

Along the fact that ESET in Bratislava is the business global business HQ, it is regional sales center for the region of Europe, Middle East and Africa – and of our business activities in Slovakia – as well.

Established: 1992

At ESET, diversity, equity, and inclusion (DEI) are integral to our corporate culture. We believe in creating a respectful environment, where everyone feels valued and respected, welcoming applications from individuals of all backgrounds, including race, gender, age, religion, disability, and sexual orientation.

Company Description:
For more than 30 years we have been here helping to watch over and protect progress.  Over a billion users worldwide rely upon ESET’s solutions to stay secure from increasingly sophisticated digital threats. ESET´s award-winning IT security software and services provide protection in over 200 countries and territories worldwide, with its software localized into more than 30 languages. 

Meanwhile, the world continues to move forward at pace. When ESET was founded, the Internet was in its infancy. Now technology is part of everything we do and is central to the continued advancements in our society. Most of the time technology does just what it is supposed to, but in order to ensure continued progress in the digital age we need someone to question what’s going on in the background.

And that’s why we are here – to continue protecting technology from threats, enabling everyone to fully embrace it’s potential and rely on it. 
Put simply - when technology enables progress, ESET is here to protect it.

ESET - Progress. Protected.

Visit www.eset.com to learn more

Title: Full Stack Developer
Description:
Join our international team of top-notch professionals

Our mission & vision

Our mission is to support our member nations and NATO with unique interdisciplinary expertise in the field of cyber defence research, training and exercises covering the focus areas of technology, strategy, operations and law.

Our vision is to foster cooperation of like-minded nations. We bring together NATO Allies and partners beyond the Alliance.

Role Overview:

This role offers an exciting opportunity to work with cutting-edge technologies and contribute to the development of innovative solutions. The ideal candidate will be passionate about technology, have a strong attention to detail, and thrive in a collaborative, fast-paced environment.

Responsibilities:

Design, develop, and maintain full-stack web applications using modern technologies and frameworks.Implement and manage infrastructure and DevOps solutions.Automate processes and workflows to improve efficiency and reliability.Ensure system security, performance, and scalability.Collaborate with cross-functional teams to deliver high-quality software solutions.Troubleshoot and debug issues across the entire stack.Stay up-to-date with emerging technologies and industry best practices.

Mandatory Requirements:

Automation & Configuration: Proficient in Ansible, managing OS environments (Linux, BSD, Windows, network devices), cloud platforms (AWS, Azure, GCP), and automating/debugging services, cron jobs, and system commands.Virtualization & Logging: Experience with vCenter API, Kafka (setup, usage, KSQL), Elastic Stack (Elasticsearch, Logstash, Kibana), and Sentry for monitoring.Access & CI/CD: Expertise in Apache Guacamole for remote access, GitLab CI/CD pipelines, and Keycloak for IAM.Containerization: Skilled in Docker, Kubernetes, and Docker Swarm.Databases: Experienced in MongoDB and PostgreSQL, including design and optimization.Backend: Strong in NodeJS, NestJS, and RESTful API design.Frontend: Proficient in Nuxt.js, JavaScript frameworks, HTML, CSS, and responsive design.

The bonus is:

Testing & QA: Skilled in automated functional testing, E2E testing methodologies/tools, and load/performance testing.Security: Knowledge of authentication/authorization mechanisms, secure coding practices, and monitoring tools.

Qualification:

Bachelor's degree or equivalent in a related field such as Computer Science, Software Engineering.Minimum 5 years of practical work experience in full-stack development.Proven track record of delivering complex software projects.Fluent in English is mandatory.Strong problem-solving and analytical skills.Excellent communication and teamwork abilities.Ability to work independently and manage multiple projects simultaneously.Continuous learning mindset and adaptability to new technologies.

The contract will be for one year with the possibility of extension.

Our HR Manager Käthrin will answer your questions.

Title: Data Engineer, Data Platform
Description:
Digital Customer Offering (DCO) is a business function within Fortum Consumer Solutions, where business and technology come together. At DCO, we create superior digital offerings and experiences for our 2,4 million consumer and enterprise customers. We innovate and find new ways to digitalize our offerings and processes. We collaborate closely with our stakeholders and external partners. Through cross-functional collaboration, agility and sustainability focus, we strive to make our customers’ increasingly digital lives easier with our services. We serve clients in the Nordics as well as Poland and Spain.

We are looking for talented and passionate individuals to join our Secure Operations & Data Solutions unit! This role involves building in-going and out-going ETL processes between data systems, creating data models for Data Scientists, and assisting in feature engineering. You will also support in MLOps. Our team is committed to pursuing innovation and improvements through increased use of data. United by our passion for technology, curiosity about user experience, and dedication to excellence, we are looking for someone who shares our enthusiasm.

In this role, you will:


Develop and maintain ETL processes and ensure that they follow the harmonized data model and that re-usage of ETL scripts is optimized. Ensure that ETL processes and reporting solutions follow and support the company data privacy and security guidelines. Ensure data correctness and high availability according to business needs. Support in deploying and maintaining Machine Learning models in production. Work according to company policies and instructions. Make sure that agreed deadlines are kept according to the work amount estimates made. 


This position can be located in either Espoo, Oslo, Solna or Gothenburg. At Fortum, we apply a hybrid working model. Read more about other job opportunities, our projects and what we offer here!

To excel in this role, you are expected to be: 


A University degree holder in a relevant field. Experienced with 3-5 years of relevant experience in IT and business/industry. Experienced in practical Data Engineer work. Knowledgeable about Data platforms (e.g., Azure, AWS) and their main tools (Databricks, Data Lake, DataFactory, Delta Lake). Knowledgeable about databases (e.g., SQL Server, PostgreSQL, Oracle). Knowledgeable about SW version control tools. Experienced with ETL/ELT processes. 


We are excited to hire individuals who are passionate about data engineering and eager to contribute to our innovative team. If you share our enthusiasm, we would love to hear from you!

We offer a hybrid work model to support your productivity.

Ready to Join Us? 

Don't miss out on this exciting opportunity! Submit your application by 19.03.2025 at the latest. We work with an ongoing selection and the job ad might be closed before the final application date. If you have any questions or would like to learn more about the position, feel free to reach out to Antti Heimonen by phone or via email at antti.heimonen@fortum.com. We are here to help and look forward to hearing from you!

To be selected for the position, the applicant must go through background clearance and a health examination including drug testing.

We are Fortum

Fortum is a Nordic energy company. Our purpose is to power a world where people, businesses and nature thrive together. We are one of the cleanest energy producers in Europe and our actions are guided by our ambitious environmental targets. We generate and deliver clean energy reliably and help industries to decarbonise their processes and grow. Our core operations in the Nordics comprise of efficient, CO2-free power generation as well as reliable supply of electricity and district heat to private and business customers. For our :5 000 employees, we commit to be a safe, and inspiring workplace. Fortum's share is listed on Nasdaq Helsinki. fortum.com

Title: Data Engineer Consultant
Description:
Locations:  KošiceWork mode: Remote or flexible work arrangements available, occasionally travel to customer


Company Overview
Arcondis is a global consulting company with an exclusive focus on the healthcare and life science industries. Headquartered in Basel, Switzerland, the company has a global footprint with offices in North America, APAC and across Europe. We have been managing challenges and solving problems for our clients in compliance, business processes, information technology, and digital transformation since 2001. Our focus lies in creating value through cross-functional, sophisticated delivery methodologies and intelligent implementation. Our clients love to work with us because of our unique skillsets, our pragmatic approach, and our will to win.
We are a medium-sized international consulting firm dedicated to Life Sciences, with a unique and inspiring culture. Our distinctive culture is the driving force behind our success; it is deeply rooted in our purpose and behaviors.
We are owned by a charitable Foundation; our key differentiator is that we contribute to social causes every year. This ethos is not just a part of our identity; it is our way of life. Our motto, "We make healthcare better," reflects the unwavering commitment we have to improving the lives of people through the work we do.
Our culture fosters collaboration, innovation, and a sense of community that sets us apart from the rest. We are living our values every day. Our leadership is expected to lead by example, demonstrating a dedication to our mission and values.
We embrace diversity and inclusivity, and we believe in giving back to the community. Together, we are not just consultants; we are agents of change, and our culture is the driving force behind our shared purpose.

About the role
As a Data Engineer, you will play a key role in designing, building, and maintaining scalable and efficient data pipelines. You need to be able to work closely with data analysts, data scientists, and other stakeholders to ensure high-quality data availability, reliability, and performance. Your expertise in data modeling, ETL processes, and databases will contribute to the overall success of our data-driven initiatives. In addition, your ability to engage with customers and understand their data needs will be an essential part of your role. Occasionally, you will be required to travel to customer sites to support project implementations and stakeholder discussions


Responsibilities
Design, develop, and maintain scalable data pipelinesOptimize data workflows to ensure efficiency, reliabilityCollaborate with data analysts and data scientists to understand data requirements and enable advanced analyticsImplement and manage data infrastructureEnsure data quality, and governance across all data assetsAutomate data processes using ETL frameworks, scripting, and orchestration toolsMonitor and troubleshoot data pipelinesCommunicate effectively with customers and stakeholders to understand business needs and translate them into technical solutionsStay up to date with emerging technologies and best practices in data engineering

Qualifications and Experience
To be successful in this role, you should possess the following qualifications and experience:
Bachelor's or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field2–3 years of professional experience in data engineering, consultant, or a related field, preferably within the Pharma or Life Sciences industryExperience with SQL, Python or any another tool for data processingHands-on experience with ETL tools, data warehousesExperience with big data technologies is a plusStrong knowledge of database design, data modeling, and data governance principlesExcellent communication skills to collaborate with both technical and non-technical stakeholdersStrong problem-solving skills and ability to work in a cross-functional team environmentConfident presence and professionalism in customer interactions

Why ArcondisAn opportunity to shape the future of healthcare by spearheading transformative deals.A collaborative and innovative work environment, where your ideas are valued, and your contributions make a significant impact.Flexible working environment, enabling work-life balance.Attractive compensation package, inclusive of performance-based incentives that reward exceptional achievements.Professional growth and development opportunities.

Title: IT Security Officer
Description:
Ben jij een ervaren Technisch Security Professional met een passie voor het verbeteren van IT-beveiliging en het beschermen van bedrijfsgegevens tegen dreigingen? Werk jij graag op tijdelijke basis voor diverse organisaties en ben je in staat om technische beveiligingsvraagstukken snel en efficiënt aan te pakken? Dan is dit mogelijk iets voor jou.
Wat ga je doen?Als IT Security Officer ben jij de spil in de technische beveiliging van de IT-omgevingen van onze klanten. Jij zorgt ervoor dat systemen, netwerken en applicaties voldoen aan de hoogste veiligheidsnormen. Je voert technische controles uit, ontwikkelt beveiligingsmaatregelen en zorgt voor de implementatie van de juiste beveiligingsarchitectuur. Daarnaast speel je een sleutelrol bij het uitvoeren van audits, risicoanalyses en het reageren op incidenten. Dankzij jouw expertise help je organisaties niet alleen om beveiligingsproblemen op te lossen, maar ook om proactief risico's te beheersen en nieuwe bedreigingen te neutraliseren.
Je bent onder andere bezig met:Ontwerpen en de implementatie van technische beveiligingsmaatregelen om de systemen en netwerken van de klant te beschermen tegen cyberdreigingen.Het uitvoeren van gedetailleerde risicoanalyses, kwetsbaarheidsscans en penetratietests om zwakke plekken in de infrastructuur van de klant te identificeren en te verhelpen.Ontwikkelen en implementeren van veilige architecturen, zowel voor on-premise systemen als voor cloudomgevingen, en het adviseren van klanten over veilige configuraties en best practices.Monitoren van beveiligingsincidenten en het snel en effectief reageren op incidenten, inclusief het uitvoeren van root cause analyses en het treffen van corrigerende maatregelen.Uitvoeren van technische audits en assessments om te voldoen aan regelgeving en industriële normen (zoals ISO 27001, NIST, GDPR).Adviseren van de organisatie over de beste beveiligingspraktijken, beleidsmaatregelen en technologieën om bedrijfsrisico’s te minimaliseren.Het trainen van interne teams en het verhogen van het bewustzijn rondom technische beveiliging en best practices.
Wat kun jij van ons verwachten:Je krijgt bij ons direct een vast contract omdat wij geloven in een langdurige samenwerking.In ons 70/30 model is je salaris gebaseerd op de klus die je uitvoert. Afhankelijk van je niveau is dit bruto tussen de €7.500 tot €15.000.Een positie voor 36 tot 40 uur welke hybride is uit te voeren.Een mobiliteitsbudget van €1.000 euro. Dit kun je gebruiken voor een leaseauto of laten uitkeren in salaris.8% vakantiegeld.Een goede pensioenregeling.Mogelijkheden om certificaten te behalen die relevant zijn voor jouw vakgebied.Je wordt onderdeel van een thuishaven met experts die de passie voor techniek delen en samen zoeken naar een klus die bijdraagt aan jouw ontwikkeling/interesses.
Wat verwachten wij van jou:Je beschikt minimaal over een HBO-opleiding in ICT.Je krijgt energie van het werken aan verschillende opdrachten.Minimaal drie jaar werkervaring in een rol als IT Security Officer, Security Analist, Security Engineer of Security Consultant.Certificeringen zoals CISSP, CISM, CISA, CEH, ISO 27001 Lead Implementer, of vergelijkbaar zijn een sterke pré.
Hoe is het om onderdeel te zijn van Cistec?Bij Cistec sta jij centraal. Wij begrijpen wat jij nodig hebt, omdat we als oprichters zelf uit de ICT komen. We weten hoe uitdagend en dynamisch de wereld van IT is, met een overvloed aan opdrachten en kansen. Ons doel is om daarbinnen het verschil te maken door een omgeving te creëren waar jij je écht thuis voelt en waar je kunt groeien – zowel professioneel als persoonlijk.
We zien onze samenwerking niet als een standaard werkrelatie, maar als een partnerschap. Bij ons draait het om jouw ontwikkeling. We ondersteunen je met opleidingsmogelijkheden, certificeringen en trainingen die je helpen om het beste uit jezelf te halen. En natuurlijk hoort daar een goed salaris bij, dat groeit naarmate jij groeit. Jouw inzet en ontwikkeling worden bij ons écht gewaardeerd.
Daarnaast helpen we je met zorgvuldige begeleiding om een opdracht te vinden die perfect bij jou past. Niet alleen qua technische vaardigheden, maar ook qua persoonlijke ambities en interesses. Op die manier draag je niet alleen bij aan het succes van onze opdrachtgevers, maar ook aan jouw eigen carrière en toekomst.
Bij Cistec geloven we dat we samen verder komen. We creëren een hechte community waarin collega’s elkaar inspireren en versterken. Een plek waar je je gesteund voelt, nieuwe uitdagingen met vertrouwen aangaat en met trots terugkijkt op wat je bereikt.

Title: Associate Software Engineer
Description:
Associate Software Engineer
📍 Location: Tampere, Finland - In Office

About Blancco Technology Group
Blancco is transforming the world of data erasure and mobile diagnostics with market-leading solutions.
Our innovative data erasure software empowers thousands of organisations to implement secure and sustainable data sanitisation processes across a wide range of IT assets. By prioritising erasure and reuse over physical destruction, organisations can enhance security, meet corporate social responsibility goals, and comply with global and local data privacy regulations.
Additionally, our mobile solutions enable organisations to carry out consistent, accurate, and measurable device assessments—whether in-store, in warehouses, or remotely. Our solutions are purpose-built for both front-of-house and back-end operations, ensuring seamless and efficient workflows.
Blancco is recognised as the industry standard in data erasure and mobile diagnostics, with our solutions tested, certified, and approved by over 15 governing bodies worldwide. No other security firm matches our level of compliance with the strictest regulations set by government agencies, legal authorities, and independent testing laboratories.


Our Culture
At Blancco, you’ll be part of a dynamic, global team that thrives on innovation and collaboration. We approach our work with passion, embrace new ideas, and continuously strive to improve. As an inclusive workplace, we believe that diverse perspectives create a stronger, more creative environment. We encourage you to bring your full, authentic self to work every day.
If you’re eager to grow, challenge yourself, and make a meaningful impact in the industry, we’d love to have you on board.


About the Role
As an Associate Software Engineer, you’ll be an integral part of our industry-leading mobile device erasure and diagnostics product team. You will have the opportunity to work with cutting-edge technologies and contribute to our flagship products in a highly successful and growing company.
We’re looking for individuals who are driven by innovation, eager to learn, and passionate about developing high-quality solutions. At Blancco, you’ll be surrounded by experts who will support your growth, and in turn, we look forward to learning from you.


Your Responsibilities
Contribute to software development, debugging, and design across the software stack.Work with the latest technologies to develop and enhance our market-leading products.Collaborate with a multicultural, global team in an Agile environment.Participate in the full software development life cycle, ensuring quality and efficiency.


What We’re Looking For
We’re excited to hear from candidates who:
Have a strong willingness to learn and continuously develop their skills.Possess excellent teamwork and communication skills, with a positive and proactive attitude.Are familiar with modern Agile software development practices and tools.Have a keen eye for detail and take a structured approach to problem-solving.Enjoy working in a multicultural and collaborative environment.You must already be eligible to live and work in Tampere.


Preferred Skills & Experience
We understand that not everyone will tick every box, but we’d love to see experience in some of the following:
Comfortable using Linux or macOS terminal.Proficiency in C/C++.Familiarity with Qt/QML (a significant advantage).Understanding of Android/iOS devices.Experience working on software development projects (professional or hobbyist).


Nice-to-Have Skills
Knowledge of USB protocol stacks.Experience with REST APIs.Familiarity with Jenkins for CI/CD.Bash scripting skills.Reverse engineering capabilities.Strong documentation practices.


What We Offer
At Blancco, we believe in creating an engaging and enjoyable work environment. We offer:
Exciting projects – Work on industry-leading technology with real-world impact.A supportive, collaborative culture – We value innovation, learning, and teamwork.Career growth opportunities – We invest in your professional development.Top-tier tools & equipment – We provide the resources you need to succeed.A fun, inclusive workplace – From team events to social activities, we make sure to celebrate our successes together.
If you’re ready to kick start your career in software development with a company at the forefront of data security and mobile diagnostics, we’d love to hear from you!

🚀 Apply today and be part of our journey!
Primary Description: Blancco Technology Group  · Tampere, Pirkanmaa, Finland (On-site)

Company Description:
The exponential growth of data and data-bearing devices requires a comprehensive digital solution for data sanitization. 

Without it, organizations risk massive data breaches and legal non-compliance from insecure and unsustainable disposal methods on end-of-life data and IT assets. 

Blancco’s scalable, industry-defining data sanitization software irrecoverably erases data across your organization without the need for physical destruction. From endpoints and drives to the cloud, Blancco sanitizes the widest possible range of assets—including data in active storage environments—all with automated, audit-ready reporting. 

Our solutions are approved and certified by 13+ leading security organizations, and we erase to more than 25 standards, from the historic DoD to NIST and the latest specifications from IEEE 2883.  

Secure erasure is more than risk mitigation. It is a promise to your colleagues, clients, and partners that you will protect them and build a more sustainable future. 

Visit www.blancco.com to secure your organization, knowing that all data has been simply, securely erased.

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
Data Engineer Cyber-security & Fraud Detection | Hybrid

Role Overview

We are looking for an experienced Data Engineer to join the ISR/RBS team within the Retail Banking Security (RBS) department. The selected candidate will be responsible for developing and maintaining the data infrastructure that supports our cybersecurity application for eFraud detection. This role requires expertise in Big Data technologies, data pipeline development, and production monitoring to anticipate and prevent fraud-related incidents.

Key Responsibilities

Big Data Development & Deployment:Develop and execute Big Data projects to support eFraud detection business needs.Perform end-to-end testing, define test scenarios, and document defects.Manage production deployments and ensure seamless rollouts.
Data Pipeline & Infrastructure Management:Design, develop, and maintain data pipelines for ETL processes across multiple data sources.Maintain and optimize databases, data warehouses, and data lakes.Ensure data integrity, governance, and compliance with internal standards.
Incident Prevention & Monitoring:Monitor and maintain fraud detection microservices hosted in the Big Data environment.Investigate production incidents and coordinate resolutions with key stakeholders.Implement automated monitoring and alerting mechanisms to enhance security.
Optimization & Security Improvements:Develop a strategy to reduce technical debt and optimize infrastructure performance.Improve data security measures and ensure decommissioning of unused resources.Maintain up-to-date documentation for all data engineering processes.


Required Skills & Experience

Minimum 3 years of experience in data engineering, development, and production monitoring.Strong technical expertise in:Scala, Spark, Hadoop, Cloudera.CI/CD tools and processes.Jira, ElasticSearch for project management and search analytics.
Nice-to-Have Skills:Experience with HDFS, HBase, Control-M, Yarn, Kafka.
Languages:English Advanced (mandatory).French Intermediate (preferred).
Soft Skills:Ability to work autonomously and proactively propose solutions.Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail.Commitment to planning, reporting, and execution of assigned tasks.


Why Join?

Work in a critical cybersecurity environment, contributing to fraud detection and prevention.Engage with cutting-edge Big Data technologies in a fast-paced banking security division.Be part of a collaborative, innovative team focused on enhancing data security.Hybrid work model offering flexibility.


If you are a Data Engineer with expertise in Big Data, fraud detection, and cybersecurity, wed love to hear from you!

Title: Data Center Operations Technician (F/M)

Exoscale is the leading Swiss/European cloud service provider.
With services covering the full cloud infrastructure spectrum - from fast deploying virtual machines to S3 compatible object storage - Exoscale provides a simple and scalable experience in order to let its clients focus on their core business.
Join a dynamic working environment with a cutting-edge distributed team based in Lausanne. Exoscale strives to create an environment with great working conditions and welcomes diverse applicants.
As part of our ongoing efforts to grow our infrastructure footprint, we are hiring a Data Center Operations Technician.
Data Center Operations Technicians at Exoscale are key to maintaining and expanding our hardware infrastructure. From managing physical and network systems to ensuring seamless operations, this role directly supports the growth and reliability of our platform.
Challenges you will be working on:
- Execute physical operations and installations directly within data centers.- Collaborate with local data center teams to remotely coordinate operations and installations.- Provision, deploy, and replace network components, both on-site and remotely.- Diagnose and resolve hardware failures efficiently.- Oversee the replacement of faulty components by coordinating with local teams and suppliers.- Develop and implement automation for recurring operational tasks.- Manage and update the inventory of physical assets across data center locations.- Ensure the availability of hardware spare parts at local data center sites.- Maintain and continuously improve internal documentation and standard operating procedures.
Ideal candidates are:
- Experienced in working with physical computer hardware.- Proficient in handling and managing physical network cabling.- Skilled in managing and configuring network devices.- Familiar with data center operations and best practices.- Knowledgeable in Linux operating systems and their administration.- Possesses strong English communication skills, both written and verbal.- Familiar with GitOps principles and workflows.- Experience with Python or Golang is a plus.

What we offer:
- Flexible working hours and working from home.- Autonomous working conditions with a lot of freedom to create.- Modern working atmosphere and centrally located office with great public transport connection- Team events as well as training and further education.

- Zurich- Frankfurt- Vienna
Regular travel within the same country is expected, including routes such as:
- Zurich -> Geneva- Frankfurt -> Munich
Occasional travel to other data center locations across Europe may also be required.

️⭐ Qui recherche-t-on ?
Manager de l'équipe Mesh, David recherche un ingénieur QA pour améliorer la qualité de notre d'un agent multi-plateforme assurant l'intégrité du poste, le contrôle et la sécurisation des communications.Nous recherchons une personne ayant une bonne compréhension de processus et méthodologie d’assurance qualité avec une expérience déjà avérée, une certification ISTQB serait fortement appréciée. Une maitrise des systèmes Linux, Windows et de bonnes compétences en réseau sont nécessaires pour ce poste.
✏️ Quelles missions pour l'Ingénieur QA Réseau - Python ?
Qualifier les nouvelles fonctionnalités d’une solution multi-OSDéfinir les plans de tests et critères d'acceptation.Rédiger et réaliser des tests fonctionnels, des tests de non régression, des mesures de performance.Mettre en place de maquettes et d’infrastructures réseau complexes.Suivre l'évolution des outils de test et développer le framework en Python, pour automatiser les tests et améliorer l'efficacité du processus de qualification.Apporter de l’expertise technique et fonctionnelle à l’équipe Support.
⚙️ Quel est l'environnement technique ?
Référentiels : Jira, Confluence.Stack technique : Python.Intégration continue : GitLab, Git.Écosystème : Linux / Windows / macOS / iOS / Android.Environnements : Docker, KVM, VMware.
Ingénieur QA Réseau- Python : pourquoi choisir Stormshield ?
💻 Quel produit ?
Le projet OverSec a reçu le soutien du plan d’investissement France 2030, destiné à faire émerger les futurs champions technologiques de demain et accompagner les transitions des secteurs d'excellence. Ce projet vise à concevoir une brique logicielle multiplateforme intégrable dans les différents actifs des infrastructures critiques, permettant de filtrer et chiffrer leurs communications.Conçue de façon à être très résiliente aux cyberattaques et aux pannes logicielles, cette brique améliorera la sûreté de fonctionnement et les processus pour maintenir les sites en conditions opérationnelles et de sécurité. Le déploiement et la configuration des différentes instances du logiciel se feront de façon globale, avec une approche accessible pour les métiers non experts en cybersécurité. Enfin, cette solution permettra de retrouver un périmètre virtuel pour des actifs de terrain et sera donc essentielle pour les usages associés à l'edge computing.
🔗 Quelle équipe pour l'Ingénieur QA Réseau - Python ?
Tu seras intégré à l'équipe OverSec, managée par David. Cette équipe est composée d’une quinzaine de personnes.
✔️Quel process de recrutement ?
Un premier échange avec Alaix, en charge du recrutement, pour échanger sur ce que tu fais actuellement et comment travailler ensemble.Un entretien téléphonique avec David. C'est un premier point pour t'expliquer plus en détails le fonctionnement de l'équipe et la vision du poste.Un entretien technique avec David et une partie de son équipe, autour d'exercices de développement.Un entretien RH avec Audrey, pour te présenter Stormshield dans sa globalité et l'ensemble des avantages.
Durée et aménagement du temps de travail, horaires flexibles, avantages... Découvre la politique sociale de Stormshield résumée dans une rapide infographie.
L’humain est au cœur de notre stratégie de développement aussi nous favorisons l’insertion des personnes en situation de handicap (RQTH).

Title: Data Center Engineer
Description:
Job Title: Network & Data Center EngineerLocation: Brussels or Paris (hybrid)Employment Type: 12 months x 3 Start: ASAP
Job Overview:
Our client, a leading retail organization headquartered in France, is undergoing a major network transformation by adopting Software-Defined Networking (SDN) and SD-WAN solutions. To support this initiative, they are seeking a Network & Data Center Engineer with expertise in SD-WAN, Meraki, Fortinet, and BUI technologies to optimize and manage their evolving network infrastructure.
Key Responsibilities:
Design, implement, and manage SD-WAN solutions using Meraki and Fortinet technologies.Maintain and optimize data center network infrastructure, ensuring high availability and performance.Troubleshoot and resolve issues related to routing and switching infrastructure, including OSPF, BGP, and MPLS configurations.Manage network security measures, including firewall configurations and access control.Collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure seamless integration of network solutions across the organization.Document network architecture, configurations, and procedures to ensure clear operational standards.Support the BUI (Business User Interface) aspects of network infrastructure, ensuring business requirements are met through tailored network solutions.Provide proactive monitoring and performance tuning to maintain optimal network operation.
Required Skills & Experience:
5+ years of experience in network engineering, with a focus on routing, switching, and data center operations.Hands-on expertise in SD-WAN technologies, specifically Meraki and Fortinet.Strong understanding of core networking protocols including OSPF, BGP, and MPLS.Experience in managing firewalls and implementing network security best practices.Familiarity with data center networking standards and high-availability architectures.Proficiency in network performance monitoring and troubleshooting tools.Strong documentation skills, with the ability to clearly articulate technical concepts to diverse audiences.Exposure to cloud networking (e.g., AWS, Azure, or GCP).Experience with Network Access Control (NAC) technologies (e.g., Cisco ISE).Knowledge of multicast technologies and high-availability network designs.

Title: EUIPO 2025-26 Traineeships – Opportunities in Digital Innovation & Data Analytics
Description:
Are you a recent graduate or a young professional in Data Analytics, Computer Science, ICT, Engineering, Mathematics, Statistics, or related fields looking to kickstart your career? Look no further! The European Union Intellectual Property Office (EUIPO) is pleased to announce the opening for applications for the 2024-25 Traineeship Programme.
At the EUIPO, we are passionate about developing the next generation of ICT professionals and data analysts with a particular interest in areas such as:
Software EngineeringCybersecurity Data Analytics and Business IntelligenceCustomer Service SolutionsBusiness AnalysisArtificial Intelligence and Generative AIIT Architecture
As a trainee at the EUIPO, you'll have the opportunity to gain invaluable hands-on experience in a technical environment that leverages cutting-edge technology and systems contributing to the vital work of the European Union in intellectual property administration.
The traineeship program lasts for 12 months starting in September 2025. During this time, trainees will receive a monthly grant *(EUR 1300 for Alicante, EUR 1500 for Brussels and Luxembourg) to support them during their experience.
Don't miss out on this opportunity to grow both personally and professionally in a multicultural and innovative environment. Apply now and take the first step towards an exciting experience with the EUIPO at its headquarters in the sunny Spanish city of Alicante!The EUIPO is committed to equal opportunities and to achieving diversity within the workforce and creating an inclusive working environment. We therefore welcome applications from all qualified candidates irrespective of gender, disability, race, colour, sexual orientation, ethnicity, beliefs, or other characteristics.
Deadline for applications: 31/03/2025 (23h59)
Read more about the EUIPO 2025-26 traineeship opportunities here: https://www.euipo.europa.eu/en/the-office/about-us/who-we-are/employer-of-choice/traineeships
*Traineeships may take place in Alicante, Brussels, or Luxembourg, depending on the profile or position..
Primary Description: EUIPO - European Union  Intellectual Property Office · Valencian Community, Spain (On-site)
Skill: 5 of 8 skills match your profile - you may be a good fit
Company Name: EUIPO - European Union  Intellectual Property Office
Company Description:
The European Union Intellectual Property Office (EUIPO) is the European Union Agency responsible for the registration of the European Union trade mark (EUTM) and the registered Community design (RCD), two unitary intellectual property rights valid across the EU-27. 

EUIPO also hosts the European Observatory on Infringements of Intellectual Property Rights, which has responsibility for a wide range of tasks related to research, communication, spreading best practice and enforcement of all types of intellectual property rights. EUIPO also maintains and manages a single publicly accessible online database of orphan works.

Together with its national and regional EU IP office partners, EUIPO has worked to provide a set of common IT tools and databases  ranging from search and classification tools, modern electronic services for users, examination and processing software and enforcement tools.

Through the EUIPO Academy, the Office offers webinars, learning materials and specific courses covering all aspects of trade mark and design registration.

EUIPO has been based in Alicante, Spain, since its foundation in 1994.


This is the official Linked In page of the European Union Intellectual Property Office (EUIPO). It is administered and moderated by the EUIPO’s Communication team.

On this page we post and share general facts about  the Office and its activities, as well as on trade marks, designs and other types of intellectual property rights. We also raise awareness about the importance of protecting IP against counterfeiting and piracy. Please note that we may not always guarantee the accuracy and completeness of this information, as it may come from various sources.

Comments and images on the EUIPO’s timeline do not necessarily reflect our official position or opinions. Furthermore, this page is not intended to be used as any kind of advice in the process of trade mark and design registration.
Specialties: trade mark protection,design protection,intellectual property,IP rights enforcement

What we expect:Strong experience with ELT/ETL solutions and tools (e.g., Python, Airflow, dbt)Knowledge of modern development practices (e.g., version control & CI/CD)Understanding of business intelligence and the role of AI in data analyticsExperience in designing and optimizing data storage solutions, including data warehouses and data lakesProficiency in working with databases (SQL)Ability to quickly learn new concepts and understand broader contextsA positive and solution-oriented attitudeFluent communication skills in Finnish and EnglishThe following skills will be beneficial in this role:
Experience with cloud technologiesUnderstanding of modern data platforms (e.g., Fabric)Experience with BI tools (e.g. Power BI)Understanding of AI (e.g. Copilot, Azure OpenAI, Amazon Bedrock)Analytical skills (statistical methods)Experience with data management and governance tools (e.g., Purview)Experience in data modelling
The job description can be modified based on the competencies and experience of the selected person.
What we offer:
At CSC, our employees enjoy a wide range of benefits designed to support both their professional and personal lives. We offer flexible working hours and the option for remote work, making it easier to balance work and daily life. Our comfortable workspaces in Keilaniemi, Espoo, and Renforsin Ranta, Kajaani, are designed to facilitate both teamwork and tasks that require quiet concentration. We provide comprehensive occupational healthcare services, comprehensive health insurance, and remote work insurance. Employees can take advantage of a lunch benefit during the workday, and we support recreational activities with sports and cultural benefits.
The selected candidate will be subject to a drug screening and a basic security clearance. The requirement for the employment relationship is that the security clearance does not reveal any noteworthy factors.
Send your application by 17.3.2025 (via our recruitment pages https://csc.fi/en/careers/ )
Diversity is part of who we are, and we continuously work to ensure the diversity and equality of our workplace. We encourage all skilled applicants regardless of background to apply for the position.
For more information, please contact Jura Tarus, jura.tarus(at)csc.fi, +358415463344 (on holiday until 10.3.)
Who are we?
We work together for the future of research and learning through advanced technology. Our competence is the platform on which our society researches, learns and remembers. With us, you get to do meaningful work for the digitalisation of Finnish society, not forgetting significant international cooperation projects.
CSC is a non-profit special assignment company owned by the Finnish government and Finnish higher education institutions. We build digital solutions for data management, scientific computing, and education that enable researchers, learners, and companies to understand the world.
Our company’s key resource is our curious personnel with a willingness to learn, and their well-being at work is very important to us. As a community, we work to ensure that well-being, diversity and inclusiveness are embedded in our culture and practices.
