Title: Information Management Specialist
Description:
The Information Management Specialist will support the implementation and ongoing operations of the information management strategy within KPMG in Belgium. This role is critical in ensuring data accuracy, accessibility, and adherence to regulatory requirements. The position involves working with various stakeholders to manage structured and unstructured data, implement data retention policies, enhance authorization management, but also to work towards a unified document management strategy within the organization.
Roles and Responsibilities
Draft and implement an information management policy, procedures and governance model including a document lifecycle strategy, includingAssist in the evaluation and selection of information management tools and technologiesServe as a liaison between IT and business units to ensure efficient management of information resourcesInform and train end users on information management policies, processes, and procedures.Support end users on the use of information management systems and best practicesMonitor information management systems for compliance and efficiency.Provide ongoing support to ensure compliance with established guidelines. Collaborate with the risk and compliance teams to identify and mitigate risks.Handle day-to-day administrative tasks related to information managementClassifying and labeling data and information.Anonymization of dataImplementing data retention policiesEnhancing authorization management (Need to Know).
Qualifications
Preferable a Bachelor’s degree in Information Management, Library Science, Computer Science, or a related field.Minimum of 3-5 years of experience in information management or a related role.Familiarity with document management systems (preferably iManage and/or SharePoint) and collaboration tools (e.g., Teams).Ability to work independently as well as in project teams and you take ownership and responsibility.Strong understanding of data governance, regulatory requirements (e.g., GDPR), and best practices in information management. Understanding the current AI landscape and how that works within knowledge Management and ideally experience implementing AI tools in the Microsoft ecosystemKnowledge of Microsoft Purview and experience and management of DLP policiesExcellent organizational, analytical, and problem-solving skills.Strong communication and training skills.Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a team environment.Experience in project management is a plus
We offer
An international corporate culture in which personal growth, mutual trust and lifelong learning are being fostered.A competitive and attractive compensation package and a great number of extra-legal advantages (Company car + fuel card, IPhone/IPad, group & hospitalization insurance, Allowances,…) which are customizable with our Reflex@KPMG plan.Career development opportunities combined with trainings based on your personal needs and ambitions.Flexible, hybrid work arrangements to enable working from wherever you are.A team of passionate colleagues to reach higher goals and support each other.A buddy and performance manager to support and assist you through your first months at KPMG.Great teambuilding, sport & wellbeing initiatives through our Together@KPMG program.An inclusive workspace that encourages diversity and pursues mutual respect for each other’s beliefs and backgrounds.
Primary Description: KPMG Belgium · Zaventem, Flemish Region, Belgium (Hybrid)

Title: Data Engineer – Data Warehousing (all genders)
Description:
Wir wollen etwas bewegen – bist Du dabei? Wir sorgen dafür, dass über 80 Millionen Menschen in Deutschland von einer digitalen Gesundheitsversorgung profitieren können. Gestalte mit uns das Gesundheitssystem von morgen.
Dein Arbeitsbereich: OperationsDer Bereich Operations ist für den stabilen, verfügbaren und sicheren Betrieb der Telematikinfrastruktur (TI) verantwortlich. Wir fokussieren uns neben der Einhaltung und Aufrechterhaltung des Betriebs auch auf die Themengebiete Compliance, Informationssicherheit, Datenschutz, Risikomanagement und Kontinuitätsmanagement. Hier laufen viele Stränge zusammen, die zu aussagefähigen Informationen für das Management verdichtet werden. Damit leisten wir einen wichtigen Beitrag für die kontinuierliche Professionalisierung der gematik.Das Team Service Information Management ist zuständig für die Sicherstellung der Informations- und Werkzeugbereitstellung für die TI - Betriebskoordination.
Deine AufgabenWeiterentwicklung: Du arbeitest am Betrieb und der Weiterentwicklung einer umfangreichen Data Warehousing Umgebung mit und entwickelst die Prozesse rund um die Speicherung, Pflege, Aufbereitung und Weitergabe von Betriebsdaten der Telematik Infrastruktur (TI) und vieler anderer Daten über das Gesundheitswesen und den Gesundheitsmarkt in Deutschland.Optimierung: Du gestaltest und optimierst die bestehenden Datenmodelle, automatisierst unterschiedlichste Datenschnittstellen und entwickelst Aggregations- und Auswertungsverfahren über komplexe Datenmodelle im Big Data Umfeld.Datenqualität: Mit der von Dir geschaffenen Dateninfrastruktur stellst Du die Aktualität und Konsistenz der Daten sicher und bildest die Grundlage für das Reporting, Datenanalysen, die Betriebssteuerung der TI und viele Entscheidungen des Unternehmens.Kommunikation: In Deinen Aufgaben kommunizierst Du aktiv mit Bedarfsträgern und Datenlieferanten, um die Datenstrukturen beständig weiterzuentwickeln.
Dein ProfilAusbildung: Du hast ein Studium oder eine Fachausbildung im Bereich Informatik, Schwerpunkt SW-Entwicklung oder vergleichbar erfolgreich abgeschlossen.Erfahrung: Du bringst mehrjährige Erfahrung in Konzeption, Betrieb und Management von relationalen Datenbanksystemen, idealerweise dem MS SQL-Server mit.ETL-Kenntnisse: Du hast umfangreiche Erfahrung, Business Logik und ETL Prozesse mithilfe von Stored Procedures und Functions umzusetzen, am besten mit T-SQL.Cloud-Know-How: Cloud-Umgebungen und Infrastruktur, sind für Dich keine Fremdwörter.Programmierkenntnisse: Idealerweise, kannst Du Kenntnisse in Programmierung mit Powershell und .Net vorweisen, sowie erste Erfahrung mit JSON und XML.Analytische Stärke: Du hast eine hohe Auffassungsgabe und bist in der Lage, schnell Zusammenhänge und Strukturen zu erkennen.Teamfähigkeit: Du bist Teamplayer und verfügst über sehr gute Kommunikationsfähigkeiten.Innovation: Du hast Spaß daran, über den Tellerrand hinauszuschauen und gemeinsam den Weg in die Hybride Cloud für das Data Warehouse mitzugestalten.Sprache: Deine sehr guten Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse, runden Dein Profil ab.
Unser AngebotInnovation: Wir gestalten die Digitalisierung des deutschen Gesundheitswesens in einem der größten E-Governance Projekte Europas.Entwicklung: Wir investieren in Deine individuelle Entwicklung (z.B. Weiterbildungen, Mitarbeiter:innen schulen Mitarbeiter:innen, Workshops, Konferenzen).Benefits: Neben einem attraktiven Gehalt bieten wir Dir Gesundheits- und Sportangebote, Mitarbeiterevents und vieles mehr.Work-Life-Balance: Vereinbarkeit von Familie und Beruf ist uns wichtig, daher gestaltest Du Deine Arbeitszeit flexibel.Arbeitszeit: Es sind 40 Wochenstunden vorgesehen. Eine Teilzeitanstellung sowie mobiles Arbeiten sind möglich.
Wir können die Zukunft nur gemeinsam gestalten - deshalb haben alle Menschen bei uns die gleichen Chancen. Ganz egal ob weiblich, männlich, divers, mit Behinderung und unabhängig von Alter, ethnischer oder religiöser Zugehörigkeit: Dein Beitrag verbessert die Gesundheitsversorgung von morgen! Wir glauben, dass ein vielfältiges, wertschätzendes, tolerantes und weltoffenes Miteinander die Grundlage ist, um das Gesundheitssystem zu digitalisieren.
Skill: 7 of 10 skills match your profile - you may be a good fit
Company Description:
Gemeinsam für eine große Aufgabe

Die Digitalisierung des deutschen Gesundheitswesens ist eines der größten IT-Projekte Europas. Das Ziel ist die Optimierung der Gesundheitsversorgung von 70 Millionen Menschen. Teil dieses ehrgeizigen und anspruchsvollen Projekts zu sein, ist ein wesentlicher Teil des Selbstverständnisses und der Motivation der rund 400 hoch qualifizierten Mitarbeiter der gematik. Diese Aufgabe gehen sie am Unternehmensstandort in Berlin-Mitte pragmatisch, lösungsorientiert und leidenschaftlich an.

Gesunde Aussichten 

Das Ziel der gematik besteht darin, die Digitalisierung des deutschen Gesundheitswesens durch eine wertgeschätzte Telematikinfrastruktur sicher zu stellen.

Ein wesentliches Tätigkeitsfeld ist dabei die Konzeption der Telematikinfrastruktur. Dies beinhaltet die Definition rechtsverbindlicher Standards und Spezifikationen für alle Komponenten und Dienste, die in der Telematikinfrastruktur verwendet werden. So werden deren Funktionalität, Kompatibilität und Sicherheit gewährleistet und sichergestellt, dass sie von allen Akteuren im Gesundheitswesen genutzt werden können.

Hierbei sind das Wissen der gematik um die technischen Möglichkeiten einerseits und die genaue Kenntnis des deutschen Gesundheitswesens andererseits entscheidend. Es geht  vor allem darum, Lösungen zu finden, die mit vertretbarem Aufwand für alle realisierbar sind und langfristig Bestand haben. Nur so lässt sich gewährleisten, dass die Telematikinfrastruktur nicht nur heute, sondern auch morgen und übermorgen ein Netz von allen für alle ist und bleibt.

Bitte beachten Sie auch unsere Netiquette: gematik.de/netiquette und unsere Datenschutzbestimmungen: gematik.de/datenschutz
Specialties: Digitalisation of the German healthcare system

 ENERCON gehört seit 40 Jahren zu den Technologieführern im Bereich der Windenergie. Company Description:
ENERCON: Pioneer in wind energy technology, partner in the energy transition and attractive employer in a future-orientated industry.

Thanks to innovative turbine technology, high quality standards and many years of experience, ENERCON is one of the leading manufacturers of onshore wind turbines. Dr Aloys Wobben founded ENERCON in Aurich (East Frisia) in 1984. With just a few employees, he developed the company's first wind turbines. The company was the first wind turbine manufacturer to use a gearless drive concept, which characterises all ENERCON wind turbines. ENERCON is also a pioneer in areas such as rotor blade design, control and grid connection technology, and continues to demonstrate its great innovative strength with a large number of new technological developments.

Today, ENERCON is active worldwide and is already present in over 35 countries with a decentralised service and sales network. This means that we not only offer our employees international career opportunities, but also very close cooperation with team colleagues abroad. We all share a common goal: energy for the world.

Shapers of the future wanted: Become part of our vision and bring a breath of fresh air to our team! ENERCON offers challenging career prospects in a wide range of areas such as Research & Development, IT, Project Management, Sales and in the Commercial Sector.

Apply now: https://www.enercon.de/karriere

Title: IT Trainee
Description:
Are you a brilliant mind with an interest in Information Technology? Would you like to challenge yourself in a dynamic international environment? Ecolab is looking for an IT Support Trainee who can efficiently support our IT team, contributing to the ongoing success of the company. This is a great chance to work with IT and Global support teams on IT projects to support our internal customers.

The Role

Join our IT team in Ecolab Italy as an IT Support Trainee based in our office in Sant Joan Despi (Barcelona). Ecolab’s IT teams leverage advanced technologies and methodologies across multiple domains including customer collaboration, end user computing, enterprise resource planning, cyber security, and business analytics, partnering with our businesses to deliver results. Our interns develop essential business and IT skills by actively supporting projects and programs that enable breakthrough results for Ecolab’s businesses.

What You Will Do

Under direct supervision you will be responsible for providing support to IT usersYou will use basic analysis techniques to troubleshoot and resolve incidents as well as assisting in performing root cause analysis on problemsUsing remote control software, you will provide onsite and cross-border supportConduct regular interaction with IT users using customer service skills and communication skillsWork with other support functions on projects and activities related to IT.Liaise with partners and vendors on IT related user support. Like for example, open incidents with HP support for hardware maintenance.Conform with ITIL processes and ensuring that all incidents are addressed efficiently, and proper system logging is maintained.

Key Responsibilities

Perform basic incident and problem analysis as required to resolve incidents and requestsPerform hardware and software change requests as assignedPerform implementation support as requiredAttend end user meetings as requested to provide local support to usersWork with IT and Global support teams to act as a local IT resource as required to ensure regional infrastructure is maintained at a high service availability level

Qualifications & Skills

Degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or other relevant areaExcellent knowledge of English language (verbal & written communication). Spanish or Italian will be considered a plusProficient with MS Office 365 & Windows 11Ability to interact professionally with others and work independently in a fast-paced environment.Strong problem solving and interpersonal skills.Excellent verbal and written communication skills.Highly dependable team player.Ability to prioritize workload and complete responsibilities on time.

Familiarity With Desktop Applications, Including The Following

Local client configurations including, SMS, SAP GUIVPN, remote/wireless access connectivity configuration and maintenanceSupport of Android and iOS mobile devices.Remote Software like GoToAssist or Bomgar

What’s In It For You

You will join a growth company offering a competitive base salaryAccess to best-in-class resources, tools, and technologyGrow your income as you drive growth.Thrive in a company that values a culture of safety to include top-notch safety training and personal protection equipment.Start date: As soon as possible 40 hours per week.Work schedule: 9AM to 6PM (daily presence at the office is needed for the role)

Company Profile

Ecolab is the global leader in water, hygiene and energy technologies and services that protect people and vital resources. Every day, we help make the world cleaner, safer and healthier – protecting people and vital resources. Ecolab is a trusted partner at nearly three million customer locations around the world, supplying clients in foodservice, food processing, hospitality, healthcare, industrial, and manufacturing markets, all choose Ecolab products and services to keep their environment clean and safe, operate efficiently and achieve sustainability goals.

Our Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion

Ecolab’s commitment to diversity, equity and inclusion (DE&I) reflects our longstanding value of working together to integrate diverse perspectives to challenge ourselves, reach our goals and do what’s right.

Disability certificates will be considered.

Our Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion

Ecolab is committed to fair and equal treatment of associates and applicants and furthering the principles of Equal Opportunity to Employment. Our goal is to fully utilize minority, female, and disabled individuals at all levels of the workforce. We will recruit, hire, promote, transfer and provide opportunities for advancement based on individual qualifications and job performance. In all matters affecting employment, compensation, benefits, working conditions, and opportunities for advancement, Ecolab will not discriminate against any associate or applicant for employment because of race, religion, color, creed, national origin, citizenship status, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity and expressions, genetic information, marital status, age, or disability.
Company Description:
A trusted partner for millions of customers, Ecolab (NYSE:ECL) is a global sustainability leader offering water, hygiene and infection prevention solutions and services that protect people and the resources vital to life. Building on a century of innovation, Ecolab has annual sales of $15 billion, employs more than 48,000 associates and operates in more than 170 countries around the world. The company delivers comprehensive science-based solutions, data-driven insights and world-class service to advance food safety, maintain clean and safe environments, and optimize water and energy use. Ecolab’s innovative solutions improve operational efficiencies and sustainability for customers in the food, healthcare, life sciences, hospitality and industrial markets.

For more Ecolab news and information, visit www.ecolab.com.
Specialties: Safe Food,Clean Water,Abundant Energy,Healthy Environments

Title: IT Specialist
Description:
Are you ready to shape the future of IT with Outokumpu?
This is your opportunity to join a global leader in stainless steel and be a vital part of our mission to deliver safe and reliable production infrastructure services. If you are passionate about operational efficiency and continuous improvement, we want to hear from you!
What You’ll Do: As an IT Specialist, On-site Services, you will ensure the delivery of safe and reliable infrastructure services at the sites in your scope, acting as a trusted partner to business counterparts.
The role involves: IT Operations & Support: Manage infrastructure, end-user devices, networks, and firewalls while ensuring service delivery meets agreed performance levels.Lifecycle & Cybersecurity: Oversee IT lifecycle management, updates, and cybersecurity to maintain a secure and efficient environment.Standardization & Improvement: Drive device, application, and process standardization while proposing improvements for better service delivery.Communication & Collaboration: Ensure clear communication and effective collaboration with IT teams, partners, and stakeholders.Documentation & Advocacy: Maintain accurate documentation and promote the value and scope of IT services.
Why Join Us? Grow with Us: We offer opportunities for professional growth and skill development, keeping knowledge in-house.Be Part of a Transformation: Join us in Q3/Q4 and contribute to our exciting new IT phase.Make an Impact: Play a key role in enhancing our IT services and improving business satisfaction.
What We’re Looking For: Bachelor’s degree in Information Systems (IS), Information Technology (IT), or equivalent industry experience.3+ years of experience in IT infrastructure-related support and development duties.Intermediate skills in Microsoft workstation operating systems, server operating systems (MS + Linux), Active Directory, and asset management tools.Intermediate skills in supporting desktop, laptop, mobile devices, VDI solutions, and peripherals hardware.Intermediate skills in LAN and firewall support & administration.Basic problem-solving skills.Strong cooperation and communication skills in both German and English, spoken and written.
If you are interested in the role, please submit your CV in English. We look forward to receiving your application!

Company Description:
Outokumpu is the global leader in sustainable stainless steel. Our business is based on circular economy: more than 90% of our production originates from recycled steel which we turn into long-lasting, fully recyclable material. Our customers use our stainless steel in many aspects of life, from civilization’s basic structures to famous landmarks and household appliances. With our total carbon footprint less than 75% of the industry average, we are working towards a world that lasts forever. 

We have an ambitious sustainability strategy and we are strongly committed to 1.5 degree target to mitigate climate change. Our emissions reduction ambition covers all direct and indirect emissions, as well as those of our supply chain.

Outokumpu employs approximately 8,500 professionals in close to 30 countries, with headquarters in Helsinki, Finland and shares listed in Nasdaq Helsinki. Read more: www.outokumpu.com

Title: Python / Automation Engineer (m/f/d)
Description:
Wer sind wir?
Our Product Department consists of over 40 developers who work on our vulnerability management solutions. The aim is to increase security for our customers by identifying vulnerabilities at an early stage so that countermeasures can be taken quickly. In addition to many German and international companies, our clientele also includes the German federal government. 
To support our development teams, we are looking for a Python / Automation Engineer (m/f/d) with multiple years of practical experience who enjoys advancing and helping shape solutions. Motivated, dynamic, and diverse teams are waiting to benefit from your expertise. 
A great match for the role would bring a strong understanding of modern coding practices, and structured problem-solving skills, more than being proficient in specific technologies.

Developing and maintaining robust Python-based applications to process security-related data
Extending and improving our internal infrastructure and tooling
Analyze and automate vulnerability data for Linux and Windows systems
Applying common development practices such as clean code, code reviews, and continuous integration

Ability to discuss and collaborate on highly technical solutions within a dynamic team and break down complex problems into practical development tasks
Experience working with data preparation and processing
Advanced Python development experience
English communication skills
You are communicative, open, and eager to learn
You enjoy new technologies and methods
You are motivated by complex and challenging tasks
You recognize tasks independently and can complete them in a structured way
You can quickly familiarize yourself with existing code and improve weak points

Python experience
Strong general IT and development knowledge

Nice to have:

Windows based security tools and workflows
System administrator experience
Bash and Powershell
Docker

Cybersecurity knowledge
Experience with APIs and web scraping

A motivated, dynamic and diverse team

Family friendliness and healthy work-life balance
The opportunity to participate in the company’s development
High transparency and open interaction at eye level
30 days of vacation and an attractive retirement package
Modern offices in a central city location with excellent accessibility
Extensive work equipment (also in the home office)
Job ticket
Attractive company health management: fitness program, job bike and much more
100% remote work possible
A good conscience due to our open-source approach

Title: Research Information Data Scientist (m/w/div)
Description:
Die Max Planck Digital Library (MPDL) in München ist eine zentrale Serviceeinrichtung der Max‑Planck-Gesellschaft zur Förderung der Wissenschaften e. V. (MPG). Wir unterstützen Wissenschaftler*innen der gegenwärtig 84 Max‑Planck-Institute und Forschungsstellen im In- und Ausland mit einem breiten Service-Portfolio, das ihnen einen einfachen Zugang zu Daten, wissenschaftlicher Literatur, kommerziellen Softwarelizenzen, wissenschaftlichen Kommunikationswerkzeugen und Dienstleistungen sowie forschungsrelevanten Softwareanwendungen bietet.
Die Big Data Analytics der MPDL untersucht das weltweite wissenschaftliche Publikationsgeschehen, die dahinterliegenden Netzwerke und prägenden Trendbewegungen („Research Information“). Die Ergebnisse der Gruppe bilden die Grundlage des Verständnisses des wissenschaftlichen Informationsnetzwerks und ‑marktes. Sie fließen unmittelbar in konkrete Kaufentscheidungen, wissenschaftspolitische Strategiebildung und modernste wissenschaftliche Rechercheverfahren ein.
Zum Ausbau unseres Teams „Data Infrastructure“ suchen wir ab sofort einen Research Information Data Scientist (m/w/div).
Ihre AufgabenMitarbeit in der Entwicklung und Anwendung von inHouse-Frameworks (SQL, PL/pgSQL, Python, LaTeX)Konsolidierung und Standardisierung von Daten aus heterogenen QuellenErstellung von Datenübersichten, statistischen Analysen und VisualisierungenAutomatisierung und Optimierung von QualitätssicherungsprozessenErstellung und Pflege von inHouse-Dokumentationen
Ihr ProfilAbgeschlossenes wissenschaftliches Hochschulstudium oder eine vergleichbare QualifikationPraktische Erfahrung mit relationalen DatenbankenFortgeschrittene Kenntnisse in einer ProgrammierspracheErfahrung im teamorientierten Programmieren (gemeinsames Code-Management, kollaboratives Debugging, ...)Erfahrung in der Bearbeitung großer und heterogener DatenmengenKenntnisse in weiteren Techniken der Datenmanipulation und ‑analyse (z. B. Pattern Matching, Statistik, Machine Learning, Netzwerkanalyse, Visualisierung)Sorgfältiger, selbstständiger und teamorientierter ArbeitsstilEngagement und Begeisterung für exzellenten ServiceBereitschaft, laufend hinzuzulernen und sich in neue Zusammenhänge einzuarbeitenEnglisch in Wort und Schrift
Unser AngebotDurch die Möglichkeit, selbstständig zu arbeiten und eigene Ideen einzubringen, ist die Tätigkeit bei uns anspruchsvoll und abwechslungsreich. Ihre Arbeitszeiten können an private/familiäre Bedürfnisse angepasst werden, um eine ausgewogene Work-Life-Balance zu erreichen. Auch besteht die Möglichkeit, bis zu 70 % der Arbeitszeit mobil zu arbeiten. Wir fördern regelmäßige Fortbildungen, beginnend von Online-Kursen bis hin zu individuellen Coachings. Des Weiteren bieten wir folgende Benefits:Betriebliche Altersvorsorge und weitere Sozialleistungen30 Tage Urlaub (bei einer 5-Tage-Woche) und 4 extra Einarbeitungstage pro JahrArbeitgeberzuschuss zum vergünstigten Deutschlandticket
Anstellung, Sozialleistungen und Vergütung richten sich nach dem Tarifvertrag für den öffentlichen Dienst (TVöD-Bund); je nach Qualifikation ist eine Eingruppierung bis EG 13 möglich. Die Stelle ist ab sofort zu besetzen und ist zunächst auf 2 Jahre befristet. Sie kann auch in Teilzeit (min. 60 %) besetzt werden.
Die Max-Planck-Gesellschaft hat sich zum Ziel gesetzt, mehr schwerbehinderte Menschen zu beschäftigen. Bewerbungen Schwerbehinderter sind ausdrücklich erwünscht. Die Max‑Planck-Gesellschaft strebt nach Geschlechtergerechtigkeit und Vielfalt. Wir begrüßen Bewerbungen jeden Hintergrunds.
Haben wir Ihr Interesse geweckt?Dann freuen wir uns auf Ihre Online-Bewerbung mit Lebenslauf, Anschreiben, Qualifikationsnachweisen und Zeugnissen.Jetzt bewerbenMax Planck Digital LibraryLandsberger Straße 34680687 Münchenwww.mpdl.mpg.de/

Title: SysOps Linux-Engineer
Description:
Please only apply if you are living in the Netherlands and hybrid working is a possibility, where we like you to work preferable 2 days on location in Rijswijk.
___
Come and join DetACT, Detecting Active Cyber Threats, and help us with our mission No More Fraud by having a positive impact on society (social impact) by protecting the elderly and vulnerable fellow man for Financial and Bank Fraud. 
DetACT is a small, collaborative team of professionals (~ 40) dedicated in close partnership with our customers to deliver high-end customer value (detecting and preventing financial fraud) and achieving our social impact. Our have high ambitions to grow our customer base and thereby protecting even more people.____
DataExpert's business unit DetACT No more Fraud (The Hague office) consists of approximately 40 (technical) professionals with a passion for technology and anti-fraud. Our services include fraud investigation and 24/7 cyber threat detection. We detect threats in real-time and escalate to the customer as needed, ensuring they are immediately aware of imminent danger and have access to the necessary data to take action. DetACT is used by multiple customers in the financial industry and can be deployed on-premises or in the cloud.
What do we ask of you?The success of the DetACT department is largely determined by the availability of the service, in addition to a beautiful (self-developed) product, very experienced colleagues and the best service for our customers. As a Linux specialist, you represent the interests of both DataExpert and the customer. Together with 5 other specialists, you will be part of the System Operations team. As a team, you will ensure that the service is available to all our customers, day and night. In addition, you will spend time improving processes, monitoring, configuration management and automating recurring tasks. You will do this together with colleagues from different disciplines. You will speak with experts and provide a clear story and direction for the future of Linux environments.
You involve internal and sometimes external stakeholders at the right level and at the right time. You are flexible, solution-oriented and you set the right priorities.
Your tasks and responsibilitiesEstablish a Debian-based operating system by developing Ansible roles and playbooks.Developing scripts to perform repetitive tasksManaging and installing physical serversTechnical application management of an application hosted on Linux (preferably Debian).Communicate with the customer in English, both in writing and orally (via Teams or by phone).
Job requirementsDriven and can keep an overview of the work to be done.At least 1 year of experience with technical application management of an application hosted on Linux (preferably Debian).Can or wants to learn to manage and further develop a complex AWS environment.Minimum of 2 years of experience in managing Linux servers (Debian-based is a plus).Experience with git.Can work independently and actively searches for 'the missing link' to complete the assignment or solve the problem.Experience with Scrum/Kanban/Lean and an agile mindset.
Desired qualificationsExperience in setting up corporate networks, preferably in possession of a CCNA certificate or equivalent certificate or demonstrable experience.Experience in designing new functionalities for a software product and/or the underlying infrastructure.Experience in designing monitoring for software and/or the underlying infrastructure.Minimum of 1 year of experience in the role of Site Reliability Engineer.Experience installing physical servers using PXEBoot.Experience in managing and extending Python scripts developed for the management of software products and (Debian) Linux systems.
What does DataExpert offer?A varied, independent position within a small informal team that attaches great value to mutual cooperation, at a company with a good reputation in the market. You work in a knowledge-intensive and dynamic working environment in which you will be faced with many challenges and the opportunity to develop yourself further.
In addition, we offer you:A market-conform salary (depending on your education and experience)Good secondary employment conditions including an attractive bonus scheme, a good pension scheme, disability insurance and a bicycle planThe possibility to work partly from home and flexible office days26 days of leaveCompany laptopThe opportunity to follow training courses and educationAnd of course very pleasant colleagues
Who is DataExpert?DataExpert, located in Veenendaal, The Hague, Linköping (Sweden) and Copenhagen (Denmark) and has been in existence for over 34 years and is a supplier to governments and the business community. We supply software products and services in the field of (digital) research, crime analysis, cybersecurity and cybercrime. In addition, DataExpert has an excellent reputation in the field of support, consultancy and training. DataExpert recently acquired DetACT.
DataExpert stands for knowledge and expertise. We know what is going on with the customers, when this is going on and how we can help the customer. We know our solutions and the process at the supplier, which allows us to respond quickly and flexibly to needs in the market.
Interested in this position?Would you like to know more about the position or do you want to send your motivation and CV directly? Then send an email to the attention of Ms. D. Wentink (HR Manager) to vacature@dataexpert.nl

To this aim, DataExpert delivers a wide portfolio of digital forensics, analytics, and cybersecurity solutions and services to its customers.

Title: Frontend Engineer Trainee, Loyalty
Description:
Primary location:

HELSINKI

Loyalty is at the heart of S Group’s cooperative nature and it provides many services for the co-ops and co-op members. Our systems manage the co-op memberships, calculate monthly cashback, store digital receipts, and provide S Group-wide customer log-in, to mention a few. Concrete examples of products developed include Omat ostot, S-ID logging in to S Group digital services, S-Mobiili mobile app and loyalty benefits and payment cards in Apple Wallet – all high-volume services used by our over 4 million co-op members. We develop the services in cross-functional agile teams where developers, QA engineers, designers, data & analytics professionals and business developers work together. With us, you'll have the possibility to impact the lives of most people living in Finland. Now you have a chance to join the journey as a Trainee!

We are looking for 1-2 Frontend Engineer Trainees to join Loyalty team in Helsinki. The role is fixed term, and we hope you can work with us approximately between June and August. Loyalty is part of the SOK Digital Development community, where we develop web services and apps for the whole S Group - digitalizing the S Group services. Your future team includes developers, designers, QA engineers, and business, all working together as a team. This is a great opportunity for you to learn from talented professionals and gain valuable experience! We work in a hybrid setting so it would be great if you could work at our office in Ässäkeskus in Helsinki at least three days a week.

Your Responsibilities

As a Frontend Engineer Trainee your main duties during the summer will be building React components and modifying our existing microfrontends into components. In addition, you will also help to improve our developer experience by developing Backstage frontend and customizing it to be more aligned with our brand guidelines. Your tasks are mostly related to frontend using TypeScript, React, React Native, NextJS and Playwright. Senior colleagues will help and guide you throughout your training period.

Examples of what we've been working on lately in Loyalty:

Launched S-Etukortti for Apple Wallet Transition from S-Mobiili to our online stores as a logged in customer Building capabilities for leveraging our customer data to better cater to co-op members’ individual needs Streamlining the joining process

Is this you?

You are curious and analytical, and you communicate effectively in English. You love to write code and solve problems. You respect software engineering as a team sport, so working with others is your preferred way to get things done. As our Trainee, we expect you to have 1-2 years of engineering studies behind you and a basic understanding of software engineering. While we don’t require prior work experience from the field, all coding experience counts as your advantage – especially frontend and React or React Native-related experience.

What We Offer 

On top of the finest colleagues, excellent learning opportunities, superb company benefits, and a respectful salary this is what we offer in return:

An opportunity to gain knowledge and technical competence in wide-ranging technology domains and an opportunity to learn from talented colleagues Ownership. You’re creating services directly for the end-users. You’re not visiting a project; you own the product together with your team Workplace democracy. Our ways of working are not set in stone. Together we’ll continuously improve the ways of developing products and services An opportunity to gain know-how and technical competence in wide-ranging technology domains (like web, mobile, and cloud) as well as business domains (restaurants, hotels, online retail, and service stations), a lot of diverse growth and job opportunities Occupational healthcare, sports, and culture benefits, lunch benefits in our staff restaurant, and access to the hobby and sports facilities in Ässäkeskus An opportunity to improve and influence the daily lives of S Group’s employees and millions of people A stable and flexible working environment based on cooperative values and principles, the possibility of choosing your daily work rhythm and location Influence and responsibility. Our engineers have a lot of freedom in their work, but they also live with their solutions, and so do millions of users too

Interested? - We’ll be happy to hear from you

Please send us your CV and an application highlighting your task-related skills by March 18th, 2025, at the latest.

Our recruitment process consists of a video interview and team interview (with a light code assessment test). You will meet our recruiter, hiring manager, and some of your colleagues during our recruitment process.

At S-Group, we are committed to working in a diverse and inclusive work environment where all our employees' unique backgrounds, skills, and perspectives are respected and valued.

At SOK IT & Development, we are a group of 500 diverse and talented professionals, each bringing a unique perspective and skill set to our shared mission. As part of the S-Group, Finland’s largest private employer with over 40,000 employees, we are entrusted with guiding the future of one of the most impactful organizations in Finland. 

Our responsibility is clear – we provide strategic guidance and technological expertise to support all areas of the S-Group. We are uniquely positioned inside S-Group with billions of rows of data from multiple use cases and business domains, all intimately connected to Finns as they/we go about our daily routines. We build SW products, apps, and services highlighted by the regular dialogue between digital and IRL worlds, which genuinely makes our work consistently intriguing. We are design conscious, we believe in community internally and externally, pride ourselves on our open source commitment, our progressive path towards an Agile and DevOps culture, and our use of modern tools and democratic development standards for a holistic philosophy to modern and pure software development practices.

Read more about SOK Digital Development: https://www.s-group.dev/

Title: Junior Data Analyst (m/w/d)
Description:
Junior Data Analyst (m/f/x)

Location: Haren

Working Hours: Full-time employee

1,400 employees in 24 locations around the world with a fleet of 60,000+ circulating containers. Since ELA’s establishment in 1972, our business has continuously been expanding, we are specialists in mobile room solutions. Our family-run company based in Haren (Ems), Germany, is growing at a fast pace and we are actively looking for qualified and dedicated team players to join us locally, internationally and beyond.

We continue to grow! We are therefore currently looking for a Junior Data Analyst (m/f/x) for our headquarter in Haren (Ems) to further develop and expand our IT department.

Do you have strong analytical skills and want to work with modern analysis tools? Then you've come to the right place! As a Junior Data Analyst (m/f/x), you will ensure that our company continues to make progress by gaining valuable insights from data. You will work with databases, create meaningful dashboards and automate analyses - all with the aim of enabling well-founded decisions.

We offer you the opportunity to develop your skills, utilise innovative technologies and work on exciting projects with a dedicated team. If you like juggling numbers and presenting complex relationships in an understandable way, then we should get to know each other!

 Your Future Role

Collecting, cleansing and analysing data from various sourcesCreating dashboards and reports with tools such as Power BIWorking with SQL databases to query and structure dataDeveloping scripts to automate data analyses (e.g. with Python or R)Checking data quality and identifying inconsistenciesProviding data analyses for various areas of the company

What You Bring To The Team

Successfully completed studies in computer science, business informatics, statistics, mathematics or comparable training, e.g. as an IT specialist for application development, data and process analysis (m/f/x) or a comparable qualificationInitial professional experience with data analysis tools (e.g. Power BI, Tableau, Excel, Google Data Studio) desirableKnowledge of SQL for data retrieval and manipulationBasic knowledge of programming languages such as Python or R an advantageStrong communication skills to present results in an understandable wayVery good German and good written and spoken English skills

What You Can Expect From Us

We offer you a permanent employment contractYou have flexible working hours with us, work flexitime and have the option of up to 60% home office per weekWe organise an extensive induction programme for you, so that you get to know the entire company and our productsWe offer you fresh fruit and drinks every dayTo keep you fit and healthy, we regularly offer you various health activities and massage appointments.You benefit from our company fitness offer: Thousands of gyms, swimming pools etc. all over Germany are at your unlimited disposal for only 25 € per month.We offer you individual development opportunities and interesting competence trainingsWe take care of your company pension scheme and offer you capital-forming benefits.At ELA, you can also expect a varied job in a globally active company, uncomplicated interaction with one another and a wide range of opportunities to contribute your own ideas.

How You Can Apply

Title: Specialist - Information Security
Description:
Scope is looking for a passionate Information Security Officer to join our Information Security team based in Berlin. The candidate should be familiar with and have previous experience with Endpoint Protection, Vulnerability Management and Pentesting exercises, Security Operation Center Management, Network Intrusion Prevention and Firewall solutions, and DevSecOps.The role requires a responsive, proactive, and highly productive professional who can work with numerous stakeholders to ensure a continued optimum level of Security.
Duties & responsibilitiesAdministering and monitoring Microsoft security platforms including Microsoft Azure and Office 365 Security Centers, Azure Sentinel, and working with Microsoft Compliance Portals for security monitoring and investigationsMonitor and restrict access to sensitive, confidential, or restricted data using Data Classification, and Data Loss Prevention solutionsManagement of Penetration Testing and Vulnerability Management activities across Web Applications and Network vulnerability scanner (Tenable Nessus) and understanding of the related industry standards, such as CVE, CPE, CVSSManagement of SIEM solution, day-to-day incidents remediation, escalation of tickets or cases derived from SIEM solution, or monitoring of server event logs, firewall logs, access logs, and other security logsEndpoint Protection and threat hunting skills for malware investigations, phishing attempt analyses, forensics, and root cause analysesReview firewall rules and policies, specifically on web application firewalls (WAFs) and Intrusion prevention systems (Sophos, Palo Alto)Take part in Incident response activities for company-wide information security incidents & data breaches, recommend improvements and controls to prevent recurrence wherever possible, or follow up with other stakeholdersMonitoring Applications and services for business continuity and resiliency processes, including data backup and recovery testing, patching and upgrading activities monitoringEnsuring the use of appropriate security tools in the development environment, play a role in developing and designing application-level security controls and standards. Familiarity with automated dynamic scanners and static code analyses tools and code review techniquesSupporting the Information Technology, Risk, and Compliance teams in the implementation of the Group Information Security Strategy
Professional & personal qualifications5+ years’ experience in the Information Security domainMinimum of 2 years’ experience with public/private cloud environments (Azure, AWS, GCP, etc.)Experience in working with DevOps teams to adopt security best practices in the cloud, including dynamic and static code analyses tools, code review techniques, and decent exposure to Terraform, Docker, container management services, CI/CD pipelines, and secrets management in microservices-based architecturesBachelor’s or master’s degree in computer science, information technology, Cyber Security, or equivalent professional experienceTechnical experience in working with DLP Solutions is a plusKnowledge of Azure Security Center, Entra ID (Identity Protection and Privilege Access Management, Conditional Access App Control), and Microsoft Security PortalsKnowledge in the implementation of Information Security frameworks like ISO 27001Certified Information Security Manager (CISM) or equivalent certificationCertified Ethical Hacking (CEH) or equivalent certificationMicrosoft Azure and Security Certifications will be a plusAbility to meet deadlines, motivate others to do the same, and manage stress effectively in high-pressure situationsAbility to take ownership and responsibility of tasks and projects that involve both independent and teamworkWillingness to learn new technologies and toolsExperience in a multitasking environment, providing support on different projects simultaneouslyFluent in English (written and spoken); Fluent in the German language is a plus
Interested?If this sounds like a journey for you, we look forward to learning more from your convincing application. Please note: For non-EU applicants, a valid work and residence permit is a prerequisite for this job position.
What we want to seeCurrent CVCopy of your university degrees and certificatesCriminal record certificate (can be provided at a later date)At least 3 letters of reference (can be provided at a later date)
Profile descriptionWith more than 250 employees operating from offices in Berlin, Frankfurt, London, Madrid, Milan, Oslo and Paris, Scope Group is the leading European provider of independent credit ratings, ESG and fund analysis. Based on forward-looking and innovative methodologies, Scope offers a European perspective that contributes to greater diversity of opinion for institutional investors worldwide. Scope Ratings is the largest European credit rating agency, registered in accordance with EU and UK rating agency regulation, offering opinion-driven and non-mechanistic credit risk analysis. Scope ESG Analysis provides tools for analysing and reporting on ESG impact and risk, as well as second-party opinions on green, social and sustainable bonds. Scope Fund Analysis rates more than 10,000 funds and asset managers across all major asset classes. At Scope Group, we are committed to fostering a diverse and inclusive workplace where everyone is treated with respect and fairness. We embrace people from all backgrounds, regardless of culture, ethnicity and gender. We ensure that our application processes are free from discrimination. By valuing each individual's unique background and perspectives, we strive to create an environment where all employees can thrive and contribute their best. Our dedication to equality and inclusivity reflects our belief that diversity drives innovation and success.

Company Description:
Scope Group is the leading European provider of credit ratings, fund analysis, ESG assessment and bespoke solutions for evaluating and monitoring risk. Scope provides an essential alternative perspective, contributing to greater diversity of credit and risk opinions for issuers and institutional investors.
 
Scope Group’s analyst teams are based in Berlin, Frankfurt, London, Milan, Madrid, Oslo and Paris.
 
Scope Ratings is the only European credit assessment institution accepted in the Eurosystem Credit Assessment Framework (ECAF) for collateral used in euro area monetary policy.  Scope’s credit ratings can be used to fulfil credit quality requirements of marketable assets that are eligible as collateral in Eurosystem monetary policy operations. Scope Ratings was accepted by Norges Bank in Norway in 2022.

Scope Ratings is registered in accordance with EU rating regulations and operates in the European Union with ECAI status. Scope is also registered with the Swiss authority FINMA.

As the leading European credit rating agency, Scope Ratings offers clients opinion-driven, forward-looking and non-mechanistic credit risk analysis and contributes to. Founded in 2012, Scope Ratings differs from other agencies and their traditional one-size-fits-all, top-down methodologies with its European perspective, recognising the importance of national and regional differences in laws, regulations, political processes and business culture across countries in it methodologies and credit assessments. ESG factors are embedded in its analysis of sovereign and public sector issuers.

Scope Ratings plans to gradually expand its business model worldwide. The group will apply for Nationally Recognized Statistical Rating Organization (NRSRO) status in the United States. 

Scope Fund Analysis is a leader in Europe for the analysis and rating of mutual funds, alternative investment funds, asset management companies and certificate issuers.

Title: IT-Datacenter Specialist
Description:
Wir suchen Dich
Für unser wachsendes IT-Team am Standort in Karlsruhe suchen wir dich in Vollzeit (40h) und unbefristet, als IT-Datacenter Specialist (m/w/d).

Das erwartet Dich bei uns
Du administrierst und organisierst die Server und das Subnetzwerk im Rechenzentrum in Karlsruhe.Du konfigurierst und verwaltest virtuelle Windows- und Linux-Umgebungen und arbeitest regelmäßig an bereichsübergreifenden IT-Projekten mit.Du installierst und betreust VMware vSphere-Umgebungen, einschließlich ESXi-Hosts, und verwaltest Sophos- und Unifi-Firewalls.Du führst Wartungsarbeiten, Host-Konvertierungen und den Austausch defekter Festplatten in Rechenzentrums- und Backupsystemen durch.Du analysierst und setzt Maßnahmen zur Effizienz- und Sicherheitssteigerung der IT-Systeme um.Du überwachst kontinuierlich IT-Systeme, dokumentierst Prozesse umfassend und reagierst flexibel und schnell auf Serverausfälle oder kritische Systemereignisse. 

Das solltest Du mitbringen
Du hast eine abgeschlossene Ausbildung oder ein Studium im IT-Bereich und verfügst über 3 bis 5 Jahre Berufserfahrung, idealerweise im Bereich Rechenzentren.Du hast gute Kenntnisse in VMWare und Synology.Du kennst dich aus mit der Administration von Linux/Unix und Services wie Postfix, Exim4, NTP oder NGINX.Du hast Erfahrung mit Dell Unity sowie mit dem Aufbau und der Verwaltung von Servern.Du bist motiviert, dich in neue Themen einzuarbeiten und Probleme lösungsorientiert anzugehen.Du sprichst gutes Deutsch und/oder Englisch. 

Das bieten wir Dir
Flexible Arbeitszeiten sowie Möglichkeit für mobiles Arbeiten.30 Tage Urlaub (auf Basis einer 5-Tage-Woche).Onboarding-Programm „Vulcan Starter Days“. Unter andrem mit Kraftwerksbesuch und Führung durch unser Labor.Sport- und Freizeitangebote - EGYM Wellpass mit15,00€ inkl. USt. Eigenanteil im Monat, regelmäßige Firmenevents, Afterwork-Sportgruppen.Corporate Benefits Plattform mit vielen attraktiven Rabattaktionen.Bikeleasingangebote.Betriebliches Altersvorsorge.Verantwortungsvolle Tätigkeit zur Gestaltung einer CO2-neutralen Zukunft in Europa.Spannende, verantwortungsvolle und abwechslungsreiche Tätigkeiten mit Platz für eigene Ideen.Raum für fachliche und persönliche Entwicklung mit individuellen Weiterbildungsmöglichkeiten. 

Wir freuen uns Dich kennenzulernen! 
Neugierig geworden? Schicke uns einfach über das Bewerbungsformular deinen Lebenslauf und schreibe uns, warum du gerne Teil von Vulcan werden möchtest. Bei Fragen steht dir Slavko Rančić (Talent Acquisition Specialist) unter 0175 2729337 zur Verfügung.
*** Bitte beachte, dass alle Bewerbungen mit dem Bewerberformular ausgefüllt werden müssen – wir akzeptieren keine Bewerbungen per E-Mail. ***
Über uns
Bei Vulcan vereint uns die Idee einer nachhaltigeren und unabhängigeren Energie- und Rohstoffversorgung für Europa. Wir sind Pioniere auf dem Gebiet der CO2-neutralen Lithiumgewinnung und haben dafür eine innovative und zukunftsweisende Technologie mithilfe des Direct-Lithium-Extraction-Verfahrens entwickelt. Dafür bringen wir Talente und Experten aus über 40 Nationen zusammen und arbeiten mit Herzblut und voller Leidenschaft an der Planung und am Bau von Geothermie- und Lithiumextraktionsanlagen, die wir selbst betreiben werden, um damit die klimaneutrale Mobilitäts- und Energiewirtschaft zu beschleunigen. Mit Unternehmen wie Stellantis und Renault haben wir bereits starke Partner, die uns auf dem Weg zum Market Leader unterstützen.Be the first with us!
Primary Description: Vulcan Energy Germany · Karlsruhe, Baden-Württemberg, Germany (On-site)

Company Description: Vulcan Energy strebt an, die weltweit erste klimaneutrale, integrierte Produktion von Lithium und Erneuerbarer Energie aufzubauen, um die CO2-Emissionen in der Batterieproduktion zu reduzieren. Unsere erste Projektphase „Lionheart“, die sich im Oberrheingraben an der Grenze zwischen Deutschland und Frankreich befindet, stellt die größte Lithium- und Geothermieressource in Europa dar. Wir nutzen die dort natürlich vorkommende Erdwärme, um Lithium aus unterirdischen geothermischen Solen zu gewinnen und dieses im Anschluss zu einem batteriefertigen Produkt weiterzuverarbeiten. Mit der unternehmenseigenen, führenden Technologie zur Lithiumextraktion VULSORB® schaffen wir eine lokale, kostengünstige und nachhaltige Lithiumquelle für europäische Elektrofahrzeugbatterien.

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
If you're ready to dive into the world of data and tackle exciting challenges that shape our business decisions, BrokerChooser is the place for you. We are eager to welcome a skilled Data Engineer with a passion for data-driven solutions to our team.
Here, your contributions will play a crucial role in optimizing our data infrastructure and influencing our strategic direction. Join us and help pave the way for data innovation that drives our success!
✨ We're building the company culture for growth:We dream big and build world-class products - We believe in taking full ownership of our projects and expect everyone on our team to bring their best ideas and initiatives to the table.Ship fast and learn from it - We blend the structure of a corporate environment with the agility of a startup, launching new features daily, trying new technologies and running numerous A/B tests to see what works best.We're going international - We're attracting top talent from across Europe and beyond, building a diverse, multidisciplinary team that’s as dynamic as the FinTech world we’re shaping.Strong feedback culture - We run an advanced feedback system that prioritizes open communication and offers the opportunity to delve deeply into your performance in monthly discussions.Annual salary benchmarks, equity option - We offer competitive salaries based on market benchmarks that are adjusted annually ensuring that your compensation remains fair and competitive.
✔️ What you'll be doing:Develop and maintain scalable, efficient data pipelines that integrate data from diverse sourcesLeverage data scraping and API solutions to gather and enhance our datasets, enriching our analytical capabilitiesCreate comprehensive reports that communicate findings clearly to stakeholders and facilitate data-driven decision-making.Actively provide insights and strategic recommendations based on deep data analysisEvaluate A/B tests rigorously and analyze resultsAssist in user research to understand customer behavior, preferences, funnel flow, contributing to product developmentDevelop statistical models, such as linear regression, to support forecasting, trend analysis, and strategic decision-makingPartner with our senior data expert on AI-based tasks and furthering our innovative capacities
Do you have what it takes?3+ years of relevant Data and Software Engineering experience, with strong proficiency in PythonA business and impact focused mindset, not afraid of big data sets, can independently draw conclusions and take the initiativeExcellent communication skills and the ability to present data-driven insights to non-technical stakeholdersWorking proficiency in English; no exam is needed, but interviews and tests might be conducted in EnglishProven experience in building and maintaining ETL pipelinesStrong SQL skillsFamiliarity with cloud computing services, particularly GCP and AWSExperience with data warehouse solutions (eg. BigQuery, Redshift, Snowflake)Proficient in BI tools (e.g., Tableau, Metabase, Power BI) and data visualization best practices
The salary range for this (medior) position is 1,400,000 - 1,750,00,000 HUF gross / month.
What do we do?In today's fast-paced FinTech landscape, we stand out as a leading global platform for brokerage comparison and financial education. Based in Budapest, Hungary, we’re here to guide individual investors all over the world with clear, unbiased, and thorough reviews of brokerage services worldwide.
Founded by finance professionals, we combine cutting-edge AI and Data Science with expert analysis to compare over 100 brokers, catering to diverse investment needs. We are a tight-knit team of 45 professionals, growing at an impressive annual rate of 50%, all while being completely bootstrapped. Our goal? To hit $4 million in annual recurring revenue (ARR) by 2024, with a potential to grow 30 times over.
Our insights are regularly featured in top-tier publications like Bloomberg, Financial Times, Forbes, and CNBC. Our innovative approach has earned us the title of Best Fintech Startup in Hungary by CESA. Plus, the feedback we provide is often implemented by industry leaders like Interactive Brokers.
We’re proud to serve nearly 700,000 monthly users across more than 200 countries, offering personalized advice in over 60 languages, saving over 10,000 people from scams every month.
To learn more about the team, visit our Career site and check out this video.

Title: Técnico de Programação de Sistemas de Automação de Edifícios
Description:
Quem somos?O Grupo Contimetra/Sistimetra é uma empresa com 60 anos de existência no mercado de venda de soluções e serviços tecnicamente inovadores. As nossas áreas de atuação são no Ar Condicionado, Controlo e Sistemas de Gestão Técnica de Edifícios e Controlo e Instrumentação para a Industria e Ambiente.
Descrição da Vaga:Estamos à procura de um Técnico de Programação de Sistemas de Automação de Edifícios para desempenhar um papel fundamental na criação e otimização de sistemas de automação de edifícios, que incluem o controlo de iluminação, climatização, segurança, gestão de energia e outros sistemas técnicos. Este profissional é responsável por programar e configurar os controladores e sistemas de automação para garantir o funcionamento eficiente e a integração perfeita dos dispositivos e sensores.
Responsabilidades:Programar e configurar sistemas de automação de edifícios de acordo com as especificações do projeto e as necessidades do cliente.Desenvolver scripts e lógica de controlo para garantir a operação eficiente de sistemas como AVAC (aquecimento, ventilação e ar-condicionado), iluminação, controlos de acesso e segurança, entre outros.Integrar diferentes dispositivos e sistemas de automação para permitir a comunicação e a coordenação eficaz entre eles.Realizar testes e depurações em sistemas para garantir que todos os componentes funcionem conforme o esperado.Colaborar com engenheiros e equipa de projeto para garantir a conformidade com as especificações técnicas e os padrões de qualidade.Manter registos precisos de todos os trabalhos realizados, atualizações de software e configurações de sistemas.Fornecer formação aos utilizadores finais e técnicos de manutenção sobre o funcionamento dos sistemas de automação.Acompanhar as tendências e avanços tecnológicos na área de automação de edifícios e fazer recomendações para melhorias e atualizações.
Requisitos:Formação técnica em eletrónica, elétrica, mecatrónica, automação ou área relacionada. Diploma ou certificação em automação de edifícios é uma vantagem.Conhecimento sólido em programação de sistemas de automação, incluindo linguagens como PLC (Controladores Lógicos Programáveis), BACnet, Modbus, entre outros.Experiência anterior em programação de sistemas de automação de edifícios.Habilidade para interpretar esquemas elétricos e diagramas de fluxo.Conhecimento em sistemas de gestão de energia e integração de fontes de energia renovável é uma vantagem.Habilidades de resolução de problemas, pensamento lógico e atenção aos detalhes.Boas habilidades de comunicação para interagir com clientes e colegas de equipa.Capacidade de trabalhar de forma independente e em equipa.Compromisso com a segurança no local de trabalho
Experiência profissional:Mínimo 2 anos de experiência na área, de preferência com experiência em campo na área de GTC.

Company Description:
A CONTIMETRA Instrumentos Industriais Lda,  foi fundada no início de 1964 pelo seu actual presidente A. J. Gama Caldas, para dar resposta à crescente procura de soluções técnicas de qualidade nas áreas da instrumentação industrial e de controlo; e difusão de ar condicionado, que se verificava, e ainda se verifica, em Portugal. 

Em 1976, dado o desenvolvimento verificado na área da instalação em obra e 
sistemas de comando e controlo, é criada a CONTIMETRA Instalações Mecânicas Lda, empresa que, dessa data em diante, se tem responsabilizado pela concepção, instalação e manutenção de variadíssimos sistemas de controlo de ar condicionado, comando centralizado e gestão técnica em edifícios por todo o país.

A partir da mesma data, a CONTIMETRA Instrumentos Industriais Lda. 
tem-se dedicado exclusivamente ao fornecimento de equipamentos e soluções técnicas em áreas tão diversificadas como o AVAC, instrumentação industrial, controlo do processo industrial, análise e tratamento de efluentes, vedantes e lubrificantes. 

Dada a vitalidade do mercado na zona norte do país, a CONTIMETRA abre uma delegação na cidade do Porto em 1982. 
Posteriormente, em 1983, esta viria a dar origem à SISTIMETRA Sistemas e Medidas Industriais Lda.

Desde a sua fundação que a CONTIMETRA tem trilhado uma senda de inovação e excelência na área da instrumentação e controlo, fornecendo os mais sofisticados equipamentos e aplicando as mais recentes tecnologias.
Specialties: AVAC - Soluções de difusão de ar condicionado ..,SGTC - Sistemas de Gestão Técnica Centralizada ..,UTAS - Unidades de Tratamento de Ar ..,Instrumentação e controlo industrial ..,Vedantes e Lubrificantes,Medição de caudal e efluentes,AVAC,Monitorização

Title: Cyber Business Analyst
Description:
Albany Beck are hiring for a Cyber Business Analyst to join the business and work with a leading Investment Bank based in Dublin on a long-term cyber remediation and regulatory mandate programme. The team is focussing on the delivery of a large-scale cyber and regulatory remediation programme, and are seeking an experienced Senior Cyber Business Analyst with deep expertise in cyber security.
The RoleAs a Cyber Business Analyst, you will play a pivotal role in driving the success of a major cyber and regulatory remediation initiative. You will act as the bridge between business stakeholders, technical teams, and external vendors to ensure that cyber security risks, particularly those involving third parties, are mitigated in line with regulatory requirements.
You will analyse, document, and refine processes while ensuring that all business needs and compliance requirements are met. This is a high-impact role for someone with a strategic mindset, who can thrive in a fast-paced environment and is able to navigate the complex intersection of cyber security and regulatory frameworks.
Key Responsibilities Lead business analysis activities within the Cyber and Regulatory Remediation Programme, focusing on cyber security requirements and compliance. Work closely with stakeholders to gather and document detailed business and technical requirements related to cyber security, compliance, and third-party risk. Analyse current cyber processes and workflows to identify gaps and propose solutions that align with regulatory standards. Collaborate with IT, legal, risk, and procurement teams to develop and implement strategies for improving cyber resilience, especially concerning third-party vendors. Develop clear business requirements documents (BRDs), process maps, data flows, and use cases to support the remediation efforts.Ensure compliance with applicable regulations (e.g., GDPR, NIST, ISO 27001, etc.) by translating regulatory requirements into actionable business initiatives. Support project management teams in the planning, prioritization, and execution of project deliverables. Act as a key liaison between business units, technology teams, and external partners to ensure effective communication and project alignment. Provide expert advice on cyber risk remediation efforts and regulatory compliance, ensuring the business remains secure and meets regulatory standards.
Key Skills and Experience Proven experience as a Business Analyst in a cyber security environment. In-depth understanding of cyber security principles, risk management, and regulatory frameworks. Experience working on large, complex remediation programs with a focus on cyber security. Strong analytical skills with the ability to translate complex business and regulatory requirements into clear and actionable plans. Excellent communication and stakeholder management skills, capable of working with cross-functional teams at all levels. Solid understanding of cyber security tools, technologies, and best practices.
Primary Description: Albany Beck · Dublin, County Dublin, Ireland (Hybrid)

Title: IT Support Engineer
Description:
In order to provide support for the MAINSYS IT infrastructure and services, MAINSYS is looking for IT Support Engineers who will:

Implement, maintain, manage and monitor installed systems, infrastructure, software and hardware within our offices, our IT datacenters and on the CloudTroubleshoot technical issues and identify solutions to software and hardware issues and diagnosticsManage multiple open cases / support tickets at onceEnsuring issues are fully closed off and communicated to internal clientsProvide accurate reporting, documentation, and technical knowledgeSupport release of new applications and test new technology and applicationsAiding in shaping how IT supports the business as a whole via contributions to the service desk and the change management processesMeeting SLA’s objectives including reaction and resolution times for managed ticketsSupport on IT projects (Security, Infrastructure, Development)Deploy infrastructure and applications and make sure they are in line with our corporate policiesManage that the IT infrastructure, systems and applications are secure, reliable, and deployed in an efficient wayImplement a comprehensive patch management strategy aligned with IT goals, plan and coordinate the deployment of patches, review reports and compliance statusConduct security events analysis reporting, identify and manage incidents, etc.Document and design processes / procedures and keep them up to dateEvaluate and recommend new IT technologies and best practices.

We coach our new IT Support Engineers and provide them with trainings adapted to the context of the MAINSYS IT Support services and aiming at developing the required skills, both in IT and around the banking applications.

- FRONTeO Branch, a complete solution for the banking advisors
- FRONTeO Open Banking, that proposes an answer perfectly adapted to the PSD2 directive

MAINSYS has recently enriched its offer by developing a range of F2B solutions (“Front to Back”) :

Finally, the CoCPit range, a leading software package in Belgium, manages the information exchange between banks and third party institutions (such as the National Bank). 

Thanks to our exhaustive knowledge of the different banking businesses, within the Retail, Private and Corporate (finance) Banks, we are ideally positioned to accompany our banking clients in their business projects through our Business Consulting activity.

Title: IT Administrator & Support Engineer
Description:
Come and join the leading #avoexperts 🥑  Westfalia Fruit is a leading multinational supplier of fresh fruit and related value added products to global markets. Through our vertically-integrated supply chain we grow, source, ripen, pack, process and market quality avocadoes & fresh produce - 365 days a year & across the globe.  With the largest avocado-growing footprint in the world, we are recognised as the leading #avoexperts, and considered as the supplier of choice to both retail & wholesale customers whom we serve from sales offices in the UK, Europe, North America, Latin America & Southern Africa.  We're looking for an IT Administrator & Support Engineer to join our team in Poeldijk, Netherlands on a permanent basis.  Our IT Administrator & Support Engineers play a crucial role in supporting user productivity and maintaining the organisation's IT infrastructure. This position serves as the second tier of technical support, collaborating with internal teams to diagnose and resolve complex IT issues affecting users. 
Responsibilities include:  Diagnose and resolve complex technical issues affecting hardware, software, mobile devices and peripherals. Maintain system performance and stability through preventive maintenance and troubleshooting. Manage the ticketing system, prioritising and resolving incidents. Provide training and guidance to users on IT systems, applications and tools. Onboard and offboard staff members, managing access control within Active Directory. Maintain key IT infrastructure including servers, networks, and security. Ensure compliance with security policies and data protection regulations. Stay up-to-date on emerging technologies and best practices in IT support. Collaborate with internal teams to deliver efficient and responsive IT support.  
 


Requirements

Experience we look for: 
Essential 
A strong background in providing on-site IT support at a 2nd line level. Fluent in both Dutch and English languages (native/C1-C2). Proficiency in Microsoft 365 and/or Azure environments, with relevant certifications such as Microsoft 365 Certified: Fundamentals or Azure Administrator Associate. Possess an advanced understanding of Windows Server and Workstation administration. Maintain a strong knowledge of Windows Active Directory and networking concepts, encompassing user management, security groups, DNS, and DHCP. Excel in both written and verbal communication, effectively interacting with both technical and non-technical audiences. Possess a proven ability to troubleshoot and diagnose complex technical issues, showcasing strong analytical and problem-solving skills. Demonstrate a passion for providing exceptional user support and service, prioritising user satisfaction.  Desirable 
 Additional fluency in another European language (French, German, Spanish). Previous experience of working in a standalone role. 

Benefits


What can Westfalia Fruit offer you?  26 days vacation, plus national holidays Salary of up to €60,000 depending on experience and skills Company pension scheme Company phone & laptop  Please note that this position does not have a specific closing date. We encourage you to apply as soon as possible, as we review applications on a rolling basis and the advert may be removed at any time. 
We're an equal opportunity employer. All applicants will be considered for employment without attention to age, ethnicity, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, family or parental status, national origin, or veteran, neurodiversity or disability status.

Title: Information Security Specialist
Description:
At TechWolf, security is not just a priority. It’s the foundation of trust that gives our customers the confidence to let us power their skills intelligence, and it safeguards the intellectual property we’ve created through years of cutting-edge research and innovation. Given the critical role of Security to our business, we want to set the standard in terms of excellence in this area. As an Information Security Specialist, your work will be central to that mission!
Within Information Security, we create a foundational layer, taking into account the organization’s strategy, relevant regulations and standards we follow. This is processed into actionable controls, which the organization has committed to executing.
Join our team as an Information Security Specialist, where you’ll have a key role in supporting and shaping how security is implemented within the organization, which has a direct impact in how the organization functions (securely)!
What you'll doYou will support through the following activities:
Leading security audits: We are dedicated in radiating externally that we take security seriously. That is why we maintain a SOC 2 Type 2 attestation, as well as an ISO27001 certificate. To maintain compliance, audits must be prepared and executed, for which you will receive responsibility.Running Security: To keep up with compliance and business requirements, we have defined a security control framework. To ensure this is running effectively, we must continuously evaluate the execution and definition of these controls to ensure they remain relevant and …Execution of the Security Roadmap: To ensure we continuously improve, Security defines its own roadmap. You will contribute to the execution of these initiatives, or might even lead a few!Interface with customers: Security is not only important to TechWolf, but also to our customers. To demonstrate this, we undergo different kinds of customer assessments and provide guidance from the definition of the architecture until signature.
Who you are:To thrive in this role, a passion for security is essential. However, the following skills are essential to succeed in this role:
You're either a fresh graduate with a passion for Information Security,Or you have up to 4 years of professional experience in Information Security.You have an inherent drive to understand the bigger picture, always seeking to gain a thorough and comprehensive understanding of problems.Your strong communication skills enable you to bridge gaps and facilitate cross-functional collaboration.As a diplomat, you excel at finding solutions that benefit all parties involved, while keeping the best interests of your function and organization at the forefront.You're based in Belgium and excited to work together with the TechWolf team in our Ghent office at least three days per week.Familiarity with audits, information security, and technical expertise are a plus!
What’s in it for you?📈 Equity - everyone is an owner at TechWolf and can share in our success!👨‍👩‍👧‍👦 Hybrid working and flexible hours - make your work schedule work for you🌱 Health insurance & retirement savings🏝️ Work from abroad 3 weeks each year💻 Learning and development opportunities🚶‍♀️ Walking culture - who doesn’t love brainstorming or connecting with colleagues while taking a walk around the office?🎉 Fun teambuildings, social & sports activities
Sounds like your cup of tea? There's more!TechWolf is on a mission to make work better and fairer for millions of people by powering the shift from jobs to skills as a framework to model talent. Our enterprise software uses AI to provide the skill data needed to power that transformation.We provide a unique opportunity to work with an all-star team and cutting-edge product, in a purpose-driven company that aims to empower people to thrive at work. TechWolf is growing fast and you’ll join a high-performing international team with a unicorn dream. Ready to help us build a rocket ship?
Follow us to keep up with our latest updates on:Website | Instagram
Skill: Skills: Information Security, Governance, Risk Management, and Compliance (GRC), +2 more
Company Description:
TechWolf’s Skills Intelligence Platform provides enterprises a fast track to adopting a skills-based talent model. By using our AI technology, organisations get an instant overview of skills and skill gaps across their workforce.

Skills-Based Organisations (SBO) need reliable information about people’s evolving competencies. Manually collecting and maintaining skill data is a struggle for most HR departments, and the results tend to be fragmented and quickly outdated. 

With TechWolf, companies obtain an automatic and up-to-date overview of their people’s skills in under eight weeks.

TechWolf’s AI technology stems from the computer labs of Cambridge University and is constantly updated with the most recent advances in Natural Language Processing. 

Our Skill Engine™ extracts, interprets, contextualises and compares skills and jobs from unstructured data - making our AI explainable and unbiased. 

As an API-first technology, TechWolf is built to connect to any of an organisation’s tools, providing the HR ecosystem with skills. No matter the setup, our technology adapts to the employee’s way of working - without adding an extra interface.
Specialties: Big Data,Artificial Intelligence,Machine Learning,Natural Language Processing,Natural Language Understanding,Human Resources,Skills,Skills intelligence,HR Tech,Computer software,Skills data
