Company Description:
Randstad založil v roce 1960 v Nizozemí Frits Goldschmeding. V průběhu dalších let jsme se postupně rozšířili do 39 zemí a stali se největším poskytovatelem personálních služeb na světě. 
Cesta Randstadu v České republice začala v roce 2008, kdy jsme vstoupili na trh převzetím lokální agentury. Na jejích základech jsme začali budovat značku Randstad a stali jsme se dvojkou na českém trhu poskytovatelů personálních služeb.  
Naším cílem je propojovat lidi se společnostmi, které jim umožní realizovat se a profesně růst a firmám vyhledávat profesionály, kteří se budou podílet na dalším úspěšném rozvoji jejich podnikání. Naše služby zahrnují vyhledávání zaměstnanců na stálé úvazky (Professionals) od úrovně specialistů přes střední a vyšší management až po nejvyšší management (Search&Selection), poskytování agenturních zaměstnanců a řešení efektivního řízení velkých objemů pracovníků (Randstad Inhouse Services).
Specializujeme se na cílené vyhledávání těch nejlepších kandidátů (sourcing), jsme celosvětově oceňovaný poskytovatel komplexních řešení náboru (RPO). 
Při naší práci se řídíme základní hodnotami naší společnosti: ‘to know, to serve, to trust’ - ‘znát, sloužit, důvěřovat‘. Vždy se snažíme porozumět potřebám našich klientů a kandidátů. Čím více je známe, tím lépe jim můžeme vyhovět a naplnit jejich očekávání.
LinkedIn zásadně změnil způsob vyhledávání a oslovování kandidátů. Svět recruitingu se neustále posouvá k cílenému vyhledávání lidí s požadovaným profilem. My v Randstadu se na tento způsob práce specializujeme. Ve světě práce nejen působíme, my jej pomáháme dále utvářet.

V roce 2018 jsme poprvé ocenili nejatraktivnější zaměstnavatele Česka. Podívejte se, kdo se umístil na nejvyšších příčkách: https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLJhGP7JByWSPQ5K1yGbkGAPOsFJN66BY5

Title: Fullstack Software Developer
Description:
Job Description

Full Stack Developer duties include:

Participating in the design and creation of scalable softwareWriting clean, functional code on the front- and back-endTesting and fixing bugs or other coding issues


Job brief

We are looking for a Full Stack Developer to produce scalable software solutions. You’ll be part of a cross-functional team that’s responsible for the full software development life cycle, from conception to deployment.

As a Full Stack Developer, you should be comfortable around both front-end and back-end coding languages, development frameworks and third-party libraries. You should also be a team player with a knack for visual design and utility.

If you’re also familiar with Agile methodologies, we’d like to meet you.

Responsibilities

Work with development teams and product managers to ideate software solutionsDesign client-side and server-side architectureBuild the front-end of applications through appealing visual designDevelop and manage well-functioning databases and applicationsWrite effective APIsTest software to ensure responsiveness and efficiencyTroubleshoot, debug and upgrade softwareCreate security and data protection settingsBuild features and applications with a mobile responsive designWrite technical documentation


Requirements

Proven experience as a Full Stack Developer or similar roleExperience developing desktop and mobile applicationsFamiliarity with common stacksKnowledge of multiple front-end languages and libraries (e.g. HTML/ CSS, JavaScript, XML, jQuery)Knowledge of multiple back-end languages (e.g. C#, Java, Python) and JavaScript frameworks (e.g. Angular, React, Node.js)Familiarity with databases (e.g. MySQL, Oracle), web servers (e.g. Apache) and UI/UX designExcellent communication and teamwork skillsGreat attention to detailOrganizational skillsAn analytical mindDegree in Computer Science, Statistics or relevant field


Career Level - IC4

About Us

As a world leader in cloud solutions, Oracle uses tomorrow’s technology to tackle today’s problems. True innovation starts with diverse perspectives and various abilities and backgrounds.

When everyone’s voice is heard, we’re inspired to go beyond what’s been done before. It’s why we’re committed to expanding our inclusive workforce that promotes diverse insights and perspectives.

We’ve partnered with industry-leaders in almost every sector—and continue to thrive after 40+ years of change by operating with integrity.

Oracle careers open the door to global opportunities where work-life balance flourishes. We offer a highly competitive suite of employee benefits designed on the principles of parity and consistency. We put our people first with flexible medical, life insurance and retirement options. We also encourage employees to give back to their communities through our volunteer programs.

We’re committed to including people with disabilities at all stages of the employment process. If you require accessibility assistance or accommodation for a disability at any point, let us know by calling +1 888 404 2494, option one.

Title: Information Technology Specialist
Description:
Position: Information Technology field Engineer (Freelancer )Location: Stuttgart, GermanyLanguage : German.
Job Description The Band 2 – Network Technician will provide day to day local\remote desktop support, receive inbound calls, answer questions, troubleshoot and document steps performed to resolve challenges with hardware, software, and application issues in a ticketing system. The candidate will also need to facilitate customer resolution for calls and engage their supervisors and managers to ensure operational consistency across all shifts within the IT Support Centre. Desktop Support Engineer provides Break Fix, fault diagnosis and resolution. Providing fault analysis to customer’s various core operating systems and platforms, as well be able to provide support and apply desktop fault resolution for the approved application suite. Ideal candidate should have 2-3 years’ experience in Windows Desktop support.  Position Responsibilities and Functions Provide first/second level contact and problem resolution for customer issues. Work with Third Party Vendors to remediate complex AV issues as needed. Provide timely communication on issue status and resolution. Maintain ticket updates for all reported incidents. Install, upgrade, support and troubleshoot XP, Windows 7, Windows 8.1, Windows 10 and Microsoft Office 2010, Cisco Jabber, another authorized desktop application. Should have basic knowledge of Mac operating system, to support Apple pc users. Install, upgrade, support and troubleshoot for printers, computer hardware. Performs general preventative maintenance tasks on computers, laptops, printers. Performs remedial repairs on Desktops, laptops, printers, and any other authorized peripheral equipment. Use diagnostic tools to troubleshoot problems associated with network connectivity, and workstation hardware/software. Broad experience of IT with basic understanding of Networks, Servers, Audio/Visual, Smart Devices and Telecoms. This position requires the ability to work in a project-based environment requiring flexibility and teamwork.Performs other duties as assigned. 
Candidate Required Minimum Qualifications and Skills  Bachelor’s degree or equivalent in Computer Science or related field. CompTIA A+, Microsoft Certified Professional (MCP) or better. Title: Threat Intelligence Analyst
Description:
Fox-ITWe are Fox-IT, or Fox. We stand for making the world safer and more secure. That means every one of us contributes in making society safer and more secure with the help of our technical and innovative solutions. From our Red Team of hackers, our Blue Team of defense specialists, highly skilled developers to trusted security consultants and more: We do this for organizations where cyber security is highly important. That is why we continuously develop our individual skills and knowledge.  
We are critical thinkers, naturally security paranoid and thrive on development. We are part of NCC Group and with 2000 like-minded colleagues around the globe, we are on our never-ending mission to create a safer world.  
We are on a mission to make society a safer and more secure place. Our people are the ones who make that possible; a global community of talented individuals working together towards a safer future.  
We aim to create an environment where everyone can reach their full potential. We work together, we are brilliantly creative, we embrace difference and we want you to join in our mission. 
The Opportunity:As a Cyber Threat Intelligence Analyst you will play a key role in our Tactical Threat Intelligence team.
Together with colleagues spanning almost all time zones, you will help to make our clients safer and more secure against cyber threats by helping them understand the motivations of relevant actors, identifying their targets and how they operate.
The Global Threat Intelligence Team has built a very strong reputation when it comes to collecting our own data and combining this with open and commercial sources. This role involves analysis of cyber threats, the development of actionable intelligence, and collaboration with various teams.
Your support to the wider organisation will be critical in the development of Fox-IT's Threat Intelligence capabilities and the broader service we offer.
Key Accountabilities:
Threat Intelligence Analysis: Identify, track, and document various Threat Actors. Document and report on their TTPs, IOCs and Infrastructure Monitor and analyse Command and Control (C2) infrastructures, Tactics, Techniques, and Procedures (TTPs), Indicators of Compromise (IOCs), and malicious domains. Map observed threat activity to known frameworks (e.g., MITRE ATT&CK) and produce structured intelligence using formats such as STIX/TAXII. Support: Provide Threat Intelligence research and contextual analysis to support Digital Forensics and Incident Response (DFIR) and Security Operations (SOC) teams. Combine technical investigations with geopolitical and regional context to deliver comprehensive, context-rich assessments. Respond to internal and external Requests for Information (RFI), offering timely, actionable intelligence. Collaboration and Information Sharing: Partner with internal teams, external partners, industry peers, and intelligence-sharing communities to enhance the organisation's threat landscape awareness. Engage in information-sharing forums and maintain current knowledge of emerging threats, vulnerabilities, and threat actor trends. Tool Management: Manage and optimise threat intelligence platforms, sources, and feeds to improve analysis efficiency Evaluate and recommend new tools or platforms to strengthen the Threat Intelligence function's capabilities. 
Technical Skills:Experience in Threat Intelligence analysis, ideally with experience in APT research, C2 tracking, and emerging geopolitical threats.  • Strong understanding of networking protocols (e.g., TCP/IP, DNS).  • Familiarity with the Cyber Threat Intelligence lifecycle and frameworks such as MITRE ATT&CK and the use of STIX/TAXII.  • Understanding of offensive security reconnaissance and attacker methodologies  • Experience assisting or interfacing with DFIR, IR, and SOC teams.  Qualifications (desired but not required):  • A bachelor's or master's degree or equivalent experience in Computer Science, Cybersecurity, or Information Security.  • Certifications such as SANS FOR578 (Cyber Threat Intelligence) or CREST Threat Intelligence Analyst (CRTIA).  • Exposure to geopolitical risk analysis and its impact on the threat landscape.
About your application:We review every application received and will get in touch if your skills and experience match what we’re looking for. If you don’t hear back from us within 10 days please don’t be too disappointed – we may keep your CV on our database for any future vacancies and we would encourage you to keep an eye on our career opportunities as there may be other suitable roles.
If you do not want us to retain your details, please email cv@nccgroup.com. All personal data is held in accordance with the NCC Group Privacy Policy. We are committed to diversity and flexibility in the workplace. If you require any reasonable adjustments to support you during the application process, please tell us at any stage
Company Description: Fox-IT prevents, solves and mitigates the most serious cyber threats with innovative solutions for government, defense, law enforcement, critical infrastructure, banking, and commercial enterprise clients worldwide. Our approach combines human intelligence and technology into innovative solutions that ensure a more secure society. We develop custom and packaged solutions that maintain the security of sensitive government systems, protect industrial control networks, defend online banking systems, and secure highly confidential data and networks.
Specialties: Intelligence,Cyber security,Forensic investigation,Threat monitoring,Managed services,Red teaming,Pentesting,Education,Fraud detection,Detection,Incident Response,Security Operations Center,Crypto technlogy

Title: Junior Threat Intelligence Analyst & Incident Responder
Description:
Unisciti a RAD e prosegui il tuo percorso professionale nel mondo della Cyber Threat Intelligence (CTI) e dell'Incident response (IR) all'interno del CSIRT.Avrai l'opportunità di crescere e sviluppare competenze tecniche e personali lavorando su progetti stimolanti e collaborando con esperti del settore.
Come Junior Threat Intelligence Analyst & Incident Responder, lavorerai su servizi e progetti di sicurezza che coprono argomenti come la prevenzione delle frodi, la protezione dei dati, l'intelligence sulle minacce, l'Investigazione, l’analisi e la risposta agli incidenti di sicurezza.
Quali saranno le tue principali attività?:• Raccogliere informazioni di cyber threat intelligence grezze e strutturate, determinandone la rilevanza ed i relativi stakeholder, sia tramite l'uso di strumenti avanzati, sia tramite la ricerca diretta sul deep&dark web.• Approfondire alert di intelligence contestualizzando e correlando informazioni tramite strumenti avanzati di CTI.• Produrre report di Cyber Threat Intelligence di tipo tattico, strategico ed operativo.• Investigare, analizzare e rispondere ad incidenti di sicurezza, sfruttando anche la CTI.• Effettuare Threat Hunting di tipo preventivo, proattivo e reattivo sfruttando informazioni di Cyber Threat intelligence.• Sviluppare tools con linguaggi di scripting per facilitare le analisi e l’automazione dei processi del CSIRT, oltreché per migliorare la raccolta, l’analisi e la correlazione delle informazioni.• Prendersi cura delle attività dei servizi imparando a dare priorità alle attività, interagire con i clienti e lavorare in Team.
Competenze Tecniche richieste:- Laurea triennale o magistrale in Ingegneria Informatica / Sicurezza Informatica / Informatica.- Da 1 a 3 anni di esperienza nella Sicurezza delle Informazioni o nell'Information Technology in generale; è preferibile un'esperienza di almeno un anno in un SOC/CSIRT.- Altamente motivato nell'esplorazione delle tecnologie e del panorama della sicurezza IT.- Conoscenza dei fondamentali della Cyber Threat Intelligence, preferibile esperienza nell’applicazione di frameworks di CTI quali: MITRE ATT&CK, Diamond model, Pyramid of pain, Analysis of Competing Hypotheses (ACH).- Conoscenza delle principali tecniche di Ethical Hacking.- Conoscenza di strumenti e tecniche per effettuare Data Analyst.- Capacità di interagire con il team e i clienti.- Conoscenza ed esperienza di base su sistema operativo Linux e Windows.- Conoscenza di base dei concetti di sicurezza delle informazioni.- Conoscenza di linguaggi di scripting come Python, Bash o PowerShell per l'automazione di analisi e raccolta dati.- Capacità di sintesi e reportistica per presentare resoconti delle proprie attività agli interlocutori.- Buon livello di inglese, scritto e parlato (B1/B2).- Esperienza nel trattamento delle informazioni secondo riservatezza. 
Offriamo:• Contratto di inserimento diretto, CCNL Commercio indeterminato o apprendistato se under 30.• Percorso formativo ad hoc per sviluppare le tue capacità e competenze.• Processo di revisione annuale per valutare la tua crescita e definire gli obiettivi di carriera.• Welcome kit e piano di Onboarding personalizzato.• Smartworking e flessibilità.
Potrebbe essere richiesta la disponibilità a reperibilità in caso di emergenze o incidenti di sicurezza fuori dall'orario lavorativo.
Le offerte di lavoro sono rivolte a entrambi i sessi. (L. 903/77).Si consiglia vivamente di allegare CV completo di autorizzazione al trattamento dei dati personali (D.Lgs. 196/03 e Regolamento UE 2016/679).

Company Description:
RAD nasce dalla volontà di realizzare un nuovo progetto d’impresa focalizzato sul crescente tema della sicurezza informatica con particolare caratterizzazione negli ambiti: Cyber Security Monitoring, Incident Response, Cyber Threat Intelligence, Cyber Threat Identification e Simulation, Digital Identity, Data Protection, Fraud detection, prevention e response.

La rapida evoluzione delle minacce nell’ambito cyber security impone un’agilità operativa diversa rispetto al tradizionale modo di fare impresa.

Diventa determinante l’approccio “Lean”, supportato da una consolidata e riconosciuta conoscenza del settore. Il DNA del personale RAD ed il modo di operare sui nostri clienti riflettono esattamente queste scelte. RAD, ha scelto di investire sulla competenza e specializzazione del proprio personale selezionando noti professionisti del settore da utilizzare come leader nelle aree di riferimento dell’azienda. Come risultato diretto della scelta operata si è da subito stabilita una visione comune, alimentata dalle competenze e specializzazioni dei singoli.

Mettendo a fattor comune la propria esperienza, il management RAD e i leader delle aree tematiche costituiscono un network di relazioni pregiate con il mercato, i vendor di riferimento ed attori chiave all’interno delle primarie aziende italiane.

RAD vuole supportare i propri clienti offrendo competenza ed eccellenza come fondamenta per la costituzione di un rapporto fiduciario con i propri clienti e partner basato sull’integrità e sulla condivisione delle priorità e degli obiettivi. Questo rapporto favorisce la ricerca del miglior compromesso tra tecnologia, processi e metodologia per ogni esigenza espressa dal cliente.

Title: Cyber Security Analyst
Description:
Introduction

You will join IBM Security Services which is a division of IBM Consulting, responsible for delivering security services to its large global customers, alongside major digital transformation projects in the application and cloud domains. You will join a team of 20 + Security Analysts who are looking after to monitor, detect and respond to cyber threats. This is an excellent opportunity to learn and apply cybersecurity fundamentals using leading edge tools. Learn more about what SOC, Security Operations Centre - https://www.ibm.com/topics/security-operations-center . We look for motivated junior professionals who are keen to learn and grow.

Your Role And Responsibilities

You will be:

 A part of day to day activities of the Security Operations Center (SOC) Improving the cybersecurity posture by identifying, verifying, and understanding cyber events. Collecting, analyzing, and correlating security events and using data to enable recommendation of mitigation of potential incidents Identifying events that pose a threat to the confidentiality, availability and integrity of information or systems Performing event and incident tracking using ticket management system Providing event and incident operational and executive reporting Supporting the 24x7x365 SOC by providing a view of security events and network activity.

Preferred Education

None

Required Technical And Professional Expertise

 Knowledge of operating systems (Linux, Windows) Knowledge of computer network basics Good English language proficiency Very good analytical and problem solving skills Openness to learn new technologies Good communication skills Team work attitude

Preferred Technical And Professional Experience

 Bachelor’s Degree in either of the disciplines: Computer Science, Automation, Electronics, Electrical, Telecommunications, Computer Engineering Knowledge of either of SIEM tools - Sentinel, Qradar or Splunk Experience in one of the domains: Identity and Access, Data Security, Network & Endpoint Security, Cloud Security, Security Operation Centre, etc. At least 1 year of professional working experience
Company Description:
At IBM, we do more than work. We create. We create as technologists, developers, and engineers. We create with our partners. We create with our competitors. If you're searching for ways to make the world work better through technology and infrastructure, software and consulting, then we want to work with you.

We're here to help every creator turn their "what if" into what is. Let's create something that will change everything.

Title: Soc Analyst I livello
Description:
Il Gruppo BV TECH è un gruppo innovativo, fondato nel 2005, interamente italiano ed uno dei principali attori del mercato italiano dell’Information & Communication Technology e della Sicurezza delle Informazioni.Il Gruppo comprende società di ingegneria, servizi informatici e sicurezza con più di 1000 dipendenti e ha sedi su tutto il territorio italiano (le principali a Milano, Roma, Genova e Grottaglie) e internazionale (Londra e Boston).Particolarmente focalizzato sui temi della Cybersecurity, il gruppo è partner fondatore di (IC)3, il consorzio creato dal Massachusetts Institute of Technology (ora Cybersecurity At MIT Sloan - CAMS) per diffondere e sviluppare la cultura della sicurezza informatica nel settore della protezione delle infrastrutture critiche.Il Gruppo BV TECH sviluppa tecnologie «nazionali» nel settore ICT in ambito sia civile sia militare (C4ISTAR), con l’ambizione di contribuire significativamente all’innovazione e alla crescita del Paese.Le principali aree di expertise del Gruppo BV TECH sono:• Sviluppo soluzioni• Ingegneria• Gestione Servizi• Prodotti e Tecnologie

BV Tech S.p.A ricerca per ampliamento del proprio organico:
SOC Analyst I Livello 
Titolo di studio: Diploma o laurea in materie scientifiche

Requisiti:
Conoscenza di tematiche di networking (Switch, Router, Firewall) e dei protocolli di rete (es: TCP, IP, HTTP, HTTPS, DNS, FTP)Conoscenza dei principali comandi di amministrazione di server Linux based e di shell scripting e/o di server MicrosoftPreferibile conoscenza del linguaggio PythonConoscenza della lingua inglesePreferibile esperienza nel monitoraggio di almeno una delle seguenti soluzioni:- SIEM e regole di correlazione eventi- Log Management- Antivirus e/o Endpoint Security- Mail Antispam- Firewalling e/o IDS/IPS- load balancing e/o Content filtering e/o web application firewall
Preferibile Certificazione Cisco CCNA, CompTIA Security+ o esperienza equivalente
E' inoltre richiesta disponibilità a lavorare nel Security Operation Center (SOC) di BV TECH, con attività su turni H24.
Completano il profilo:
Forte interesse e volontà ad apprendere conoscenze ed acquisire competenze in ambito cyber security.Forte spirito di iniziativa ed orientamento al risultato.
L'inserimento avverrà con contratto Indeterminato con RAL ed inquadramento commisurate all'esperienza maturata. Alla RAL si aggiunge Indennità di turnazione H24.Ulteriori benefit: buoni pasto, assicurazione sanitaria.

Title: Data Analyst - Product
Description:
At Shapr3D, we’re transforming how industries design and innovate. From automotive and aerospace to consumer tech and industrial design, our platform powers some of the boldest ideas across industries that shape 16% of the global GDP.

Our multi-platform product has earned the Apple Design Award and is regularly featured in Apple Keynotes. With Series B backing and a rapidly growing user base, we’re scaling fast - and this is your chance to be part of the journey.

Interested in finding out what Shapr3D and Budapest have to offer? Check out this page!

“Growth comes from challenges, and Shapr3D gives you plenty of both. This is a place for those who want to push themselves while contributing to a product that’s redefining the CAD industry. As a Data Analyst, you’ll drive critical product and marketing decisions, directly shaping how professionals work worldwide.” - Tibor Kolozsi, VP of Product

Within the organization

We are a small Data Team at Shapr3D, but we have a big impact. As our product becomes more complex and we make the transition from B2C to B2B, we are responsible for making sure that our data systems can handle the increased load and that people can get the information and insights they need quickly and easily.

We work with teams across the company as we believe that having a healthy data-informed mindset is essential to Shapr3D’s success. We are committed to building a world-class product and engineering organization, and we believe that our Data Team is essential to achieving this goal. We are here to keep the conversation honest, connect the dots and help our stakeholders evaluate the short and long-term impact of their decisions.

Read more about scaling-up engineering at Shapr3D (https://csi.pet/pFDkv) and listen to some thoughts from our Engineering VP on managing hyper-growth. (https://csi.pet/UeMYA)

What you'll do

Own core data sets end-to-end. Ensure data quality, define metrics, create and maintain ETL/ELT flows, and make data visible and accessible through data visualization and dashboards.Improve data literacy within the company. Help stakeholders understand and use data effectively by answering their questi stakeholders. Use your data analysis skills to answer specific questions and solve prons, providing training, and developing common data standards.Perform ad-hoc analyses, experiments and report your findings tooblems for the business. Communicate your findings to stakeholders in a clear and concise way.Develop a unified view of customer behavior through deeper analysis into how our features are being used

What you'll bring

Experience with creating and maintaining datasets, data visualization, and dashboards for business problemsStrong data analysis (e.g. cohort and funnel analyses), communication skills and a business mindsetSolid SQL foundations. Python knowledge and experimentation is a plusExperience in SaaS business and KPI settings, B2B experience is a plusA natural curiosity and a willingness to challenge yourself and try different solutionsWilling to grow into a thought partner: ready to ask hard questions and challenge your stakeholders across all seniority levels

A sneak peek into our stack...

We built our infrastructure on top of AWS and DatabricksWe use multiple external tools for data visualization and analytics including Tableau, Mitzu, Hubspot, and SalesforceMost of our code is written in Spark SQL and Python (sometimes PySpark)

What do we offer?

✨ Ownership & Impact – Be part of a startup shaping the future of design and manufacturing, with equity options.

🌍 Relocation Support – Full relocation package if you’re moving to Budapest, one of Europe’s fastest-growing tech hubs.

📚 Learning & Growth – Work alongside some of the industry’s best minds and continuously evolve your skills.

🏥 Comprehensive Benefits – Private healthcare, life insurance, gym membership, and more.

📍 Office-First Culture – We believe in in-person collaboration to build something extraordinary (Read more about our approach [https://csi.pet/EGxz8]).

You can read more details about our benefit package here (https://csi.pet/6YQsB)

About Shapr3D

We don’t just innovate - we create a new status quo in 3D design. With a multi-platform product redefining CAD, we’re on a mission to disrupt a 40-year-old industry and empower creators worldwide.

By joining us, you’ll contribute to a top-tier product that’s won the Apple Design Award and is regularly featured in Apple Keynotes. But what we’re most proud of is our growing global user base, designing the future every day.

If this excites you, let’s talk! And don’t worry if you don’t tick every single box - we hire for potential and mindset.

📩 Submit your CV in English and join the Shapr3D revolution.

Shapr3D is the leading multi-platform CAD software, delivering precision, flexibility, and efficiency across devices, including iPad, Mac, Windows, and Vision Pro. Built on Siemens Parasolid®, Shapr3D offers advanced modeling tools and seamless collaboration, streamlining the design process from concept to production.

With Shapr3D, you can:

- Accelerate early-stage design workflows, quickly exploring concepts and iterating on ideas.
- Create precise, manufacturing-ready models with History-Based Parametric Modeling.
- Conduct real-time design reviews and spatial collaboration using immersive Vision Pro workflows.
- Integrate with industry-standard CAD tools for smooth data exchange and compatibility.
- Collaborate efficiently through secure cloud workflows with instant synchronization across teams.
- Protect your designs with enterprise-grade security and compliance.

Shapr3D is tailored to address the challenges of traditional CAD systems. Its cross-platform capabilities streamline early-stage conceptual design and single-part modeling for manufacturing tooling and fixtures, eliminating bottlenecks and enabling faster time-to-market with improved team collaboration.

Adopted by industry leaders and professionals worldwide, Shapr3D is redefining CAD for product design, architecture, and engineering. From exploring initial concepts to creating precise, manufacturing-ready models, and conducting real-time design reviews with Vision Pro, Shapr3D delivers a reliable solution for today’s most demanding workflows.

Since its founding in 2015, Shapr3D has been at the forefront of CAD innovation, equipping professionals and enterprises to tackle modern design challenges with confidence.

Description:

Role DescriptionThis is a full-time on-site role for a Data & AI Consultant located in Nicosia, Cyprus. The Data & AI Consultant will be responsible for tasks related to pattern recognition, consulting, data science, natural language processing (NLP), and machine learning.
Qualifications
Bachelor’s and/or Master's degree in computer science, engineering, or any other relevant subject from a reputable University. Up-to 5 years of full-time working experience in Data and/or AI and/or Machine Learning or a similar role. Strong skills in Python and/or R, and SQL. Good understanding of the different data architecture patterns (e.g., Data Lake, Data Mesh, Data Warehouse, Data Lakehouse) Solid understanding of data modelling, ETL processes, and data integration techniques, including experience of implementing the above concepts. Experience with data visualization and BI tools such as PowerBI and/or Tableau. Ability to work with a wide variety of data types (i.e. structured and unstructured), extracting and integrating data from modern and legacy data platforms Excellent communication and collaboration skills, with the ability to work effectively in a cross-functional team environment. Clearly communicating findings, recommendations, and opportunities to improve data/AI systems and solutions. Strong mathematical and quantitative skills including calculus, linear algebra, and statistics. 

It will be a plus if you have 

A deep understanding of and ability to teach concepts, tools, features, functions, and benefits of different Data & AI approaches. Experience working with diverse teams to deliver complex solutions. Familiarity with Generative AI models and frameworks e.g. OpenAI family, open source LLMs, etc. Experience fine-tuning Generative AI models. You have experience with lean/agile software development.

Title: Cybersecurity Consulting Intern - Wavestone Luxembourg
Description:
Description de l'entreprise
Enterprise is at the heart of the major transformations that are changing the world; namely, increased market competition, the switch to digital technology and the accentuation of environmental emergency. The aim of our strategic plan, "Impact", is to position Wavestone as the one-stop shop for managing some of these major transformations across the industry. We believe in the power of multidisciplinary teaming and how this can bring together the best business technology and sustainable development experts to drive successful transformations.
Wavestone, an independent leading French consulting pure-player, and Q_PERIOR, a consulting leader in the Germany-Switzerland-Austria region, joined forces in 2023 to become the most trusted partner for critical transformations. Drawing on more than 5,500 employees across Europe, North America and Asia, the firm combines seamlessly first-class sector expertise with a 360° transformation portfolio of high-value consulting services.
We are committed to our corporate culture, "The Positive Way," which values Client Satisfaction, Employee Development, Responsibility and Ethics, and Team Spirit.
Wavestone is listed on Euronext Paris, has been awarded the Great Place To Work label in all its locations and is ranked in Forbes World's Best Management Consulting Firms 2023 List.For more information, visit www.wavestone.com
Our Luxembourg office is expanding, driven by high demand from our cybersecurity services. We are looking for interns with interest in the areas related to cybersecurity and emerging technologies to join us.
Description du poste
As an Intern you will:
Contribute to projects covering a broad range of cybersecurity and digital risk topics, and occasionally digital transformation and IT strategyWork on consulting assignments to develop and deliver security strategies and architectures (for IT/cloud), cyber maturity and data protection assessments, security policies and associated governance;Have the opportunity to develop your project management and consulting skills by playing a key role in the production of deliverables, preparing client presentations and actively participating in the success of our engagements.Work in highly collaborative and international teams.Contribute internal projects to contribute to the ongoing development of the Luxembourg office.
Qualifications
You are completing a master’s degree in IT management, engineering, computer science, economics, business studies or any related field;You have strong interest in the consulting world, emerging technologies, digital transformation, and cybersecurity;You can quickly grasp new topics and progressively gain autonomy in your assignments;You are client-orientated and committed to high-quality and timely delivery in order to consistently meet deadlines;You are a team player and appreciate a collaborative, diverse and international work environmentYou have good interpersonal skills, and a demonstrated ability to communicate and collaborate effectively with clients and peers; andYou are fluent in English. French and/or another language will be considered as an asset.
Informations supplémentaires
Terms & Length: The internship must be under university agreement should last at least 6 months so that you have time to project yourself within the office and to see you flourish. The exact length of the internship is open to discussionManagement: Your internship will be steered by a supervisor with whom you will have the opportunity to share your questions and expectations through frequent step pointsOpportunity: The internship is paid! Also, a good intern makes a good collaborator: more than 70% of our trainees receive a job offer at the end of their internship
Diversity and Inclusion: Wavestone is an inclusive employer committed to equal opportunities. We support and celebrate diversity and have dedicated teams to work on anti-racism, gender equality, disability awareness and LGBTQIA+ topics. Wavestone has a strong Corporate Social Responsibility agenda, a Women of Wavestone forum and a diversity and inclusion network called Wavestone For All. As part of this diversity and inclusion policy, Wavestone supports people with disabilities and/or those who require accommodation during the recruitment process and when they take up their position.
This job is based in Luxembourg.
If you need assistance or an adjustment to our recruitment process due to a disability or impairment, please reach out to us to discuss.

Title: Junior Consultant Information Security (m/w/d)
Description:
DEIN JOBIT- und Informationssicherheit sind deine Leidenschaft? Du willst mit DataGuard Unternehmen nachhaltig und innovativ voranbringen? Flexibilität ist dir wichtig – arbeiten, wo und wie es für dich passt? Und du möchtest die Beratung deiner Kunden mit smarter Technologie noch effektiver machen? Dann werde Teil unseres Tech Practice Teams!
LET’S PROTECT THE PEOPLE BEHIND THE DATAWir sind ein schnell wachsendes Technologie-Unternehmen mit einem klaren Ziel: Wir schützen die Menschen hinter den Daten. Mit über 250 Mitarbeitenden weltweit und Standorten in München, Berlin, London und Wien helfen wir mehr als 3.000 internationalen Kunden, Datenschutz, Informationssicherheit, Compliance effizient und gewinnbringend umzusetzen. Das Besondere daran? Wir kombinieren persönliche und qualitative Beratung mit unserer selbst entwickelten SaaS-Plattform zu einer innovativen Rundumlösung.
DU FÜR UNSDu berätst unsere Kunden mithilfe unserer Plattform bezüglich der Informationssicherheit in ihrem Unternehmen und erstellst Informationssicherheits-Managementsysteme (ISMS) „from scratch“, welche du nach erfolgreichem Aufbau weiterhin mit betreustDu führst unsere Kunden als vertrauensvolle/r Partner/in durch den Auditprozess für Zertifizierungen wie der ISO 27001Du unterstützt unser Sales und Customer Success Team beim Cross- und Up-Selling bestehender KundenDu entwickelst unsere InfoSec Lösung stetig weiter, indem du qualifiziertes Feedback an unser Produktteam weitergibst
WIR FÜR DICHDeine persönliche Weiterentwicklung steht bei uns im Mittelpunkt: Mit einem individuellen Trainingsbudget und halbjährlichen Feedback-Zyklen fördern wir deine Talente und bringen deine Karriere auf das nächste LevelWerde Teil eines internationalen, englischsprachigen Unternehmens, in dem dich erfahrene Experten fördern und gezielt dabei unterstützen, langfristig erfolgreich zu seinGenieße echte Autonomie und nutze die Freiheit, aktiv Einfluss zu nehmen, durch „Learning by Doing“ zu wachsen und deinen eigenen Weg zu gestalten – dabei gehört „Trial and Error“ selbstverständlich zum EntwicklungsprozessProfitiere von zahlreichen Benefits: einer EGYM Wellpass Mitgliedschaft für dein körperliches Wohlbefinden, monatlicher finanzieller Unterstützung für lokale Transportkosten, einem Zuschuss für Internetkosten sowie umfassender Unterstützung bei deiner RelocationDie DataGuard Flex Policy bietet die perfekte Balance zwischen persönlicher Zusammenarbeit, Homeoffice und Arbeiten von überall auf der WeltFreu dich auf regelmäßige Highlights wie coole Firmen-Events, das legendäre jährliche Offsite „Spikeweek“, unvergessliche Jahresabschlussfeiern, kreative Onsite-Sessions und entspannte Team-Lunches
DAS BRAUCHST DU FÜR EINER ERFOLGREICHE KARRIERE BEI DATAGUARDGrundlegende Kenntnisse in den Bereichen IT- und Information SecurityErste Erfahrungen im Umgang mit Kunden, idealerweise in einem dynamischen Growth UmfeldKlarer Kopf. Herz am rechten Fleck. Eigenständiges Arbeiten.Du verfügst über eine prozess- und kundenorientierte DenkweiseDu hast sehr gute Kommunikations- und Präsentationsskills in exzellentem Deutsch und EnglischPlus:IT-orientiertes Studium oder AusbildungErfahrungen im SaaS oder Legal Tech Umfeld
EIN PAAR LETZTE WORTE. EHRLICH UND VON HERZEN. Unabhängig von deiner Herkunft, Ethnie, Geschlechtsidentität, Religion oder deinen individuellen Voraussetzungen: Bei uns zählt das, was hinter dem Menschen steckt. Als Guards und Guardettes verbindet uns neben unserer Hingabe der Glaube an unser gemeinsames Ziel: Protect the people behind the data. Überzeuge uns mit deiner Persönlichkeit und deinen Skills – und wir werden gemeinsam Großes bewegen. Wir freuen uns auf dich!
Company Description:
DataGuard is a security and compliance software company trusted by more than 4,000 organizations across the globe. Our customers use the platform to build up scalable risk management while getting certified fast and complying effortlessly with industry regulations and frameworks such as ISO 27001, TISAX®, NIS2, SOC2, GDPR, and the EU Whistleblower Directive. 

Our purpose-built software suite offers AI-powered workflow automation and seamless integration capabilities, reducing the time and money organizations spend to build a digital Information Security Management System (ISMS) and Compliance Management System (CMS). 

DataGuard empowers organizations active in 50+ countries to better understand, identify, and manage the risks that matter most to them – and to build up a robust security and compliance posture that allows them to stay ahead of their evolving business and regulatory needs.

(TISAX® is a registered trademark of the ENX Association. DataGuard is not affiliated with the ENX Association. We provide Software-as-a-Service and support for the assessment on TISAX® only.)

Title: Data Engineer (f/m)
Description:
Job Description

The Data Engineering team is responsible for implementation of data engineering processes of the AVL Data Analytics Platform. You will be participating in development of ETL pipelines for batch processing of files, data quality check libraries and processing libraries for automotive files. You will be working on innovative and strategic projects in the automotive industry for various domains (fleet validation, HIL/SIL testing, ADAS, …) related to data engineering and applied data science in large scaled team with broad areas of expertise.

Title: IT specialist (Artificial Intelligence) (m/f/d)
Description:
**The University of Veterinary Medicine Hannover (TiHo) combines modern science with university tradition.**

As a world-renowned university of veterinary medicine, the TiHo offers a diverse and forwardlooking range of tasks in the field of teaching, research and services. More than 1,000 employees work in the institutes, clinics and administration of the TiHo. The TiHo as an employer

We are a cosmopolitan university. In veterinary medicine we occupy a top position worldwide. The satisfaction of our employees is a cause close to our heart. We offer an exciting and varied working environment. 

IT specialist (Artificial Intelligence) (m/f/d)

EG 10 TV-L; full-time (39,8h); permanent employment

at the Institute of Animal Genomics. Starting date: earliest possible date

Area of responsibility

The Institute of Animal Genomics is looking for a qualified person to strengthen the work group „Veterinary Functional Genomics“, which aims at linking innovative and future-oriented basic research with translational applied research in Animal Breeding and Genomics. The work group is interested in the genetic architecture of the genome in livestock and pets, and its role in the development of phenotypic traits. Sequencing data are produced, investigated by different methods including DNA language models and new software solutions are being developed.

Key tasks and focus areas:

Support in the development and implementation of AI solutions, particularly DNA language modelsFurther development and maintenance of AI modelsContribution to the advancement of the AI strategy, as well as data management and process organizationSupport for the scientific team in the analysis of sequencing datasets (Next Generation Sequencing)Promotion of knowledge transfer and capacity building in AI developments and technologiesCollaboration with interdisciplinary teams from molecular genetics, veterinary medicine, and data analytics

Recruitment requirements

A completed degree in Computer Science, Bioinformatics, Data Science, or a related field is requiredProficiency B2 in English

Required Professional Knowledge And Personal Skills

Strong programming skills in Python, R, or a comparable programming languageExperience with AI methods (e.g., machine learning, deep learning) and their application to biological data (e.g., DNA language models)High level of initiative and self-organization to work independently within self-organized teamsStrong analytical and conceptual thinking skills, combined with the ability to develop innovative solutionsExcellent teamwork skills and a willingness to work in interdisciplinary teams and foster collaborationFlexibility and a willingness to learn in order to quickly adapt to new technologies and research fieldsExperience in an academic environment is an advantage but not a mandatory requirement

What we offer

Special annual bonusFlexible working hours30 days holidayAdditional retirement arrangement: Pension Institution of the Federal Republic and the Federal States (the company pension of the public service)Staff canteen with discount meal offersParticipation in university sports at a discountTargeted further education and training opportunitiesFamily friendlinessAppreciative working atmosphere with contemporary management culture

The employment relationship is subject to the public sector collective agreement on the federal states (TV-L). Severely disabled applicants will be given priority in the case of equal suitability. The University of Veterinary Medicine Hannover particularly wants to promote the professional equality of men and women. Therefore, it strives to increase the underrepresented gender in the respective area.

Contact

For information, please contact our secretary´s office on telephone number +49 511 953-8876. Applications with the usual documents can be submitted via our online portal by 01.04.2025 at the latest.

The application documents will be destroyed after completion of the personnel selection process.

Title: Junior of Medior IT-risk consultant
Description:
Probability & Partners is op zoek naar een junior of medior IT-risk management consultant. Als IT-risk consultant werk je voor onze klanten bij bij banken, pensioenfondsen, verzekeraars en vermogensbeheerders. Je bent soms voor langere en soms voor kortere periodes van enkele maanden verbonden aan één of meerdere klanten. Opdrachten kunnen bestaan uit het inrichten van een control framework voor IT-risk, het uitwerken van beleid voor bijvoorbeeld autorisatiemanagement, het inrichten van dashboards voor informatiebeveiliging, het uitvoeren van risicoanalyses, het adviseren over IT-beheersmaatregelen in het algemeen, klanten helpen om ISO 27001 gecertificeerd te raken, het beoordelen van de informatiebeveiliging bij uitbestedingspartners en alle andere zaken die nodig zijn om de digitale weerbaarheid van onze klanten te vergroten. Je werkt bij onze klanten samen met een senior van Probability & Partners of in een team bestaande uit meerdere collega’s.
Competenties· Analytisch en kritisch· Vermogen om problemen efficiënt op te lossen· Kennis van regelgeving (DORA) en normen voor informatiebeveiliging zoals ISO 27001· Inzicht in technische dreigingen· Resultaat gedreven
ErvaringWerkervaring in IT of in IT-risk en informatiebeveiliging is nuttig maar niet per se vereist. Je wordt namelijk ondersteund om je (verder) te ontwikkelen op dit gebied met opleidingen, coaching en begeleiding tijdens je werk.
0-2 jaar voor Junior3-5 jaar voor Medior
OpleidingHbo- of wo-opleiding in IT of informatiebeveiliging of een andere opleiding en persoonlijke affiniteit met IT-risk en informatiebeveiliging. Een certificaat of de bereidheid dit te behalen als CISM/CISA/CRISC/CISSP of andere certificatie op het gebied van informatiebeveiliging is aanbevolen.
KennisKennis van informatiebeveiliging, IT-risk, of kennis van risicomanagement in zijn algemeenheid of specifieker voor IT-risk is een pre maar als je die niet of beperkt hebt, krijg je de kans om je daarin te ontwikkelen. PreHet hebben of willen behalen van certificaten op het gebied van informatiebeveiliging als CISM/CISA/CRISC/CISSP.
OntwikkelingsmogelijkhedenDoorgroeien tot een allround cybersecurity professional met uiteenlopende opdrachten in verschillende bedrijfstakken binnen de financiële sector van junior tot senior.Meer dan genoeg mogelijkheden om internationale certificaten te behalen.Mogelijkheid om eigen projecten bij klanten te leiden.
CultuurIntrinsiek gemotiveerde en behulpzame collega’s.Gericht op het leveren van kwaliteit.Gezonde werk-privébalans, geen buitensporige werkweken.Flexibele contractvormen om andere interesses na te streven.Tweemaandelijkse informele activiteiten.
VergoedingJaarlijkse beoordeling van prestaties en salaris.Boven marktconform startsalaris, afgestemd op individueel niveau.Mogelijkheid om extra uren te compenseren met vrije tijd.Eindejaarsbonus, vakantiegeld en reiskostenvergoeding.Opleidingsmogelijkheden.
Kantoor: De Entree 232, 1101 EE (Amsterdam)Aantal uren per week: 36-40 uurContact: info@probability.nl

Title: IT Engineer
Description:
At Macrobond, we are dedicated to transforming the way people work with economic and financial data, one click at a time. We understand that time is the scarcest asset, which is why we strive to convert every second into value.
Our mission is to revolutionize the way financial and economic intelligence is analyzed, visualized, and shared, turning hours of work into minutes. From our single SaaS platform, we provide access to a wealth of macroeconomic and financial data, along with analytics tools to chart insights, and collaboration features that enable instant sharing or publishing of content. We are not just about offering a smarter, faster way to work with data; it's about enabling a smarter, faster way to work together.
Founded in Malmö, Sweden, in 2008, we aimed to simplify and enhance the workflow of financial professionals. Today, Macrobond serves over 900 customers globally, including major banks, asset managers, government institutions, and research houses, highlighting our impact and the trust we've earned within the financial industry.
We are looking for a skilled and proactive IT Engineer to join our team. In this role, you will have the opportunity to work in international environment with a range of cutting-edge technologies to ensure the smooth operation of our hardware and software infrastructure. We are looking for someone who thrives under pressure, possesses strong research skills, and has excellent team cooperation and interpersonal skills. A readiness to work in an agile environment and adapt quickly to changing demands will also be key to your success in this role. If you are passionate about solving technical challenges and have experience with tools like Microsoft 365, Azure, Powershell and more this is the role for you!
Your main tasks will include:Responding to support ticketsDiagnosing issues with computer software, peripherals, and hardware.Setting up computers for new employeesDeploying software, preparing software packagesWorking on internal policies (security, asset management, MS 365, antivirus, etc.)Creating and managing global domain policiesConfiguring network devicesCreating scripts (mostly PowerShell)Enforce the IT security policy, creating training and phishing campaigns for end usersAdministering hardware and software procurement
Expectations :Minimum of 2 years of experience in similar positionTechnical education background or equivalent experienceEnglish (minimum B2/C1)Advanced level knowledge of the Microsoft Windows/Microsoft 365 environmentIT security and data privacy principlesKnowledge of computer networks (CCNA level preferably)Experience with computer hardware maintenance
What we offer:Stable position in a growing business with a "people first" atmospherePrivate health care and sport benefitsCafeteria platformLanguage learning platformInternal, external or online (e.g. Udemy) training possibilitiesHybrid work modelA modern office in the city center with an amazing chillout space.
If you think you could be a good match for us and you're interested in what Macrobond has to offer, click the button to fill in a short questionnaire and submit your CV in English. Good luck!
In your application, please include the following statement: I hereby agree to the processing of my personal data by Macrobond Financial for the purposes of current recruitment process, in accordance with the currently applicable GDPR regulations.
Company Description: Macrobond revolutionizes investment research workflows, empowering institutions to transform complex data and analytics into actionable insights with unparalleled efficiency.

On behalf of our client, a growing and dynamic company in the SMB market, we are seeking a highly motivated and skilled Security & Compliance Specialist. This company, with a turnover around SEK 300 million and 60 dedicated employees, is expanding its focus on the SMB segment in Stockholm and needs a talented professional to join their team.

They value their employees highly, with 70% of the workforce being shareholders, and they prioritize employee happiness and well-being. Their culture is vibrant, supportive, and flexible, providing a great work-life balance.
Position Overview:The Security & Compliance Specialist will play a critical role in developing and implementing frameworks that ensure ISO compliance and meet GDPR requirements. This role requires a proactive and analytical individual with a deep understanding of legislation, compliance, and security, who can work independently and take responsibility for their tasks.

Key Responsibilities:Develop and implement security and compliance frameworks for multiple customers.Ensure ISO 27001, 14001, and 9001 compliance.Align practices with NIST standards.Maintain a strong focus on GDPR.Collaborate with customers to understand their needs and provide tailored solutions.Automate repetitive tasks to enhance efficiency.Contribute to internal security and compliance processes (1/3rd focus).Engage with customers to close deals and build lasting relationships.

Qualifications:Strong understanding of Information Security frameworks such as ISO & NIS 2.Solid grasp of GDPR and its implications for SMBs.Fluency in Swedish is a must.Located in Stockholm.

What our client offers:Competitive salary and benefits package.A flexible work environment (50% in office, 50% remote).A culture that prioritizes employee happiness and well-being.Employee ownership: 70% of the employees are shareholders.Exciting company-wide events, such as an annual ski resort holiday.An opportunity to be part of a growing company with a strong SMB focus.A supportive and dynamic team with six tech hubs, including a merged Security & Compliance and Training hub.

Title: IT Support Analyst
Description:
IT Support analyst
Als IT support analyst ben je verantwoordelijk voor onsite IT-ondersteuning, ondersteuning van de productie en gebruikers, de netwerk infrastructuur, serverbeheer en IT-apparatuur ondersteuning voor twee locaties.Je maakt deel uit van ons On-Site IT support team, verantwoordelijk voor de ondersteuning van de fabrieken in Europa. Het team is gevestigd in Nederland, Polen, Slowakije en Zweden – in totaal 12 mensen.
Wat je gaat doen?Installeren, uitvoeren van doorlopend onderhoud en beheren van IT-apparatuur (laptops, telefoons, printers, terminals);Beheren van lokale servers en netwerk infrastructuur in samenwerking met wereldwijde teams;Verwerken en monitoren van gebruikersverzoeken;Gebruikers trainen en opleiden in IT-tools en software;Actief deelnemen aan de verbetering van IT-diensten;Ondersteunen van het gebruik van lokale applicaties in overeenstemming met wereldwijde standaarden;Deelnemen aan interne en externe audits;Assisteren van wereldwijde IT-teams bij het plannen en uitvoeren van updates en onderhoudswerkzaamheden.
Er wordt 24/7 support On-Call Benelux gegeven (ondersteuning van remote locaties). De werktijden zijn van 08:00-16:00uur. Je werkt 1x in de 4 of 6 weken in een shift.
Wie ben je?Minimaal 2 jaar ervaring in een vergelijkbare rol;Kennis van IT-apparatuur (computers, servers, netwerkapparatuur, fabrieks IT-apparaten zoals scanners, zebra, labelprinters etc.);Bekend met Microsoft Office 365 software;Kennis van Microsoft Windows server systemen installatie en basisconfiguratie;Beheersing van de Nederlandse en Engelse taal;Begrip van netwerk operationele principes;Kennis van ITIL, certificering en Active Directory is een pluspunt;Vermogen om te werken in een gedistribueerde structuur;Flexibiliteit en het vermogen om taken te prioriteren in een complexe, dynamische werkomgeving';Sterke communicatie- en analytische vaardigheden;Ervaring in het bedienen van interne klanten op IT-gebied.
Wat bieden wij jou?Een bepaalde tijd contract van 7 maanden via Akkodis waarna overname bij opdrachtgever of een direct contract bij opdrachtgever;Werken in een ervaren team met veel kennis, drive en passie;Marktconform salaris (op jaarbasis tussen € 44000 - € 66000);Goede secundaire arbeidsvoorwaarden zoals 13e maand, 25 vakantiedagen + 11,5 ADV-dagen, bonus en een gunstige pensioenregeling.
Wil je meer weten?Neem contact op met Mitchell van Nuil viamitchell.van.nuil@akkodisgroup.com of bel naar : 06 - 14 93 74 87

CODESYS GroupPersonalabteilung+49-831-540 31-0
Company Description:
The CODESYS Group is manufacturer of CODESYS, the hardware-independent IEC 61131-3 automation software, and ranks among the world’s leading software manufacturers in the automation industry. Today more than 170 employees work at the company headquarters in Kempten, Germany and at the subsidiaries in China, Italy and the United States. The customers of the company founded in 1994 by Dieter Hess and Manfred Werner come from all areas of automation: manufacturers of industrial controllers as well as their users who automate machines and plants with CODESYS.
CODESYS covers the complete software side of automation. Core products of the market-leading automation suite are the CODESYS Development System, the corresponding platform-independent control system CODESYS Control and the CODESYS Automation Server, the cloud-based Industry 4.0 platform. The engineering of edge, fog or cloud controllers and the exchange of data in IIoT networks is standard functionality in CODESYS. Modern engineering functions, including real OOP, debugging and integrated compilers, enable convenient processing of all tasks - including cloud connection and other IIoT functions. With the integrated CODESYS Visualization, users create and animate professional interfaces for testing, commissioning, and operation. Integrated fieldbus configurators and protocols support the most important fieldbus systems and real-time Ethernet. With comprehensive motion, CNC, and robotic functions, users can plan movements and execute them on the controller. CODESYS Safety SIL2 and SIL3 are integrated safety products certified by TÜV according to IEC 61508. In the CODESYS Store, users will find useful additional tools for all aspects of CODESYS.
1,000 different device types from over 400 manufacturers, tens of thousands of CODESYS users worldwide and several million CODESYS-compatible devices prove: CODESYS is the leading, manufacturer-independent IEC 61131-3 automation suite.

Imprint: https://www.codesys.com/legal-no
Specialties: Industrielle Automatisierung

Title: Software Developer
Description:
Job Description

We are looking for a skilled and motivated Software Developer to join our team in building innovative solutions that support the automation of network application deployments. This role offers a dynamic and collaborative environment, providing the opportunity to work with cutting-edge technologies such as Kubernetes, Go, and CI/CD pipelines to deliver high-quality, scalable software solutions.

How You Will Contribute And What You Will Learn

 Write clean, maintainable, and efficient code in languages such as Go and Python. Participate in the full software development lifecycle, including design, implementation, testing, and deployment. Lead and perform development activities. Engage in code reviews and provide constructive feedback to improve code quality and team practices. Actively participate in a scrum team and contribute to agile processes. Present developed features and code changes during sprint reviews. Support your colleagues in completing their tasks.

Key Skills And Experience

 BSc or MSc in engineering, telecommunications, computer science or an equivalent education with 3 - 5 years of experience in software development. Proficiency in one or more programming languages: Go, Python, or Java. Understanding of software design patterns and best coding practices. Ability to write unit and integration test, familiar with automated testing frameworks and methodologies. Strong understanding and hands-on experience with Docker and Kubernetes. Knowledge of data storage solutions and patterns - SQL/NoSQL databases. Experience with Agile methodologies, particularly Scrum or Kanban. Familiarity with version control systems, specifically Git. Experience with CI/CD tools such as Jenkins or GitLab CI for continuous integration and delivery. Strong knowledge of Linux environments and command-line interfaces. Familiarity with basic networking concepts, API design and RESTful services.

Preferred Qualifications:

 Experience with public cloud platforms (e.g., AWS, Google Cloud, Azure) for application deployment and management. Proficiency in using Helm and familiarity with Kubernetes best practices for scaling, networking, and resource management. Strong communication skills and the ability to work collaboratively in a team setting. A proactive attitude toward learning new technologies and methodologies.

What You Will Learn:

 Advanced software development practices and methodologies in a collaborative environment. In-depth experience with Kubernetes. Continuous professional development in programming languages and software engineering best practices.

About Us

 Come create the technology that helps the world act together

Nokia is committed to innovation and technology leadership across mobile, fixed and cloud networks. Your career here will have a positive impact on people’s lives and will help us build the capabilities needed for a more productive, sustainable, and inclusive world.

We challenge ourselves to create an inclusive way of working where we are open to new ideas, empowered to take risks and fearless to bring our authentic selves to work

What we offer

Nokia offers continuous learning opportunities, well-being programs to support you mentally and physically, opportunities to join and get supported by employee resource groups, mentoring programs and highly diverse teams with an inclusive culture where people thrive and are empowered.

Nokia is committed to inclusion and is an equal opportunity employer

Nokia has received the following recognitions for its commitment to inclusion & equality:

 One of the World’s Most Ethical Companies by Ethisphere  Gender-Equality Index by Bloomberg  Workplace Pride Global Benchmark 

At Nokia, we act inclusively and respect the uniqueness of people. Nokia’s employment decisions are made regardless of race, color, national or ethnic origin, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, marital status, disability, protected veteran status or other characteristics protected by law.

We are committed to a culture of inclusion built upon our core value of respect.

Join us and be part of a company where you will feel included and empowered to succeed.
Company Description:
At Nokia, we create technology that helps the world act together. 

As a B2B technology innovation leader, we are pioneering the future where networks meet cloud to realize the full potential of digital in every industry.

Through networks that sense, think and act, we work with our customers and partners to create the digital services and applications of the future. 


For our latest updates, please visit us online www.nokia.com

Title: IT Support Engineer
Description:
Ravago is an international recycler and distributor of plastics, building materials and chemicals. Over the last 60 years, the family business has grown from a local Belgian team to the international company we are today with more than 8100 employees around the globe. Like the branches of the tree protruding from the frame of the logo, Ravago has grown beyond its original sphere of influence. But it is the roots, our employees, who ensure that the tree remains alive and continues to grow.
To strengthen our IT team, we are looking for an IT Support Engineer to join our production site in Schkopau near Merseburg (Germany) as soon as possible.With technical expertise, a service-oriented approach and team spirit, you will help manage our IT infrastructure efficiently and assist end-users with IT questions quickly and competently, as well as keep our Configuration Management Data Base up to date.
Your Responsibilities:You are the first point of contact for IT support (via phone, email, and on-site) and handle incidents, service requests, and change requests.You process tickets via our IT Service Management ticketing tool.You take responsibility for the installation, configuration, and maintenance of hardware and software.You ensure the stability and availability of the IT infrastructure and ensure compliance with agreed service levels.You inform, train, and support end-users by creating and updating FAQ documentation.You stay up-to-date in your field to provide professional and current services.
Your Profile:Successfully completed bachelor's or master's degree in IT (e.g. Computer Science, Business Informatics) or a comparable qualification through several years of professional experience (at least 5 years)Very good knowledge of Microsoft platform tools (Microsoft 365/ Azure Active Directory); knowledge of other systems and programs is an advantageGood analytical skills and a structured way of workingA deep understanding of how IT processes affect businessVery good written and spoken German and English skillsHigh service orientation and motivation to support users with IT problemsStrong communication skills and enjoy working in a team
We Offer:An exciting and varied job with flexible working hours in an international environmentFlat hierarchies and short decision-making processesComprehensive induction, including at our company headquarters in Arendonk/Belgium, and regular training opportunitiesAn attractive salary with additional benefitsModern equipped workplace and flexible working hours with the possibility to work from home on certain daysA motivated and collegial international team in which you can grow

Title: Data Solution Architect
Description:
Data Solution Architect 
As a preferred supplier to one of our biggest Financial Clients, I am seeking for Data Solution Architect for a position in Amsterdam, Netherlands. As a Data Solution Architect you play a crucial role in moving our business forward. You will have responsibility for design and governance of IT solutions with a focus on data (Data Platform, Data Analytics & Reporting, Market & Reference Data). You will focus on the optimal use of our IT landscape and steer our change in the direction of our defined future state architecture.
It is your job to oversee our application & data landscape. But also to inspire, involve and activate the development teams with each and every change. You investigate, tune and verify standards and strategic views with internal and external global stakeholders (e.g. product owners, business managers, IT managers, external authorities). You support decision making by creating, providing and communicating clear deliverables.
Requirement: 
You have a unique combination of development experience with a passion for technology, and have a strong interest to work in the global capital markets. Your technology is up-to-date, so CI/CD, Cloud and Micro-services are nothing new to you. At the same time, you realise that our systems need to be up and running, the markets, our customers and our users depend on us. You have a minimum of 4 years of work experience in the data and application domain, within a comparably complex environment (in- & external stakeholders, complex IT environment, different time zones and different cultures). You have experience with IT architecture and can think on conceptual level. You have strategic and analytical skills and the ability to understand, inspire and activate others.
Experience: Experience in data modeling, data integration and data architecture.Experience with data science, analytics, business intelligence and similar technologies.Experience with Cloud Data Platform Architecture for reporting & analytics (AWS is a plus)Knowledge of Reference and Master Data Management.Knowledge of data management principles and practices.Knowledge of the different aspects of Data and IT architecture (applications functions, software development; application platforms, data structures and interaction patterns, data storage & retention strategies, data security aspects).Knowledge and experience in architecture implementations and related methods and tools, such as TOGAF and Archimate.Knowledge of solutions and tools in the (big) data domain is considered a plus.
Contract: 6+ monthsRates: ExcellentLocation: AmsterdamInterview: 2 stages, 1 technical + 1 assessment

Title: Cyber Security Analyst
Description:
Introduction

A career in IBM Consulting is rooted by long-term relationships and close collaboration with clients across the globe. You'll work with visionaries across multiple industries to improve the hybrid cloud and AI journey for the most innovative and valuable companies in the world. Your ability to accelerate impact and make meaningful change for your clients is enabled by our strategic partner ecosystem and our robust technology platforms across the IBM portfolio; including Software and Red Hat. Curiosity and a constant quest for knowledge serve as the foundation to success in IBM Consulting. In your role, you'll be encouraged to challenge the norm, investigate ideas outside of your role, and come up with creative solutions resulting in ground breaking impact for a wide network of clients. Our culture of evolution and empathy centers on long-term career growth and development opportunities in an environment that embraces your unique skills and experience.

Your Role And Responsibilities

You will join IBM Security Services which is a division of IBM Consulting, responsible for delivering security services to its large global customers, alongside major digital transformation projects in the application and cloud domains. You will join a team of 20 + Security Analysts who are looking after to monitor, detect and respond to cyber threats. This is an excellent opportunity to learn and apply cybersecurity fundamentals using leading edge tools. Learn more about what SOC, Security Operations Centre - https://www.ibm.com/topics/security-operations-center . We look for motivated junior professionals who are keen to learn and grow.

You Will Be

 A part of day to day activities of the Security Operations Center (SOC) Improving the cybersecurity posture by identifying, verifying, and understanding cyber events. Collecting, analyzing, and correlating security events and using data to enable recommendation of mitigation of potential incidents Identifying events that pose a threat to the confidentiality, availability and integrity of information or systems Performing event and incident tracking using ticket management system Providing event and incident operational and executive reporting Supporting the 24x7x365 SOC by providing a view of security events and network activity.

Preferred Education

Bachelor's Degree

Required Technical And Professional Expertise

 Knowledge of operating systems (Linux, Windows) Knowledge of computer network basics Good English language proficiency Very good analytical and problem solving skills Openness to learn new technologies Good communication skills Team work attitude

Preferred Technical And Professional Experience

 Bachelor’s Degree in either of the disciplines: Computer Science, Automation, Electronics, Electrical, Telecommunications, Computer Engineering Knowledge of either of SIEM tools - Sentinel, Qradar or Splunk Experience in one of the domains: Identity and Access, Data Security, Network & Endpoint Security, Cloud Security, Security Operation Centre, etc. At least 1 year of professional working experience
Skill: 6 of 10 skills match your profile - you may be a good fit

At IBM, we do more than work. We create. We create as technologists, developers, and engineers. We create with our partners. We create with our competitors. If you're searching for ways to make the world work better through technology and infrastructure, software and consulting, then we want to work with you.

We're here to help every creator turn their "what if" into what is. Let's create something that will change everything.

Title: Data Engineer H/F
Description:
📢 Nous recherchons un(e) Data Engineer, basé(e) à Lyon
👉Quelques mots sur les activités numériques de Thales Lyon :Les activités numériques représentent une entité rattachée au groupe Thales, spécialisée dans l’IT et présente au national.L’agence de Lyon adresse divers sujets d’expertise : ingénierie logiciels, cybersécurité, infogérance des infrastructures et transformation digitale.
🎯 Votre rôle et missionsEn nous rejoignant, vous intégrerez le centre de compétences Augmented data, spécialisé dans la conception, le développement et l’évolution d’applications data centrées. Vous y boosterez votre carrière en travaillant sur des technologies telles que Spark, Elasticsearch, Kube ... le plus souvent dans un environnement Agile.
Dans le cadre des projets que nous opérons aujourd’hui :- Vous contribuerez à la conception, au maintien, à la scalabilité des plateformes d’analyse de données au travers de votre expertise sur les sujets data (base de données, gestion de flux, ETL …)- Vous contribuerez à la conception et à la mise en production des pipelines d’analyses et de transformations de données en veillant à leur bonne adaptation aux besoins métiers et aux contraintes techniques du client- Vous pourrez intervenir sur des sujets de visualisations, dans le but de notamment accompagnées nos clients sur la conception de Dashboard métier intelligent …- Vous serez également amenées à échanger directement avec des DevOps/Datascientist pour la mise en place, l’intégration des pipelines et l’élaboration des algorithmes de traitements de données.- A l’échelle du département, Vous serez un acteur majeur du développement de notre activité et du lancement de nouveaux projets de valorisation de données.
🙋‍♀️ 🙋‍♂️ Votre profilDe formation Bac +5 en informatique (école d’ingénieur, Master ou équivalent), vous justifiez d’une première expérience réussie sur un projet data ? Vous souhaitez participer à la conception et intervenir sur des solutions de récupération et d’exploitation de données métiers dans des contextes critiques et hautement sécurisés ?Autonome, dynamique, organisé(e) et proactif(ve), vous souhaitez évoluer au sein d’équipes passionnées par l’exploration et l’intégration des technologies nouvelles au service des métiers de nos clients ?Vous avez des compétences qui couvrent les domaines suivants :Mise en place et gestion de base de données (SQL, Elasticsearch, Clickhouse ...)Langages de programmations (Java, Python)Gestion de flux (Kafka, flink, logstash …)Environnements big Data (Spark/hadoop )Principes et outils de type ETLVous êtes de plus intéressé(e):Par les environnements containerisés (docker, kubernetes, helm ...)Les concepts DevOps (Ansible, CI/CD...)Les sujets de Datavisualisation (Vega, Kibana, python librairies...)Vous aimez travailler en équipe ? Vous êtes reconnu(e) pour vos qualités relationnelles et vos capacités de vulgarisation ?Alors notre poste d’Ingénieur(e) Data(H/F) est fait pour vous !
🙌 Votre carrière chez ThalesDifférentes opportunités vous permettront de découvrir d'autres domaines ou sites. Vous pourrez évoluer et développer vos compétences dans différents domaines.Explorez un espace attentif au développement personnel.Développez vos talents dans un autre domaine du groupe Thales, en découvrant de nouveaux produits, de nouveaux clients, un nouveau pays ou en vous orientant vers une solution plus complexe.Choisissez entre une expertise technique ou un parcours de leadership.
Vous travaillerez dans une entreprise résolument humaine avec des valeurs fortes comme la sécurité au travail, l’égalité Homme/Femme et l’équilibre vie personnelle/professionnelle (Accord Télétravail).
Intégrez une Société qui valorise la diversité et l’inclusion, où chacun(e) est reconnu(e) pour sa singularité.Entreprise handi-accueillante, nos postes sont ouverts aux personnes en situation de handicap.
Rattaché(e) à la Convention métallurgie, vous bénéficierez aussi de ses multiples avantages (…)
Vous souhaitez en savoir plus ?N’hésitez pas à contacter notre équipe de recrutement ou nos équipes directement.

Thales (Euronext Paris: HO) is a global leader in advanced technologies specialized in three business domains: Defence & Security, Aeronautics & Space, and Cybersecurity & Digital identity. It develops products and solutions that help make the world safer, greener and more inclusive.
