Title: IT Analyst (d/f/m)
Description:
What makes Cognizant a unique place to work? The combination of rapid growth and an international and innovative environment! This is creating a lot of opportunities for people like YOU - people with an ambitious spirit who want to make a difference in this world.

Cognizant's delivery model infused with a distinct culture of high customer happiness. We consistently deliver positive relationships, cost reductions, and business results. Be one of our change-makers and join the success story: we are looking for a

IT Analyst (d/f/m) 

Location: Düsseldorf, Germany (on-site)

The Opportunity

We re seeking an IT Analyst (d/f/m) with many years of experience in IT Service Management Incident Management and End User Tools like Nexthink. The candidate will be responsible for overseeing desktop support in a remote work model from the office. This role requires a proactive approach to managing IT services and ensuring seamless operations.

Your Key Result Areas

 General IT service and user support: Provide support at all levels, both face-to-face and through various communication channels. Logging support requests and incidents: Document and track reported issues. Monitoring and completion of issues and requests: Oversee the resolution of problems received by the IT Service Desk, escalating when necessary. Troubleshoot problems: Use diagnostic tools and escalate issues as needed. Liaise with regional offices and third-party suppliers: Collaborate to resolve user support issues.

Your Qualifications

 Minimum of 5 years’ experience in IT support in a corporate environment. Excellent written and verbal communication skills in German and English. Troubleshooting in a corporate computing environment. Investigation and diagnostic skills. Experience with Microsoft Windows 10 & 11. Proficiency in the Microsoft Office 365 suite of applications and Teams. Familiarity with iPhone/iPad technology and mobile apps. General user administration tasks. Data/voice cabling and patching skills. Experience with Intune, Autopilot and MS Teams Ability to manage expectations by sitting down with stakeholders

Desirable Qualifications

 Experience working with Legal tools in the legal sector. Familiarity with the iManage Document Management System. Experience with Service Now ticket logging. Microsoft Certified Desktop Support Technician (MCDST) or above. Working knowledge of ITIL/Service management best practice. Accredited ITIL certification (Foundation level). Experience in leading small projects.

At Cognizant, Taking Care Of Employees Is a Priority

You can pursue innovative career tracks and opportunities hereYou can enhance your professional development through education and dedicated trainingWe’ll give you the skills you need to keep pace with the changing workplace while our compensation, health insurance benefit and gym membership discount to help you stay healthy and plan for the future.

Title: ML Engineer
Description:
We believe it takes great people to create a great product. That’s why our team lives our company values, and we hire based on them, too. Since 2010, Pipedrive has been on a mission to support sales and marketing teams with easy-to-use, powerful tools that make everyday work faster and easier. Today, our cloud-based software is trusted by over 100,000 companies and used in 179 countries. We have grown from a five-person team to a truly international company of over 850+ people, representing more than 50 nationalities, with ten offices distributed across Europe and the US. In 2020, Pipedrive received a majority investment from Vista Equity Partners, a global investment firm that invests exclusively in enterprise software, data, and technology-enabled businesses, making Pipedrive the fifth unicorn from Estonia.

In this role you will transform more sophisticated data science prototypes with the mix of standard and non-standard components into production-ready ML solutions and deploy on existing infrastructure. Join us and be a key player in shaping the future of our ML capabilities!

Your new adventure:

Ensure error-free and efficient deployments of ML models from development into an existing production infrastructureAutomate data pipelines for online and offline features used by ML modelsOptimize ML models that are running in production for better performance, latency, memory, and throughputEnsure that ML models running in production are monitored for performance and accuracyEnsure data privacy, security, and compliance with relevant regulations and best practicesTroubleshoot and resolve issues related to ML models’ output and performanceContribute to building and managing ML platform components to monitor the performance and health of deployed machine learning models and automate repeatable processes in ML workflowsBe on-call when it’s your turn, react to alerts, and resolve production incidents

Does this sound like you?

3+ years of engineering experienceExperience with distributed data processing systemsConceptual understanding of ML development lifecycle and hands-on experience with productionising ML solutionsExperience with ML algorithms, frameworks, and tooling (e.g., Amazon SageMaker, TensorFlow, PyTorch, scikit-learn)Proficient in a programming language preferably PythonExperience in SQL and data modeling (including toolset) Familiarity with agile methodologiesExcellent communication and writing skillsEducational background in computer science, mathematics, statistics, or a related field is a plus

Why Pipedrive:

People-first culture - Be part of a team that values authenticity, champions collaboration, and supports each other—no egos, just teamwork. Work alongside top talent from around the world in an inclusive space where different perspectives fuel our best ideas. Everyone is welcomeUnlock potential – Push boundaries, take ownership, and experiment with the latest technologies as we enhance our AI First Vision. We empower bold ideas that drive real changeWe’ve got you – Your well-being matters. Enjoy flexible hours, wellness perks and SWAG. Think performance-based bonuses, 28 paid leave days, well-being days, compassionate leave, and even pawternal leave—because we take care of ourselves and our peopleGrow with us – Whether through mentorship, coaching, or internal mobility, we invest in helping you unlock your potential. Open, honest feedback and clear communication are at our core. We grow together through trust and accountability Packed with purpose – Help 100,000+ small and medium-sized businesses grow and succeed while doing meaningful, customer-driven work

Pipedrive is an equal-opportunity employer. We encourage diversity in the workplace regardless of age, gender, race, religion, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity or veteran status.

Based on this role's access to certain data, Pipedrive might conduct a pre-employment background investigation in conjunction with your application for employment with our company. Such data will be handled in accordance with Pipedrive's Privacy Policy for Recruitment.

We are looking for a ML Engineer to join our team in Tallinn.

The company is backed by majority holder Vista Equity Partners, Bessemer Venture Partners, Insight Partners, Atomico, and DTCP.

Title: IT-Administrator (m/w/d)
Description:
Wer wir sind




Das erwartet Sie bei uns

Für uns zählen in erster Linie Ihre Persönlichkeit, Ihre Leistungsmotivation sowie Ihr Wille zum gemeinsamen Erfolg

Der Bauch sagt ja und der Kopf stimmt zu? Dann werden Sie Teil unseres erfolgreichen Teams.

Wir bieten nach gründlicher Einarbeitung ein interessantes und abwechslungsreiches Aufgabengebiet, umfangreiche Sozialleistungen und ein überdurchschnittliches Einkommen. Sie erwartet ein attraktives Arbeitsumfeld sowie Fortbildungs- und innerbetriebliche Entwicklungsmöglichkeiten in einem expandierenden Unternehmen. Neben einem attraktiven Gehalt bietet DELTA-V weitere interessante Leistungen wie Urlaubs- und Weihnachtsgeld, 30 Tage Jahresurlaub, Mitarbeiterrabatte, JobRad, vergünstigtes Mittagsessen und kostenlose Getränke. Freuen Sie sich auf ein Betriebsklima zum Wohlfühlen und ein Team, das Sie auch persönlich bereichern wird. Wir glauben nämlich daran, dass berufliche Leistung und persönliche Zufriedenheit eng beisammen liegen.

... und darüber hinaus noch eine ganze Menge mehr.

Title: BRAND HUNTER
Description:
Profiel
Sterke merken creëren, herdenken en met de juiste creativiteit in de markt zetten. Daar staat SQUAD voor. Onze ambitieuze bende ‘brand warriors’ staat klaar om een divers klantenportfolio op de wenken te bedienen. En om dat portfolio verder uit te bouwen, zoeken we een mondige, sociale en aimabele brand hunter. Pijl-en-boog-skills niet vereist, een neus voor zaken, kennis van de sector en een gezonde dosis empathie des te meer. Staat jouw radar op scherp?SQUAD bouwt op een kleinschalig, complementair en getalenteerd team. We staan dus voor directe communicatie en een hands-on aanpak. En dat verwachten we ook van ons nieuwste gezicht.Je gaat graag de baan op, spot opportuniteiten en legt proactief contacten met interessante leads.Je bouwde al een eigen netwerk uit en matcht ons enthousiast met prospects in die kringen.Je hebt ervaring in of affiniteit met de sector. Jouw kennis van alle ins en outs schept vertrouwen bij prospects.Je bent een teamplayer, die goed blendt in onze hechte SQUAD-familie.Je hebt de nodige maturiteit.Je voelt aan wat de klant wil en weet daar de sterktes van SQUAD aan te koppelen.
Takenpakket
Je gelooft in de kracht van SQUAD en dat deel je trots met de wereld. In het bijzonder met bedrijven waar je onze diensten aanprijst. Netwerken zit je nu eenmaal in het bloed. Tijdens events, op prospectieronde doorheen de provincie (en daarbuiten) of in je persoonlijke kringen deel je onze kennis en kunde met de wereld. Zo ondersteun je onze groei en onze diversificatie. Werkte je enthousiasme aanstekelijk en start je prospect een traject bij SQUAD? Dan blijf jij het aanspreekpunt. Jouw interne projectopvolging – en strategische inzichten – bieden houvast, voor de klant en voor onze creativo’s.

Wat bieden we jou?
Een tof, nieuw kantoor, leuke collega’s, occasionele likjes van kantoorhond Marcel en dagelijkse ontmoetingen met interessante mensen: redenen genoeg om ‘ja’ te zeggen op onze vacature. Toch geven we je graag een extra zetje met deze argumenten:Met je SQUAD-bedrijfswagen ben je een echte ambassadeur voor ons merk, tijdens en na de uren.Je krijgt een laptop en gsm met abonnement.Naast een marktconforme beloning krijg je bij SQUAD mooie extra’s.

Interesse?Stuur je CV en portfolio (website) per e-mail naar: warrior@squad.be

Title: Junior Data Engineer
Description:
Junior Data EngineerOTP Bank’s digital transformation journey leverages the power of Cloud to drive innovation, enhance operational efficiency, and deliver exceptional digital banking experiences. By adopting scalable, secure, and intelligent cloud solutions, we aim to transform our IT infrastructure, enable seamless data-driven decision-making, and foster agility in responding to evolving customer needs.
Job DescriptionAs a Junior Data Engineer, you will contribute to the design, building, and management of data pipelines that support data-driven decision making across various products and services. You will have the opportunity to be part of OTP Cloud Journey and shape the future of banking.You will collaborate with stakeholders to understand data requirements, model data flows, transform raw data, ensure data quality, and comply with data governance standards. You will use your skills and experience in software engineering, cloud data engineering, data platforms, and data visualization to deliver scalable and reliable data solutions. OTP’s mission is to become leading bank of the digital era. As employees we work with a growth mindset, innovate to empower others, and collaborate to realize our shared goals. We nurture values of respect, integrity, and accountability to create a culture of inclusion where everyone can thrive at work and beyond.
Responsibilities• Collaborate across squads to define data requirements, roadmaps, use cases, and metrics for data products or features.• Design and document data models, schemas, and flows that meet business and analytical needs.• Extract, transform, and load data from various sources using query languages, tools, and APIs.• Ensure data quality, completeness, and reliability across data pipelines.• Develop and implement data tools, tests, and monitors to optimize data performance and troubleshoot issues.• Comply with data governance policies and standards for data security, privacy, and classification.• Contribute to the data glossary and data catalog to document data sources, definitions, and lineage.
Required Qualifications• Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science, Math, Software Engineering, Computer Engineering, or related field.• Experience in data engineering, data science, software development, or data modeling.• Knowledge of programming languages, such as Python, Java, Scala, or C#• Knowledge of Microsoft Azure data platform• Knowledge of frameworks, such as Databricks, Spark, Kafka• SQL data query language knowledge• Growth Mindset and willingness to learn
Additional/Prefered Qualifications• Knowledge of data visualization tools, such as Power BI• Relevant Microsoft Azure Cloud certifications are a plus• Strong communication, collaboration, and problem-solving skills• Fluent in Hungarian and intermediate or above level of English is a must
Perks/Benefits• Yearly Bonus• Cafeteria• Private Health Insurance• Discounted Banking Services• Trainning and Development Opportunities• Sports/Fitness Discounts

Company Description:
Az OTP Csoport Magyarország egyik legnagyobb pénzügyi szolgáltató vállalata. A nemzetközi terjeszkedés eredményeként az OTP Csoport ma már meghatározó regionális szereplő a kelet-közép-európai piacon, Magyarországon kívül további 11 országában van jelen.

Az OTP Csoport több mint 17,5 millió ügyféllel rendelkezik, a lakossági szegmensben piacvezető Magyarországon, Szlovéniában, Szerbiában, Montenegróban, illetve Bulgáriában. 

A csoport zászlóshajója az OTP Bank, mely korszerű pénzügyi szolgáltatások széles körét nyújtja Magyarországon. A Csoport a lakossági terület mellett a vállalati ügyfelek magas színvonalú kiszolgálását is prioritásként kezeli, az agrárvállalatok számára az anyabank és a legtöbb leánybank speciális termékeket kínál.

Az OTP Bank Magyarországon 350 fiókból álló fiókhálózatot működtet, alkalmazottainak száma meghaladja a 10 000 főt.



OTP Group is one of the biggest financial suppliers in Hungary. As a result of an international expansion OTP Group is a determining player on the banking market within the CEE region. The bank is present in 11 countries besides Hungary.

OTP Group is one of the leading financial service providers within the region with over 17,5 million customers. We retained our position as the market leader credit institution in the retail segment in Hungary, Montenegro and Bulgaria. 

As its flagship unit, OTP Bank Hungary provides a wide range of state-of-the-art financial services in Hungary, while offering, through the network of local Group subsidiaries, solutions to a number of other special financial needs including the distribution of investment funds, home and other specific savings, and auto financing. In addition to retail, our Group also gives priority to serving corporate customers to a high standard, with the parent bank and most subsidiary banks offering special products to agricultural companies.

OTP Bank operates with more than 350 branches in Hungary and the number of its employees exceeds 10.000.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Jsme datově-analytické oddělení v mediální divizi Publicis Groupe. Naši kolegové využívají námi zpracovaná data a datové analýzy pro pokročilé plánovaní, řízení a vyhodnocování mediálních kampaní.Aktuálně se poohlížíme po datovém nadšenci, který bude parťákem pro naše mediální a kreativní agentury. Hledáme někoho, kdo má chuť se učit a objevovat nové technologie a postupy. Je v pohodě, že zatím neumíš vše, my tě to během pár měsíců naučíme. Budeme rádi za týmového hráče.
Co tě u nás čeká? Naším nejtypičtějším projektem je situace, kdy za námi přijde koncový klient (obvykle velké společnosti, často z bankovního či FMCG průmyslu, jindy třeba obchody se sportovním vybavením či kosmetikou), s tím, že investuje velkou spoustu peněz do reklamy a chce vědět, jestli se mu to vyplatí a jak to dělat efektivněji. Ukáže nám své prodeje za poslední roky a také investice do různých médií (od televize po sociální sítě). My tato data vezmeme, identifikujeme další externí faktory jako inflaci či počasí a jdeme pomocí R modelovat, využívajíce tzv. Marketing Mix Modeling. K technickým a veskrze matematickým výsledkům, které takto dostaneme, tvoříme v Pythonu spoustu vizualizací a dopočtů, které nakonec prezentujeme klientovi.Kromě toho občas vytvoříme nějakou appku, ať už pro klienty nebo naše kolegy, děláme i menší datové analýzy a zpracováváme různá data, která se nám od kolegů dostanou do rukou.Teď bychom ale chtěli udělat další krok. Díky spolupráci s asi 200 klienty jsme nasbírali velké množství analytických dat, ještě víc jich máme z různých systémů, ať už jde o data Mety nebo Googlu. A přišel čas se do nich pořádně podívat. Hledat v nich insighty, benchmarky a využívat je pro predikce. Jednoduše, chceme je začít pořádně vytěžovat a k tomu hledáme tebe!

Co bychom u tebe rádi viděli? • VŠ vzdělání v oblasti STEM (Science, Technology, Engineering and Mathematics apod.)• Alespoň rok praktických zkušeností v Data Science nebo podobné oblasti.• Máš statistické znalosti, rozumíš principům a ideálně jsi se tak potkal s metodami jako je regrese a práce s časovými řadami.• ML. Máš zkušenost s machine learningem, už jsi implementoval různé ML modely a vidíš v nich trochu dál než jen k tomu, aby nespadl použitý kód.• Python. Tvoje práce bude primárně o Pythonu. Předpokládáme, že knihovny Pandas, Numpy, Matplotlib, Seaborn, a taky Scikit-Learn či Theano ti nejsou cizí.• R. Částečně tu zužitkuješ i zkušenosti s R, byť není nezbytné.• Umíš psát dobře přehledný a okomentovaný kód.• Hlouběji chápeš lineární regresy.• Práce s Excelem a PowerPointem pro tebe nejsou překážkou.• Nemáš problém si pomocí SQL vytáhnout data.• Jsi zvyklý používat GIT.• Výhodou ti může být také to, že jsi někdy potkal cloudové platformy (Azure, AWS, Google Cloud). Nebo sis zkusil práci s Data Factory, Databricks či Dash.• Udělal jsi alespoň jeden graf v Tableau, případně jiném vizualizačním nástroji.• Nemáš problém komunikovat v angličtině.
Co můžeme nabídnout? • Možnost vytvářet nové datové produkty, do velké míry podle svého uvážení. Nebudeš pouze obsluhovat už hotové modely.• Zkoušení nových technologií a možnost hledat řešení problémů podle svého.• Rozhled napříč analytickými disciplínami – data science tým aktivně kooperuje s dalšími analytickými týmy jako je datový engineering, dashboarding, webová analytika či s datově-výzkumnými týmy.• Velké množství různých druhů objemných datasetů (mediální data, kampaňová data, data o spotřebním chování, ...).• Možnost osobního a profesního rozvoje prostřednictvím častých školení, ať už na téma dat a analytiky nebo médií, prezentování a vyjednávaní.• Aktivní spolupráci se zkušenými marketingovými stratégy a dalšími kapacitami marketingového světa. S klienty můžeš být občas v kontaktu, budeš-li chtít, ale nikdo tě do toho nebude nutit.• Projekty pro největší lokální i nadnárodní společnosti. Často z oboru bankovnictví nebo FMCG průmyslu.• Práce v office plném fajn lidí, pár psů a zajímavých projektů• Kolektiv s neformální kulturou, tykat si budeš i s naším CEO. Poznáš spoustu zajímavých lidí napříč obory – kreativce, developery či projekťáky a můžeš se zapojit do všeho, co se ve firmě děje.• Práce v moderních prostorech, kde si můžeš oddechnout u fotbálku a pinpongu, s venkovní terasou.• Možnost spolupráce na nadnárodních projektech a čerpání know-how ze zahraničních poboček sítě Publicis Groupe.• Onboarding a efektivní on-the-job training – naučíme tě všechno co je potřeba.
Benefity navíc (po zkušební době): • Benefitní balíček, ze kterého si sám vybereš, co ti vyhovuje (po zkušebce, v hodnotě 15tis. Kč/rok).• Mobil s firemním tarifem.• Pokud onemocníš, doplatíme ti nemocenskou do sta procent• Několik dnů volna - "My Days" - navíc.• Rádi pomáháme, a tak má každý možnost využít dobrovolnický den.• Firemní chata – týmově i samostatně můžeš odjet pracovat nebo relaxovat na naši firemní chatu.
CO TEĎ? Dej nám o sobě vědět! :)

Company Description:
Founded in 1926 by Marcel Bleustein-Blanchet, the “father of French advertising”, Publicis Groupe is today the third largest communications group in the world. In more than 100 countries, we help clients build strong brands, transform their marketing and win in the platform world.   

Our approach is based on the integration of all marketing disciplines into one whole. We have abandoned the traditional holding structure and switched to the new modular Power of One model. Instead of dozens of separate agencies, our experts on creativity, media, data and technology work now together as one team. All under one roof. From strategic consultants to specialists who will complete the project. In addition, through the global Marcel platform, we are connected to 80,000 talents from across our network.

Title: Python Developer (German Speaking)

Title: Web Fullstack Application Developer
Description:
Descrizione del Ruolo
Stiamo cercando un progettista e sviluppatore web fullstack con esperienza di almeno 3 anni negli ambiti della pubblicazione di contenuti sul World Wide Web e di applicazioni web based. Il collaboratore avrà la responsabilità di progettare e sviluppare insieme ai responsabili del design UX, lo stack frontend e backend di presentazione, e di progettare e sviluppare le funzionalità CMS e di backoffice. È richiesta una misurabile conoscenza e competenza dellle tecnologie web e delle metodologie di sviluppo allo stato dell'arte.
Responsabilità
- Interagire con le funzioni interne dell'azienda (project management, business unit, e team tecnici)e eseguire i propri compiti rispettando la pianificazione;- Progettare e implementare siti, portali di contenuti, CMS, facendo uso delle tecnologie allo stato dell'arte dello sviluppo web;- Collaborare con i team di infrastruttura e di supervisione della sicurezza informatica per garantire che le applicazioni siano performanti e conformi alle best practices di sicurezza;- Sviluppare e mantenere codice nei repository aziendali;
Requisiti
- Laurea in Informatica, Ingegneria Informatica, o formazione equivalente;- Esperienza comprovabile nello sviluppo di CMS, siti, portali, applicazioni;- Conoscenza approfondita di API Gateway e tecnologie correlate.- Conoscenza con i processi di contonuous integration e continuous delivery;- Esperienza d'utilizzo di **Git e Gitlab/Github**;- Competenza ed esperienza di sviluppo nei seguenti linguaggi: **PHP, NodeJS, Java, Javascript**- Conoscenza ed esperienza in almeno un framework di sviluppo per applicazioni web basato sui linguaggi conosciuti (es. Laravel per PHP, ExpressJS o AdonisJS per NodeJS )- Conoscenza e dimestichezza nell'uso della tecnologia **Docker**- Familiarità con le pratiche di sicurezza delle API, inclusi **OAuth2, OpenID Connect e JSON Web Tokens (JWT)** e le basi della crittografia simmetrica e asimmetrica.- Capacità di lavorare in modo autonomo e in team, gestendo il proprio tempo nel rispetto di progetti e scadenze.- Ottime capacità di problem solving e attenzione ai dettagli.
Competenze Desiderabili
- Conoscenza ed esperienza nella progettazione e sviluppo di siti basati headless CMS;- Conoscenza ed esperienza nell'integrazione di servizi di pagamento online- Conoscenza ed esperienza nello sviluppo di API- Conoscenza di metodologie Agile e DevOps.- Familiarità con ambienti cloud (AWS, Azure, Google Cloud).
Offriamo
- Un ambiente di lavoro dinamico e stimolante.- Opportunità di crescita professionale e sviluppo delle competenze.- Pacchetto retributivo competitivo e benefici aggiuntivi.

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
About Us

Diligent is the global leader in modern governance, providing SaaS solutions across governance, risk, compliance, audit and ESG. Empowering more than 1 million users and 700,000 board members and leaders with a holistic view of their organization’s GRC practices so they can make better decisions, faster. No matter the challenge.

At Diligent, you are an agent of positive change. You are joining a team of passionate, smart, creative people who not only want to help build the software company of the future, but who want to make the world a more sustainable, equitable and better place. Be a part of a global community on a mission to make a real impact.

Learn more at diligent.com.

Position Overview:

Diligent are looking for someone who has a strong knowledge of development to join our Centre for Global Product Innovation in Budapest and together build our new comprehensive Data Platform. We collect information from tens of thousands of sources and process this large amount of data with various tools including ML classification, NLP, and tagging to provide input for the Data Science team and a wide range of reports for our clients, all built on native AWS.

The ideal candidate will have proven ability to apply effective analysis, design, programming, and testing skills to produce and maintain scaled SaaS software solutions. They will be driven, resourceful and not feel intimidated by significant technical challenges. They will want to take ownership of the features they are working on, proactively drive improvements in software design and development practices, and might work with more junior members of the team to help develop their skills and optimize the performance of the team over time

Key Responsibilities


In addition to core development activities for core modules and integration projects, you will be required to: Design, code, review and test assigned features and user stories, in accordance with the agile methodology employed by Diligent Collaborate with the product owner and engineering manager in the analysis and documentation of technical requirements and user stories for assigned features Assist with production of high quality operational and system documentation as required Communicate effectively with other development teams, production operations, and a number of other technology groups, to ensure regular smooth delivery of working software to production


Required Experience/Skills


2+ years experience in a hands-on development role at a commercial software company Experience with Python and common libs Experience with SQL and NoSQL databases Experience with could tools, could native development Experience with REST API Problem-solver attitude - Technology agnostic approach Ability to contribute to the effectiveness of a high-performing agile team 


Preferred Experience/Skills


Worked with data warehouse, event driven architecture Experience with Airflow, Spark, dbt Experience with AWS tools Experience with CDK, Terraform CI/CD experience, containers, cloud deployments, GitHub actions 


What Diligent Offers You


Creativity is ingrained in our culture. We are innovative collaborators by nature. We thrive in exploring how things can be differently both in our internal processes and to help our clientsWe care about our people. Diligent offers a flexible work environment, global days of service, comprehensive health benefits, meeting free days, generous time off policy and wellness programs to name a fewWe have teams all over the world. We may be headquartered in New York City, but we have office hubs in Washington D.C., Vancouver, London, Galway, Budapest, Munich, Bengaluru, Singapore, and Sydney.Diversity is important to us. Growing, maintaining and promoting a diverse team is a top priority for us. We foster and encourage diversity through our Employee Resource Groups and provide access to resources and education to support the education of our team, facilitate dialogue, and foster understanding.


Diligent created the modern governance movement. Our world-changing idea is to empower leaders with the technology, insights and connections they need to drive greater impact and accountability – to lead with purpose. Our employees are passionate, smart, and creative people who not only want to help build the software company of the future, but who want to make the world a more sustainable, equitable and better place.

Headquartered in New York, Diligent has offices in Washington D.C., Baltimore, London, Galway, Budapest, Vancouver, Bengaluru, Munich, and Sydney. 

We are a drug free workplace. Diligent is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate based on race, color, religious creed, sex, national origin, ancestry, citizenship status, pregnancy, childbirth, physical disability, mental disability, age, military status, protected veteran status, marital status, registered domestic partner or civil union status, gender (including sex stereotyping and gender identity or expression), medical condition (including, but not limited to, cancer related or HIV/AIDS related), genetic information, or sexual orientation in accordance with applicable federal, state and local laws. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Diligent's EEO Policy and Know Your Rights. We are committed to providing reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities and disabled veterans in our job application procedures. If you need assistance or an accommodation due to a disability, you may contact us at recruitment@diligent.com.

To all recruitment agencies: Diligent does not accept unsolicited agency resumes. Please do not forward resumes to our jobs alias, Diligent employees or any other organization location. Diligent is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.

Title: Data Analyst (with Reporting skills)
Description:
Are you a passionate Data Analyst looking for an exciting opportunity to grow and work on impactful projects? We are seeking a highly motivated Data Analyst (with reporting skills) to join our dynamic team. You'll have the flexibility to work fully remotely. As a key member of our dynamic organization, you will be responsible for gathering, analyzing, and presenting data to support informed decision-making and drive operational excellence. This role offers an exciting opportunity to work on diverse projects and collaborate with cross-functional teams in a fast-paced environment.
What You'll Do:Develop and maintain robust data analysis and reporting systems to track key performance indicators (KPIs), trends, and metrics; Collaborate closely with stakeholders to gather data requirements and ensure alignment with business objectives; Conduct in-depth analysis of data to uncover insights and trends, and provide actionable recommendations to stakeholders; Continuously improve reporting processes and systems to enhance efficiency, accuracy, and usability; Stay informed about industry trends and best practices in reporting, data analysis, and business intelligence. 

Requirements

Bachelor's degree in Business Administration, Finance, Statistics, or a related field; 2-3 years of experience in data analysis, reporting, or business intelligence roles; Advanced proficiency in Microsoft Excel, including pivot tables, formulas, power queries, and power pivots; Good knowledge of SQL; Experience in data visualization tools is an asset; Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with a keen attention to detail; Excellent communication skills, with the ability to convey complex information clearly and concisely; Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a multicultural environment; Fluency in English is required.  

Benefits

We believe in rewarding talent and dedication. Here's what you can expect as part of our team: Competitive full-time salary; Private Health Coverage on the Company's group program; Flexible Working Hours; Top-of-the-Line Tools; Professional Development: Benefit from language courses, specialized training, and continuous learning opportunities; Career Growth: Work with some of the most innovative and exciting specialists in the industry; Dynamic Work Environment: Thrive in a setting that offers challenging goals, autonomy, and mentoring, fostering both personal and company growth. If you want an exciting challenge, work with some of the coolest technologies, and enjoy your time doing it, then join us! Submit your detailed CV in English, quoting reference: (DAR/03/25).You may also consider all our other open vacancies by visiting the career section of our website (www.eurodyn.com) and follow us on Twitter (@EURODYN_Careers) and LinkedIn.EUROPEAN DYNAMICS (ED) (www.eurodyn.com) is a leading European Software, Information, and Communication Technologies company, operating internationally (Athens, Brussels, Luxembourg, Copenhagen, Berlin, Stockholm, London, Nicosia, Valetta, Vienna, Den Haag, Hong Kong, etc.) The company employs over 1000 engineers, IT experts, and consultants (around 3% PhD, 41% MSc, and 54% BSc). We design and develop software applications using integrated, state-of-the-art technology. Our current IT projects have a value exceeding 300 million EURO. EUROPEAN DYNAMICS is a renowned supplier of IT services to European Union Institutions, international organizations, European Agencies, and national government Administrations in 40 countries and 4 continents.As part of our dedication to the diversity of our workforce, we are committed to Equal Employment Opportunity without regard for race, colour, national origin, ethnicity, gender, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, or religion.

Title: Test Data Engineer IT
Description:
Strong and modern IT is one of the strategic success factors for the future competitiveness of Hapag-Lloyd. For this reason, we will grow in many areas and, in particular, successively expand the development teams around our internal system. We are seeking a highly motivated and detail-oriented Test Data Engineer to join our team. As a Test Data Engineer, you will play a critical role in ensuring the quality and reliability of our software products by supporting product teams in analyzing, defining, and creating test data for various testing needs by using your skills and knowledge about creating data models. You will contribute to a highly agile development environment based on microservices, self-contained systems, and continuous integration/continuous delivery (CI/CD) practices with a high degree of test automation. You will also leverage K2View for advanced Test Data Management (TDM).
 Utilize K2View to manage test data efficiently, ensuring scalability, data privacy compliance, and alignment with system requirements. Collaborate with product teams to analyze requirements and design suitable test data for:  User acceptance testing (UAT)  Developer tests  Integration testing  Non-functional testing based on ISO 25010 standards (e.g., performance efficiency, reliability, ...)   Design and create data models, including Entity-Relationship Diagrams (ERD), to understand system relationships and enable the creation of accurate and meaningful data subsets. Work closely with product owners, developers, testers, and DevOps engineers to align test data management practices with CI/CD workflows and automated testing frameworks.  Build and maintain reusable and scalable test data repositories, ensuring they align with domain-specific requirements and comply with security, regulatory, and privacy standards.  Analyze test results and data to support root cause analysis for test failures and ensure continuous quality improvement.  Contribute to building tools and frameworks for test data simulation, anonymization, and versioning.  Ensure traceability and coverage of test data against system requirements.  Qualifications  Experience with K2View or similar Test Data Management tools. Proficiency in database technologies (SQL, NoSQL) and data manipulation techniques. Strong skills in creating data models and ERD diagrams to represent system relationships and define data subsets. Proficiency in working with distributed systems based on microservices architecture and self-contained systems. Experience with ISO 25010 non-functional requirements testing (e.g., performance efficiency, scalability). Experience in test data anonymization and compliance with data protection regulations (e.g., GDPR). Strong understanding of agile software development lifecycle and methodologies. Familiarity with test automation frameworks and tools (e.g., Selenium, JUnit, Cucumber).  Knowledge of CI/CD pipelines and associated tools (e.g., Jenkins, GitLab).  Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with a focus on collaboration and communication. Willingness to travel internationally from time to time Ability to work independently and in a solution-oriented manner  High level of empathy and positive basic attitude  As an internationally active company, we require a good command of written and spoken English  Nice to Have:  Familiarity with message brokers such as Kafka.  Experience in cloud-based environments (AWS).  Background in data engineering or a similar field.  We offer  Knowledge Center in Gdansk  
 One of the goals of Hapag-Lloyd strategy, is to become more agile in the way we work and to create an environment in which we can make faster and innovative decisions. Knowledge Center in Gdansk enables the further accelerated growth, especially in the area of developing innovative digital solutions, agility and business centricity. To learn more, please check our website - https://knowledgecenter.pl/ 
  We offer:  
  Private medical care (Saltus) Gym card (Multisport) Attractive annual bonus up to 22,5%! (depending on company performance results) Group life insurance and employee capital plan (PPK) Cafeteria benefit system (cinema tickets, vouchers etc.) Focus on healthy lifestyle (fruit days, bike competitions, football trainings) Charity and volunteer initiatives Modern and well-connected office (Alchemia complex in Gdańsk Oliwa) Relocation support (financial support, covering immigration process for non-Polish citizens) Internal learning management system Development budget (sharing the costs of certifications and conferences/ IT events) Flexible working hours and home office possibility (hybrid work model) About Us With a fleet of 287 modern container ships and a Vessel Capacity 2.2 million TEU, as well as a Container Capacity 3.2 million TEU including one of the world’s largest and most modern reefer container fleets, Hapag-Lloyd is one of the world’s leading liner shipping companies. In the Liner Shipping segment, the Company has around 13.500 employees and 400 offices in 139 countries. Hapag-Lloyd has a container capacity of 11.9 million TEU – including one of the largest and most modern fleets of reefer containers. A total of 114 liner services worldwide ensure fast and reliable connections between more than 600 ports across the world. In the Terminal & Infrastructure segment, Hapag-Lloyd has stakes in 20 terminals in Europe, Latin America, the United States, India, and North Africa. The roughly 2.600 employees assigned to the Terminal & Infrastructure segment deal with terminal-related activities and provide complementary logistics services at selected locations.
Company Description: With a fleet of 292 modern container ships and a total transport capacity of 2.3 million TEU, Hapag-Lloyd is one of the world’s leading liner shipping companies. In the Liner Shipping segment, the Company has around 13,700 employees and 399 offices in 139 countries. Hapag-Lloyd has a container capacity of 3.4 million TEU – including one of the largest and most modern fleets of reefer containers. A total of 113 liner services worldwide ensure fast and reliable connections between more than 600 ports on all the continents. In the Terminal & Infrastructure segment, Hapag-Lloyd has equity stakes in 20 terminals in Europe, Latin America, the United States, India and North Africa. 3,000 employees are assigned to the Terminal & Infrastructure segment and provide complementary logistics services at selected locations in addition to the terminal activities.

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
ASTRELYA est un groupe de conseil et d’expertise IT fondé en 2017, présent en France (Paris et régions) et en Suisse (Genève). Aujourd'hui plus de 280 collaborateurs accompagnent nos clients dans l’accélération et la transformation de leurs organisations.
Dans le cadre de notre développement, nous recherchons un Data Engineer (H/F) pour rejoindre une équipe en charge d’un programme de transformation sur les risques de marché de notre client bancaire.
Votre rôle :Concevoir les solutions techniques à mettre en œuvre et estimer le coût avec l'équipeDévelopper de nouvelles fonctionnalités de la phase de conception aux tests, dans une démarche durable (haute qualité du code, respect des principes d'architecture et de sécurité informatique, documentation, automatisation des tests, utilisation maitrisée de l'infrastructure) Travailler sur des problématiques d'optimisation de performances et proposer des solutions innovantes ;Maintenir et améliorer la Software Factory et les environnements de développement ;Assurer, avec l'équipe, le support de niveau 3 et les développements nécessaires pour maintenir une production ponctuelle, de qualité et maîtrisée.
Environnement technique:Hadoop,Spark, Scala,Hive,Sql ServerKafka.

Title: IT Analyst
Description:
ALTEN – Światowy lider usług inżynieryjnych i ITGrupa ALTEN, założona w 1988 roku we Francji, jest wiodącym partnerem technologicznym, obsługującym największych klientów na świecie. W 2023 roku osiągnęła przychody przekraczające 4,07 miliarda euro i zatrudnia ponad 57 000 pracowników, w tym 88% inżynierów i ekspertów IT.ALTEN Polska działa od 13 lat, wspierając innowacje, badania i rozwój oraz systemy IT swoich klientów. Posiada biura w Krakowie, Warszawie, Wrocławiu, Gdańsku i Poznaniu.Obsługuje kluczowe branże, takie jak lotnicza, kosmiczna, przemysłowa, motoryzacyjna, kolejowa, energetyczna, finansowa, telekomunikacyjna i sprzedażowa.Zakres ekspertyzy: analiza biznesowa, cyberbezpieczeństwo, sztuczna inteligencja, analiza danych i rozwiązania chmurowe, rozwój aplikacji, testowanie oprogramowania, zarządzanie projektami, oprogramowanie wbudowane, zarządzanie jakością, industrializacja, transformacja cyfrowa oraz inżynieria przemysłowa.Więcej informacji na http://www.altenpolska.pl

Title: Web Software Engineer Portugal
Description:
WIT Software creates products and solutions for the Telecom industry and has a very strong background on Messaging, IP Voice and Video, Unified Communications, Telecom VAS services, IPTV and Mobile Money. The company has 23 years of existence and works with some of the relevant Telecom companies in the global market, from Europe, Japan, US and Africa.
WIT is developing an innovative software product that leverages emerging concepts from the latest generation of IMS and mobile telecommunications networks. This product has the potential for commercial distribution to hundreds of mobile operators and service providers, reaching millions of users across various geographies worldwide.
We are seeking experienced and talented Web Software Engineers to join our Product Team. This is an excellent opportunity for those who are passionate about developing successful software for the global market.
Key Responsibilities:• Develop, design, and maintain software applications using modern web technologies.• Collaborate with team members to develop scalable and high-performing software solutions.• Work closely with UI/UX designers to translate designs into code.• Create solutions using responsive design principles and ensure cross-browser compatibility.• Understand REST APIs and have experience integrating them into web applications.• Integrate and maintain databases within the application architecture.• Implement automated testing to ensure code stability and functionality.• Follow best practices and guidelines to ensure system security and data integrity.• Optimize the performance of applications for full-scale production deployments.• Provide code documentation and contribute to technical documents.• Participate in code reviews.• Configure the usability of all front-end applications.• Troubleshoot and debug to optimize performance.
Requirements:• Degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field.• Prior experience as a Web Engineer.• Strong proficiency in HTML, CSS, and JavaScript, including modern ES6+ syntax and features.• Knowledge of TypeScript, GraphQL, or other recent web technologies.• Previous experience developing with React.js and other frameworks, such as Angular or Vue.js.• Experience with Node.js and frameworks for SSR-enabled websites, such as Next.js.• Experience with SQL databases, including schema design, queries, and performance optimization.• Proficient in software engineering best practices, including design patterns, code reviews, and unit and integration testing.• Familiarity with continuous integration, deployment, and DevOps processes.• Knowledge of cloud services such as AWS for hosting, optimization, and delivery of web-based content.• In-depth understanding of computer science fundamentals, internet technologies, and protocols.• Ability to meet tight deadlines.• Capable of prioritizing multiple tasks to achieve goals without management oversight.• Fluent in English with strong communication skills.• Ability to communicate complex topics in a clear and structured manner.• Capable of quickly exploring and using new frameworks and tools.• Proactive, able to take initiative and operate independently.• Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
Benefits• Work from anywhere near our 5 offices in Portugal – Porto, Leiria, Coimbra, Belmonte, or Lisbon. Enjoy the flexibility of a hybrid setup, with just two days a week at the office and the rest from wherever suits you best!• We offer a competitive compensation package as well as an environment conducive to personal and professional growth

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
About Welvaart

On a daily basis, we assume commitments and present solutions to our stakeholders in order to create a structure of human values, based on professionalism, honesty and rigor.

With a management based on Human Centered Design, we take care of our professionals with consistent career plans, but flexible with their needs and expectations of evolution. Our management team guarantees an empathetic and present leadership that will provide superior technological engagement and delivery to our clients' projects and products.

Role

Develop, fine-tune, and deploy Generative AI models using AWS services like Bedrock, SageMaker, and Lambda.

Work with LLMs, embeddings, transformers, and diffusion models for applications in NLP, image generation, and AI automation.

Optimize prompt engineering, fine-tuning, and Reinforcement Learning from Human Feedback (RLHF) techniques.

Build scalable MLOps pipelines for training and deploying GenAI models using SageMaker, ECS, and Kubernetes.

Process and manage large-scale datasets for AI training using AWS Glue, Athena, and Redshift.

Implement vector databases (Pinecone, Weaviate, FAISS, Amazon OpenSearch) for efficient retrieval-augmented generation (RAG) applications.

Design and optimize ETL pipelines for AI/ML data workflows.

Collaborate with software engineers, DevOps, and product teams to integrate AI models into applications and APIs.

Ensure security, compliance, and data privacy in AI/ML workflows.

Monitor AI model performance and retraining needs using AWS CloudWatch, MLFlow, and other observability tools.

We are looking for

Strong background in Data Science, Machine Learning, and Generative AI.

Proficiency in Python, SQL, and ML frameworks (TensorFlow, PyTorch, Hugging Face Transformers).

Experience with AWS AI/ML services such as SageMaker, Bedrock, Lambda, and Comprehend.

Hands-on experience with LLMs, embeddings, transformers, and diffusion models.

Familiarity with Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG), vector databases, and knowledge graphs.

Experience in MLOps, containerization (Docker, Kubernetes, ECS), and CI/CD for ML pipelines.

Solid understanding of cloud optimization, distributed computing, and model scaling.

Strong data engineering skills for processing large datasets in AWS Glue, Athena, or Spark.

Knowledge of NLP, image generation models, or multimodal AI solutions.

What you can discover with us?

Title: Analyst (Corporate Intelligence and Investigations)
Description:
Job Description 
We are hiring a full-time analyst to join our Warsaw office. The successful candidate will join a team conducting corporate intelligence and investigations throughout Europe and beyond. They will be given the opportunity to rapidly develop skills and experience in one of the most interesting and exciting lines of work that one could hope to be in.
While previous professional experience is a plus, it is not a requirement. Instead, we are looking for individuals with an aptitude for critical thinking, in-depth research, and report writing, who demonstrate tenacity and conscientiousness in their approach. A high level of written and spoken English proficiency is a must, and knowledge of other foreign languages is a strong advantage.
Please note that this is not a geopolitical risk, corporate security, or cybersecurity position. While there is overlap with these fields, our work predominantly concerns business transactions. We uncover risks related to an investment or senior hire, unravel complex layers of ownership across different jurisdictions, and help legal teams build the strongest case during a dispute. 
The Role
Conducting open-source research in a wide range of sources, such as corporate records, press and online media, litigation and regulatory filings, and leaked datasets.Synthesising the data gathered from such sources to produce well-written and strategically actionable reports serving a diverse range of intelligence requirements, including enhanced due diligence, asset tracing, and litigation support.Working with an extensive network of associates, including fellow researchers, on-the-ground partners, and a wide range of human sources with expertise in specific sectors.Liaising with clients to ensure that reports are tailored to their needs and are delivered within the agreed scope, budget, and timeline.Developing and maintaining research methodologies for jurisdictions in which we work and keeping up to date with new developments in the availability of open-source data.
The Candidate
Passionate about in-depth research. Enjoys piecing together data points and developing a comprehensive picture. Doesn’t give up when they hit obstacles but thinks: “I will find a way to get the information I’m looking for.”Detail-oriented, with a clear and elegant style of writing. Exceptional command of professional-level written English. Gets satisfaction from delivering a high-quality report that genuinely helps the client to make an informed decision.Has sufficient understanding of the international business and political landscape to quickly grasp the concepts they are exploring. Has a rudimentary understanding of company forms and finance terminology (or can be taught). Isn't put off by legalese.Enjoys working in a team and regularly communicating with a wide range of external associates. Is naturally communicative and gracious, and enjoys building personal and professional relationships.Can accept feedback and learn quickly. There is a steep initial learning curve, and a lot of training and support will be provided. This will include direct, clear, and respectful feedback.Has the personality of an educator, meaning someone who can understand a concept fully and convey it to another person (whether that be a colleague, an associate, or a client) in the most appropriate way to help them understand it.
The Company
Bearstone is a corporate intelligence and investigations company. Our work includes research in open sources, discreet enquiries among human sources, and a range of other investigative techniques. Our focus is on quality and reliability. Our company culture values continuous improvement and striving for excellence, and our team shares a passion for staying at the forefront of investigative best-practice. We maintain the highest ethical and regulatory compliance standards. Our staff are based in Warsaw, Berlin, London, and Belgrade, and we maintain a network of trusted associates who enable us to work across Europe and beyond.
﻿Additional Information
Additionally, we are open to long-term cooperation with people based in Belgrade. If you're interested in joining our Belgrade team, please send your resume and a cover letter to recruitment@bearstone.global with the subject line 'Application for a Belgrade Position'.
Please do not reach out by message to individual Bearstone team members regarding your application.

Title: Data Management Analyst
Description:
Primary Location

Netherlands-The Hague

NATO Body

NATO Communications and Information Agency (NCIA)

Schedule

Full-time

Application Deadline

11-Mar-2025, 11:59:00 PM

Salary (Pay Basis)

7,163.77

Grade

NATO Grade G15

 Who we are: 

For more than 75 years, NATO’s mission has been to preserve peace and security in the Alliance for nearly one billion citizens. The NATO Communications and Information Agency (NCIA) and its predecessors have worked tirelessly in providing the means that enable the connectedness and togetherness that keep our Alliance strong. We are the NCI Agency, a team of 3,300 civilian and military staff in 30 locations throughout Europe, North America and Asia.

Our technology and cyber experts allow NATO to conduct critical operations, protect NATO’s airspace, make data-driven decisions, defend against cyber-attacks, secure NATO networks and maintain superiority in space. This is all possible because of our greatest force, our people. In order to keep this edge we aim to hire, train and retain the very best staff.

Our staff members represent both the diversity and unity of our Alliance. When you join the NCI Agency, you will be part of an organization where you can contribute authentically to the mission and purpose of NATO and help us keep our technological edge.

 About the job: 

Based in The Hague, Netherlands the newly created post of Data Management Analyst will join the Chief Information Office (CIO) within the Information Knowledge and Data Management (IKDM) Branch.IKDM lead the development, maintenance and governance of the information, knowledge and data management efforts within the Agency, including implementing the Agency’s Data Management system. This includes full alignment of all Agency related strategies, plans, policies, processes and programmes with the NATO Information Management Authority (NIMA), as required. CIO/IKDM delivers several pivotal information and knowledge sharing tools that foster an environment of responsibly and securely sharing information.

The Data Management Analyst will be responsible for developing, implementing, operating and improving the Agency’s Data Management system; including but not limited to data architecture, data modelling and design; data storage and operations; data security and protection; data integration and interoperability; document and content management; reference and master data; data warehousing and business intelligence; metadata; data quality.Under the direction of the Head Information, Knowledge and Data Management, the responsibilities will also include:

 Documentation: Engages with documenting data sets, processing purposes, and means of processing. Data Management and Protection: Leads data management and protection activities, and ensures compliance with personal data protection rules. Training and Awareness: Ensures staff managing data are appropriately trained and maintains agency awareness. Ethics and Compliance: Applies ethical principles in handling data, focusing on personal or sensitive data.


For the full job description of responsibilities you can review here on the NCIA careers site

 About you: 

You possess the ability to lead, inspire, and effectively engage a diverse and multidisciplinary team with tact, sound judgment, and adaptability. Additionally, your strong awareness, motivational skills, and attentive listening contribute to your capabilities which include:

 Data Architect qualification and experience; Experience in the management of large scale Data Protection efforts; Experience and knowledge in development of data artefacts, including dashboards, plans, status reports, briefs, etc.; Experience and knowledge in briefing senior stakeholders on Data Management, Architecture, Protection and Quality; Recognized track record in assessing risk and negotiating with stakeholders, including understanding their needs, problems and requests, and proposing constructive ways ahead; Proven ability to communicate effectively in English both in writing and orally with excellent briefing skills to different types of audiences, including authoring high-quality reports and providing briefings to senior stakeholders.


Desirable Experience and Education:

 Education at the Masters Level or extensive relevant professional experience, would be advantageous; Experience in NATO or international organization’s Data Governance or Protection work; Experience in ICT security and Data Protection; Certification in Risk Management is highly desirable; (Management of Risk -MoR\- or similar)


 What we offer: 

 Genuinely meaningful work as part of the most successful alliance in history Initial 3 year contract with competitive tax-free monthly salary of 7,163 EUR and household and children’s allowances Privileges for expatriate staff including expatriation and education allowances (where appropriate) and additional home leave Excellent private health insurance scheme Generous annual leave of 30 days plus official holidays NATO Pension Scheme Development programs such as professional training, wellbeing, and more


To learn more about NCI Agency and our work, please visit our website .

The NCI Agency prides itself on being an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to fostering an inclusive environment of mutual respect and value uniqueness and differences in gender, gender identity, race, ethnic or cultural origin, age, religion, sexual orientation and physical or neurocognitive ability.

Additional details on the conditions of application can be found via the NCI Agency career site.

Title: IT Desktop Support Intern
Description:
Do you want to build a better world? 
About Enfinity GlobalEnfinity Global is a purpose-driven company focused on making a positive impact on the planet by helping companies, governments, and individuals transition to a carbon-free and sustainable economy. Our role as a leading IPP is to develop, finance, build, operate, and own decarbonization assets in the long term in Europe, Asia, and the Americas through our offices in the USA, Spain, Italy, UK, Netherlands, India, and Japan.
Our team of over 350 Enfiniters comprises seasoned finance professionals, as well as experienced project developers and operators with extensive industry experience across all stages of the project life cycle. We pride ourselves on being creative and innovative solution providers to our customers and partners.
Job Description: Enfinity Global is looking for a motivated IT Desktop L2 Support Intern to join our IT team. This internship provides an opportunity to gain hands-on experience in troubleshooting, maintaining, and enhancing IT services within a dynamic work environment. The intern will assist in resolving escalated technical issues, supporting end-users, and improving IT operations. The ideal candidate will work alongside experienced professionals and contribute to the successful execution of software projects.

Title: IT-Student:in
Description:
Zur Verstärkung unseres Teams in Reutlingen suchen wir ab sofort einen Werkstudent (m/w/d) im Bereich Interne IT.
Warum iPoint für Dich die beste Wahl ist
Spannende IT Projekte: Du sammelst wertvolle Erfahrungen und unterstützt uns rund ums Thema IT an unserem Standort in Reutlingen.Maximale Flexibilität: Ob Mobile Office oder Working Abroad - Ortsunabhängige Arbeitsmodelle sind bei uns Standard. Dein Studium geht vor: Deine Arbeitszeiten bestimmst Du selbst.Bestärkendes Arbeitsumfeld: Durch punktgenaue Unterstützung sind wir jederzeit an Deiner Seite und immer für Dich da. Bei uns findest Du die perfekte Balance zwischen Teamarbeit und Eigenständigkeit.Wir fordern und fördern: Deine (Weiter)-Entwicklung liegt uns am Herzen.Wir feiern gemeinsam Erfolge: Firmen- und Teamevents sind uns wichtig, um die Gemeinschaft zu stärken.
Dein Profil
Du befindest dich in einem Bachelor- oder Masterstudium der Fachrichtung Informatik oder vergleichbar.Idealerweise hast Du bereits erste praktische Erfahrungen im Bereich IT sowie in der Behandlung von IT-Störungen gesammelt.Du verfügst über gute IT-Kenntnisse und ein ausgeprägtes technisches Verständnis.Du verfügst über gute Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse.Du hast Freude daran, eigene Ideen und Dein bisher erworbenes Wissen einzubringen.Du übernimmst Verantwortung für Deine Aufgaben und Projekte, die Du durch Deine Selbstständigkeit umsetzt.
Deine Aufgaben
Du verwaltest das IT Lager am Standort Reutlingen.Du analysierst und behebst Hardwareprobleme; auch in Zusammenarbeit mit unseren Dienstleistern.Du verwaltest das IT Inventar.Du richtest PCs, andere Geräte und die Arbeitsplätze ein.Du unterstützt den First-Level Helpdesk.
Wer wir sind
We exist to put power in the hands of people who are dedicated to advancing a safer, more sustainable future. 
Wir nutzen die Digitalisierung, um einen nachhaltigen Wandel herbeizuführen. Mit unserer kompetenten Software und unseren Dienstleistungen unterstützen wir international renommierte Unternehmen global nachhaltige und gesetzeskonforme Produkte herzustellen.

Deshalb braucht unser wachsendes Team von über 170 Experten Dich, Deine Fähigkeiten und Deine Begeisterung!

Title: Python Backend Software Engineer (f/m)
Description:
We’re the forever innovators. On a mission that goes beyond business. Securing digital ownership in a changing world. Unlocking true freedom. We’re revolutionaries.

Looking beyond today. Bridging excellence and pragmatism, with ambition and conviction,to push the limits of what’s possible. That’s what you’ll do here, in this playground of innovation. With leadership and trust, you’ll write the rules of new technology, and create products that redefine security in a digital age.

Founded in 2014, Ledger is the global platform for digital assets and Web3. Over 20% of the world’s crypto assets are secured through our Ledger Nanos. Headquartered in Paris and Vierzon, with offices in UK, US, Switzerland and Singapore, Ledger has a team of more than 500 professionals developing a variety of products and services to enable individuals and companies to securely buy, store, swap, grow and manage crypto assets – including the Ledger hardware wallets line with more than 6 millions units already sold in 200 countries.

Join our Ledger Recover team as a talented Senior Software Engineer and play a key role in building and maintaining the infrastructure and backend systems that ensure the secure recovery of digital assets. This opportunity requires a strong security focus, familiarity with hardware integration (including HSMs), and the ability to work across both software and infrastructure layers.

You'll be a vital part of a highly collaborative, cross-functional team dedicated to delivering the Ledger Recover product.

The Team Includes

 2 Frontend Engineers focusing on crafting seamless and secure user interfaces. 2 Backend Engineers ensuring scalable and secure API and infrastructure solutions. 1 QA Engineer driving quality and resilience across the product. 1 Product Manager defining the vision and roadmap for Ledger Recover. 1 Engineering Manager supporting and guiding the team to achieve its goals.


Your mission

Design, develop, and maintain secure backend services using Python and FastAPI for the Ledger Recover product.Implement and enhance testing frameworks with pytest to ensure robustness and security of code.Collaborate with the hardware team to integrate software with HSMs and other security devices.Build and maintain cloud infrastructure using AWS, Kubernetes, and Helm, ensuring high availability and security compliance.Enhance the security posture of the Ledger Recover system, including implementing best practices for cryptographic operations.Support quality assurance processes, identifying vulnerabilities and addressing potential threats.Optional - Develop and test frontend tools using TypeScript, Next.js, and Playwright to support user interactions


What we're looking for

Proficiency in Python 3 with experience in frameworks like FastAPI, coupled with a solid understanding of security principles (cryptography, secure system design).Proficient in secure code development and testing using pytest, with knowledge of infrastructure tools like AWS, Kubernetes, and Helm.Experience with security-focused QA processes, ensuring system resilience.Strong problem-solving skills and a security-first mindset, with excellent communication and collaboration abilities.Full professional proficiency in English.A passion for innovation and secure technology development.Familiarity with microservice architecture concepts.Nice to have:Understanding of HSMs and their integration into software solutions.Familiarity with frontend development (TypeScript, Next.js) and end-to-end testing tools (Playwright).Prior experience in the blockchain or crypto domain.


What's in it for you

Equity: Employees are the foundation of our success, and we award stock options so you can share in that success as we grow. Flexibility: A hybrid work policy.Social: Annual company outing for Ledgerdary Days, plus frequent social events, snacks and drinksMedical: Comprehensive health insurance policy offering extensive medical, dental and vision care coverage. Well-being: Personal development, coaching & fitness with our dedicated partners.Vacation: Five weeks of paid leave per year, in addition to national holidays and rest & relaxation (RTT) days.High tech: Access to high performance office equipment and gadgetsTransport: Ledger reimburses part of your preferred means of transportation. Discounts: Employee discount on all our products.


We are an equal opportunity employer for all without any distinction of gender, ethnicity, religion, sexual orientation, social status, disability or age.
Skill: 7 of 10 skills match your profile - you may be a good fit
Company Description:
Founded in Paris in 2014, LEDGER is a global platform for digital assets and Web3. Ledger is already the world leader in Critical Digital Asset security and utility.  With more than 6M devices sold to consumers in 200 countries and 10+ languages, 100+ financial institutions and brands as customers, 20% of the world’s crypto assets are secured, plus services supporting trading, buying, spending, earning, and NFTs. LEDGER’s products include: Ledger Stax, Nano S Plus, Nano X hardware wallets, LEDGER Live companion app, [ LEDGER ] Market, the world’s first secure-minting and first-sale distribution platform, and Ledger Enterprise. With its ease of use, LEDGER allows a user to begin investing in digital assets and ultimately, achieve financial freedom in a safe and stress-free environment.

Headquartered in Paris and Vierzon, with offices in London, New York and Singapore, Ledger has a team of more than 900 professionals developing a variety of products and services to enable individuals and companies to securely buy, store, swap, grow and manage crypto assets – including more than 6 millions devices already sold in 180 countries. 

Ledger combines either Nano S Plus or Nano X and the Ledger Live app to offer consumers the easiest way to start their crypto journey while maintaining full control over their digital assets. With its ease of use, Ledger allows users to begin investing in digital assets and ultimately, achieve financial freedom in a safe and stress-free environment, with education provided by its Ledger Academy and Quest. 

In addition to consumer products, Ledger has also developed Ledger Enterprise, a digital asset custody and security solution for institutional investors and financial players.

Title: Servicecoördinator
Description:
Uitbreiding van ons serviceteam
Na de verkoop en installatie van een hoogwaardige en innovatief videobewakingssysteem wordt deze overgedragen aan onze serviceorganisatie. Als Service Coördinator ben je het centrale aanspreekpunt voor onze klanten, monteurs en interne afdelingen en zorg je voor een efficiënt en succesvol gebruik van deze klantinstallatie op het gebied van techniek, service en onderhoud. Je zorgt ervoor dat alle serviceprocessen soepel verlopen en dat klantvragen snel en professioneel worden afgehandeld.

Wat verwachten we van je:
Coördineren en plannen van service- en onderhoudswerkzaamheden aan videobewakingssystem.Verwerken van storingsmeldingen en klantaanvragen voor onderhoud en reparaties van videobewakingssystem.Fungeren als eerste aanspreekpunt voor klanten bij technische vragen of problemen met hun videobewakingssystem.Inplannen van monteurs en zorgen voor een efficiënte inzet van personeel en middelen.Bewaken van de voortgang van werkzaamheden en zorgen voor tijdige en kwalitatieve afhandeling van serviceverzoeken.Proactief adviseren van klanten over verbeteringen of upgrades van hun videobewaking oplossingen.Opstellen en controleren van service-rapportages en het nauwkeurig verwerken van administratieve gegevens in het systeem.

Wie ben je:
Je hebt een afgeronde HBO-opleiding, bij voorkeur in de richting van Technische Bedrijfskunde, Elektrotechniek, ICT of Beveiligingstechniek.Je hebt ervaring in een vergelijkbare coördinerende rol binnen een servicegerichte organisatie.Je beschikt over uitstekende communicatieve vaardigheden en kunt snel schakelen tussen verschillende partijen.Je hebt affiniteit met video/beveiliging;Je hebt een goed organisatorisch en analytisch vermogen, en weet snel en effectief oplossingen te bedenken.Je bent klantgericht en oplossingsgericht met een hands-on mentaliteit.Ervaring met ERP-systemen of servicemanagementsoftware is een pré.Je beheerst de Nederlandse en Engelse taal uitstekend, zowel in woord als geschrift.

Wat bieden we je:
Een veelzijdige en uitdagende functie binnen een jonge, professionele en dynamische organisatie gespecialiseerd in beveiligingstechniek.Een marktconform salaris met goede secundaire arbeidsvoorwaarden, zoals een pensioenregeling, reiskostenvergoeding en opleidingsmogelijkheden.Mogelijkheden voor verdere specialisatie in beveiligings- en CCTV-technologieën.Een informele en collegiale werkomgeving waar ruimte is voor eigen initiatief en groei.Veel verantwoordelijkheid en vrijheid om serviceprocessen te optimaliseren en klanttevredenheid te verhogen.
Wanneer kom je op gesprek?

Vulnerability Analyst Contract Role
Job description and skills
Conduct vulnerability assessments, identify system weaknesses, and recommend remediation strategies to minimize risk exposure.Lead team meetings to streamline the vulnerability remediation process, ensuring efficient communication and timely resolution of security issues.Usage of Splunk for monitoring and reporting (with SPL - Search Processing Language), improving detection rules and creating dashboards to enhance security visibility and incident response.Conduct security awareness training for various teams, providing actionable guidance to remediate identified vulnerabilities and delivering clear explanations of their potential impact.Configure tools such as Burp, Nessus, and Nexpose.Creation of weekly vulnerability scan reports.Provide threat intelligence and reports to appropriate teams.Facilitate team meetings to ensure smooth vulnerability remediation.Assist in creating QRadar Rules for detection rules based on specific incident scenarios or threat vectors (e.g., brute force attacks, data exfiltration)Assist in creating QRadar rules with the MITRE ATT&CK framework to identify tactics, techniques, and procedures (TTPs) used by attackers.API and Python ScriptingFamiliarity with CVE, CVSS, EPSSParticipation in the definition of security baselinesProvide activity reports to management to demonstrate service SLA and service quality
