Title: Cyber Security IAM Analyst
Description:
Job Description

A Identity and Access Management (IAM) Analyst is to work with various departments within our organization. Drive identity and access control initiatives to support policies, regulatory compliance, and industry standards.

You will belong to our Cyber Security Engineering unit and be a part of our IAM Center of Excellence team.

This position involves working closely with stakeholders and IAM teams. Gathering requirements and translate them into IAM functions for implementation. Your role will focus on providing expertise and guidance to various business units. You will also get to collaborate with and focus on different aspects of IAM, e.g. analyst, engineer, and administrator. 

Key Responsibilities :

Work with stakeholders to identify and document new requirements for the IAM system. Identify opportunities for improving the IAM strategy, policies and processes Coach other members of the organization on the best practices that should be followed in identity and access management. Collaborate with IAM teams to analyze how new requirements impact existing systems and processes, identifying potential risks and challenges.Assess and document IAM processes and procedures to ensure they comply with company policies and security standards.Maintain and update IAM documentation, including user manuals and policies.


Qualifications

To be successful in the role as a Functional IAM analyst, we believe you are a strong driver for IAM process change and implementation initiatives. You have a high attention to details and accuracy in documentation. We also believe that you can manage and prioritize multiple administrative tasks simultaneously and to analyze complex requirements and develop effective solutions.

What your need to succeed:

2+ years of experience working in IAM solutions with a more administrative focus that concentrates on processes and administration rather than technical details.Experience with Saviynt as an IGA tool or with other similar tools Application of Identity Governance Administration processes Application of cyber security principles such as Least Privilege and Separation of Duties Atlassian knowledge, Jira and Confluence.Ability to communicate effectively with various stakeholders and teams.


Good to have:

Experience in creating and maintaining documentation describing new requirements, implementation plans, and changes in the IAM environment. Experience in planning and executing projects, including requirements gathering, development, and implementation.


Additional Information

This is a fulltime permanent position, starting as soon as possible according to agreement. The role is a hybrid position, based in our office in Stockholm, Sweden. Unfortunately relocation is not offered for this role.

Apply by sending in your CV in English as soon as possible. Due to data policies, we only accept applications through career page.

We are eager to meet you! 😊

Working with tech at H&M Group   

Shaping the future of fashion with people, data, and tech. The fashion and retail industries are going through a transformation, driven by customers' technology and sustainability expectations. At H&M Group, we want to shape the future of fashion and lifestyle by harnessing the power of smart tech and data. With our 74-year history of innovation, we understand the need to collaborate and co-create with engineers and tech specialists around the world to achieve our vision.  

You are joining a unique value-driven culture, a large tech network and community where you can be yourself. Besides the obvious perks such as staff discount cards, flexible work life, learning communities, wellness benefits, parental benefits etc. There are endless opportunities to experiment and grow in any direction that you want, and when you grow, we grow. Being a major player gives us countless opportunities to make a real impact and shape the future.   H&M Group is a value-driven company that wants to lead the way to a more inclusive environment. We are committed to creating an inclusive & diverse workplace with a dynamic and innovative culture. We welcome your application regardless of who you are, where you’re from and what you like. We welcome applicants with different backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. We welcome all applicants to strengthen our innovative and diverse culture.   


Benefits At H&M

We offer all our employees at H&M Group attractive benefits with extensive development opportunities around the globe. All our employees receive a staff discount card, usable on all our H&M Group brands in stores and online. Brands covered by the discount are H&M (Beauty and Move included), COS, Weekday, Monki, H&M HOME, & Other Stories, ARKET, Afound. In addition to our staff discount, all our employees are included in our H&M Incentive Program – HIP. You can read more about our H&M Incentive Program here.

In addition to our global benefits, all our local markets offer different competitive perks and benefits. Please note that they may differ between employment type and countries.

Inclusion & Diversity

H&M is a part of H&M Group. At H&M Group, we’re determined to create and maintain inclusive, diverse and equitable workplaces throughout our organisation. Our teams should consist of a variety of people that share and combine their knowledge, experience and ideas. Having a diverse workforce leads to a positive impact on how we address challenges, on what we perceive possible and on how we choose to relate to our colleagues and customers all over the world. Hence all diversity dimensions are taken into consideration in our recruitment process.

We strive to have a fair and equal process and therefore kindly ask you not to attach a cover letter in your application as they often contain information that easily can trigger unintentional biases.

Title: Senior Fullstack Security/Software Engineer
Description:
About Us:At UBITECH, we’re at the forefront of digital innovation, developing secure, reliable solutions that empower organizations worldwide. Recognized as one of the best workplaces in Greece, we’re committed to creating an environment where our team members can thrive, collaborate, and make a difference.
The Security and Trusted Computing Group at UBITECH conducts interdisciplinary research in most aspects of computer and information security, ranging from advanced cryptography and access control mechanisms, for ensuring secrecy and authentication in todays’ communications, to the design, analysis and implementation of novel protection mechanisms for enhanced security, privacy, trustworthiness, and reliability in numerous emerging IoT applications. Through methods such as applied cryptography, hardware enhanced security, modelling and security analysis of systems, and verification, we are building security into new technology, providing assurance to the user that they are interacting with a trusted platform. Our research focuses on cryptography; trusted computing; secure communications; privacy and authentication; and security verification – with applications in, e.g., automotive, future Internet and 5G, smart grid, healthcare, e Payment, etc.
Responsibilities and Preferred Qualifications: Extensive experience developing reasonably complex, high-quality software and maintaining service and testing environments. This also includes the design of security solutions best suited for achieving a specific set of requirements – drive the identification of most appropriate technologies to use (i.e., Intrusion Detection, Firewall Configuration, etc.); Analyze security requirements and apply industry-recognized methodologies to translate them into effective security controls; Experience with Typescript, React, and Node.js is a plus; Experience with cloud native applications and orchestration including Kubernetes; Web- and Cloud-relevant, such as Java, Ruby, Rust, Go, Python, PHP, C#, Lua, and JavaScript; Experience with the technologies regarding cloud service provision and the security features they provide (Key & Secret management, IAM, Service Accounts, Workload / VM Identities, TLS / PKI, Load Balancing, storage encryption, data localization, etc.). Experience with application authentication, authorization, identity, access management, and secrets management technologies, such as OAuth, MFA, SSO, JWT, PKI, Cloud IAM, Password-less authentication, Wazhu, etc. Experience with cloud confidential computing, virtualization, enclaves, containers, and workload attestation technologies. Proven track record of writing robust unit, integration, and E2E tests.What we offer:Flexibility: Hybrid model to maintain a healthy work-life balanceContinuous Learning: Learning budget and ongoing training opportunitiesOffsite Trip and Team Socials: Team trip to a secret destination once per yearPrivate Health Insurance: Private health insurance on the company's group program;Workplace: Pleasant work-space with a fun and relaxing playroom;Health: Gym discount;Personal Development: A great opportunity to grow and work with the most amazing people in the industry;Team: Being part of a friendly environment which at the same time offers challenging goals.

Company Description:
The Akelius Languages Online gGmbH develops a
digital language application.
Anyone can use the language course for free to learn a new language, 
independent of their language skills or other languages they speak.
The language course is a cooperation between the
Akelius Foundation and UNICEF,
produced through us as a subsidiary.
The language project started in 2015 during the
European migrant crisis.
Roger Akelius wanted to provide fast and unbureaucratic help for the more than 163,000 immigrants coming to Sweden.
The idea was to help refugees learn the local
language when settling in their new country.
Not being able to communicate in the language of the host country is a huge barrier to integration.
To help solve this problem on a larger scale, we started an official partnership with UNICEF in 2017.

We now offer the language course in English, French, German, Greek, Italian, Portuguese, Russian, Spanish, Swedish and Polish.
We added Polish in 2022 as an emergency response to the war in Ukraine, 
to help refugee children to prepare for their school start in Poland.
So far, the language course has been used in UNICEF educational projects in Greece, Lebanon, Mauritania, Italy, Bosnia Herzegovina, Serbia, Albania, Mexico and Kazakhstan.
São Tomé and Príncipe and Cape Verde began the implementation of the language course in 2022.
The courses are offered in refugee camps, learning centers and more recently in governmental schools as well.
In 2023 teaching English in monastic education in Bhutan kicked off.

The language course is available online on
computers, tablets and smartphones.
The Android application can be downloaded from
the PlayStore and then used online or offline.

Our colleagues in both Berlin and Nicosia offices work passionately to support the development of our online and analog products as well as our partners.
Specialties: E-Learning,Language learning

Title: Data Team - Data Governance Specialist
Description:
The Wow
The Data Governance Specialist is a key role in the application and implementation of the data governance strategy, where the goal is to enable data to be democratised and the company to become more data-driven.
 
A taster of what you will be involved with 

Oversee the implementation of the data governance strategy, including data and business catalogues, master data management, metadata management, and data classification.
Ownership of the data governance tool including maintenance and adaptation to business needs.
Collaborate closely with cross-functional teams, including data engineers, analysts, and product managers, to understand data requirements and facilitate smooth data operations.
Assist in the development and ensuring adherence to data governance policies, procedures, standards, and best practices.
Ensure compliance with data protection regulations and industry standards whilst aligning to business needs.
Assist in the data maturity assessment and development of roadmap to improve maturity.
Help stakeholders grow in the data governance area through training plans, mentoring, and information sessions.

 
What we are looking for

3+ years of experience in a similar role involving data governance.
Bachelors degree in computer science or related field.
Strong understanding of data governance principles, frameworks, and best practices.
Experience of building a data catalogue including business glossary and business terms.
Broad knowledge of data quality, data integration, data lifecycle, databases and data warehousing solutions.
Experience with mapping data lineage.
Familiarity with data privacy regulations, including GDPR, and data security standards.
Experience in the iGaming industry is considered a plus.
Experience with data quality and data governance tools and methodologies, including data validation and profiling.
Experience with managing a Data Governance Tool (e.g. Collibra, Atlan, OvalEdge)
Familiarity with Data Integration tools such as Apache NiFi and orchestration tools such as Apache Airflow.Proficiency with issue tracking tools like JIRA and documentation platforms like Confluence
Effective communication skills, both verbal and written, with the ability to clearly document and communicate data quality results and issues.
Excellent collaboration skills, with the ability to work cross-functionally with business, tech, and data engineering teams, and lead working groups.
Self-starter mindset, analytical approach, and positive "can-do" attitude.

 
What we offer
Much like riding a rollercoaster, sometimes life at Betsson can be lightning fast with twists and turns but always FUN! Then again, what else would you expect from a business 75% millennial and 1700 strong, spread across 7 offices with 900 based out of our Malta HQ alone! We recognise it may not be for the faint-hearted, but if you’re a go-getter, initiator and adrenaline junkie, always striving to push the boundaries and challenge yourself, then you’ll fit right in.
 
Challenge accepted?
By submitting your application, you understand that your personal data will be processed as set out in our Privacy Policy

Title: Power BI Specialist
Description:
We currently have a vacancy for a Power BI Specialist fluent in English, to offer his/her services as an expert who will be based in Austria. In the context of the first assignment, the successful candidate will be integrated with the Development team of the company that will closely cooperate with a major client's IT team on site. 
Your tasks Design, develop, and deploy interactive Power BI reports and dashboards; Write, analyze and optimize SQL queries, including creating views and functions for performance efficiency; Implement best practices in data modelling and database design to enhance reporting efficiency; Migrate and optimize reports from Tableau to Power BI, ensuring accuracy and efficiency; Utilize DAX to manipulate and prepare data for visualizations, particularly geospatial analysis and maps.

 University degree in in Software Engineering or related subject combined with relevant IT professional experience of 10 years; Minimum 5 years of experience in design, development, and deployment of Power BI Reports; Minimum 3 years of experience in querying RDBMS databases including creation of views and functions; Experience in connecting Power BI reports to various data sources such as on-premise SQL Server, Azure cloud database, Google analytics, MS Excel files, SharePoint Lists and APIs; Experience of deploying reports for integration on Public Websites and intranet sites; Experience in preparing data using DAX in Power BI and other means for use in Visualizations especially Maps; In-depth understanding of data modelling and database design; Ability to analyze existing Tableau reports with existing data sources and recommend improvements while transitioning to Power BI; Ability to write and optimize queries to improve performance efficiency; Excellent command of the English language.

Title: Full stack Developer (Full remote) - INDUSTRY 4.0 - IT
Description:
Ruolo: Middle Fullstack Developer
Luogo: Full remote dall'Italia

ALTEN supporta le strategie di sviluppo dei propri clienti nelle aree dell’innovazione, della R&D e dei sistemi informativi tecnologici.
Nato più di 30 anni fa e presente in 30 Paesi, il Gruppo ALTEN si è affermato come leader mondiale nell’ingegneria e nei Servizi IT e leader Europeo per la consulenza nell'industria Life Sciences.Lavoriamo con attori chiave nei settori: Aeronautico &Spaziale, della Difesa & Navale, della Sicurezza, Automobilistico, Ferroviario, dell’Energia, del Life Sciences, Finanziario, del Retail e dei Servizi.
Con un fatturato di oltre 4.069 miliardi di euro, abbiamo attualmente più di 57.400 collaboratori in tutto il mondo. In Italia siamo presenti in 12 città lungo tutto il territorio nazionale: Torino, Milano, Gallarate, Brescia, Genova, Modena, Maranello, Bologna, Firenze, Roma, Napoli e Bari.

Di cosa ti occuperai:
Svilupperai e manterrai applicazioni web scalabili utilizzando Node.js per il backend e Angular per il frontend;Collaborerai con il team di sviluppo per progettare, testare e implementare nuove funzionalità;Ottimizzerai il codice per garantire alte prestazioni e sicurezza delle applicazioni;Parteciperai alle code review e contribuirai a migliorare le best practice aziendali;Integrerai API RESTful e lavorerai con database relazionali e NoSQL;Ti occuperai della gestione del ciclo di vita del software, dalla progettazione alla messa in produzione;Lavorerai in un ambiente Agile/Scrum, partecipando a stand-up meeting e sprint planning.
Requisiti:
Esperienza di almeno 3 anni nello sviluppo Full Stack con Node.js e Angular;Ottima conoscenza di JavaScript/TypeScript e dei principali framework/librerie;Esperienza con database SQL e NoSQL (es. PostgreSQL, MongoDB);Conoscenza di strumenti di versioning come Git;Esperienza con RESTful API e integrazione di servizi esterni;Buona comprensione di architetture scalabili e modulari.

Perché scegliere ALTEN?
Technological challengesCrediamo che la tecnologia abbia un grande potenziale per migliorare il nostro futuro, per questo ricerchiamo talenti che siano motivati a costruire oggi il mondo di domani. Con il nostro portfolio clienti e i diversi progetti di R&D attivi, in ALTEN avrai modo di lavorare su progetti all'avanguardia. La nostra Technical Direction ti accompagnerà e indirizzerà durante il tuo percorso. Avrai la possibilità di metterti alla prova in contesti progettuali diversi e di confrontarti con esperti del settore per ampliare sempre più le tue conoscenze. Potrai unire le tue passioni e metterti in gioco professionalmente. Accetti la sfida?
Inspiring TogethernessCi impegniamo a favorire un ambiente di lavoro sereno e collaborativo organizzando attività di team building, iniziative di aggregazione, eventi sportivi, per conoscerci meglio e condividere momenti insieme. Il successo di un gruppo si fonda sulla cooperazione e condivisione reciproca del sapere e degli interessi.
Fulfilling OpportunitiesIn ALTEN troverai corsi formativi all’avanguardia per accrescere le tue competenze sia tecnologiche, sia linguistiche! Tramite ALTEN Academy potrai ottenere certificazioni con alcuni dei più importanti schemi internazionali come IREB®, ISTQB® e altri. Attraverso Aula Streaming, invece, avrai accesso a corsi di formazione più trasversali relativi a soft skills e potrai scegliere tra 12 corsi di lingua straniera.
Sustainable commitmentCrediamo che la tecnologia sia a supporto dello sviluppo sociale e della tutela ambientale. Oltre a collaborare a progetti che mirano alla sostenibilità, ci impegniamo a sostenere le cause che più abbiamo a cuore, avendo collaborato e collaborando, tra gli altri, con AISM, AIRC, LILT, Save the Children, Treedom, This Unique. Valorizziamo l'unicità e ci impegniamo a garantire che tutte le nostre persone abbiano pari opportunità all'interno della nostra azienda, fornendo loro gli strumenti per esprimere al massimo il proprio potenziale. Il nostro approccio alla diversità e all'inclusione si fonda sui principi di etica e integrità e rappresenta il fattore determinante per lo sviluppo di orizzonti di crescita personale e aziendale più ampi. Promuoviamo l'inserimento e l'integrazione lavorativa delle persone appartenenti alle categorie protette - in base a quanto disciplinato dalla legge 68/99.
I prossimi step:Una volta ricevuto il tuo cv, ci prenderemo il tempo necessario per valutarlo attentamente.
Se sarà in linea con questa o con altre posizioni aperte all’interno del Gruppo, il nostro team Talent Acquisition ti contatterà telefonicamente.
L’iter di selezione proseguirà con un colloquio conoscitivo con l'area Business, un successivo colloquio più approfondito, durante il quale potrebbe essere richiesto un test pratico, ed infine un colloquio tecnico.
L’ordine e il numero delle interviste potrebbero variare a seconda delle esigenze di selezione.
In alternativa, saremo felici di conservare il tuo CV nel nostro gestionale per poterlo rivalutare per opportunità future. Operando in 12 diverse città e altrettanti settori, potrebbero contattarti più Talent Acquisition Partner e/o più Business Manager, se riterranno che il tuo profilo sia in linea con i progetti e le necessità che stanno ricercando in quel momento.
Se dovessi identificare ulteriori offerte di tuo interesse e in linea con il tuo profilo, aspettiamo la tua candidatura per poterla valutare nuovamente.
ALTEN opera nel rispetto dei principi di diversità, equità ed inclusione, che alimentano i nostri valori. ALTEN ha l’obiettivo di abbattere ogni barriera e pregiudizio, garantendo un ambiente di lavoro accessibile ed accogliente, valutando candidature indipendentemente da genere, etnia, disabilità (artt. 1 e 18, legge 68/99), età, orientamento sessuale, religione, stato civile, convinzioni personali e politiche, appartenenza ad organizzazioni sindacali, responsabilità familiari e back-ground socio-economico.
Company Description:
Il Gruppo ALTEN, leader europeo nella consulenza per le tecnologie avanzate in campo ingegneristico e ICT, è quotato alla Borsa di Parigi e vanta più di 57.000 collaboratori in più di 30 Paesi nel mondo. 

In Italia ALTEN è presente su tutto il territorio nazionale con più di 4.500 collaboratori e uffici collocati in diverse città italiane, tra cui Milano, Gallarate, Brescia, Torino, Genova, Bologna, Modena, Maranello, Firenze, Roma, Napoli e Bari. 

ALTEN si propone al mercato con servizi legati al mondo dell’ingegneria, dell’information technology, delle telecomunicazioni e del life sciences, con numerosi centri di eccellenza tra cui: digital, business intelligence, testing, formazione (ALTEN Academy), ITSM, IoT, hw, sw embedded, quality e CSV. 

La forza di ALTEN si fonda sulla competenza e professionalità dei profili tecnici e manageriali, che vengono selezionati e formati con percorsi strutturati e replicati anche all’interno dell’ALTEN Academy, che eroga corsi di formazione e certificazione anche verso l’esterno.
Specialties: IT Division,Techno Division,Telecommunications Division

Title: Graduate Program - Junior Application Support Analyst
Description:
Are you passionate about technology and want to discover how project management in project delivery, fuels innovation in managing payments and fosters business excellence? Do you want to work in a multinational, multidisciplinary environment with open opportunities for international mobility? If yes, you are welcome to contact us! Ready to kickstart your career's journey with Euronet's Horizon Graduate Program?
At Euronet, we believe in technology as an enabler of change and growth. We are passionate about innovation that supports expansion through new products and new markets around the world with a human-led and tech-powered approach. We always cater for the needs of businesses and consumers as they evolve in a very dynamic and changing payments landscape. The Horizon Graduate Program is an initiative of Euronet to invite University graduates to join our company for an initial period of 6 months, under a paid employment contract. You will work as an integral part of our teams under the leadership of experienced managers that value your work and solve meaningful problems. Upon completion of this initial period, the opportunity for an open-ended employment could be offered for selected candidates that showcase excellence and wish to work in a multi-national organization.
What you'll do:  Fully understand the services and the technical and operation requirements of the supported Back Office Applications. Ensure the supported application error free and secure operation and resolve production incidents. Application support includes - incident resolution, user support, regular maintenance, version upgrade, change implementation.  Participate and/or coordinate application enhancement and new development and commercial project implementations.  Provide ad-hoc on-call support and cooperate with internal departments and with external Software providers. 


Requirements


What you'll need:  IT University studies in the last academic year OR freshly graduated  Full-time employment for 6 month period: Successful candidates who perform well during the six-months program could be offered open-ended employment. Title: Graduate Data Scientist
Description:
Company Description

Wise is a global technology company, building the best way to move and manage the world’s money.

Min fees. Max ease. Full speed.

Whether people and businesses are sending money to another country, spending abroad, or making and receiving international payments, Wise is on a mission to make their lives easier and save them money.

As part of our team, you will be helping us create an entirely new network for the world's money.

For everyone, everywhere.

Job Description

More about our mission and what we offer.

Role/Programme

As a Graduate Data Scientist, you’ll join our Data Science team in September 2025. This full-time role offers a chance to make a meaningful impact and kickstart your career. You’ll be onboarded with the global Graduate cohort in one of our offices and learn the basics of being a Wiser.

How You’ll Make an Impact: In this role, you will:

Help take Wise to the next level as we scale to impact 100’s of millions more customersYou will work directly on projects that impact our customers and will help us prioritize the most significant improvements to our products with their convenience and trust in mindParticipate in building industry-proven machine learning based solutions and find opportunities to experiment with state-of-the-art algorithms

Growth And Development

At Wise, we believe in continuous learning and development. You will have access to:

Data Science training and onboarding - introduction to the data science tools and terminology we use at Wise.Mentorship/ buddy programme - you will have a buddy assigned to you to give you as much possible connection with people who know what you’re going through!

Qualifications

What You’ll Bring:

You are Graduating in 2024 or 2025 with a Bachelor’s or Master’s degree, potentially in Computer Science or any other STEM subject. However, a degree in a technical field is not a must as our selection process prioritises your skills.Ready to start full-time in September 2025.Knowledge of computer science and machine learning fundamentals including data structures, algorithms, data analysis, linear algebra and statisticsYou should have a good command of Python 3 and SQL and be familiar with major data analysis and ML frameworks such as Pandas, Scikit-Learn and MLFlowA self-started side project(s) that you are proud to talk aboutGreat communication skills and the ability to articulate complex, technical concepts to a non-technical audienceEligible to work in Tallinn

Additional Information

Why You’ll Love Working Here?

🏠You will have flexibility in how and where you work. We understand everyone needs a little something different - so we’ll do our best to make it happen, but we recommend coming to the office as much as possible in your first months!

🌍 Mobile Wiser: After six months with Wise, you can work from anywhere (up to 90 days)

🌴Paid Sabbatical leave, Me days, Volunteering day plus your annual vacation days

💚Compassionate leaves

📈Professional and development annual budget

🍽️Weekly/Bi-weekly office lunch and breakfast, coffee, tea and snacks!

💸Gross Monthly Salary of 3,000 EUR with an RSU Package

🏢Fun and creative offices with social activities

💚Embrace global connection during Mission Day

🌟Be part of a global team with a global mindset

💥Have a real impact. Solve real customer problems

For more details on location-specific benefits, please check here.

If you are excited about this opportunity and you’re confident in your abilities but don’t hit every mark on our list, we still want to hear from you! Don’t hesitate to apply by submitting your updated resume! 

For everyone, everywhere. We're people building money without borders — without judgement or prejudice, too. We believe teams are strongest when they are diverse, equitable and inclusive.

We're proud to have a truly international team, and we celebrate our differences.

Inclusive teams help us live our values and make sure every Wiser feels respected, empowered to contribute towards our mission and able to progress in their careers.

If you want to find out more about what it's like to work at Wise visit Wise.Jobs.

Keep up to date with life at Wise by following us on LinkedIn and Instagram.

Title: Associate, IT, Data Engineer
Description:
Company Description

MUFG Investor Services provides asset servicing solutions to the global investment management industry. Leveraging the financial and intellectual capital of MUFG – one of the largest banks in the world with $2.8 trillion in assets – we provide clients access to a range of leading solutions from fund administration, middle-office outsourcing, custody, foreign exchange, trustee services and depository to securities lending and other banking services.

With a diverse and dynamic network of offices across the globe, MUFG Investor Services provides challenging and rewarding careers. We achieve this by offering continuous learning and development, collaborative team work environment, promotion of work-life integration, and exposure to a wide variety of work.

Imagine your future at MUFG Investor Services where you can grow professionally, in a diverse and inclusive workplace that rewards your contribution.

Job Description

As a data engineer in MUFG, your roles and responsibilities would typically include:

Data Infrastructure Management: Designing, building, and maintaining the data infrastructure, including databases, and data pipelines, to ensure efficient data storage and retrieval. ETL (Extract, Transform, Load) Development: Developing and implementing ETL processes to extract data from various sources, transform it into a consistent format, and load it into the data ecosystem for analysis. Data Integration: Integrating data from different systems and sources, including internal databases and external APIs, to create a unified view of the organization's financial data. Data Quality and Governance: Ensuring data quality, integrity, and security by implementing data governance processes, data validation, and data cleansing procedures. Performance Optimization: Optimizing data infrastructure and processing pipelines to enhance data processing speed and overall system performance. Real-time Data Processing: Implementing real-time data processing solutions to handle streaming financial data for time-sensitive applications like trading platforms or fraud detection. Data Security and Privacy: Implementing security measures to protect sensitive financial data from unauthorized access and complying with data privacy regulations. Collaborative Work: Collaborating with product owners, business analysts, data analysts, data scientists, and other stakeholders to understand data requirements and provide them with reliable and accessible data. 

Qualifications

Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or a related technical field or equivalent experience.1 - 3 years of commercial experience ETL tools (experience with Apache NiFi will be considered an advantage).Experience with programming languages such as Python will be considered as advantage.Experience in data-related process controls.Experience working with a team of developers using agile methodologies to achieve planned process deliverables.High level of accuracy and attention to detail.Demonstrate commitment to providing customer-focused quality service.Excellent verbal and written communication in English.Good teamwork and collaboration skills.

Additional Information

At MUFG Investor Services, we are exceptionally proud of our approach to Hybrid Working. It enables the flexibility to thrive from wherever our employees work and, stay connected to their team and our culture. When we make Hybrid Working plans, we get to know the individual and pride ourselves in underpinning all our decisions with fairness and consistency.

MUFG Investor Services provides all of its employees with an extremely attractive compensation package. In addition to base salary, there is a group medical insurance scheme, group pension scheme, reimbursement of professional subscriptions, paid holidays and assistance towards gym memberships.

We thank all candidates for applying; however, only those proceeding to the interview stage will be contacted. If you are contacted for a job opportunity, please advise us of any accommodations needed to ensure fair and equitable access throughout the recruitment and selection process. All accommodation information provided will be treated as confidential and used only to provide an accessible candidate experience.

MUFG is an equal opportunity employer.

Title: Data Protection Consultant
Description:
Heb jij een passie voor gegevensbescherming en privacy en wil je jouw ervaring inzetten in een innovatieve en dynamische omgeving? Als Data Protection Consultant speel je een sleutelrol in het waarborgen van de privacy en beveiliging van gevoelige informatie binnen complexe projecten.

Wat ga je doen?
Je ondersteunt organisaties bij het naleven van privacywetgeving zoals GDPR en adviseert hen over informatieveiligheid, risicomanagement en complianeJe ontwikkelt strategieën en geeft praktische aanbevelingen rond gegevensbescherming, rekening houdend met juridische, technische en organisatorische aspecten.Je bent een bruggenbouwer: je luistert naar stakeholders, vertaalt complexe onderwerpen naar duidelijke boodschappen en geeft opleidingen en sensibiliseringssessieJe volgt proactief ontwikkelingen in wet- en regelgeving, rechtspraak en best practices om altijd een stap voor te blijven.

Wie ben jij?
Ervaring en kennis: Je hebt minimaal 3 jaar ervaring in een relevante functie (bijvoorbeeld medewerker gegevensbescherming, privacy officer, DPO, advocaat of jurist). Affiniteit met IT, publiek recht en risicomanagement is een plus.Communicatief sterk: Je kan complexe materie helder uitleggen en aanpassen aan verschillende doelgroepen. Je bent overtuigend en weet standpunten te motiveren met gedegen analyses.Hands-on mentaliteit: Je blijft kalm onder druk, werkt nauwkeurig en schakelt moeiteloos tussen diverse stakeholders.Gepassioneerd door digitalisering: Je hebt een sterke interesse in informatisering en volgt de nieuwste trends op het gebied van gegevensbescherming op de voet.Certificaten in gegevensbescherming en goede IT-skills zijn een troef, evenals ervaring in een organisatie met een complex stakeholderlandschap.
Wat bieden wij?Een uitdagende functie met impact, waarin je een cruciale rol speelt bij het beschermen van privacy in een sterk gedigitaliseerde wereld.Werken in een vooruitstrevende en professionele omgeving met ruimte voor groei en ontwikkeling.De kans om samen te werken met gedreven professionals en complexe vraagstukken aan te pakken.
Ben jij klaar om jouw expertise in te zetten voor projecten die ertoe doen? Solliciteer vandaag en bouw mee aan een veilige digitale toekomst!

Title: Data Scientist (d/f/m)
Description:
Why us?

We believe that AI has the potential to revolutionize how cancer and other complex diseases are diagnosed and treated. We also believe that AI is a tool, not an identity – without access to high quality data and a scientifically rigorous, transparent approach to model development, AI is just a buzzword. That’s where we come in.

Aignostics is a spin-off from one of Europe's largest and most prestigious university hospitals (Charité), with employees in Berlin and New York. We have received over $50M in funding from leading investors and are a growing team of over 100 interdisciplinary professionals. We work with academic partners as well as leading global life sciences companies.

As a Data Scientist (d/f/m) at Aignostics, you work on interdisciplinary projects to push the state of the art of machine learning for digital pathology. Together with your colleagues you apply state-of-the-art machine learning techniques to solve complex real-world problems. You independently conduct rigorous experiments while also contributing well-designed features to our codebase.

This is a unique opportunity to join a fun, diverse, and growing team of 100+ data scientists, software developers, biologists, and pathologists to shape the next generation of cancer treatments. You will be part of a driven community that works in an agile, supportive and interdisciplinary research environment where your results make a difference to patients. In our established startup you have the opportunity to grow personally and technically, take responsibility and benefit from a dynamic work environment.

At Aignostics, we believe that fighting cancer is a job for people of all identities, backgrounds, and cultures. We value and celebrate diversity and inclusion and are committed to offering equal employment and promotion opportunities for all applicants and employees. Applicants will be considered regardless of their age, disability, ethnicity, race, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, religion, etc. We thrive through collaboration and believe the more inclusive we are, the better our work will be.

Where your expertise is needed 

Work on interdisciplinary projects connecting machine learning, software engineering and biomedical domain knowledgeApply and evaluate novel computer vision approaches for extracting insight from high-resolution biological imagesTransform proof-of-concept machine learning models into automated, tested and production-ready systemsClearly communicate your results

What We Are Looking For

Degree in a relevant field, e.g. Computer Science, Machine Learning or BioinformaticsEagerness to learn new technologies and excel in a complex spaceSolid theoretical foundations and 1-2 years of experience developing novel machine learning techniquesAdvanced skills in Python, Linux, cloud computing and machine learning software stacksExperience with development of deep learning models for computer vision Passion for clean code and high standards for quality assuranceExcellent communication and team working skills

Bonus points for

Exposure to biomedical data Experience in considering Information Security criteria under ISO 27001

We are still keen to hear from you if you don't match all the above points! Our needs are diverse and growing and you are encouraged to apply if you have any combination of these skills. The recruitment process is a comparative exercise and decisions will be made based on the applications we review at each time.

Our offer

Join a purpose-driven start up: We are working collectively to fight cancer and improve patient outcomes. Come help us make a difference!Cutting-edge AI research and development, with involvement of Charité, TU Berlin and our other partnersWork with a welcoming, diverse and highly international team of colleagues Opportunity to take responsibility and grow your role within the startupExpand your skills by benefitting from our Learning & Development yearly budget of 1,000€ (plus 2 L&D days), language classes and internal development programsMentoring program, you’ll learn from great expertsFlexible working hours and teleworking policyEnjoy your well-deserved time off within our 28 paid vacations days per yearWe are family & pet friendly and support flexible parental leave optionsPick a subsidized membership of your choice among public transport, sports and well-beingEnjoy our social gatherings, lunches, and off-site events for a fun and inclusive work environment

Join us to make a difference!

About Us

aignostics.com

Title: Data Engineer (12 Month Contract)
Description:
I'm looking for a Data Engineer (CONTRACTOR) in Barcelona, Spain.

Tasks & Responsibilities

* Design, develop, and maintain data pipelines to support data collection, transformation, and storage.
* Implement data integration workflows to consolidate data from various sources into a unified platform.
* Optimize and manage databases, ensuring scalability, reliability, and performance.
* Collaborate with data analysts and scientists to understand business needs and provide technical solutions.
* Monitor and troubleshoot data pipelines to identify and resolve issues promptly.
* Implement and maintain data governance and security policies.
* Develop and document processes to ensure compliance with data quality standards.

Data Engineer Resume Summary

* Data Pipeline Development: Build efficient ETL/ELT pipelines to process large-scale datasets.
* Database Management: Administer databases and data warehouses, optimizing storage and retrieval processes.
* Cloud Integration: Deploy and manage data solutions on cloud platforms like AWS, Azure, or Google Cloud.
* Programming Expertise: Proficient in Python, SQL, and frameworks like Apache Spark or Hadoop.
* Data Governance: Implement robust governance policies to ensure data security and compliance.
* Collaboration: Work closely with cross-functional teams to design and deliver scalable data solutions.
* Performance Monitoring: Analyze system performance and implement improvements to enhance efficiency.
* Innovation: Stay updated on emerging technologies and recommend tools to improve data processes.

Project Details

Role: Data Engineer (CONTRACTOR)Position: Data EngineerLocation: Barcelona, Spain (On-site with flexibility as needed)Duration: 12-month contractEngagement Type: Freelance/Interim ManagerIf you are interested or know someone who might be, feel free to reach out! Let's connect and explore this exciting opportunity!

Company Description:
Robert Walters is the world’s most trusted talent solutions business. Across the globe, we deliver recruitment, recruitment process outsourcing and advisory services to organisations of all shapes and sizes, opening doors for people with diverse skills, ambitions, and backgrounds.    

The businesses we partner with want to make things happen. And they need people to do it. They have goals. They have challenges. They want answers.   

We deliver the talent solutions they need to reach their goals. That might mean recruiting a permanent, temporary, or interim professional. It might mean putting together an outsourced team of 30 recruitment experts. Or it might mean reframing the way they think about remuneration or diversity.     

Whatever the solution, we deliver better experiences and higher quality outcomes by taking the time to listen to, and fully connect with, the people and organisations we partner with. Our ability to truly understand them and share their compelling stories is what sets us apart.   

By engaging with people's stories, we help organisations find the skills and solutions to succeed and assist talented professionals to power their unique potential.   

The biggest opportunities start with a story, tell us yours today.

Title: IT Security Specialist
Description:
Position Description

As an IT Security Specialist, you will play a key role in supporting our client within the automotive sector by ensuring robust server, network, and security management. Reporting to the Team Lead and Service Manager, you will work in a dynamic, hybrid environment to enhance the security posture of a large-scale project. You will address security vulnerabilities, maintain and improve security tools, and ensure compliance with security policies and standards.

Your future duties and responsibilities

 Proactively managing vulnerabilities and implementing remediations using tools such as Tenable or similar solutions. Analyzing and managing CERT advisories to address potential threats. Maintaining and remediating antivirus tools (e.g., Trellix, ESET, or comparable tools). Assisting in creating and maintaining SIEM use cases (e.g., Qradar or other SIEM platforms). Managing and securing Windows, Active Directory, and Unix systems. Applying and ensuring compliance with Information Security policies and standards. Delivering on time in a fast-paced and complex environment. Ensuring a seamless process flow across IT processes, logging, monitoring, application interfaces, and network connectivity.

Required Qualifications To Be Successful In This Role

 Proficiency or experience in some of the following areas: Vulnerability management tools (e.g., Tenable or similar). SIEM platforms (e.g., Qradar or equivalent). Antivirus tools (e.g., Trellix, ESET) or comparable solutions. Windows, Active Directory, and Unix environments. Detection tools (e.g. Plant Anomaly Detection, CheckPoint / TippingPoint IPS, FlowMon or similar Strong understanding of IT processes and security standards. A willingness and ability to learn new tools and technologies as needed.

Personal Skills:

 Strong communication skills with fluent English (spoken and written). Excellent analytical and troubleshooting skills. Team-oriented mindset, with the ability to collaborate and negotiate effectively. Proactive learner, adaptable to new technologies, processes, and skills. Flexible, self-motivated, and capable of thriving under pressure in diverse cultural environments.

Together, as owners, let’s turn meaningful insights into action.

Life at CGI is rooted in ownership, teamwork, respect and belonging. Here, you’ll reach your full potential because…

You are invited to be an owner from day 1 as we work together to bring our Dream to life. That’s why we call ourselves CGI Partners rather than employees. We benefit from our collective success and actively shape our company’s strategy and direction.

Your work creates value. You’ll develop innovative solutions and build relationships with teammates and clients while accessing global capabilities to scale your ideas, embrace new opportunities, and benefit from expansive industry and technology expertise.

You’ll shape your career by joining a company built to grow and last. You’ll be supported by leaders who care about your health and well-being and provide you with opportunities to deepen your skills and broaden your horizons.

Come join our team—one of the largest IT and business consulting services firms in the world.

Et bientôt sur de nouveaux territoires ! Notre mission ? Connecter les meilleurs talents aux entreprises pour leur donner un temps d’avance. Nous accompagnons nos clients dans l’intégralité de leurs besoins en transformation numérique à travers de nombreux domaines d’expertises : Software Engineering, Finance, Pilotage de projets, Devops, Data, Cloud, Cybersécurité ou encore Agilité. Intervenant aussi bien dans les secteurs de la Banque, de l'Assurance, des Télécommunications que de l'Industrie ou des Transports, aujourd'hui 40% des entreprises du CAC40 sont clientes Meritis.Fort de nos valeurs d’exigence, d’humilité, de bienveillance et de proximité, nous comptons aujourd’hui plus de 900 collaborateurs. Vous avez un diplôme d’ingénieur (Bac+5).Vous avez à minima 3 ans d'expérience professionnelle en développement.Vous êtes doté(e) d’une grande capacité d’adaptation.Vous savez faire preuve d’autonomie.Vous rêvez de progresser entouré(e) de personnes de tous niveaux d’expertise.Vous possédez un niveau d’anglais confirmé, vous permettant d’évoluer au sein d’une équipe multiculturelle.  Ce poste est uniquement ouvert à du CDI. Outils / technologies :  Python (Applicatif et non pas data science), pour le développement du Back-endJS pour le développement du Front-EndEnvironnement anglophone  Devenir collaborateur Meritis c’est : Des parcours professionnels sur mesure (évolution de carrière, formations adaptées, mentoring…) ;Avoir le choix de sa mission et un accompagnement personnalisé tout au long de votre carrière ;Evoluer dans un environnement où l’apprentissage est favorisé : formations certifiantes, e-learning, meetUp, concours de code, parcours d’évolutions etc ;Faire partie de communautés d’experts qui partagent leurs savoirs et expériences au sein de nos centres de compétences ;Un environnement convivial avec de nombreux événements festifs (soirée annuelle, séminaires & teambuiding, déjeuners et afterworks…) ;Meritis est engagée dans la Responsabilité Sociétale des Entreprises. Nous valorisons notre impact positif sur la société et l'environnement. Notre démarche RSE guide chacune de nos actions pour promouvoir l'équité, la durabilité et le bien-être de nos collaborateurs. Rejoignez-nous pour être partie prenante de cette démarche responsable, où chacun de nos talents contribue à construire un avenir meilleur.Nos différences sont nos atouts. C’est pourquoi Meritis s'implique en faveur de la diversité et de la non-discrimination. Tous nos métiers sont accessibles aux personnes en situation de handicap.

Title: IT auditor
Description:
Senior Internal IT Auditor 
Als Senior Internal IT Auditor (RE) bij DELA ben je verantwoordelijk voor audits die ertoe doen! Jewerkt op het hoofdkantoor in Eindhoven samen met vijf collega-auditors en een managerin teamverband aan het uitvoeren van verschillende soorten audits en onderzoeken. In deze rol kun je jezelf in de breedte ontwikkelen, aan de slag gaan met gedragsaspecten en deze inzetten bij de uitvoering van audits.
Wat je als Senior InternalIT Auditor (RE) bij DELA doet om een waardevolle bijdragete leveren aan onze organisatie.
Onze innovatieve manier van auditen is kenmerkend: scherp, gefocust op leren en altijdvanuit de verbinding. Je focust niet enkel op de audits die per se moeten, maar juist ook op de audits die aansluiten bij wat de business nodig heeft. Daarbij kijk je niet alleen naar de mogelijke verbetering, maar ook naar de grondoorzaken. Ook hebben we oog voor het grotere plaatje: door afstand te nemen lukt het om de bevindingen uit onze onderzoeken in de juist context te plaatsen. Op deze manier werk je niet jaarlijkse checklists af, maar creëer je écht toegevoegde waarde voor de organisatie.
Samen met je collega’s op het hoofdkantoor in Eindhoven geef je daarnaast invulling aan een visie op internal audit in 2030 en de verdere ontwikkeling van internal audit binnen DELA. Agile werken en samen leren zijn hierbij belangrijke uitgangspunten.
De diversiteit aan auditen en de vrijheid die je krijgt maken dit een mooie volgende stap in jouw carrière. En dat alles binnen een lerende omgeving van een maatschappelijk betrokken organisatie.Wat we van jou als Senior Internal IT Auditor wensen om de mens kant van onze dienstverlening optimaal te vertegenwoordigen.
Wat we van jou verwachten:
Je hebt een WO-opleiding afgerond, liefst aangevuld met een postmaster RE;Je hebt >6 jaar ervaring met (interne of externe) IT auditwerkzaamheden;Je hebt ervaring in de beoordeling van het beheersen van operationele en IT risico’s, waaronder met betrekking tot digitale transformatie programma’s;Je hebt ervaring in de financiële sector;Je bent op de hoogte van relevante (toekomstige) wet- en regelgeving zoals DORA en de AI act;Je hebt bij voorkeur ervaring met het toepassen van data analyse.
Daarnaast herken je jezelf in het onderstaande:
Je bent in verbinding met het management en komt zo tot gedragen adviezen;Je bent sterk in mooie ideeënomzetten naar concrete, impactvolle acties;Je werkt graag in teamverband om zo tot nog betereresultaten te komen;Je bent reflectief op je eigen handelen en wilt het steeds een beetje beter doen;Je hebt een flinke dosis nieuwsgierigheid en zelf-startend vermogen;Je combineert in jouw audits harde zaken (data, cijfers, processen) met zachte aspecten (gedragen emotie) om zo tot waardevolle inzichten te komen. Je hebt interesse in het auditen van cultuur en gedrag;Je bent een stevige gesprekspartner binnen alle lagen van de organisatie.
Wat je als Senior Internal IT Auditor bij DELA krijgt om voldoening en betekenis uit jouw werk te halen.
DELA is een coöperatie die, net als jij, midden in het leven staat. Kenmerkend voor DELA is een open communicatie, een informele sfeer, een goede interne samenwerking en betekenis geven aan je werk.
We geven je de mogelijkheid om de arbeidsvoorwaarden af te stemmen op jouw persoonlijke wensen en behoeften. Daarom krijg je:
Direct een contract voor onbepaalde tijd voor 40 uur per week;Een salaris tussen€ 5.317,- en € 7.596,-bruto per maand, o.b.v. 40 uur per week;Bovenop je salarisontvang je een individueel keuzebudget t.w.v. 20,25% van jouw maandsalaris, dat je naar wens kan laten uitbetalen in geld en/of extra verlofdagen;Een hybride werkomgeving met mogelijkheid tot thuiswerken en inrichten thuiswerkplek;Een internationale werkomgeving (Nederland, België, Duitsland);€750 bruto per jaar om te besteden aan jouw vitaliteit (sportschoenen, sportabonnement, mindfulness, stoppen met roken cursus, etc.);Een goede pensioenregeling, korting op verzekeringsproducten en de mogelijkheid om cursussen te volgen.

Ons credo “Human Key Solutions” staat garant voor gemotiveerde kennisspecialisten binnen de domeinen Finance & Control en Audit, Risk & Compliance. Wij bemiddelen mensen vanaf HBO-niveau, in functies vanaf assistent-controller tot aan de CFO. RSG Finance is actief binnen zowel de profit als de publieke sector.

RSG onderscheidt zich door het unieke businessmodel: het Flexibel Vennootmodel. We streven ernaar om met onze flexibele vennoten een arbeidscontract voor onbepaalde tijd aan te gaan. Dit geeft hen zekerheid en dit stelt ons in staat om onze opdrachtgevers op een continue basis te voorzien van ondernemende specialisten met een hoogwaardig kennisniveau.

Title: Backend Developer (m/w/d)
Description:
About Us: 
We are one of the most innovative HR tech start-ups in Luxembourg! Our work is at the intersections of technology and psychology. With our AI-based assessments, we are dedicated to improving the work place for as many people as possible by increasing hiring success rate, enhancing employee experiences, and driving organizational success. We’re a dynamic team of forward-thinkers who are committed to making a positive impact in the world of HR.
Would you like to join us? 
We are currently looking for a Back-end Developer to join our team. 
Location: This position is full-time based in Luxembourg.
Tasks

Design, implement and maintain robust back-end applications using Java and the Spring framework.
Develop and manage RESTful APIs and integrations with third party services.
Work closely with front-end developers, data scientists and product owners to align backend functionality with overall product goals.
Write and maintain unit and integration tests to ensure high quality, secure code.
Conduct code reviews and collaborate on security and performance best practices.
Implement security best practices to meet ISO 27001 standards.
Participate in security audits and vulnerability assessments.
Manage deployments on our Linux servers and Kubernetes clusters.
Set up and maintain CI/CD pipelines using GitLab.
Provide IT support and troubleshoot production issues as required.
Monitor system performance and suggest improvements.
Stay up to date with emerging technologies and integrate them into the development process as appropriate.

Requirements
Required Skills:

3+ years of backend development experience, with strong background in Java and the Spring Framework.
Working experience with 3rd party integrations, working with APIs, and developing integrations.
Working experience with common development tools such as Git, Maven, JUnit, SQL, etc.
Familiarity with secure software development practices and DevOps.
Familiarity with developing containerised applications.
Strong problem-solving skills and a collaborative mindset.

Nice to have:
Working experience with Docker, Kubernetes and Linux server administration.

Working experience in creating and maintaining documentation, both for technical and non-technical users.

Benefits
Benefits as a Zortify team member:

Be part of a multifunctional and international team. You will work with a great team of developers, data scientists, and psychologists, from 10 different nationalities.
A supportive and inclusive work culture where your ideas are valued and encouraged.
Competitive salary and lunch vouchers.
27 annual vacation days.

Last but not least, you will have the opportunity to complete your individual personality analysis, with Zortify’s AI-based assessment.
Is there something missing that is particularly important to you? – Let us know and we’ll talk about it! 
We look forward to receiving your application with the following information:

CV
Portfolio

Description:

🌍 Qui sommes-nous ?Chez Vizzia, nous révolutionnons la propreté et la sécurité urbaine grâce à des technologies innovantes et respectueuses des libertés individuelles. Nos solutions combinent des caméras intelligentes, une IA avancée et une plateforme intuitive pour aider les villes à réduire drastiquement les dépôts sauvages de déchets.En forte croissance, nous collaborons avec plus de 100 municipalités pour bâtir un avenir plus propre et plus sûr, tout en intégrant les meilleures pratiques en matière de protection des données.
🎯 Vos missionsEn tant qu’Ingénieur Vidéoprotection, vous jouerez un rôle clé dans l’installation, la configuration, la maintenance et l’amélioration continue de nos solutions de vidéoprotection, tout en participant à des projets de recherche et développement.
R&D et veille technologiqueEffectuer une veille technologique sur les nouvelles caméras, équipements et fonctionnalités du marché.Tester, modifier et paramétrer des caméras OEM pour évaluer leur compatibilité et performance.Collaborer avec l’équipe hardware pour intégrer les innovations pertinentes dans nos solutions.
Configuration et optimisation techniqueRéglages avancés des caméras IP (exposition, masquage, FPS, etc.).Rédaction et validation des plans d'implantationInstallation et paramétrage de systèmes de gestion vidéo (VMS) comme Milestone ou Genetec.Diagnostic et résolution des anomalies techniques, comme les problèmes de lisibilité des plaques.
Installation d’infrastructures complètesMise en place de Centres de Supervision Urbains : installation des caméras, configuration des serveurs, déploiement des VMS et mise en œuvre des réseaux sécurisés.Application des bonnes pratiques en matière de sécurité et de conformité.
Gestion et maintenanceSupervision du parc de caméras et gestion proactive des tickets d’incidents.Garantir la qualité de service et proposer des améliorations continues des systèmes.
Expertise réseau et sécuritéConfiguration, paramétrage et optimisation des réseaux pour la vidéoprotection.Implémentation des meilleures pratiques en cybersécurité pour garantir la robustesse des installations.

Expérience : 3 ans minimum dans la vidéoprotection ou les systèmes IP similaires.
Compétences techniques :Maîtrise des technologies de camérasConnaissances approfondies des réseaux (LAN, WAN, VPN) et de la sécurité informatique.Capacité à diagnostiquer et résoudre des problèmes techniques complexes à distance.Sensibilité aux projets R&D et à l’innovation technologique.
Qualités personnelles : rigoureux, curieux, autonome et doté d’une forte capacité d’adaptation face à des environnements techniques variés.

Company Description:
Vizzia, votre partenaire de confiance pour une ville propre. 🤝

Chez Vizzia, nous développons une solution innovante qui aide les gestionnaires de territoires à réduire durablement les dépôts illégaux de déchets grâce à des détecteurs intelligents et à un accompagnement 360°.
Pour une gestion plus efficace des déchets et de nos territoires, et l'amélioration du cadre de vie de nos citoyens. 🌍

Les dépôts sauvages, qu’est-ce que c’est ? Ce sont un million de tonnes de déchets illégalement jetés en France chaque année, qui ne se recyclent pas et se détériorent petit à petit dans la nature, causant des effets néfastes pour l’environnement et pour la santé. 

Notre mission 🎯 jouer un rôle actif dans la dépollution et œuvrer pour un monde plus propre.

Aujourd’hui, Vizzia, ce sont: 
- Plus de 36.5 tonnes de dépôts illégaux de déchets détectés.
- Une quinzaine de collaborateurs engagés. 
- Des pistes de développement infinies pour continuer à accompagner les territoires dans leurs problématiques du quotidien.

Title: Machine Learning Expert
Description:
Hi all,

We are looking for ML expert for our customer in Malmö. For long term assignment.

Position: Machine Learning Expert

Company Overview:

ITIVE AB is a leading technology company that specializes in providing innovative solutions for businesses across various industries. Our team of experts is committed to delivering cutting-edge technology and services to our clients, helping them stay ahead of the competition.

Job Overview:

In this role you'll be responsible for building machine learning based systems and conduct data analysis that improves the quality of our Find My features. You'll be developing time-series models to extract information, using outlier detection to identifying anomalies and applying data science methods to quantify the quality of our data. You will take part in the development, integration, hardening and deployment of the models at scale, which would require a good combination of data science and software engineering.

Required Skills

Strong programming skills and extensive experience with PythonProfessional experience working with machine learning and data science, such as classification, feature engineering, clustering, anomaly detection and neural networksFine tuning and iterating on modelsKnowledgeable in classic machine learning algorithms (SVM, Random Forest, Naive Bayes, KNN etc). Experience using deep learning libraries and platforms, such as PyTorch, Tensorflow, KerasExperience with frameworks such as Sklearn, Numpy, Pandas


Added Qualifications

Knowledge in at least one of the following: time series analysis, data miningAbility to do statistical modeling and building predictive models


Why Work With Us:

At ITIVE AB, we value our employees and provide a supportive and dynamic work environment. As a Machine Learning Expert, you will have the opportunity to work with cutting-edge technology, collaborate with a talented team, and make a significant impact on our customer businesses. We offer competitive salaries, benefits, and opportunities for professional growth and development.

If you are passionate about machine learning and want to be a part of a fast-paced, innovative company, we encourage you to apply for this position asap.

Please note that candidates need to be eligible to EU Secret clearance.
Nature of the tasks:• Apply standards methods and tools for measuring and reporting on wide set of relevant performance indicators (response time, availability, safety, integrity).• Produce data set procedures and instructions for other analysts or administrators.• Monitor and maintain data management systems.• Ensure the integrity and security of existing data management systems.• Identify, investigate and correct problems or incidents related to data management systems.• Provide training, support, advice and guidance on data set issues to other information system practitioners.
Required knowledge and skills:• In-depth knowledge of RDBMS systems design and architecture.• In-depth knowledge of MS SQL/Oracle /MySQL administration.• Experience with Cluster administration (Windows/Linux).• Experience with network storage.
Two of the below list of certificates are required:• Administration Oracle Database Administrator Certified Professional/Master• Oracle Certified Professional, MySQL 8.0 Database Administration• Oracle Certified Expert, Oracle Database 12c: RAC and Grid Infrastructure• Oracle Certified Professional Oracle Database Security Expert• Administering a SQL Database Infrastructure• Microsoft Certified: Azure Database Administrator Associate• Administering Microsoft SQL Server• MongoDB Professional Certification• Any other data store platform technology expertise certificate

Title: Cloud Engineer
Description:
Ben jij de Cloud Engineer (VMWare) die graag vasthoudt aan kaders en, waar nodig, de regie neemt in de ‘heat of the moment’? Voel jij je een tevreden mens als je omgeving op volle toeren draait zonder mankementen? Dan kun jij, als Cloud Engineer (VMware), een waardevolle toevoeging zijn voor Uniserver!
Je taken & doelen:Als Cloud Engineer (VMware) ben je onderdeel van de afdeling DevOps. Je bent samen met je team van Engineers verantwoordelijk voor onze infrastructuur of netwerk. Je focus ligt op het inregelen van diensten en het beheren van onze infrastructuur en netwerk. Je volgt beleid, zorgt dat documentatie op orde is, acteert adequaat op incidenten en voert controleslagen in binnen je processen. Je houdt vast aan duidelijke kaders en weet zo zaken te controleren en beheersen. Zo ben jij de regisseur van een deel van onze producten en diensten. Jouw werk zorgt ervoor dat wij de hoogste kwaliteit aan services kunnen blijven leveren aan onze klanten.
Je doel is om de kwaliteit van onze infrastructuur en netwerk te bewaken. Wanneer er toch iets misgaat dan streef je ernaar om de incidenten snel en adequaat op te lossen zodat eenzelfde incident zich niet meer zal herhalen. Zo maak je onze infrastructuur en netwerk nog robuuster en garandeer je de kwaliteit van onze techniek die we leveren aan onze klanten.
Je verantwoordelijkheden (in het kort):Het ontwikkelen en borgen van het beheerplan samen met je team;Uitvoeren van en rapporteren over je beheerkalender taken;Documentatie (van CRM tot werkinstructies) bijwerken en controleren op kwaliteit;Beheren en inrichten van datacentra (van leverancier support tot installatie hardware);Verbeteringen aan infrastructuur/netwerk hard- en software bepalen en rapporteren;Event-, release-, availability- en configuratiemanagement taken uitvoeren;Volgen van Uniservers ITIL en ISO-richtlijnen (o.a. security en informatiebeveiliging);3e lijn supportverzoeken uitvoeren.
Je kwalificaties:Afgeronde HBO/WO opleiding in de richting van Computer Science, Information Technologyof vergelijkbaar;Minimaal 3 jaar werkervaring in vergelijkbare functie;Bekent met ITIL en ISO-richtlijnen voor o.a. security en informatiebeveiliging;Samenwerken, kwaliteitsgericht, verantwoordelijk, accuraat, plannen en presteren onder druk.
Wat je van ons kan verwachten:Een persoonlijk jaarlijks groeipad wat samenhangt met je rol en de jaarlijkse bedrijfsdoelstellingen;Salaris van € 3.757 – € 6.360 bruto;8% vakantiegeld;25 vakantiedagen (mogelijkheid om 10 extra te kopen);Pensioenregeling bij Allianz (3% eigen bijdrage);Leaseauto of mobiliteitsbudget (€ 0,23 kilometervergoeding);Hybride werken;Laptop naar keuze en laptoptas;Telefoon naar keuze;Thuiswerk werkplek inrichting en thuiswerkvergoeding € 2,35/dag;Gratis lunch elke dag op kantoor Alkmaar;Leuke bedrijfsfeesten.
Skill: Skills: Network Administration, DevOps, +8 more
Company Description:
Met 24 jaar ervaring en 175 professionals in dienst is Uniserver een van de grootste cloudhosting organisaties van Nederland. We leveren hoogwaardige en stabiele oplossingen voor MSP’s, ISV’s en het mid-market segment. Dagelijks zetten wij ons in voor onze missie: van elke klant een succesverhaal maken. Onze ambitie is om koploper te blijven op de Nederlandse cloudmarkt.

We leven in een tijd waarin elk bedrijf digitaal is. Van banken en verzekeraars tot de bakker op de hoek. Wat hen verbindt is de wens snel te kunnen voldoen aan de steeds veranderende behoeften van de markt.

Wanneer je bedrijfsvoering sterk gedigitaliseerd is, is een aanpasbare moderne technologie-stack een vereiste. Bij Uniserver ondersteunen we onze partners en klanten met de nieuwste flexibele infrastructuuroplossingen en verregaande kwalitatieve dienstverlening zodat we perfect kunnen aansluiten bij iedere unieke business case. 

Wij geloven in partnership voor altijd: beginnend bij het eerste gesprek en gedurende de hele looptijd. Daarbij vinden we het belangrijk samen te werken met onze partners en hun klanten. Mensen presteren het beste wanneer ze werken als een team.

De beste in cloud
Bij Uniserver geloven we dat mensen moeten doen waar ze het beste in zijn. Voor ons is dat het leveren van hybride cloudoplossingen. Wij nemen de IT-infrastructuur van onze klanten over en helpen bedrijfsprocessen automatiseren en optimaliseren. Ons cloudplatform stelt klanten in staat zorgeloos en grenzeloos te groeien. Onze infrastructuur en IT-systemen zijn makkelijk te gebruiken zodat klanten zich volledig kunnen concentreren op het ontwikkelen van hun organisatie. Zo helpen wij hen de beste te worden in wat ze doen. 

Samen zijn we het krachtigst. Dat is de Uniserver belofte. En daarom zijn wij nummer 1.

Title: Junior Software Developer
Description:
Scegliendo Horsa avrai l’opportunità di far parte di una delle più importanti realtà di consulenza IT del panorama italiano. Siamo specializzati nelle aree ERP, Business Analytics, Technology e nelle aree più innovative come la Cyber Security, il Cloud e la Industry 4.0. Grazie alla qualità del nostro operato, siamo riconosciuti come Partner d’eccellenza per guidare i processi di trasformazione digitale dei nostri Clienti a respiro nazionale e internazionale.

Siamo alla ricerca di giovani talenti appassionati di tecnologia, da inserire nel nostro team che si occupa di sviluppo di software volti all’ottimizzazione dei processi aziendali.

Crediamo fortemente nel potere della formazione continua dei nostri professionisti; avrai quindi l’opportunità di essere sempre aggiornato sulle nuove tecnologie e di ampliare le tue conoscenze personali e professionali.

La persona sarà inserita presso la nostra sede di Scorzé.

Posizione:

Il nostro obiettivo è sviluppare al meglio le tue potenzialità e il tuo talento. Per questo, parteciperai a percorsi di formazione studiati appositamente per fornirti conoscenze e competenze nello sviluppo Power, PHP e Angular.

Sarai coinvolto nei nostri progetti e farai parte di un team dinamico, in cui collaborazione, formazione e affiancamento a figure con esperienze consolidate ti consentiranno di crescere professionalmente e tecnicamente. Inoltre, avrai l'opportunità di sviluppare competenze nella gestione dei progetti, con una prospettiva di crescita verso un ruolo da Project Manager.

Requisiti:

Acquisire competenze e conoscenze che ti permetteranno di analizzare, progettare, sviluppare e documentare progetti di ingegnerizzazione dei processi aziendali;Affiancare le figure più senior nell’implementazione di soluzioni che rispondono alle esigenze dei nostri clienti.

Altre informazioni:

Sei la persona giusta per noi se…

Hai una forte motivazione personale nell’acquisizione di nuove conoscenze tecnologiche e ad affrontare nuove sfide.Hai buone doti relazionali, comunicative e attitudine al team working;Sei disponibile a trasferte.

La ricerca è rivolta anche a persone appartenenti alle categorie protette L.68/99 Art.1.

Inviare curriculum vitae dettagliato, con l’autorizzazione al trattamento dei dati personali secondo il Regolamento UE 2016/679 (GDPR).

Ai sensi della normativa vigente l'offerta di lavoro si intende estesa a entrambi i sessi (L 903/77).

Title: Technical Pre-sales Consultant
Description:
ORGANISATIONINCERT is a center of expertise providing services and solutions based on knowledge and experience acquired in cryptography, Public Key Infrastructure (PKI), identity security (eTravel documents and Digital ID Wallets), biometry and artificial intelligence. Established since 2012, INCERT is a public agency owned by the State of Luxembourg and the Luxembourg Chamber of Commerce. INCERT also represents and defends Luxembourg’s national interests at European and international organizations.Further information about INCERT can be found at www.incert.lu.
Within the scope of its business activities, INCERT is now recruiting a Technical Pre-sales Consultant. This position could be fulfilled remotely and on part time basis.
YOUR REPONSIBILITIES You will have to assume following responsibilities:- Manage business partners qualification and customers activities to ensure the successful implementation and delivery of solutions and services;- Work with the Senior Management to support opportunity qualification process as well as the customer satisfaction. Report on opportunity status and strategic plan;- Assist the different teams in the daily execution of projects and tasks;- Present solutions to customers, partners and others stakeholders. Create documents and products sheets including high level specifications;- Attend to business meetings, make demo and present our solutions portfolio;- Prepare response to tenders, RFPs and RFIs. Write specifications, proposals, SoW, contracts, business reports and user documentation;- Provide markets trends analysis, including competition and technology landscape, thanks to solutions and features expertise;- Participate in the establishment of the pricing policies considering each part of our activities and areas of expertise;- Represent INCERT during events, exhibitions or any other business activity in Europe and Internationally;- Coordinate, when applicable, the implementation of our solutions, including third parties’ products, in customers and partners offices for the successful delivery of our projects. Deliver advice, training and functional support;- Solve business needs by analyzing functional and technical requirements of our business partners and customers in coordination with our Solutions and R&D teams;- Lead the commercial delivery plan of our projects and contracts with the support of our dedicated teams;- Participate in the development of our solutions by monitoring key markets, technologies trends and providers and making feedback from business meetings.

YOUR PROFILE Professional skills and education:- Have 6-8 years of professional experience in a cybersecurity/IT Services company or equivalent experience;- Have a good understanding of cryptography, cybersecurity and information security concepts; - Hold a Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Business Administration, Engineering, Cybersecurity, Computer Science, Information Technology or related field of study or equivalent work experience; - Have a proven experience promoting end-to-end solutions or web/mobile applications for the Automotive and/or Energy and/or Healthcare and/or Industrial IoT sector(s); - Have a previous experience in an international context, specifically in addressing large accounts based outside of Luxembourg.
Soft skills: - Excellent presentation, interpersonal, written and verbal communication as well as public speaking skills; - Proven skills to identify new opportunities, prospect new markets and customers, solve problems in full autonomy;- Ability to translate customer technical requirements and expectations in functional and business languages;- Talent to establish deliverable plans with measurable milestones and focus on high quality standards;- Analytical mindset with an ability to learn and synthesize large amounts of information with little context in a fast-moving environment; - Good verbal and writing communication as the position requires close interaction with customers, as well as project management capacity;- Being a strong team player, act on own initiative, be self-motivated and meet deadlines;- Acting with a high sense of confidentiality and integrity;- Being comfortable to negotiate contracts and defend the interests of the Agency in English and French. Luxembourgish and/or German are considered as an asset;- Being fully aligned with our corporate values.
Please note that a criminal record will be requested as part of the final stage of our hiring process.
We look forward to receiving your application and a letter explaining your interest in the position at the following email address: hrlux@incert.lu
