Title: Cyber Security Analyst (L2)
Description:
La tua nuova azienda:
Per un nostro cliente, multinazionale leader a livello globale in ambito IT Security & Cyber Defense, siamo alla ricerca di un Senior Cyber Security Analyst (Tier 2) da inserire all'interno del Security Operations Center (SOC).
Responsabilità:
Monitoraggio, analisi e gestione degli eventi di sicurezza tramite SIEM e altri strumenti di cybersecurity;Analisi avanzata degli incidenti di sicurezza e gestione della loro mitigazione e risposta;Coordinamento con il team SOC L1 per l'escalation e la gestione degli alert di sicurezza;Conduzione di investigazioni forensi su eventi di sicurezza complessi;Collaborazione con i team di Threat Intelligence per il miglioramento delle strategie di difesa;Implementazione e ottimizzazione di regole SIEM per migliorare l'efficacia del rilevamento delle minacce;Supporto nella definizione di strategie di incident response e miglioramento continuo dei processi SOC;Redazione di reportistica tecnica e presentazione di analisi di incidenti e minacce ai team di gestione della sicurezza.
Requisiti:
Laurea in Informatica, Sicurezza Informatica, Ingegneria o discipline affini;Esperienza comprovata di almeno 2/3 anni in un SOC o in ambito di Cyber Security Operations;Conoscenza approfondita di SIEM (ad es. Splunk, QRadar, ArcSight), IDS/IPS, EDR, Firewall e tecnologie di sicurezza correlate;Esperienza nell'uso di framework di sicurezza come MITRE ATT&CK, NIST, ISO 27001;Buona conoscenza delle metodologie di Threat Hunting e delle principali tecniche di attacco e difesa;
Cosa offriamo:
RAL 35.000€ - 50.000€ + M.B.O.Opportunità di crescita e sviluppo professionale in un ambiente altamente innovativo;Smart Working: 3 giorni a settimana;Formazione continua e possibilità di ottenere certificazioni di settore (CEH, GIAC, CISSP, etc.)

Title: Qlik Sense Developer
Description:
Some careers shine brighter than others.If you’re looking for a career that will help you stand out, join HSBC, and fulfil your potential. Whether you want a career that could take you to the top, or simply take you in an exciting new direction, HSBC offers opportunities, support and rewards that will take you further.
Your career opportunityEnterprise Technology/Compliance IT Department brings together all areas of financial crime risk management at HSBC including anti-money laundering: transaction monitoring, screening, risk assessment etc. and is dedicated to implement the most effective global standards to combat financial crime.
The Risk & Compliance MI IT team provides MI and automated document generation applications to the Compliance business areas including Group Risk Assurance, Fraud, Financial Crime Risk, and Financial Crime Threat Mitigation.
The user base is global covering differing needs of business customers from interactive management information, self-service platforms, improving efficiency by creating and distributing documents automatically, and providing technical and functional expertise on the use of the platform.
Role Overview: The purpose of this role is to support existing Qlik Sense and Qlik Mashup based applications, develop new applications as directed by the business users, and improve the quality controls and efficiency/automation across a delivery. There are a number of dashboards and reporting processes in the portfolio therefore the engineer needs to be able to multitask and self-manage their workload to a degree.
The role requires ensuring that both server and their own workstation environments are operational in a non-development environment and meeting stringent information security requirements. In the production environment, the role requires the individual to provide support to the level 3 team.
The engineer will be able to help shape the delivery process and expected to use their experience to meet the three key themes of projects: 1) Efficiency, 2) Effectiveness, 3) Constant Improvement.
The role requires ensuring that both server and their own workstation environments are operational in a non-development environment and meeting stringent information security requirements. In the production environment, the role requires the individual to provide support to the level 3 team.
The engineer will be able to help shape the delivery process and expected to use their experience to meet the three key themes of projects: 1) Efficiency, 2) Effectiveness, 3) Constant Improvement.
What you’ll do Review the business requirements that have been submitted via JIRAs.Ensure that if business requirements are unclear then they are clarified with the appropriate stakeholders.Design and implement the changes in QlikSense, NPrinting, GeoAnalytics, Qlik Mashu.Follow the team’s delivery methodology (unit testing, documentation, integration testing, package/deploy, release processes).Support UAT processes, update documentation.Support release management in deployments and provide production support (third line).Deliver improvement activities (such as better ways for the team to work).Take ownership of the dashboards and be responsible for the quality of the deliverable.
What you need to have to succeed in this role Essential Experience & Skills:Minimum 3-years’ experience in QlikSense, from a structured IT delivery methodology background.Documentation skills (every developer has to create documentation covering design and testing).Mature positive attitude to interact positively with senior stakeholders.Able to work alone but escalates when needed.Pro-active and takes ownership, and responsible for the outcomes.Mashup framework and configuration (tools: Node.js, React; language: JavaScript) nice to have.NPrinting, and Qlik GeoAnalytics, Data Modelling will be an advantage.Strong communications skills I English (written & spoken). 
What we offerCompetitive salaryAnnual performance-based bonusAdditional bonuses for recognition awardsMultisport cardPrivate medical careLife insuranceOne-time reimbursement of home office set-up (up to 800 PLN).Corporate parties & eventsCSR initiativesFinancial support with trainings and educationNursery discountsSocial fundFlexible working hoursFree parking
If your CV meets our criteria, you should expect the following steps in the recruitment process:
Online behavioural test (for external candidates)Telephone screen (for external candidates)Job interview with the hiring manager
We are looking to hire as soon as possible so don’t wait and apply now!You'll achieve more when you join HSBC.

Title: Data Engineer for ESG Data Platform
Description:
We are looking for a Data Engineer to join our ESG CDP team at NN to help us design, build, deploy and run the ESG Central Data Platform solution that will deliver ESG (Environment, Society, Governance) metrics for internal and external stakeholders. Reporting on ESG metrics of the asset portfolio of NN is a key component of the reporting needs and obligations at NN. The ESG Central Data Platform delivers the data collection, aggregation and reporting functionality required by many internal and external stakeholders.
What you are going to doESG CDP is a solution built on Azure with Azure-native data technologies, primarily Databricks and Data Factory. We are looking for a Data Engineer with 3+ years of hands-on experience with Azure Data Factory and Databricks.Common activities for the Data Engineer to work on in this position are:Design, implement and maintain data pipelines using best practicesWrite automated unit and regression testsBuild scalable, reusable and future proof data pipelinesHave a close eye on developments in the cloud and data marketplace to apply innovations on our platformPerform code reviews of other developersDesign and implement data storage layer with Azure Data Lake Storage Gen2Work on solutions for ingesting batch and streaming data and transform using Databricks Spark notebooks using Delta LakeAlign with colleagues on solution design and architectureAdvice on the use of the features and technologies such as Databricks Unity Catalog which could deliver business benefitsAlign with colleagues in different teams on the Product Backlog and Roadmap of the team
Who you areWe are looking for a candidate with the following skills and experience:3+ years experience working on data solutions as data engineer3+ years experience in working with Azure data technologies such as Data Factory and DatabricksMultiple years experience working with PythonHands on experience with PySparkKnowledge of data engineering concepts and capable of applying this to solution design and architectureExperience with data modelingMultiple years experience in workingFluent in English, both verbal and in writingExperience working in Agile/Scrum and DevOps teams
We prefer candidates with one or more of the following skills and experience:Experience in working in the Financial Services industry.Experience with enterprise software development (Java, C#, …)
What we offer youSubstantial budget for education (conferences, hard and soft skills trainings, language courses)International team – English use on daily basisNew modern offices near Anděl, but also home office flexibility5 weeks of vacation, 5 Well-being days3% employer supplemental pension monthly contributionVolunteering days to support our communityMeal contribution, Cafeteria program, monthly home office allowanceMultisport card, partnership with various companies (Makro, Datart, Sony, ...)iPhone, O2 Family discountsEmployee referral bonuses to encourage the addition of great new people to the team
Who you will work withYou will work in a diverse environment with a lot of professionals with strong experience in Finance & Risk and IT. Your colleagues have many different nationalities and English is the default language for meetings and communication. Working at NN in the Finance & Risk domain can be demanding: strict deadlines and hard requirements are common. However, we combine this with the Agile way-of-working (in Agile and DevOps teams), and there is always room for experimentation and ideas for improvements. We celebrate our successes and results, and appreciate the contributions of every individual in the team.

Title: Full Stack Developer
Description:
Chi siamo: 

InterlemGroup è un'azienda d'innovazione, con un lungo track record di successi da oltre 20 anni, che opera in un contesto sia nazionale che internazionale nell'ICT e Digital Trasformation con un portafoglio consolidato di clienti di prestigio.

Il nostro obiettivo è quello di affiancare le principali aziende nazionali ed internazionali affiancandole nel loro percorso di "trasformazione digitale".

Il Gruppo, sempre attento alla ricerca di nuovi talenti e alla valorizzazione della persona, è in forte espansione e offre grandi spazi di crescita. Potrai portare innovazione nelle più importanti aziende e continuare la tua formazione professionale per fare davvero la differenza.

Proponiamo un’opportunità lavorativa in un ambiente collaborativo e orientato al successo, garantendo un piano di crescita economica e professionale che riflette il valore delle competenze e ambizioni.

Opportunità di lavoro:

Siamo alla ricerca di una persona freelance con partita IVA interessata a lavorare in qualità di Full Stack Developer che si occupi del rinnovamento e personalizzazione del gestionale aziendale del cliente.

Chi cerchiamo:

Freelance/Partita IVA;Valutiamo anche profili con competenze solo Back-End o solo Front-End;Diploma o Laurea Triennale/Magistrale in discipline STEM;Esperienza maggiore di 5 anni;Buona conoscenza dell'inglese.


Requisiti:

Competenze Back-End richieste:

 Esperienza nello sviluppo in Java 17 +; Padronanza di OOP, design patterns, algoritmi e strutture dati. Conoscenza Framework Spring e dei suoi moduli principali (Security, Data, Batch, Boot, Integration, MVC, Cloud, AOP, AMQP, WebFlux); Esperienza con strumenti di Continuous Integration, Delivery e Deployment. Padronanza nell'utilizzo delle tecnologie container - based (es. Docker), e della gestione del del deployment di applicazioni.


Competenze Front-End richieste:

 Esperienza nella creazione e gestione di componenti React e conoscenza del suo ecosistema; Padronanza di JavaScript ES6 + incluse arrow functions, const/let, destructuring e async/await. Ottima conoscenza di HTML, CSS e preprocessori come Sass o LESS; Esperienza con Redux o React Context API per la gestione dello stato dell’applicazione Capacità di gestire il routing con React Router o soluzioni simili; Conoscenza di Fetch API o Axios per la comunicazione con un server; Familiarità con strumenti di bundling per organizzare e ottimizzare il codice (es. Webpack); Familiarità con Git e piattaforme di Controllo di Versioning per la gestione del codice sorgente; Capacità di sviluppare interfacce seguendo gli standard Responsive Design; Esperienza nel lavorare efficacemente all'interno di un team di sviluppatori, comunicando e collaborando, con modalità di sviluppo Agile

 Conoscenza dello sviluppo di applicazioni web nel Cloud (Amazon AWS e/o Microsoft Azure); Esperienza nella pubblicazione e gestione di servizi su cluster Kubernetes; Sviluppo microservizi con Java Quarkus. Title: Graduate Program - Junior Application Support Analyst
Description:
Are you passionate about technology and want to discover how project management in project delivery, fuels innovation in managing payments and fosters business excellence? Do you want to work in a multinational, multidisciplinary environment with open opportunities for international mobility? If yes, you are welcome to contact us! Ready to kickstart your career's journey with Euronet's Horizon Graduate Program?
At Euronet, we believe in technology as an enabler of change and growth. We are passionate about innovation that supports expansion through new products and new markets around the world with a human-led and tech-powered approach. We always cater for the needs of businesses and consumers as they evolve in a very dynamic and changing payments landscape. The Horizon Graduate Program is an initiative of Euronet to invite University graduates to join our company for an initial period of 6 months, under a paid employment contract. You will work as an integral part of our teams under the leadership of experienced managers that value your work and solve meaningful problems. Upon completion of this initial period, the opportunity for an open-ended employment could be offered for selected candidates that showcase excellence and wish to work in a multi-national organization.
What you'll do:  Fully understand the services and the technical and operation requirements of the supported Back Office Applications. Ensure the supported application error free and secure operation and resolve production incidents. Application support includes - incident resolution, user support, regular maintenance, version upgrade, change implementation.  Participate and/or coordinate application enhancement and new development and commercial project implementations.  Provide ad-hoc on-call support and cooperate with internal departments and with external Software providers. 


Requirements


What you'll need:  IT University studies in the last academic year OR freshly graduated  Full-time employment for 6 month period: Successful candidates who perform well during the six-months program could be offered open-ended employment.  Knowledge of MSSQL query, Windows servers, MS Office  General understanding of IT Security and WEB applications Good command of written and spoken English and Hungarian is a must Openness to learn and grow, combined with high analytical and strong problem-solving skills    Advantages (not necessary but considered as plus):  Understanding of Web Applications (Apache/Tomcat, IIS)  Basic development knowledge (Java, .Net, ASP.NET)  Knowledge of open-source operating system (Linux OS) 

Benefits


What you'll get:  Competitive compensation  Possibility for a career in a growing, international environment  Opportunities to learn and participate in various projects

Company Description: Euronet’s Electronic Funds Transfer (EFT) Segment meets the needs of financial institutions and consumers through Euronet-owned and outsourced ATMs and POS terminals combined with value added and transaction processing services.

Company Description:
ZEISS is an internationally leading technology enterprise operating in the fields of optics and optoelectronics. In the previous fiscal year, the ZEISS Group generated annual revenue around 11 billion euros in its four segments Semiconductor Manufacturing Technology, Industrial Quality & Research, Medical Technology and Consumer Markets (30 September 2024).

With over 46,000 employees, ZEISS is active globally in around 50 countries with more than 60 sales and service locations, around 40 research and development facilities, and 35 production facilities worldwide (30 September 2024). Founded in 1846 in Jena, the company is headquartered in Oberkochen, Germany. Title: Python Engineer
Description:
We are looking for a senior Python Developer who is keenly interested in Python-based processing of LIDAR data, object detection, validation and transformation. This role will directly contribute to the creation and maintenance of greener, safer and more resilient urban spaces.
Who we areAs the global pioneer for digital twins of urban forests, we provide very detailed digital copies of each individual tree in a city. This insight will provide cities with the information they need to ensure the maintenance and development of their green spaces. With our solution we support the digital transformation of smart cities world-wide. Combining the latest laser scanning technology with the most advanced AI & machine learning methods, greehill enables cities to be radically more productive in their daily operations and to improve the well-being of citizens through a greener, healthier, and more resilient urban environment. We currently operate offices in Budapest (HQ, R&D), Berlin, Singapore, San Francisco and Paris.
Your task will beWriting effective and scalable Python codes for solving various challenges.Use Python libraries such as FastAPI, SQLAlchemy and Pandas.Support ML processing using Python tools.Store and process 2D, 3D, GIS data.
We need you to haveHigh level knowledge of Python, strong algorithmic thinking.Team-player attitude.
We value if you haveKnowledge in data processing of urban objects.Experience with docker/kubernetes and cloud technologies.Experience in a startup working environment.
We offerOpportunity to have high impact on the digitisation and management of urban forests and on climate change adaptation in cities.Opportunity to join a dynamically growing team with a lot of freedom to develop together with us.Possibility to work and learn in an international, open-minded team of passionate (green-) tech experts.
Please note, our office attendance is high, with employees working on-site four days a week.
We appreciate the interest of all job seekers in our organization. However, please note that at this time, we are unable to consider applications from outside of Hungary, who require a work permit for this position. We thank you for your understanding and encourage you to explore other opportunities with greehill in the future.
Company Description:
Helping cities world-wide grow greener and healthier through Smart Tree Inventories. 

 

We are bringing the right data to the people who need it. ​At greehill, we digitize entire urban forests and provide a platform that empowers cities to map, monitor and analyze the current status of their urban forest and optimize the impact of urban trees on urban life. We enable data-driven decision-making to improve ecosystem services, thermal comfort, and operational efficiency.
Specialties: LIDAR,MLS,ALS,Feature Extraction,Greenery

Title: Data Scientist
Description:

Feladatok:Adatgyűjtés és adatfeldolgozás különböző forrásokból, biztosítva az adatok minőségét és integritását.Adatelemzési modellek és algoritmusok fejlesztése, tesztelése és implementálása a hatékony döntéshozatal érdekében.Generikus adatelemzési pipeline folyamatok létrehozása, riportok készítése.Prediktív elemzési modellek és gépi tanulási algoritmusok létrehozása és alkalmazása az üzleti problémák megoldására.Az eredmények vizualizálása és jelentések készítése a vezetőség és más érintettek számára.Szorosan együttműködés az üzleti elemzőkkel, AI engineerekkel és más érintettekkel a követelmények és célok megértése érdekében.Folyamatos tudás naprakész tartás az adatkutatás és a gépi tanulás legújabb trendjeivel és technológiáival.

Title: Junior Database Administrator
Description:
Getronics is a global ICT integrator with a long history that extends over 135 years, across various locations in the UK, Europe, Asia Pacific and Latin America. Getronics are the founders and leading member of the Global Workspace Alliance with a unique model provides customer with consistent IT services. Our vision is to reimagine the digital future one customer as a time.
We have an exciting opportunity for an Junior Database Administrator to join our team!
Team Purpose:
Working within Managed Services, the DBA Team currently comprises of 7 DBA’s, 4 of whom specialize in SQL Server. The DBA team provide remote database administration services for nearly 400+ SQL Servers across multiple different customers. Our primary support platforms are SQL Server 2008 - 2019 running under Windows 2012 - 2019, and include some high availability solutions, with a limited number of legacy Windows 2003/ 2008 and some SQL Server 2000/2005 installations.
Role Purpose:
As part of the global operations team, the role will be reporting into the DBA team leader. It will require interaction with various teams within Managed Services such as Windows, Storage and Virtualization team as well as non-technical teams such as Service Desk, Change Management and the Project Management Office. The role has no direct reports.
Responsibilities/Accountability:
To install, support and maintain MS SQL Server instances and databases under the guidance of a Senior DBA. To work as part of the team DBA to ensure that all SLA’s are maintained. Respond to all SQL Server related incidents.Assist the team with proactive improvements to internal processes.To participate in the change control process.
Skills/Experience:
Ideally the applicant will have some understanding of databases, preferably with some experience using SQL Server.Experience with Windows 2012 through to Windows 2019 Operating Systems.Experience working with High Availability solutions such as Windows Clustering.Experience with Disaster Recovery solutions.An understanding of virtualization technologies.An understanding of storage technologies.An aptitude for problem-solving in a multi-disciplinary environment.Understanding of ITIL processes.Knowledge of TSQL, VB/ ASP, PowerShell would be an advantageExcellent written and oral communication skills
If you think you have 75% or even 90% of what we are looking for and know you are capable of the responsibilities and duties at hand, we encourage you to apply! Not all applicants require 100% of what we expect. This will prove you are willing to develop, curious to learn and grow professionally and personally.
What to do next:
If this ticks your boxes, and you are looking for a new and exciting opportunity, then please apply below with a copy of your CV and your contact details. We would appreciate a short message as to why you are interested in the position and Getronics!
As a business, we offer an Employee Referral Programme, if you have someone in your life you think would be a perfect fit then send them a link to the career’s webpage.
If you would like to ask any questions regarding our vacancies, Getronics as a business, or anything else, please don’t hesitate to get in touch. The Talent Acquisition team will be available on 0141 814 1055 or alternatively, email into weallmakeuk@getronics.com
We are committed to equal opportunities for all staff and applications from individuals are encouraged, regardless of age, disability, gender, sexual orientation, race, religion, or belief, relationship status, and families.
Company Description:
We empower your business to stay competitive by offering flexible, secure and reliable technology services, tailored to your unique needs, helping to drive growth, increase efficiency, reduce cost, and delivers measurable success.

We are committed to low-carbon and sustainable development through our IT solutions to help companies like yours reduce your environmental impact.

Getronics is a global leader in technology solutions with a team of over 4,000 colleagues in 22 centres, providing comprehensive end-to-end services across the globe. 

We are one of only 18 companies from around the world positioned within the Gartner’s 2024 Magic Quadrant for Outsourced Digital Workplace services, and we are the leading and founding member of the Global Workspace Alliance (GWA).

We are committed to delivering exceptional customer service, to enable your business to focus on your core strengths while entrusting your IT needs to Getronics.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
A hazai IT piac dinamikusan fejlődő szereplője, a Kontron Hungary Kft., a Kontron csoport tagja – korábban S&T Consulting Hungary Kft., több mint huszonöt éve működik sikerrel a hazai és nemzetközi informatikai szolgáltató piacon. Stabil háttérrel, tapasztalt kollégákkal, kiemelkedő szakértelemmel és a legfejlettebb technológiákkal dolgozó csapatunk bővítéséhez keresünk kollégát az alábbi pozícióba:

Data Scientist

Title: Software Engineer
Description:
OPSWAT, a global leader in IT, OT, and ICS critical infrastructure cybersecurity, delivers an end-to-end platform that gives public and private sector organizations and enterprises the critical advantage needed to protect their complex networks, secure their devices, and ensure compliance. Over the last 20 years our commitment to innovative technology has earned the trust of more than 1,700 organizations, governments, and institutions globally, solidifying our role in protecting the world’s critical infrastructure and securing our way of life.

The Position

We are looking for a hands-on Software Engineer to join our growing Technology Development Center in Veszprém. This is an exciting opportunity to work on a talented team building and re-engineering OPSWAT's security products. If you are a knowledgeable, creative, passionate individual who is interested in designing and building unique security solutions that no one else is building, then you are the one we are looking for!

What You Will Be Doing

Plan, design and develop C++ - based cyber security application and softwareReview design spec/codingProduct maintenanceImplement new versions of the productDesign specifications and write test casesProvide inputs and documentation of new or existing featuresPartner with your agile team members on delivering sprint commitmentsWork with local and remote engineering teams to deliver on quarterly goals


What We Need From You

Strong command of C++3+ years programming experience for Windows and/or Linux platformsGood command of spoken and written EnglishExpertise in multi-threaded programming and memory managementCI/CD experience, good skills in version control (preferably Git)Experience with containerization and working in QT framework is nice to haveExperience with REST API utilization and SDK integration would be an assetExperience with Bitbucket, Jira, Confluence will be preferredKnowledge in Rust and Python is an advantageIt’s good to have experience with Agile / Scrum working environment


Why You'll Love Working Here

Stable, growing international company background with an exceptional customer groupThe newest technology environmentExtra benefits – supported sport activities (kettlebell training and football), massage, language courses, equipped kitchen etcAttractive working environment – nice office full of accessories (fruits every day, coffee, breakfast, tea etc.)Regular team events and Happy Hour activities


OPSWAT is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to providing an environment where equal employment opportunities are extended to all employees and applicants, free of discrimination and harassment of any type. All employment decisions are based on individual qualifications, job requirements, and business needs without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other category protected by federal, state, or local laws.

Recruiting Agencies: we do not accept unsolicited resumes from third party agencies for any of our open positions. To submit resumes for our jobs, there must be a recruiting contract approved by our legal team and endorsed by both parties. We are currently not accepting additional 3rd party agencies at this time.
Skill: 9 of 10 skills match your profile - you may be a good fit
Company Description:
OPSWAT protects critical infrastructure. Our goal is to eliminate malware and zero-day attacks. We believe that every file and every device pose a threat. Threats must be addressed at all locations at all times—at entry, at exit, and at rest. Our products focus on threat prevention and process creation for secure data transfer and safe device access. The result is productive systems that minimize risk of compromise. That’s why 98% of U.S. nuclear power facilities trust OPSWAT for cybersecurity and compliance.

OPSWAT. Trust no file. Trust no device.

www.opswat.com

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
About the teamCurrently we are looking for a new member in the Acquisition Squad of Magyar Telekom's AI and Data Innovation Tribe.The Acquisition Squad is a dynamic team composed of both seasoned veterans and ambitious young talents. Operating in an agile environment, they follow a two-week sprint cycle and actively participate in key ceremonies to ensure efficient collaboration. The squad places a strong emphasis on thorough documentation in Data Governance and automation, streamlining future developments. As pioneers of the cloud migration project, they are laying the foundation for a data-driven future, driving innovation and scalability within the organization.
This position is for you if you are interested in the following tasksDesign, develop, and optimize scalable data pipelines to support reliable data ingestion, transformation, and storage in the Data Lake.Assess source data, identifying structures, relationships, and potential data quality issues to ensure readiness for analysis.Collaborate with cross-functional teams to translate business requirements into technical data solutions and actionable insights.Develop frameworks and tools to facilitate seamless data integration from diverse source systems, including databases, APIs, and file systems.Work closely with data analysts and business stakeholders to design integrated views tailored to business or data science needs.Implement end-to-end testing frameworks for data pipelines to ensure quality and reliability.Advocate for and implement robust data governance, security, and compliance practices.Stay current with emerging technologies and best practices to continuously improve data processes and systems.
You are the ideal candidate if you haveBachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Data Science, or a related field. (Master’s degree preferred).Proven experience in designing, implementing, and maintaining scalable data pipelines and data infrastructure.Strong database expertise, including advanced SQL and experience with ETL processes.Proficiency in Python for data engineering and data analysis. (Experience with Scala or Java is a plus.)Knowledge of distributed data platforms such as Cloudera or Apache Hadoop and Big Data technologies like Spark and Hive.Familiarity with cloud platforms and services (preferably GCP).Solid understanding of data governance principles, including metadata management, data lineage, and data quality frameworks.Experience working with and integrating various source system types (e.g., Kafka, MQ, SFTP, APIs, file shares).Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to bridge the gap between technical and business requirements.
It’s an advantage if you haveExperience with CI/CD pipelines and automation tools.Knowledge of data privacy regulations and best practices for handling Personally Identifiable Information (PII).Familiarity with REST APIs and third-party system integrations.Proficiency in visualization tools (e.g., Power BI, Tableau).Exposure to UX/UI principles for creating integrated and user-friendly data views.Practical experience with GCP’s data-related services (e.g., BigQuery, Dataflow, Pub/Sub) is a significant advantage.Hands-on knowledge of Apache Airflow for managing workflows and orchestrating data pipelines.

A Telekom a digitális optimistákat keresi, akik - álljon bármilyen szám is az anyakönyvi kivonatukban - hisznek benne, hogy a digitális technológia a fejlődés motorja, melynek állandó változásával együtt ők is képesek megújulni, épp úgy, ahogy a Telekom is folyamatosan keresi a fejlődési lehetőségeket.

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
Dolgoznál egy erős szakmai csapat tagjaként?

Igazi csapatjátékos vagy, akire lehet számítani?

Ha magadra ismersz, csatlakozz hozzánk Data Engineer munkakörbe!

Az UNIQA kompozit biztosítóként évtizedek óta a pénzügyi szektor egyik stabil szereplője hazánkban. Az osztrák gyökerekkel rendelkező cég Magyarországon közel 500 munkavállalóval és több, mint 100 különböző munkakörrel rendelkezik. Nemzetközi hátterünk biztos és stabil alap, melyre bátran tudunk építkezni. Célunk az ügyfeleink magas színvonalú kiszolgálása, a folyamatos fejlődés és a változásokhoz történő gyors alkalmazkodás.

Mi az UNIQA-nál hiszünk a sokszínűségben és a befogadó kultúrában, éppen ezért szívesen várjuk azon jelentkezéseket is, melyek cégünk sokszínűségét tovább erősíthetik.

#startyourbetter

Hogyan telnek majd a napjaid?

Te leszel felelős az adattárházzal kapcsolatos fejlesztésekért (MS SQL és Azure alapú fejlesztések tervezése és kivitelezése),Adat áttöltéseket/transzformációkat (ETL) fogsz csinálni, részt veszel a felhős Azure DWH kialakításában,Hozzád fog tartozni az új források bevonása adattárházba, meglévő folyamatok optimalizálása/újra írása, riportok fejlesztése Power BI segítségével.

Téged Keresünk, Ha

stabil SQL és SSIS (T-SQL) tudással rendelkezelvan tapasztalatod adattárház építésben (Azure, Python előny)hatékonyan oldod meg a problémákat, analitikus gondolkodásoddal jól átlátod a rendszereket,önállóság mellett erős csapatszellem van benned,nyitott vagy és könnyen megtalálod a hangot az üzleti területtel.

Miért érdemes hozzánk csatlakozni?

Egy stabil BI csapat tagja lehetsz egy multinacionális cégnél, ahol biztosítjuk a lehetőséget a szakmai fejlődésre, akár nemzetközi projektben,Az idődet te fogod tudni beosztani, úgy, hogy a munkán túl a magánéletedre is tudj koncentrálni,Egy új, kihívásokkal teli terület vár Rád, ahol nyitottak vagyunk az ötleteidre.
Company Description:
Mi az UNIQÁ-ban nap mint nap azon dolgozunk, hogy a biztosítás újra arról szóljon, amiről a kezdetekben: biztonságot, megoldást nyújtsunk szolgáltatásainkkal, s tényleg segítsünk, ha baj van.

Osztrák központú, a régióban sikeresen működő, ideális méretű multi vagyunk. Célunk, hogy a legjobb ügyfélélményt nyújtó biztosító legyünk. Ügyfeleink kényelme érdekében termékeinket folyamatosan fejlesztjük, folyamatainkat egyszerűsítjük és digitalizáljuk.

Büszkék vagyunk arra, hogy innovációinkkal trendet teremtünk a biztosítási piacon, a jövő kihívásaira, ügyfeleink változó igényeire is készülve.

Kiemelten foglalkozunk munkatársaink elkötelezettségével, elégedettségével is, mert az ügyfélélményért a legtöbbet ők tudnak tenni.

Hiszünk abban, hogy Ügyfélként vagy Csapattagként: nálunk megtalálod számításaidat!
Specialties: befektetéskezelés,biztosítás,insurance,investment

Title: Data Privacy Consultant
Description:
Are you passionate about data privacy compliance topic, spiced with IT mindset and enthusiastic about customer support? This opportunity is for you!
A Data Privacy Consultant position has opened at our multinational client. They are a leading agricultural technology company who focuses on transforming food production through Regenerative Agriculture to improve soil health, increase productivity, and combat climate change.In this position you will work with the Data Protection team providing customer service to internal clients using the Data Privacy tool, significantly contributing to the company’s efforts to comply with data privacy laws and safeguard personal information.
As a Data Privacy Consultant, you will:
Assist in deploying the data privacy tool across the company’s diverse jurisdictions.Support privacy assessments, data mapping and investigations of the organisation's data processing activities as part of the ongoing maintenance of the data privacy tool data protection management system.Assist with customer support for various departments within the company like HR, Marketing, IT to integrate data protection controls into the organisation's supporting systems.Oversee and address data privacy inquiries, including those concerning the use of the tool.Assess new regulations and develop compliance strategies, including updating data privacy tool assessments.Educate the organisation about the importance of data privacy compliance.Develop and deliver policies, guidelines, and training materials to ensure the organisation is compliant with data privacy rules and regulations.
What you will need to succeed:
A dedicated customer support professional with a keen interest in data privacy compliance, committed to developing expertise in this dynamic area.Minimum 1–2 years of experience in leading or participating in tool or process implementation, or has a background in advisory/consulting.Excellent communication skills in English with a proactive attitude and problem-solving abilities.Nice to have law degree.
What you’ll get in return:
Long-term career and internal training opportunities.Energetic and international work environment.Modern office in Budapest with Home Office opportunities.Competitive salary and benefit package.
If you are interested in this position, do not hesitate to apply! Simply upload your English CV. Please note that only selected candidates will be contacted.

Company Description:
We are leaders in specialist recruitment and workforce solutions, offering advisory services such as learning and skill development, career transitions and employer brand positioning.

As the Leadership Partner to our customers, we invest in lifelong partnerships that empower people and businesses to succeed. We help you achieve your career goals and deliver your business needs by combining meaningful innovation with our global scale and insights.

Last year we helped over 280,000 people find their next career. Join the millions of people around the world that our specialist recruitment consultants provide with up-to-date information on career options, interesting insights and specific industry trends.

We help our customers define and implement strategies to create inclusive and equitable workplaces. Through harnessing and analysing data, we support business decision making and advise on how to access Talent Networks. We also assist in identifying attractive employer propositions by truly understanding a company’s identity, and support clients with all aspects of their Early Careers proposition, from strategic planning through to operational execution.

Hays is the market leader in the UK and Asia Pacific and one of the market leaders in Continental Europe and Latin America. The c.12,800 people we employ around the world partner with clients and candidates to power the world of work. Every day our expert consultants help thousands of candidates find their next role, and they also help clients reshape workforces and deal with talent shortages. In the year to 30 June 2021, we placed 77,000 people in permanent jobs and 244,000 people into temporary roles. For more information about our global network, strategy and Group financial results, visit www.haysplc.com

Title: Software developer intern - Calibration team
Description:
Developing automated driving requires a complete, mature toolchain to collect, generate, use and manage the data needed for a safe and robust solution. aiData is the most advanced, data-driven pipeline for automated driving that reduces the complexity of the processing with high automatization while still ensuring automotive quality.The sensors are the most important link between the system and the environment. Perfect sensor calibration and a deep understanding of how sensors recognize the world is essential for a self-driving application. As a software developer intern in our small team, you will take part in calibration tool development, diagnostic data analytics pipeline development and support the team's daily work with coding and testing.
Job SummaryClose cooperation with researcher colleagues to help develop state-of-the-art sensor calibration algorithms (Python, C++)Participate in the development and testing of calibration applications (C++)Develop and maintain tools for analyzing collected sensor diagnostic and calibration data (Python, JavaScript)Create data statistics and charts (Python, JavaScript)
Key QualificationsSolid C++ and Python knowledgeIntermediate level English knowledgeAbility to work independentlyOngoing (active/passive) full-time university studies for at least one more yearAt least 20-25 working hours/week
Considered as a plusProgramming in JavaScript (React.js)Experience in computer visionExperience in sensor calibrationStrong mathematical skills
What We OfferPossibility to gain valuable work experience at the forefront of the automotive R&D sectorCompetitive student salary and long-term bonus systemInspiring and supportive working environmentTeambuilding events and other benefits for studentsFlexible working hoursLong-term job opportunityPossibility of an immediate startIn-service training opportunityFree lunch every workday, nearby at one of the best all-you-can-eat restaurants in Budapest or delivered by Wolt for Work
Company Description: We are one of the largest independent automated driving technology providers in the world. Our holistic approach to driving automation tackles three main industry challenges: software, development and validation tools, and processing hardware. Our team of over 230 works in offices in the USA, Japan, and Hungary to ensure our products are solving the real-world challenges of driving automation. We rely on our team’s expertise in artificial intelligence, sensor fusion, 3D graphics and real-world automated driving workloads, developed utilizing our global test fleet to provide robust solutions. As a result, our market-ready products can accelerate the safe and affordable deployment of ADAS and automated driving bringing these life-saving technologies to the public sooner.
Specialties: Self-driving cars,Artificial Intelligence,Advanced Driver Assistance Systems (ADAS),Computer vision,Neaural Network Acceleration Hardware,Simulator technology,Autonomous vehicles

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
This is the perfect opportunity for you, if You have…Bachelor's or Master's degree preferably in Computer Science, Engineering, Data Science, or a related field or Economics with strong IT affinity;2-4 years of experience in data engineering, data warehousing, or big data;strong proficiency in SQL and experience with relational databases. NoSQL is an advantage;knowledge of least one programming languages such as Python, VBA, Scala or C#;familiarity with at least one data integration tool such as Data Factory, Synapse Analytics, Alteryx, SSIS, or Data management Platform e.g. MS Fabric, Synapse Warehouse;understanding of data modeling, data structures, algorithms, master data and transactional data concepts;familiarity with data visualization tool capabilities (e.g. MS Power BI, Tableau, Qlikview), report development in these tools is not a requirement, but the effective data preparation for reporting;knowledge of cloud data storage and processing platforms preferably MS Azure based;excellent problem-solving and analytical skills;ability to work independently and collaboratively in a team environment;strong communication skills, both written and verbal in English and in Hungarian;knowledge of MS Office tools;willingness to learn new technologies;can do attitude.
Nice to have skills:Experience with Master data management\governance tools e.g. Purview.Experience with big data technologies.Familiarity with Agile methodologies.Knowledge of containerization and orchestration technologies like Docker and Kubernetes.Conceptual understanding of Machine Learning use cases.Azure certificates in topics of Data engineering, Data analytics.
As part of our team, we will count on you to…proactively support the team with new ideas and solutions;support the design and development of scalable and reliable data pipelines to ingest, process, and store large volumes of structured and unstructured data;collaborate with data scientists, analysts, and other stakeholders to understand data requirements and implement solutions that meet business needs;support the development and maintenance of data models, schemas, and metadata regarding to data warehousing and data analytics initiatives;stay up-to-date with the latest trends and technologies in data engineering, continuously improving skills and knowledge;participate in cross-functional projects and initiatives, contributing data engineering expertise as needed.
We’ll provide you with the opportunity to…participate in diverse projects and get a hands on experience on various data technologies;work in close-knit, cohesive teams where members help one another to achieve a common goal;grow professionally and personally during your role via professional mentoring and several online and offline learning opportunities such as Udemy, Coursera or in-house technology workshops and trainings;have flexible working schedule with our hybrid office presence policy and respect for your work/life balance;get a competitive salary package with fringe benefits and health insurance (Medicover).

ZF is a global technology company supplying advanced mobility products and systems for passenger cars, commercial vehicles and industrial technology. Its comprehensive product range is primarily aimed at vehicle manufacturers, mobility providers and start-up companies in the fields of transportation and mobility. ZF electrifies a wide range of vehicle types. With its products, the company contributes to reducing emissions, protecting the climate as well as enhancing safe mobility. Title: AI Data Manager
Description:
Company Description

In the Budapest Artificial Intelligence Development Centre of Continental, Autonomous Mobility, we create next generation automotive software solutions which make automated driving safe and affordable. We work towards Vision Zero, a goal to eliminate fatal accidents happening every day on the world’s roads. We are looking for creative minds who are passionate to shape the future of automated driving by delivering world-class perception and fusion systems.

Job Description

Our teams develop software solutions for automated parking and safety systems, processing various automotive sensor data and providing a robust, scalable output to driving function modules.

Your tasks:

AI Data Manager is responsible for providing the proper quality, quantity and distribution of relevant datasets for the AI projects, focusing on Lane Detection area. Collect, consolidate and document data requirements from deep learning / machine learning specialists Plan, request, track and facilitate labeling activities in line with project timelines Track and communicate the status of the data processing steps in a transparent way Prepare and maintain label specification for different machine learning functions Review labeling results in line with the label specification and project requirement Represent the machine learning projects towards other departments. 

Qualifications

 University degree (BSc, MSc) Relevant job experience in business analysis / project management (medior / senior) Proactive mindset Excellent stakeholder management skills Experience with software engineering task coordination Excellent command of English language Collaborative, open-minded, team player attitude 

Nice to have:

Experience with data-driven development Experience with agile development methods. 

Additional Information

What We Offer

Participation in exciting, highly innovative projects. Personal career development and a challenging role with end-to-end responsibility. Ability to directly deliver software into real products. Opportunity to see your ideas turn into reality with our test vehicle. Continous development with access to numerous trainings, including technical skills, soft skills and language skills. A friendly, respectful and collaborative work environment that encourages creativity and innovation. Competitive compensation and a wide range of benefits, including:Private health insuranceBonus systemEmployee discountsSport pass supportEasily accessible office location. 
Ready to drive with Continental? Take the first step and fill in the online application.
Company Description:
Continental develops pioneering technologies and services for sustainable and connected mobility of people and their goods. Founded in 1871, the technology company offers safe, efficient, intelligent and affordable solutions for vehicles, machines, traffic and transportation. In 2023, Continental generated sales of €41.4 billion and currently employs around 200,000 people in 56 countries and markets. 

- 💛 Our Netiquette 💛 -
The purpose of our LinkedIn page is to offer information about products and solutions at Continental, about our company culture and about our actions and initiatives. Moreover, we would like to provide you with quick and easy contact for your questions and comments related to the above mentioned topics. We emphasize the importance of an appropriate and respectful style when communicating on our page and therefore we established the following community rules:
- Please post only comments related to the topics covered by this page.
- Treat each user in a respectful way, as you expect to be treated as well. Abusive language, aggression and bullying are not allowed on our page.
We therefore reserve the right to remove posted comments or any other content from this site:
- which is offensive or abusive,
- includes a commercial benefit or unwanted advertising messages,
- violates the rights of third parties as well as the right to intellectual property,
- which is irrelevant or misleading
- which is a spam (repeated duplicate posting)
- for any other reason deemed necessary to create a helpful and respectful community
The comments on our contributions reflect the opinion of individual users. Our LinkedIn page is frequently checked for possible violations as mentioned above. However, ongoing inspection of the content of the posted comments is not reasonable without concrete indication of a (legal) violation as mentioned above. We will immediately remove the relevant links if they are found to violate any aforementioned law or principle.

Title: Software Developer
Description:
Job Description

We are looking for a skilled and motivated Software Developer to join our team in building innovative solutions that support the automation of network application deployments. This role offers a dynamic and collaborative environment, providing the opportunity to work with cutting-edge technologies such as Kubernetes, Go, and CI/CD pipelines to deliver high-quality, scalable software solutions.

How You Will Contribute And What You Will Learn

 Write clean, maintainable, and efficient code in languages such as Go and Python. Participate in the full software development lifecycle, including design, implementation, testing, and deployment. Lead and perform development activities. Engage in code reviews and provide constructive feedback to improve code quality and team practices. Actively participate in a scrum team and contribute to agile processes. Present developed features and code changes during sprint reviews. Support your colleagues in completing their tasks.

Key Skills And Experience

 BSc or MSc in engineering, telecommunications, computer science or an equivalent education with 3 - 5 years of experience in software development. Proficiency in one or more programming languages: Go, Python, or Java. Understanding of software design patterns and best coding practices. Ability to write unit and integration test, familiar with automated testing frameworks and methodologies. Strong understanding and hands-on experience with Docker and Kubernetes. Knowledge of data storage solutions and patterns - SQL/NoSQL databases. Experience with Agile methodologies, particularly Scrum or Kanban. Familiarity with version control systems, specifically Git. Experience with CI/CD tools such as Jenkins or GitLab CI for continuous integration and delivery. Strong knowledge of Linux environments and command-line interfaces. Familiarity with basic networking concepts, API design and RESTful services.

Preferred Qualifications:

 Experience with public cloud platforms (e.g., AWS, Google Cloud, Azure) for application deployment and management. Proficiency in using Helm and familiarity with Kubernetes best practices for scaling, networking, and resource management. Strong communication skills and the ability to work collaboratively in a team setting. A proactive attitude toward learning new technologies and methodologies.

What You Will Learn:

 Advanced software development practices and methodologies in a collaborative environment. In-depth experience with Kubernetes. Continuous professional development in programming languages and software engineering best practices.

About Us

 Come create the technology that helps the world act together

Nokia is committed to innovation and technology leadership across mobile, fixed and cloud networks. Your career here will have a positive impact on people’s lives and will help us build the capabilities needed for a more productive, sustainable, and inclusive world.

We challenge ourselves to create an inclusive way of working where we are open to new ideas, empowered to take risks and fearless to bring our authentic selves to work

What we offer

Nokia offers continuous learning opportunities, well-being programs to support you mentally and physically, opportunities to join and get supported by employee resource groups, mentoring programs and highly diverse teams with an inclusive culture where people thrive and are empowered.

Nokia is committed to inclusion and is an equal opportunity employer

Nokia has received the following recognitions for its commitment to inclusion & equality:

 One of the World’s Most Ethical Companies by Ethisphere  Gender-Equality Index by Bloomberg  Workplace Pride Global Benchmark 

At Nokia, we act inclusively and respect the uniqueness of people. Nokia’s employment decisions are made regardless of race, color, national or ethnic origin, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, marital status, disability, protected veteran status or other characteristics protected by law.

We are committed to a culture of inclusion built upon our core value of respect.

Join us and be part of a company where you will feel included and empowered to succeed.
Skill: 9 of 10 skills match your profile - you may be a good fit
Company Description:
At Nokia, we create technology that helps the world act together. 

As a B2B technology innovation leader, we are pioneering the future where networks meet cloud to realize the full potential of digital in every industry.

Through networks that sense, think and act, we work with our customers and partners to create the digital services and applications of the future. 


For our latest updates, please visit us online www.nokia.com  

To view open positions and to apply, please visit: www.nokia.com/careers

Title: Frontend Developer (Remote)
Description:
At Cryptohopper we're looking for a Lead Front End Developer to join our team.
zk-SNARKs, miners, nodes, bulls, bears, FOMO and FUD. Some of those terms may sound like Marvel villains or curse words (“I should FUD you upside the head for staring at my nodes!”), but to a trained ear they spell m.a.g.i.c. Cryptocurrency magic, to be exact. In our view – and yes, it’s a bold statement – crypto will be the currency your grandkids consider the norm. And for good reason, because however cryptic crypto may seem, the underlying Blockchain technology is as safe as possible.
Trading in these currencies, though? That’s when sh*t used to go sideways. Until the launch of Cryptohopper: an AI-driven bot that makes crypto trading accessible, fun, and worthwhile. Do you want to optimize and innovate a bot that hosts more than 2 million transactions worth an estimated half a billion USD each month?
Show us what you got!

Interlude: fork in the road time!
Picture yourself at a junction. Not just ‘any’ junction, but, say, a crossroads in Dark Souls III. Lots of dynamic lighting. Fire. Brimstone. The works. Nifty particle effects. The kind of scene that invariably unfolds whenever you need to prep for a Stand Up. Anyway. At this particular junction, you can go right or (surprise!) left. So what to do? Well, that depends on your ambitions and skillset.

Front End Developer?
Turn left if you’re into the customer-facing side of things. Since our customer is the End Boss, you prefer to face him/her head-on! And you can. In our compact team you take the helm when it comes to conceptualizing, coding and implementing user-centric interfaces. A mission-critical responsibility because our bots-dashboards have (cough) grown organically. It seemed like a brilliant idea to make it super complex at the time. But hey. Together with back enders, our hugely talented (they made us say that) UX Designers and reputable design agency, you ensure the platform looks and feels as awesome (and responsive) as the victories our users experience. And yes, the roadmap, backlog and our wildest dreams are filled to the brim with new enhancements, redesigns and add-ons for our API, landing pages, onboarding and automated trading strategies. All for that flawless user experience. Show us what you got!

Hi, we're the full tech/stack.
React, NextJs, Typescript, JavaScript, HTML, CSS, PHP, Golang, NodeJs, MySQL, InfluxDB, jQuery, Sass, Less, Rust, Flux, Redux, RESTful, APIs, AWS, Kubernetes, Python, Redis Cache, Cryptotrading, Cyber security, Linux, Open source, etc.

You know you got this if.
You bring 9+ years of experience as a front end or full stack developer to the tableJavaScript, React and NextJs are probably going to be the best (wo)men at your weddingYou have a strong opinion on all things UX and (raw) design, and a track record that assures team members you aren’t talking sh*tYou can own a whole department if neededOne time you subsisted on nothing but design patterns for a month

What we offer.
A mission-driven culture with a great work/life balance and a good benefits package. We also:
Work remotely.Send you on your merry way for 25 days each year, minimum (more is negotiable)Provide you with great gear; a high-end laptop and whatever else you need to succeed. Perhaps an AI-driven desk chair that *knows* when you want to lean back?Lifetime Cryptohopper subscription (if you don’t break our BFF vows)Shower you with extras, like trading benefits, a generous training budget, and (mom will be proud!) the opportunity to work in a domain that accelerates financial inclusion for the unbankedPour you a stiff drink on Thursdays, coffee that won’t make you wish you chose tea, and lots of mind-blowing feedback on your work, hobby’s and pets. And we sincerely look forward to hearing what’s on your mind, too.
Company Description:
We change the way the world invests. 

Started in 2017 by two brothers, we like to trade differently. Regular traders trade with emotion, need sleep, can't keep track of all markets en some lack experience. 

Cryptohopper helps traders by bringing innovation and the experience of professionals to the people. Bots don't need sleep, or copy a pro that's using our sophisticated software to trade.

Want to help building on the future of crypto trading? Visit our career page at careers.cryptohopper.com. 

The world of investing is changing fast. Our mission is to lead this change.

Title: System Administrator – fresh graduates are welcome
Description:
KBC Bank, the parent company of the Hungarian K&H Bank, provides banking services in 5 European countries. The international IT solutions of the banking group, covering several European countries, takes place with Hungarian and Belgian colleagues in Hungary and Belgium, therefore not only our services are international, but also our teams. Our responsibilities range from day-to-day operation to application development and its operation. We are constantly expanding the Hungarian side of the team, which is why we are looking for enthusiastic, motivated new employees with junior, medior or possibly senior work experience.
Do you know our banking app has been named the best in the world? Or that we have ‘Kate’, a digital personal assistant at the cutting edge of AI tech? Perhaps you’re aware there’s a KBC coin on its way, programmable money on the blockchain?
At KBC IT, the era of suits and ties is long behind us; we have a real, dynamic start-up mentality. You’ll work with more than 1500 like-minded professionals on the solutions of tomorrow.
We are quick to react. We are flexible. And we are focused on achieving the best results. There is space for new ideas that ensure we keep innovating. Always with the latest technology. KBC is big, but not unwieldy.
Are you ready for the challenge of combining innovation with 100% uptime? It is always interesting. One day, you implement changes or new features. The next day, you pull on your rubber boots, roll up your sleeves and tackle urgent or complex problems.
Would you like to know more about KBC ICT Infrastructure? In our data centres in Belgium, Hungary, and the cloud, we host the critical applications that support our banking and insurance activities by registering millions of transactions at light speed every day. We do this on our own Mainframe, on our own extensive private cloud, and in the public cloud (AWS, Azure), on various standard platforms (Windows, Linux and x) as well as cloud-native technologies (such as Hadoop, Kubernetes, Docker or others).
The Control Tower is responsible for operational monitoring and management of infrastructure and business applications on mainframe, Open systems and Cloud.Many of our business applications need to be available 24*7, which is why the Control Tower works in a shift system onsite.
What your job will be:You are involved in the day-to-day operational management of mainframe and open systems.You work closely together with our Business, IT colleagues and Service Delivery Owners.You dive into the details of an incident to find out if we can remediate it immediately, or if we have to seek for a solution together with the DevOps teams. You’re an expert at solving incidents and ensuring we have zero downtime.Based on our reporting you initiate problems out of recurrent incidents.
What you can expect working with us:You can make sure your future career is steady within our companyLife-long learning and plenty of opportunities to challenge yourselfCompetitive salary as well as other benefits such as:10% customizable cafeteria,annual performance-based reward,company phone with mobile internet, that you can use for private purposes as wellemployee discount at the bankMedicoverYour English language skills won’t be worn out as you can use it on a daily basisWe value your insight and are always open to suggestionsInternational environment with a cheerful work atmosphereGreen office in Millennium Park, equipped with:bicycle storage and showersrestaurant with panoramic views over the Danube and the National Theatrefree coffee in our community area where we hang out and play darts, and many dining options in the surrounding area

What we expect from You:You are prepared to work in a fully continuous shift regime onsite. ( 3 shifts after the trial period covering 24/7 ) You keep calm during difficult situations.You have a bachelor’s or master’s degree.You’re looking forward to improve your knowledge of IT (Mainframe & Open systems), or to acquire it.You’re happy to go exploring and finding ways to involve other people in new stories. Automating a repetitive job, immersing yourself in new material, brainstorming with your colleagues about different ways of doing things, testing out a new technology ... You’ll be at home in this job if you enjoy these tasks.You enjoy working as part of a team. Smooth communication is an important aspect of this, therefore it’s important that you are fluent in English (both written and verbal)You are eager to learn and absorb new technology quickly. You have the energy and talent to deep dive into new material, and to build up expertise in it.You have the interest and a strong analytical mind to quickly match the IT components to the underlying business process.You are result driven and takes initiative to gets things done.

What you can expect during the recruitment process:After sending your CV in English, expect a three-round interview process, one online with our local recruiter, one online in English with the Belgian team leader, and the final round is in person at our office in Budapest (in Hungarian) to get to know each other better.An efficient selection process is important for both of us, so we try to make it as fast as possible, and even if you are not selected we will give you a detailed feedback.

Title: Software Engineer
Description:
Job Description

As a Software Engineer, you will solve complex problems that have a profound impact on how we reach our customers when they do business. This is an area of constant transformation, driven by the need to adjust our internal processes to better serve our customers, and the continuous improvement cycle required to keep our technologies efficient and up to date. You will be a member of our global Pricing & Quoting IT product team, will work on several IT solutions to support sales and marketing areas and partnering with internal users. To thrive in this role, you must embrace an engineering attitude, possess confident technology knowledge, be well-versed in object-oriented programming, and have knowledge of software development lifecycle management.

In this Role, Your Responsibilities Will Be:

Ability to design, develop, test, and maintain software applications. Knowledge of software development principles and methodologies (Agile, Scrum, etc.) Knowledge of DevOps principles to ensure that software is developed, tested, and deployed efficiently and effectively, including additional skills related to automation, infrastructure management, and deployment processes. Ability to learn and improve your skills with the help of your mentor and teammates. 

Who You Are:

You scan the environment for new technical skills, knowledge, or capabilities that can benefit business or personal performanceYou want to learn designing processes and procedures that allow managing from a distance.You establish and maintain effective customer relationships.

For This Role, You Will Need:

Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent experience in the field of IT Strong communication skills in English, both oral and written Understanding fundamentals of relational database technologyProblem-solving and analytical skills

Preferred Qualifications that Set You Apart:

Relevant software engineering experience in multinational environment Strong collaboration skills to work effectively in multinational team environment and capability to work alone Familiarity with software security principles and standard methodologies Experience with GIT, Azure DevOps, ServiceNowOracle E-Business Suite/Mulesoft/Salesforce development experience would be nice to have 

Our Offer to You:

International working area, good Team spirit Flexible working hours Special attention on mental and physical healthiness with free corporate gym, sport fields on our site, weekly fruit day, farmers market, medical screening... etc. Cafeteria including multiple selectable options Supportive atmosphere, team buildings and other company events Discounts (e.g.: gyms, book stores, restaurants) Yearly Appreciation week, including fun, educational and health-related programs

The philosophy is fundamental to living our company’s values and our responsibility to leave the world in a better place. Learn more about our Culture & Values and about Diversity, Equity, & Inclusion at Emerson .

Moreover, our global volunteer employee resource groups will empower you to connect with peers that share the same interest, promote diversity and inclusion and positively contribute to communities around us.

We understand the importance of work-life balance and are dedicated to supporting our employees' personal and professional needs. From competitive benefits plans and comprehensive medical care to equitable opportunities for growth and development we strive to create a workplace that is supportive and rewarding. Our work schedule aims at creating new levels of growth, build a stronger community and provide greater professional development for our employees.

Title: Digital & Tech Graduate Programme 2025 - Budapest
Description:
Job Description

The core purpose of our Digital and Technology, (D&T), graduate programme is to ensure all of our graduates build up a broad portfolio of skills and experiences that is going to accelerate their development and prepare for them to leaders of the future.

So, our hands-on, accelerated learning programmes are perfect for people who are curious, have an ability to learn quickly, and are excited to gain a breadth of experiences which will set you up for a career to be proud of.

Starting in Budapest, our three-year rotational graduate programme will enable you to spend your days right at the heart of our global organisation supporting to create value for Diageo and our great brands.

Who are we? 

Diageo is one of the world’s leading producers of premium drinks. We have an outstanding collection of over 200 brands, old and new, large and small, global and local – that are enjoyed in more than 180 countries around the world.

Celebrating our inclusive and diverse culture is core to our purpose which values everybody irrespective of background, disability, religion, gender identity, sexuality or ethnicity. We know that for our business to thrive, we depend on having diverse talent with a range of backgrounds, skills and capabilities in each of the 180 countries in which we operate and to reflect our broad consumer base. We view diversity as one of the key enablers that helps our business to grow and our values, purpose and standards set the conditions for us to respect the outstanding contribution each person brings.

The D&T function plays a pivotal role in supporting Diageo’s long-term vision by maximising data and digital technology to transform our business and put us one step ahead of the competition – whether that be working directly with our markets to implement new systems and capabilities or working with our Analytics and Insights team to help predict future industry trends.

Join our Graduate programme and support us in delivering our 'Society 2030: Spirit of Progress' agenda—a 10-year action plan to help create a more inclusive and sustainable world!

How does the programme work? 

Start date: September 2025.

Over the three-year rotational programme, you’ll have an opportunity to gain experience in various specialisms within D&T whilst developing your leadership skills

You Could Be Working In

Strategic Planning – Either as a strategic Business Partner, or as a systems guru, you’ll be working with leaders across our different business functions and geographies to craft our technology roadmaps of the future – think big and think ahead! This is the forward-looking team that will keep us ahead of the competition. Technology Transformation – Supporting the implementation of world-leading technology solutions across Diageo – from the implementation of cutting-edge capabilities that drive point of sale across outlets, to the simplification and automatization of our technology infrastructure. Project & Change Management – Creating and delivering a portfolio of strategic projects that support the D&T transformation agenda. Working within an extended agile team, you will have experience and exposure to industry best practice in project management and change readiness. Cyber Security – Protecting Diageo’s intellectual property from external hackers – either by developing internal capability and cyber resilience – or, supporting crisis management during an attack. Employee Experience – Working on the front line on new systems and technology deployment on-site to ensure a seamless employee experience. Data Science/Visualization – You will understand the function you partner, translating their everyday experience into a business problem, a testable hypothesis and in the end, a solution. With quantitative analysis, data mining and visualization you will be the one providing the insights that move our business forward! Data Engineering – The backbone of our analytics products is the clean, optimized data that our product managers and project teams use to build tools and solutions for our business problems. Designing, building, and maintaining data processing systems makes sure we use data in an efficient way, and you’ll be successful if you’re comfortable around code, databases and design. We can only build high if the base is strong! 

At Diageo, we believe in fostering a culture of continuous learning where every day presents an opportunity for growth, development. Across your graduate programme, you will have a combination of formal training, mentoring and hands on learning with the wider European Cohort. This will help you gain a strong foundation of leadership skills, a deep understanding of Diageo's operations and feel empowered by the end of your programme to follow various career paths within our organisation.

Who are we looking for? 

On the qualification’s side, you’ll need to have acquired or be expecting to acquire an academic degree, graduating in 2025 or within the last 5 years. You must be proficient in English, and with opportunities across Europe you must be mobile and prepared to relocate geographically during the programme. Our key locations include the UK and Budapest – however, we are a global function with employees based all over the world – so the opportunities are endless, and we’d like you to grasp any opportunity with both hands!

You’ll need to be a curious, flexible, self-motivated team-player who loves to turn ideas into action and someone who shows integrity, respect for others and, above all, a passion for learning something new every day.

Most importantly we ask you to be you. Come as you are, with your own ideas and ambitions, and let's celebrate your talent and empower you to reach your fullest potential.

What Are The Rewards

With everything you can learn here, and the long-term opportunities we have to offer, the Digital & Technology Graduate Programme could just be the best decision you’ve ever made!

Join us and you can expect to receive a highly competitive salary (salary is dependent on the location of your rotations, as an example your year one salary based within the UK will be in the region of £37,000), along with an annual bonus opportunity and industry leading benefits package.

Application details 

We have several graduate opportunities across the business. For the best chance of being successful we recommend applying for one programme as soon as possible. We recruit on a rolling process, meaning that we will close roles when we have received enough applications to fill our 2025 graduate roles.

NB: Pymetrics is the first stage of the application process for all of our Early Career’s programmes at Diageo and after completion your result will be used for all applications that require it within a one-year period.

Please note that our assessment centres this year will be held between December and February, so, you will hear from us closer to the time if you have successfully reached this final stage. We appreciate your patience.

Interested, but want to learn more? 

The Early Careers team will be hosting a series of insight and coaching events as well as live chats over the coming months, and we want to hear from you! For more info and to register today visit: https://meetandengage.com/diageoearlycareers

Worker Type

Graduate

Primary Location:

Budapest

Additional Locations :

2025-02-10
